504.definition: a hollow metal object, often like a cup in shape, that makes a ringing sound when hit by a small piece of metal inside it; the sound that it makes
504.example: A peal of church bells rang out in the distance.

505.definition: to be in the right or suitable place
505.example: Where do these plates belong (= where are they kept)?

506.example: in memory of our dearly beloved son, John

507.definition: at or to a lower level, position or place
507.example: They live on the floor below.

508.definition: at or to a lower level or position than somebody/something
508.example: He dived below the surface of the water.

509.definition: a long narrow piece of leather, cloth, etc. that you wear around the middle part of your body

510.definition: a long seat for two or more people, usually made of wood

511.definition: something that can be measured and used as a standard that other things can be compared with
511.example: Tests at the age of seven provide a benchmark against which the child's progress at school can be measured.

512.definition: a curve or turn, especially in a road or river
512.example: a sharp bend in the road

513.definition: to lean, or make something lean, in a particular direction

514.definition: in or to a lower position than somebody/something; under somebody/something
514.example: They found the body buried beneath a pile of leaves.

515.definition: improving a situation; having a helpful or useful effect
515.example: A good diet is beneficial to health.

516.definition: a person who gains as a result of something
516.example: Who will be the main beneficiary of the cuts in income tax?

517.definition: an advantage that something gives you; a helpful and useful effect that something has
517.example: Freedom of information brings great benefits.

518.definition: to be useful to somebody or improve their life in some way
518.example: We should spend the money on something that will benefit everyone.

520.definition: next to or at the side of somebody/something
520.example: He sat beside her all night.

521.definition: used for making an extra comment that adds to what you have just said
521.example: I don't really want to go. Besides, it's too late now.

522.definition: in addition to somebody/something; apart from somebody/something
522.example: We have lots of things in common besides music.

523.definition: of the most excellent type or quality
523.example: That's the best movie I've ever seen!

524.example: Which one do you like best?

525.definition: the most excellent thing or person
525.example: We all want the best for our children.

526.definition: an arrangement to risk money, etc. on the result of a particular event; the money that you risk in this way

527.definition: to risk money on a race or an event by trying to predict the result
527.example: You have to be over 16 to bet.

528.definition: to give information about somebody/something to an enemy
528.example: betray somebody/something, He was offered money to betray his colleagues.

529.definition: of a higher standard or less poor quality; not as bad as something else
529.example: We're hoping for better weather tomorrow.

530.definition: in a more excellent or pleasant way; not as badly
530.example: She sings much better than I do.

531.example: the better of the two books

532.definition: in the space or period of time separating two or more points, objects, etc. or two dates, events, etc.
532.example: The house was near a park but there was a road in between.

533.definition: in or into the space separating two or more points, objects, people, etc.
533.example: Q comes between P and R in the English alphabet.

534.definition: on the other side; further on
534.example: Snowdon and the mountains beyond were covered in snow.

535.definition: on or to the further side of something
535.example: The road continues beyond the village up into the hills.

536.definition: a strong feeling in favour of or against one group of people, or one side in an argument, often not based on fair judgement
536.example: accusations of political bias in news programmes (= that reports are unfair and show favour to one political party)

537.definition: a road vehicle with two wheels that you ride by pushing the pedals with your feet
537.example: He got on his bicycle and rode off.

538.definition: an offer by a person or a company to pay a particular amount of money for something
538.example: bid for something, A German firm launched a takeover bid for the company.

539.definition: to offer to pay a particular price for something, especially at an auction
539.example: bid (something) (for something), I bid £2 000 for the painting.

540.definition: large in size, degree, amount, etc.

541.example: I used to ride my bike around the neighbourhood for hours.

542.definition: a document that shows how much you owe somebody for goods or services

543.definition: to send somebody a bill for something
543.example: bill somebody for something, Please bill me for the books.

545.definition: a container that you put waste in

546.definition: to tie somebody/something with rope, string, etc. so that they/it cannot move or are held together strongly
546.example: bind somebody/something to something, She was bound to a chair.

547.definition: the story of a person’s life written by somebody else; this type of writing

548.definition: connected with the science of biology

549.definition: the scientific study of the life and structure of plants and animals

550.definition: a creature that is covered with feathers and has two wings and two legs. Most birds can fly.
550.example: a bird’s nest with two eggs in it

551.definition: the time when a baby is born; the process of being born
551.example: at birth, The baby weighed three kilos at birth.

552.definition: the day in each year which is the same date as the one on which you were born

553.definition: a small flat dry cake for one person, usually sweet, and baked until hard

554.definition: a senior priest in charge of the work of the Church in a city or district

555.example: These trousers are a bit tight.

556.example: The dog gave me a playful bite.

557.definition: to use your teeth to cut into or through something

558.definition: having a strong, unpleasant taste; not sweet
558.example: Black coffee leaves a bitter taste in the mouth.

560.definition: having the very darkest colour, like coal or the sky at night

561.definition: the very darkest colour, like night or coal
561.example: the black of the night sky

562.definition: the flat part of a knife, tool or machine, which has a sharp edge or edges for cutting
562.example: The machine comes with a plastic guard over the blade to protect the operator.

563.definition: responsibility for doing something badly or wrongly; saying that somebody is responsible for something
563.example: Why do I always get the blame for everything that goes wrong?

564.definition: to think or say that somebody/something is responsible for something bad
564.example: blame somebody/something for something, She doesn't blame anyone for her father's death.

565.definition: empty, with nothing written, printed or recorded on it
565.example: Sign your name in the blank space below.

566.definition: an empty space on a printed form or document for you to write answers, information, etc. in

567.definition: a large cover, often made of wool, used especially on beds to keep people warm
567.example: It’s cold tonight—can I have another blanket?

568.definition: an explosion or a powerful movement of air caused by an explosion

569.definition: to violently destroy or break something into pieces, using explosives
569.example: They blasted a huge crater in the runway.

570.definition: to lose blood, especially from a wound or an injury

571.definition: a mixture of different types of the same thing

572.definition: to mix two or more substances together
572.example: blend A with B, Blend the flour with the milk to make a smooth paste.

573.definition: to ask God to protect somebody/something
573.example: They brought the children to Jesus and he blessed them.

574.definition: God’s help and protection, or a prayer asking for this

575.example: Doctors think he will go blind.

576.definition: a large piece of a solid material that is square or rectangular in shape and usually has flat sides
576.example: The houses are made of concrete blocks with tin roofs.

577.definition: to stop something from moving or flowing through a pipe, a passage, a road, etc. by putting something in it or across it
577.example: After today's heavy snow, many roads are still blocked.

578.definition: a website where an individual person, or people representing an organization, write regularly about recent events or topics that interest them, usually with photos and links to other websites that they find interesting
578.example: This is a link to the museum's blog.

580.definition: the red liquid that flows through the bodies of humans and animals
580.example: He lost a lot of blood in the accident.

581.definition: a hard hit with the hand, a weapon, etc.
581.example: She received a severe blow on the head.

582.definition: to send out air from the mouth
582.example: + adv./prep., You're not blowing hard enough!

583.definition: having the colour of a clear sky or the sea on a clear day

584.definition: the colour of a clear sky or the sea on a clear day

585.definition: a long thin piece of strong hard material, especially wood, used, for example, for making floors, building walls and roofs and making boats
585.example: He had ripped up the carpet, leaving only the bare boards.

586.definition: to get on a ship, train, plane, bus, etc.

587.definition: to talk in a way that shows you are too proud of something that you have or can do
587.example: I don't want to boast, but I can actually speak six languages.

588.definition: a vehicle (smaller than a ship) that travels on water, moved by oars, sails or a motor

589.definition: the whole physical structure of a human or an animal
589.example: The human body is a complex structure.

590.definition: when a liquid boils or when you boil it, it is heated to the point where it forms bubbles and turns to steam or vapour
590.example: The water was bubbling and boiling away.

591.definition: brave and confident; not afraid to say what you feel or to take risks
591.example: It was a bold move on their part to open a business in France.

592.definition: a weapon designed to explode at a particular time or when it is dropped or thrown

593.definition: to attack something/somebody by leaving a bomb in a place or by dropping bombs from a plane
593.example: Warplanes bombed targets in and around the capital.

594.definition: an occasion when a bomb is dropped or left somewhere; the act of doing this

595.definition: something that forms a connection between people or groups, such as a feeling of friendship or shared ideas and experiences

596.definition: any of the hard parts that form the skeleton of the body of a human or an animal
596.example: He survived the accident with no broken bones.

597.definition: an extra amount of money that is added to a payment, especially to somebody’s wages or salary as a reward

598.definition: a set of printed pages that are fastened inside a cover so that you can turn them and read them
598.example: His desk was covered with piles of books.

599.definition: to arrange to have or use something on a particular date in the future; to buy a ticket in advance

600.definition: an arrangement that you make in advance to buy a ticket to travel somewhere, go to the theatre, etc.
600.translation: 预订（预先安排购买票务、预订剧院位置等）

601.definition: a sudden increase in trade and economic activity; a period of wealth and success
601.example: Living standards improved rapidly during the post-war boom.
601.translation: 激增，繁荣（贸易和经济活动的突然增加；富裕和成功时期）

602.definition: something that helps or encourages somebody/something
602.translation: 助力，激励（帮助或鼓励某人/某事的事物）

603.definition: to make something increase, or become better or more successful
603.translation: 促进，增加（使某物增加，或变得更好、更成功）

604.definition: a strong shoe that covers the foot and ankle and often the lower part of the leg
604.translation: 靴子（覆盖足部、脚踝甚至小腿部分的坚固鞋子）

605.definition: the line that divides two countries or areas; the land near this line
605.example: I live in a small town in the US, near the Canadian border.
605.translation: 边境（划分两个国家或地区的界线；边境附近的土地）

606.definition: to share a border with another country or area
606.translation: 接壤（与另一个国家或地区共享边界）

607.definition: feeling tired and impatient because you have lost interest in somebody/something or because you have nothing to do
607.example: There was a bored expression on her face.
607.translation: 感到厌倦的（因失去兴趣或无事可做而感到疲倦和不耐烦）

608.definition: not interesting; making you feel tired and impatient
608.translation: 乏味的（无趣的；使人感到疲倦和不耐烦）

609.definition: to come out of your mother’s body at the beginning of your life
609.translation: 出生（在生命开始时从母亲体内出来）

610.definition: to take and use something that belongs to somebody else, and return it to them at a later time
610.example: borrow something, Can I borrow your umbrella?
610.translation: 借（借用属于他人的东西并在稍后归还）

611.definition: a person who is in charge of other people at work and tells them what to do
611.example: I'll ask my boss if I can have the day off.
611.translation: 老板（在工作中负责管理他人并告知其做什么的人）

612.definition: used with plural nouns to mean ‘the two’ or ‘the one as well as the other’
612.translation: 两个都（与复数名词连用，表示“两者”或“一个以及另一个”）

613.definition: used with plural nouns to mean ‘the two’ or ‘the one as well as the other’
613.translation: 两者（与复数名词连用，表示“两者”或“一个以及另一个”）

614.definition: to spend time and/or energy doing something
614.translation: 费心（花费时间或精力去做某事）

615.definition: a glass or plastic container, usually round with straight sides and a narrow neck, used especially for storing liquids
615.translation: 瓶子（玻璃或塑料容器，通常为圆形，颈部窄，用于储存液体）

616.definition: in the lowest, last or furthest place or position
616.translation: 底部的（在最低、最后或最远的位置）

618.definition: if something bounces or you bounce it, it moves quickly away from a surface it has just hit or you make it do this
618.example: The ball bounced twice before he could reach it.
618.translation: 弹跳（从刚接触的表面迅速弹开，或使某物这样做）

619.definition: certain or likely to happen, or to do or be something
619.example: There are bound to be changes when the new system is introduced.
619.translation: 肯定的，必然的（肯定或很可能发生、做或成为某样事物）

620.definition: a real or imagined line that marks the limits or edges of something and separates it from other things or places; a dividing line
620.example: After the war the national boundaries were redrawn.
620.translation: 边界（标志事物极限或边缘的界线；分界线）

621.definition: the act of bending your head or the upper part of your body forward in order to say hello or goodbye to somebody or to show respect
621.example: She gave a slight bow of her head in greeting.
621.translation: 鞠躬（低头或弯腰以示问候、告别或尊敬的行为）

622.definition: to move your head or the top half of your body forwards and downwards as a sign of respect or to say hello or goodbye
622.example: bow (to/before somebody/something), He bowed low to the assembled crowd.
622.translation: 鞠躬（低头或弯下上半身以示尊敬、问候或告别）

623.definition: a deep round dish with a wide open top, used especially for holding food or liquid
623.translation: 碗（深圆形的碟子，顶部开阔，用于盛放食物或液体）

624.definition: a container made of wood, thick card, metal, etc. with a flat stiff base and sides and often a lid (= cover), used especially for holding solid things
624.example: in a box, Everything we owned was neatly packed in cardboard boxes.
624.translation: 盒子（木头、厚纸板、金属等制成的容器，有坚固底座和侧面，通常有盖）

625.definition: a male child or a young male person
625.translation: 男孩（男孩子或年轻男性）

626.definition: a man or boy that somebody has a romantic or sexual relationship with
626.translation: 男朋友（某人与其有浪漫或性关系的男性或男孩）

627.definition: the organ inside the head that controls movement, thought, memory and feeling
627.example: The human brain is a complex organ.
627.translation: 大脑（头部的器官，控制运动、思维、记忆和感觉）

628.definition: a part of a tree that grows out from the main stem and on which leaves, flowers and fruit grow
628.example: She climbed the tree and hid in the branches.
628.translation: 树枝（树主干上长出的部分，其上长有叶、花和果实）

629.definition: a type of product, service, etc. made or offered by a particular company under a particular name
629.translation: 品牌（公司在特定名称下生产或提供的产品、服务等类型）

630.definition: to apply a brand name, image or identity to something
630.example: brand something, The website was not doing a very good job of branding the company.
630.translation: 打品牌（对某物应用品牌名称、形象或身份）

631.definition: willing to do things that are difficult, dangerous or painful; not afraid
631.translation: 勇敢的（愿意做困难、危险或痛苦的事；不害怕）

632.definition: a failure to do something that must be done by law
632.translation: 违反（未能履行法律规定的义务）

633.definition: to not keep to an agreement or not keep a promise
633.example: The government is accused of breaching the terms of the treaty.
633.translation: 违背（未遵守协议或未履行承诺）

634.definition: a type of food made from flour, water and usually yeast mixed together and baked
634.translation: 面包（由面粉、水和酵母混合烘焙而成的食品）

635.definition: a short period of time when you stop what you are doing and rest, eat, etc.
635.example: She was on her lunch break.
635.translation: 休息，间歇（停止正在做的事进行休息、用餐等的短时间）

636.definition: to be damaged and separated into two or more parts, as a result of force; to damage something in this way
636.example: All the windows broke with the force of the blast.
636.translation: 打破，破碎（因受力而损坏并分成两部分或更多；以这种方式损坏某物）

637.definition: an occasion when a vehicle or machine stops working
637.translation: 故障（车辆或机器停止工作的场合）

638.definition: the first meal of the day
638.example: They were having breakfast when I arrived.

639.definition: an important development that may lead to an agreement or achievement
639.translation: 突破（可能导致协议或成就的重要进展）

640.definition: either of the two round soft parts at the front of a woman’s body that produce milk when she has had a baby
640.example: She put the baby to her breast.
640.translation: 乳房（女性身体前部两个产生乳汁的圆软部分之一）

641.definition: the air that you take into your lungs and send out again
641.translation: 呼吸（吸入肺部并再次呼出的空气）

642.definition: to take air into your lungs and send it out again through your nose or mouth
642.example: He breathed deeply before speaking again.
642.translation: 呼吸（通过鼻子或嘴将空气吸入肺部并呼出）

643.definition: the action of taking air into the lungs and sending it out again
643.example: Her breathing became steady and she fell asleep.
643.translation: 呼吸（将空气吸入肺部并呼出的动作）

644.definition: a particular type of animal that has been developed by people in a certain way, especially a type of dog, cat or farm animal
644.example: Labradors and other large breeds of dog
644.translation: 品种（经人工培育具有特定特征的动物类型，尤指狗、猫或家畜）

645.definition: to have sex and produce young
645.example: Many animals breed only at certain times of the year.
645.translation: 繁殖（进行性行为并产生后代）

646.definition: baked clay used for building walls, houses and other buildings; an individual block of this
646.example: The school is built of brick.
646.translation: 砖（用于建筑墙壁、房屋等的烘烤粘土块；单块砖）

647.definition: a woman on her wedding day, or just before or just after it
647.example: a toast to the bride and groom
647.translation: 新娘（婚礼当天、婚前或婚后不久的女性）

648.definition: a structure that is built over a road, railway, river, etc. so that people, vehicles, etc. can cross from one side to the other
648.example: We crossed the bridge over the River Windrush.
648.translation: 桥（建在道路、铁路、河流等上方的结构，供人或车过河/跨路）

649.definition: lasting only a short time; short
649.translation: 简短的（持续时间很短的；短的）

650.example: He had spoken to Emma only briefly.
650.translation: 简短地（在很短的时间内）

651.translation: 明亮的（充满光亮的；强烈闪耀的）

652.translation: 出众的，灿烂的（极其聪明或令人印象深刻的）

653.definition: to come to a place with somebody/something
653.example: bring somebody/something (with you), Don't forget to bring your books with you.
653.translation: 带来（带着某人/某物来到某地）

655.definition: a way of connecting to the internet that allows you to receive information, including pictures, etc., very quickly and that is always active (so that the user does not have to connect each time)
655.example: plans to provide rural areas with fast broadband
655.translation: 宽带（一种始终连接且能快速接收信息、图片的网络连接方式）

656.example: (British English), a party political broadcast (= for example, before an election)
656.translation: 广播节目（无线电或电视节目）

657.definition: to send out programmes on television or radio
657.example: The concert will be broadcast live (= at the same time as it takes place) tomorrow evening.
657.translation: 广播（在电视或无线电上发送节目）

658.definition: a person whose job is presenting or talking on television or radio programmes
658.example: She is a writer and broadcaster on environmental matters.
658.translation: 广播员（在电视或无线电节目中主持或谈话的人）

659.example: Broadly speaking, I agree with you.
659.translation: 概括地说（通常而言，不考虑细节）

660.definition: that has been damaged or injured; no longer whole or working correctly
660.translation: 破碎的（已损坏或受伤的；不再完整或不能正常工作的）

661.definition: a boy or man who has the same parents as another person
661.translation: 兄弟（与另一人父母相同的男孩或男人）

662.definition: having the colour of earth or coffee
662.translation: 棕色的（土地或咖啡的颜色）

663.definition: the colour of earth or coffee
663.example: leaves of various shades of brown
663.translation: 棕色（土地或咖啡的颜色）

664.definition: a computer program that lets you look at or read documents on the World Wide Web
664.example: What do you use as your default browser?
664.translation: 浏览器（让你在万维网上查看或阅读文档的计算机程序）

665.definition: an object made of short stiff hairs (called bristles) or wires set in a block of wood or plastic, usually attached to a handle. Brushes are used for many different jobs, such as cleaning, painting and tidying your hair.
665.translation: 刷子（由短而硬的毛或线制成的工具，用于清洁、绘画或整理头发）

666.definition: to clean, polish or make something smooth with a brush
666.example: brush something, to brush your hair/teeth
666.translation: 刷（用刷子清洁、磨光或使某物平滑）

668.definition: a ball of air or gas in a liquid, or a ball of air inside a solid substance such as glass
668.translation: 气泡（液体中的空气或气体球，或固体物质如玻璃内部的空气球）

669.definition: a US, Australian or New Zealand dollar; a South African rand; an Indian rupee
669.translation: 美元（美国、澳大利亚或新西兰的元；南非兰特等货币的俗称）

670.example: an old college buddy of mine

671.definition: the money that is available to a person or an organization and a plan of how it will be spent over a period of time
671.translation: 预算（个人或组织可用资金及其在一段时间内的支出计划）

672.definition: a thing or person that reduces a shock or protects somebody/something against difficulties
672.example: buffer against something, Support from family and friends acts as a buffer against stress.
672.translation: 缓冲（减轻冲击或保护某人/某物免受困难的事物或人）

673.example: There's a bug crawling up your arm.

674.definition: to make something, especially a building, by putting parts together
674.example: build (something), They have permission to build 200 new homes.
674.translation: 建造（通过组合部件制造某物，尤指建筑物）

675.definition: a structure such as a house or school that has a roof and walls
675.translation: 建筑物（有屋顶和墙壁的结构，如房屋或学校）

676.definition: the main part of something; most of something
676.example: The bulk of the population lives in cities.
676.translation: 主体，大部分（某物的主要部分；某物的大部分）

677.definition: a small metal object that is fired from a gun
677.example: He was found to have a single bullet wound in his chest.
677.translation: 子弹（从枪中射出的细小金属物体）

678.definition: a number of things of the same type which are growing or fastened together
678.example: a bunch of bananas, grapes, etc.
678.translation: 串，束（生长或固定在一起的若干同类物品，如香蕉）

679.definition: a duty, responsibility, etc. that causes worry, difficulty or hard work
679.translation: 负担（引起担忧、困难或辛苦工作的职责、责任等）

680.definition: the system of official rules and ways of doing things that a government or an organization has, especially when these seem to be too complicated
680.translation: 官僚主义（政府或组织的官方规则和办事方式，尤指显得过于复杂时）

681.definition: the act or ceremony of burying a dead body
681.translation: 埋葬，葬礼（埋葬尸体的行为或仪式）

682.definition: an injury or a mark caused by fire, heat or acid
682.translation: 烧伤，烫伤（由火、热或酸造成的伤害或痕迹）

683.example: A welcoming fire was burning in the fireplace.

684.definition: to break open or apart, especially because of pressure from inside; to make something break in this way
684.example: That balloon will burst if you blow it up any more.
684.translation: 破裂，爆发（因内部压力而裂开；使某物以此方式破裂）

685.definition: to place a dead body in the ground
685.example: bury somebody/something, They killed her and buried her body.

686.definition: a large road vehicle that carries passengers, especially one that travels along a fixed route and stops regularly to let people get on and off
686.example: by bus, Shall we walk or go by bus?
686.translation: 公共汽车（运送乘客的大型道路车辆，通常有固定路线和停靠站）

687.definition: a plant that grows thickly with several hard stems coming up from the root
687.translation: 灌木（由根部长出数条硬茎、生长茂密的植物）

688.definition: the activity of making, buying, selling or supplying goods or services for money
688.example: It's been a pleasure to do business with you.
688.translation: 生意，商业（为了赚钱而制造、买卖或供应商品、服务的活动）

689.definition: a man who works in business, especially at a high level
689.example: a group of visiting Italian politicians and businessmen
689.translation: 商人（从事商业工作的人，尤指高层人员）

690.definition: having a lot to do; perhaps not free to do something else because you are working on something
690.translation: 忙碌的（有许多事要做；因正在工作而可能没空做别的事）

691.definition: used to introduce a word or phrase that contrasts with what was said before
691.example: I got it wrong. It wasn't the red one but the blue one.
691.translation: 但是（用于引入与前述内容对比的词或短语）

692.example: We've had nothing but trouble with this car.

693.definition: a soft yellow food made from cream, used in cooking and for spreading on bread
693.translation: 黄油（由奶油制成的软黄色食品，用于烹饪和涂抹面包）

694.definition: a small round piece of metal, plastic, etc. that is sewn onto a piece of clothing and used for fastening two parts together
694.example: (British English), to do up/undo your buttons
694.translation: 按钮（缝在衣服上的小圆片金属或塑料，用于扣紧两个部分）

695.definition: to obtain something by paying money for it
695.example: buy (something), Where did you buy that dress?

697.definition: used for showing how or in what way something is done
697.example: The house is heated by gas.
697.translation: 由，通过（用于显示某事是如何完成的或以何种方式完成）

699.definition: a small room on a ship in which you live or sleep
699.example: I lay in my cabin feeling miserably seasick.
699.translation: 舱，小木屋（船上居住或睡觉的小房间；小木屋）

700.definition: a group of senior members of a government that is responsible for advising and deciding on government policy
700.translation: 内阁（政府中负责建议和决定政策的高级成员团体）

701.definition: a set of wires, covered in plastic or rubber, that carries electricity, phone signals, etc.
701.translation: 电缆，电线（覆盖塑料或橡胶、传输电力或信号的一组电线）

702.definition: a place where you can buy drinks and simple meals. Alcohol is not usually served in British or American cafes.
702.example: There are small shops and pavement cafes around every corner.
702.translation: 咖啡馆（可以买饮料和简餐的场所，通常不供应酒精）

703.definition: a sweet food made from a mixture of flour, eggs, butter, sugar, etc. that is baked in an oven. Cakes are made in various shapes and sizes and are often decorated, for example with cream or icing.
703.translation: 蛋糕（由面粉、鸡蛋、黄油、糖等混合烘焙而成的甜食）

704.definition: to use numbers to find out a total number, amount, distance, etc.
704.example: calculate something, An independent valuer will calculate the value of your property.
704.translation: 计算（使用数字找出总数、金额、距离等）

705.definition: the act or process of using numbers to find out an amount
705.translation: 计算（使用数字找出数额的行为或过程）

706.definition: the act of speaking to somebody on the phone
706.example: to get/receive a call from somebody
706.translation: 电话（在电话上与某人交谈的行为）

707.definition: to give somebody/something a particular name; to use a particular name or title when you are talking to somebody
707.example: call somebody/something + noun, They decided to call the baby Mark.
707.translation: 呼唤，称呼（给某人/某物起名；在谈话中使用特定的名字或称谓）

708.example: It is important to keep calm in an emergency.
708.translation: 冷静的（不兴奋、不紧张或不难过的）

709.definition: a quiet and peaceful time or situation
709.translation: 冷静，平静（安静而和平的时间或情况）

710.definition: to make somebody/something become quiet and more relaxed, especially after strong emotion or excitement
710.example: Have some tea; it'll calm your nerves.
710.translation: 使冷静（使某人/某事变得安静和放松，尤指在强烈情感之后）

711.definition: a piece of equipment for taking photographs, moving pictures or television pictures. It can be a separate item or part of another device.
711.example: Just point the camera and press the button.
711.translation: 照相机（拍摄照片、电影或电视画面的设备）

712.definition: a place where people live temporarily in tents or temporary buildings
712.translation: 营地（人们暂时居住在帐篷或临时建筑中的地方）

713.definition: to put up a tent and live in it for a short time
713.example: I camped overnight in a field.
713.translation: 露营（搭建帐篷并短时间居住在其中）

714.definition: a series of planned activities that are intended to achieve a particular social, commercial or political aim
714.translation: 活动，运动（旨在实现特定社会、商业或政治目标的一系列计划活动）

715.definition: to take part in or lead a campaign, for example to achieve social or political change, or in order to win an election
715.example: The party campaigned vigorously in the north of the country.
715.translation: 参加活动（参加或领导旨在实现社会变革或赢得选举的活动）

716.definition: living in a tent, etc. on holiday
716.translation: 露营（度假时住在帐篷等地方）

717.definition: the buildings of a university or college and the land around them
717.translation: 校园（大学或学院的建筑及其周围的土地）

718.definition: a metal container in which food and drink is sold
718.example: can of something, a can of beans/beer/soda
718.translation: 罐头（售卖食物或饮料的金属容器）

719.definition: used to say that it is possible for somebody/something to do something, or for something to happen
719.translation: 能（用于说明某人/某事可能做某事，或某事可能发生）

720.definition: a long straight passage dug in the ground and filled with water for boats and ships to travel along; a smaller passage used for carrying water to fields, crops, etc.
720.translation: 运河（地面挖掘的供船只航行的长直水道；或用于灌溉的小水道）

721.definition: to decide that something that has been arranged will not now take place
721.example: All flights have been cancelled because of bad weather.
721.translation: 取消（决定已安排好的事情不再进行）

722.definition: a serious disease in which growths of cells, also called cancers, form in the body and kill normal body cells. The disease often causes death.
722.translation: 癌症（严重的疾病，体内细胞异常生长并杀死正常细胞）

723.definition: a person who is trying to be elected or is applying for a job
723.translation: 候选人（试图竞选职位或申请工作的人）

724.definition: a round stick of wax with a piece of string (called a wick) through the middle that is lit to give light as it burns
724.translation: 蜡烛（中间带芯的圆蜡棒，点燃后发光）

725.definition: the negative of can; can not
725.example: I cannot believe the price of the tickets!

726.definition: a strong heavy rough material used for making tents, sails, etc. and by artists for painting on
726.translation: 帆布（用于制作帐篷、帆及供艺术家绘画的强韧粗糙材料）

727.definition: a type of soft flat hat with a peak (= a hard curved part sticking out in front). Caps are worn especially by men and boys, often as part of a uniform
727.translation: 盖，帽（带帽檐的软质平帽，常作为制服的一部分）

728.definition: the ability or qualities necessary to do something
728.example: Age affects the range of a person's capabilities.
728.translation: 能力（做某事所需的才能或素质）

729.definition: having the ability or qualities necessary for doing something
729.example: capable of something, You are capable of better work than this.
729.translation: 有能力的（具备做某事所需的才能或素质）

730.definition: the number of things or people that a container or space can hold
730.example: a fuel tank with a maximum capacity of 50 litres
730.translation: 容量（容器或空间能容纳的东西或人的数量）

731.definition: having the form and size used at the beginning of a sentence or a name
731.example: English is written with a capital ‘E’.
731.translation: 大写的（用于句子开头或名称的字母形状和大小）

732.definition: the most important town or city of a country or region, where the government operates from
732.example: Cairo is the capital of Egypt.
732.translation: 首都，省会（国家或地区最重要的城镇或城市，政府所在地）

733.definition: an economic system in which a country’s businesses and industry are controlled and run for profit by private owners rather than by the government
733.example: the growth of industrial capitalism in the West
733.translation: 资本主义（企业的生产和经营由私人控制以获取利润的经济制度）

734.definition: based on the principles of capitalism
734.translation: 资本主义的（基于资本主义原则的）

735.definition: the person in charge of a ship or commercial aircraft
735.translation: 船长，机长（负责船只或商业飞机的负责人）

736.definition: the act of capturing somebody/something or of being captured
736.example: He evaded capture for three days.
736.translation: 捕获（捕捉某人/某物或被捕捉的行为）

737.definition: to catch a person or an animal and keep them as a prisoner or shut them in a space that they cannot escape from
737.example: Allied troops captured over 300 enemy soldiers.
737.translation: 捕捉（抓住人或动物并将其关押，使其无法逃脱）

738.definition: a road vehicle with an engine and four wheels that can carry a small number of passengers
738.example: Paula got into the car and drove off.
738.translation: 汽车（带引擎、有四个轮子且能载少量乘客的道路车辆）

739.definition: a chemical element. Carbon is found in all living things, existing in a pure state as diamond and graphite.
739.translation: 碳（一种化学元素，存在于所有生物中，纯态下为钻石或石墨）

740.definition: thick, stiff paper; a piece of this for writing on
740.translation: 卡片，硬纸板（厚且坚硬的纸；用于书写的一片这种纸）

741.definition: the process of caring for somebody/something and providing what they need for their health or protection
741.example: Some people were badly injured and needed medical care.
741.translation: 照料，护理（照顾某人/某物并提供健康或保护所需的过程）

742.definition: to feel that something is important and worth worrying about
742.example: I don't care (= I will not be upset) if I never see him again!
742.translation: 在乎，关心（觉得某事重要且值得担心）

743.definition: the series of jobs that a person has in a particular area of work, usually involving more responsibility as time passes
743.translation: 职业生涯（一个人在特定工作领域的一系列工作经历，通常随时间增加责任）

744.definition: giving attention or thought to what you are doing so that you avoid hurting yourself, damaging something or doing something wrong
744.translation: 小心的（对所做之事给予注意或思考，以避免受伤、损坏或出错）

745.definition: with a lot of attention or thought, so that you avoid hurting yourself, damaging something or doing something wrong
745.translation: 小心地（带着极大的注意或思考，以避免伤害、损坏或错误）

746.definition: not giving enough attention and thought to what you are doing, so that you make mistakes
746.translation: 粗心的（对所做之事没有给予足够的注意和思考，导致出错）

747.definition: the goods carried in a ship, an aircraft or a motor vehicle
747.example: The tanker began to spill its cargo of oil.
747.translation: 货物（船只、飞机或机动车辆装载的物品）

748.definition: a piece of thick woven material made of wool, etc., used to cover the floor of a room or stairs; the material used for carpets
748.example: He spent the morning laying the new carpet.
748.translation: 地毯（用于覆盖房间地面或楼梯的厚织材料，通常由羊毛制成）

749.definition: a separate section of a train for carrying passengers
749.translation: 车厢（火车中用于载客的独立部分）

750.definition: a long pointed orange root vegetable
750.translation: 胡萝卜（长尖形状的橙色根茎类蔬菜）

751.definition: to support the weight of somebody/something and take them or it from place to place; to take somebody/something from one place to another
751.example: carry somebody/something, He was carrying a large bag.
751.translation: 携带，运送（支撑重量并将其从一处带到另一处）

752.definition: a humorous drawing in a newspaper or magazine, especially one about politics or events in the news
752.translation: 漫画，卡通（报纸或杂志中幽默的绘画，尤指关于政治或新闻事件）

753.definition: to make objects, patterns, etc. by cutting away material from a piece of wood or stone, or another hard material
753.translation: 雕刻（通过切割木头、石头或其他硬质材料制作物体或图案）

754.definition: a particular situation or a situation of a particular type
754.example: in… cases, In some cases people have had to wait several weeks for an appointment.
754.translation: 情况，案例（特定的情况或特定类型的状况）

755.definition: money in the form of coins or notes
755.example: How much cash do you have on you?
755.translation: 现金（硬币或纸币形式的钱）

756.definition: a public building or room where people play gambling games for money
756.example: a new hotel and casino in Las Vegas
756.translation: 赌场（供人们进行金钱赌博游戏的公共建筑或房间）

757.definition: all the people who act in a play or film
757.example: an all-star cast (= including many well-known actors)
757.translation: 全体演员（在戏剧或电影中表演的所有人）

758.definition: to look, smile, etc. in a particular direction
758.example: cast something + adv./prep., She cast a welcoming smile in his direction.
758.translation: 投射（朝特定方向注视、微笑等）

759.definition: a large strong building with thick, high walls and towers, built in the past by kings or queens, or other important people, to defend themselves against attack
759.translation: 城堡（带有厚墙和塔楼的大型坚固建筑，过去由国王等建造以防御攻击）

760.example: casual clothes (= comfortable clothes that you choose to wear in your free time)
760.translation: 非正式的，休闲的（不正式的，如在空闲时间穿的舒适衣服）

761.definition: a person who is killed or injured in war or in an accident
761.example: Our primary objective is reducing road casualties.
761.translation: 伤亡人员（在战争或事故中死亡或受伤的人）

762.definition: a small animal with soft fur that people often keep as a pet. Cats catch and kill birds and mice.
762.translation: 猫（人们常作为宠物饲养的小型皮毛动物）

763.definition: a complete list of items, for example of things that people can look at or buy
763.example: a mail-order catalogue (= a book showing goods for sale to be sent to people’s homes)
763.translation: 目录（完整的物品清单，如供人们查看或购买的东西）

764.definition: an act of catching something, for example a ball
764.example: Roger made some brilliant catches at today's game.
764.translation: 接，抓（接住某物，例如球的行为）

765.definition: to stop and hold a moving object or person, especially in your hands
765.example: She managed to catch the keys as they fell.
765.translation: 接住，抓住（停止并握住移动的物体或人，尤指用手）

766.definition: a group of people or things with particular features in common
766.example: These are the nominees from each category.
766.translation: 类别（具有共同特征的一群人或事物）

767.definition: to provide food and drinks for a social event
767.example: (British English), cater for somebody/something, Most of our work now involves catering for weddings.
767.translation: 承办酒席（为社交活动提供食物和饮料）

768.definition: cows and bulls that are kept as farm animals for their milk or meat
768.translation: 牲畜（作为农场动物饲养以获取奶或肉的牛类）

769.definition: the person or thing that makes something happen
769.example: Unemployment is a major cause of poverty.
769.translation: 原因（使某事发生的个人或事物）

770.definition: to make something happen, especially something bad or unpleasant; to make somebody do something
770.example: cause something, Do they know what caused the fire?
770.translation: 引起，造成（使某事发生，尤指坏事或不愉快的事）

771.definition: care that you take in order to avoid danger or mistakes; the fact of not taking any risks
771.translation: 小心，谨慎（为了避免危险或错误而采取的注意；不冒险的事实）

772.definition: being careful about what you say or do, especially to avoid danger or mistakes; not taking any risks
772.example: The government has been cautious in its response to the report.
772.translation: 谨慎的（对言行小心，尤指为了避免危险或错误；不冒险）

773.definition: a large hole in the side of a hill or cliff or under the ground
773.example: the mouth (= the entrance) of the cave
773.translation: 洞穴（山坡、悬崖边或地下的巨大孔洞）

774.definition: a small disc on which sound or information is recorded. CDs can be played or read on various types of machines, including CD players and computers. (the abbreviation for ‘compact disc’)
774.example: on CD, His albums are available on CD and online.
774.translation: 激光唱片，CD（录制声音或信息的圆盘）

775.definition: to stop happening or existing; to stop something from happening or existing
775.example: Welfare payments cease as soon as an individual starts a job.
775.translation: 停止（停止发生或存在；使某事停止发生或存在）

776.definition: the top inside surface of a room
776.example: a large room with a high ceiling
776.translation: 天花板（房间顶部的内部表面）

777.definition: to show that a day or an event is important by doing something special on it
777.example: Jake's passed his exams. We're going out to celebrate.
777.translation: 庆祝（通过举行特别活动来表示某一天或某事件的重要性）

778.definition: a special event that people organize in order to celebrate something
778.example: The occasion was the 40th anniversary celebrations of the orchestra.
778.translation: 庆祝活动（人们为了庆祝某事而组织的特别活动）

780.definition: the smallest unit of living matter that can exist on its own. All plants and animals are made up of cells.
780.translation: 细胞（能独立存在的生物物质的最小单位）

781.definition: an area of land used for burying dead people, especially one that is not next to a church
781.example: He was buried in a private cemetery.
781.translation: 墓地（用于埋葬死者的土地，尤指不紧邻教堂的）

782.definition: a coin and unit of money worth 1% of the main unit of money in many countries, for example of the US dollar or of the euro
782.example: A one-minute phone call to the UK cost 10 cents.
782.translation: 美分（许多国家的主要货币单位的1%，例如美元或欧元的1%）

783.definition: in the centre of an area or object

784.definition: the middle point or part of something
784.example: He walked to the centre of the circle.
784.translation: 中心（某物的中间点或部分）

785.definition: to be the person or thing around which most activity takes place; to make somebody/something the central person or thing
785.example: centre around/round somebody/something, State occasions always centred around the king.
785.translation: 以...为中心（成为活动围绕发生的中心人物或事物）

786.example: A century ago, Valparaiso was the country's main port.

787.definition: a public or religious occasion that includes a series of formal or traditional actions
787.example: More than 1 000 people attended the ceremony.
787.translation: 仪式（包括一系列正式或传统行动的公开或宗教场合）

788.definition: strongly believing something; having no doubts
788.example: I think it was him, but I can't be certain.
788.translation: 确定的（坚信某事；没有疑问）

789.example: Without treatment, she will almost certainly die.

790.example: There is no certainty that the president's removal would end the civil war.

791.definition: an official document that may be used to prove that the facts it states are true
791.translation: 证书，证明（可用于证明所陈述事实真实的官方文件）

792.definition: a series of connected metal rings, used for pulling or fastening things; a length of chain used for a particular purpose
792.example: She wore a heavy gold chain around her neck.
792.translation: 链条，链子（一系列连接的金属环，用于拉动或紧固物体）

793.definition: to fasten something with a chain; to fasten somebody/something to another person or thing with a chain, so that they do not escape or get stolen
793.example: chain somebody/something, The doors were always locked and chained.
793.translation: 用链子锁（用链子紧固某物；将某人/某物锁在另一物上）

794.definition: a piece of furniture for one person to sit on, with a back, a seat and four legs
794.translation: 椅子（供一人坐的家具，有靠背、座部和四条腿）

795.definition: to act as the chairman or chairwoman of a meeting, discussion, etc.
795.translation: 主持（担任会议、讨论等的负责人）

796.definition: the person in charge of a meeting, who tells people when they can speak, etc.
796.example: Sir Herbert took it upon himself to act as chairman.
796.translation: 主席（会议负责人，负责告知人们何时可以发言等）

797.definition: a new or difficult task that tests somebody’s ability and skill
797.translation: 挑战（测试某人能力和技能的新任务或困难任务）

798.definition: to question whether a statement or an action is right, legal, etc.; to refuse to accept something
798.example: challenge something, His legal team immediately sought to challenge the decision.
798.translation: 质疑，挑战（怀疑陈述或行动是否正确、合法；拒绝接受某事）

799.definition: difficult in an interesting way that tests your ability
799.translation: 具有挑战性的（以一种测试你能力的有趣方式展现出困难）

800.definition: a hall in a public building that is used for formal meetings
800.example: The members left the council chamber.
800.translation: 议事厅（公共建筑中用于正式会议的大厅）

801.definition: a person, team, etc. that has won a competition, especially in a sport
801.translation: 冠军（在比赛中获胜的人或团队，尤指体育比赛）

802.definition: a competition to find the best player or team in a particular sport
802.translation: 锦标赛（为了找出特定运动中最优秀选手或团队的比赛）

803.definition: a possibility of something happening, especially something that you want
803.example: chance of doing something, She only has a slim chance of passing the exam.
803.translation: 机会，可能性（某事发生的可能性，尤指你渴望的事）

804.definition: the act or result of something becoming different
804.example: change in something, We're hoping for a change in the weather.
804.translation: 变化（某事物变得不同的行为或结果）

805.example: Rick hasn't changed. He looks exactly the same as he did at school.

808.definition: a separate section of a book, usually with a number or title
808.translation: 章节（书籍中独立的部分，通常带有编号或标题）

809.definition: a person or an animal in a book, play or film
809.example: the main character in the film
809.translation: 人物，角色（书、戏或电影中的人或动物）

810.definition: very typical of something or of somebody’s character
810.example: characteristic of something/somebody, Community support of families is characteristic of many societies.
810.translation: 典型的，特征性的（某人或某物特征中非常典型的一面）

811.definition: a typical feature or quality that something/somebody has
811.example: There were few similarities in the brothers' physical characteristics.
811.translation: 特征，特性（某物/某人所具有的典型特征或品质）

812.definition: to be typical of a person, place or thing
812.example: the rolling hills that characterize this part of England
812.translation: 以...为特征（成为某人、某地或某物的典型）

813.definition: the amount of money that somebody asks for goods and services
813.translation: 费用（某人对商品和服务要求的金额）

814.definition: to ask an amount of money for goods or a service
814.example: The fees charged by some companies are excessive.
814.translation: 收费（对商品或服务要求一定数额的金钱）

815.definition: an organization for helping people in need
815.translation: 慈善机构（帮助有需要的人的组织）

816.definition: the power of pleasing or attracting people
816.example: He was a man of great charm.
816.translation: 魅力（吸引或取悦他人的力量）

817.example: The cottage is tiny, but it's charming.
817.translation: 迷人的（非常愉快或吸引人的）

818.definition: a diagram, lists of figures, etc. that shows information
818.example: Some shares have lost two-thirds of their value since being issued (see chart).
818.translation: 图表（显示信息的图表、数据列表等）

819.definition: to record or follow the progress or development of somebody/something
819.example: The exhibition charts the history of the palace.
819.translation: 记录，跟踪（记录或跟踪某人/某事的进度或发展）

820.definition: a written statement describing the rights that a particular group of people should have
820.example: the European Social Charter of workers’ rights
820.translation: 章程，宪章（描述特定群体应享权利的正式书面声明）

821.definition: an act of running or driving after somebody/something in order to catch them or it
821.example: The thieves were caught by police after a short chase.
821.translation: 追逐（为了抓住某人/某物而奔跑或驾车跟随的行为）

822.definition: to run, drive, etc. after somebody/something in order to catch them or it
822.example: chase somebody/something, My dog likes chasing rabbits.
822.translation: 追逐（为了抓住某人/某物而奔跑、驾驶等）

823.example: I just called in for a chat.
823.translation: 聊天（友好的非正式谈话）

824.definition: to talk in a friendly, informal way to somebody
824.example: I'm sorry I can't stop to chat.
824.translation: 聊天（以友好、非正式的方式与某人交谈）

825.definition: costing little money or less money than you expected
825.translation: 便宜的（价格低廉或低于预期的）

826.example: I got this dress cheap in a sale.

827.definition: a person who cheats, especially in a game
827.translation: 骗子（在游戏中作弊的人）

828.definition: to trick somebody or make them believe something that is not true
828.example: cheat somebody/something, She is accused of attempting to cheat the taxman.
828.translation: 欺骗，作弊（欺骗某人或使其相信不真实的事）

829.definition: an act of making sure that something is safe, correct or in good condition by examining it
829.example: Could you give the tyres a check?
829.translation: 检查（通过检查某物来确保其安全、正确或状态良好）

830.definition: to examine something to see if it is correct, safe or acceptable
830.example: check something, She gave me the minutes of the meeting to read and check.
830.translation: 检查（核实某事是否正确、安全或可接受）

831.definition: either side of the face below the eyes
831.translation: 脸颊（眼睛下方脸的两侧）

832.definition: a shout of joy, support or praise
832.example: A great cheer went up from the crowd.
832.translation: 欢呼，喝彩（表达喜悦、支持或赞扬的叫喊）

833.definition: to shout loudly, in order to show support or praise for somebody, or to encourage them
833.example: We all cheered as the team came on to the field.
833.translation: 欢呼（大声叫喊以示对某人的支持、赞扬或鼓励）

834.definition: happy, and showing it by the way that you behave
834.example: You're not your usual cheerful self today.
834.translation: 快乐的（高兴并从行为中表现出来）

835.definition: a type of food made from milk that can be either soft or hard and is usually white or yellow in colour; a particular type of this food
835.translation: 奶酪（由牛奶制成的固体或软质食品，通常为白色或黄色）

836.definition: a person whose job is to cook, especially the most senior person in a restaurant, hotel, etc.
836.example: a new book by celebrity chef Jamie Oliver
836.translation: 厨师（职业厨师，尤指餐厅、酒店中的高级厨师）

837.example: changes in the chemical composition of the atmosphere

838.definition: a substance obtained by or used in a chemical process
838.translation: 化学制品（通过化学过程获得或使用的物质）

839.definition: the scientific study of the structure of substances, how they react when combined or in contact with one another, and how they behave under different conditions
839.translation: 化学（研究物质结构、反应及性质的科学）

840.definition: the top part of the front of the body, between the neck and the stomach
840.translation: 胸部（身体前部的顶部，位于脖子和胃之间）

841.definition: a large bird that is often kept for its eggs or meat
841.example: They keep chickens in the back yard.
841.translation: 鸡（常为了蛋或肉而饲养的大型鸟类）

843.definition: a person with a high rank or the highest rank in a company or an organization
843.translation: 首领，长官（公司或组织中职级最高的人）

844.definition: a young human who is not yet an adult
844.translation: 孩子（尚未成年的年幼人类）

845.definition: the period of somebody’s life when they are a child
845.translation: 童年（一个人作为儿童的生活时期）

846.definition: a long thin piece of potato fried in oil or fat
846.example: He was eating a burger and chips.
846.translation: 薯条（油炸的长条马铃薯片）

847.definition: a hard brown sweet food made from cocoa beans, used in cooking to add taste to cakes, etc. or eaten as a sweet
847.translation: 巧克力（由可可豆制成的棕色硬甜食）

848.definition: an act of choosing between two or more possibilities; something that you can choose
848.example: We are faced with a difficult choice.
848.translation: 选择（在两个或更多可能性之间进行的抉择行为；可选之物）

849.definition: a group of people who sing together, for example in church services or public performances
849.example: She sings in the school choir.
849.translation: 合唱团（一起唱歌的一群人，如在教堂或公开演出中）

850.definition: to decide which thing or person you want out of the ones that are available
850.translation: 选择（从可选项中决定你想要哪一个物或人）

851.definition: to cut something into pieces with a sharp tool such as a knife
851.example: chop something, He was chopping logs for firewood.
851.translation: 砍，剁（用刀等利器将某物切成碎片）

852.definition: lasting for a long time; difficult to cure
852.translation: 慢性的（持续时间长且难以治愈的）

853.definition: a thick, solid piece that has been cut or broken off something
853.translation: 大块（从某物上切下或折断的厚实、坚固的一块）

854.definition: a building where Christians go to attend services, pray, etc.
854.example: The procession moved into the church.
854.translation: 教堂（基督徒参加礼拜、祈祷等的建筑）

855.definition: a thin tube of paper filled with tobacco, for smoking
855.translation: 香烟（填充烟草供吸食的细纸管）

856.definition: a building in which films are shown
856.translation: 电影院（放映电影的建筑）

858.definition: to draw a circle around something
858.example: circle something, Luke circled a date on the kitchen calendar.
858.translation: 圈出（在某物周围画一个圆）

859.definition: a line, route or journey around a place
859.example: The race ended with eight laps of a city centre circuit.
859.translation: 环路，电路（围绕某地的线路、路径或旅程）

860.definition: when a liquid, gas or air circulates or is circulated, it moves continuously around a place or system
860.example: The condition prevents the blood from circulating freely.
860.translation: 循环（液体、气体或空气在某处或系统中连续移动）

861.definition: the movement of blood around the body
861.example: Regular exercise will improve blood circulation.
861.translation: 循环（血液在全身的流动）

862.definition: the conditions and facts that are connected with and affect a situation, an event or an action
862.example: Police said there were no suspicious circumstances surrounding the boy's death.
862.translation: 情况，环境（与情况、事件或行动相关并影响它的条件和事实）

863.definition: to mention something as a reason or an example, or in order to support what you are saying
863.example: cite something, She cited examples of companies the city has helped relocate or expand.
863.translation: 引用（提及某事作为理由、例子或为了支持你的观点）

864.definition: a person who has the legal right to belong to a particular country
864.example: The defeat of the president did not change the lives of ordinary citizens for the better.
864.translation: 公民（具有属于特定国家法律权利的人）

865.definition: the legal right to belong to a particular country
865.example: They were granted full French citizenship.
865.translation: 公民身份（属于特定国家的法律权利）

866.example: Parking is difficult in the city centre.
866.translation: 城市（大型且重要的城镇）

867.definition: officially connected with a town or city
867.translation: 城市的，市民的（正式与城镇或城市有关的）

868.definition: connected with the people who live in a country
868.example: civil unrest (= that is caused by groups of people within a country)
868.translation: 民用的，公民的（与居住在国家的人民有关的）

869.definition: connected with people who are not members of the armed forces or the police
869.example: He left the army and returned to civilian life.
869.translation: 平民的（与非武装部队或警察成员的人有关的）

870.definition: a person who is not a member of the armed forces or the police
870.example: Two soldiers and one civilian were killed in the explosion.
870.translation: 平民（非武装部队或警察成员的人）

871.definition: a state of human society that is very developed and organized
871.translation: 文明（高度发达且有组织的社会状态）

872.definition: a statement that something is true although it has not been proved and other people may not agree with or believe it
872.example: claim about somebody/something, The company had made false claims about its products.
872.translation: 主张，声明（关于某事属实的陈述，尽管尚未被证实且他人可能不同意）

873.definition: to say that something is true although it has not been proved and other people may not believe it
873.example: claim (that)…, He claims (that) he was not given a fair hearing.
873.translation: 主张，声称（在未证实的情况下称某事为真）

874.definition: to make something clearer or easier to understand
874.example: clarify something, to clarify a situation/problem/issue
874.translation: 阐明，澄清（使某事更清晰或更容易理解）

875.definition: the quality of being expressed clearly
875.example: a lack of clarity in the law
875.translation: 清晰（表达得清楚明确的品质）

876.definition: a short fight between two groups of people
876.example: Clashes broke out between police and demonstrators.
876.translation: 冲突（两群人之间的短暂战斗）

877.definition: a group of students who are taught together
877.example: in the/your class, We were in the same class at school.
877.translation: 班级（一起上课的一群学生）

878.definition: accepted or deserving to be accepted as one of the best or most important of its kind
878.translation: 经典的（公认为同类中最优秀或最重要的之一）

879.definition: a book, film or song which is well known and considered to be of very high quality, setting standards for other books, etc.
879.example: The film is now a cult classic.
879.translation: 经典（著名的、被认为具有极高质量且为其他作品设定标准的书、电影等）

880.translation: 古典的（与古典音乐有关的）

881.definition: the act or process of putting people or things into a group or class (= of classifying them)
881.example: a style of music that defies classification (= is like no other)
881.translation: 分类（将人或物归入特定组或类的行为或过程）

882.definition: to arrange something in groups according to features that they have in common
882.example: The books in the library are classified according to subject.
882.translation: 分类（根据共同特征将某物按组排列）

883.definition: a room where a class of children or students is taught
883.translation: 教室（教孩子或学生上课的房间）

884.definition: a group of words that includes a subject and a verb, and forms a sentence or part of a sentence
884.example: in a clause, There are languages that require the subject to come before the object in a clause.
884.translation: 子句，从句（包含主语和谓语并构成句子的词组）

886.definition: to remove the dirt or dust from something
886.example: I spent all day cooking and cleaning.
886.translation: 打扫（清除某物上的污垢或灰尘）

887.definition: easy to understand and not confusing
887.example: She gave me clear and precise directions.
887.translation: 清晰的（易于理解且不令人困惑的）

888.definition: to remove things that are not wanted or needed from something
888.example: clear something, The settlers cleared the land and planted crops.
888.translation: 清除（从某物中移走不想要或不需要的东西）

889.definition: in a way that is easy to see or hear
889.example: Please speak clearly after the tone.
889.translation: 清晰地（以易于看见或听见的方式）

890.definition: a person whose job is to serve customers in a shop
890.example: The clerk at the counter gave me too little change.
890.translation: 店员，办事员（在商店接待顾客的人或办公室职员）

891.definition: quick at learning and understanding things
891.translation: 聪明的（学习和理解事物很快的）

892.definition: the act of pressing the button on a computer mouse or touchpad
892.translation: 点击（按下电脑鼠标或触控板按钮的行为）

893.definition: to choose a particular function or item on a computer screen, etc., by pressing one of the buttons on a mouse or touchpad
893.example: Click here to add your opinion to the survey.
893.translation: 点击（通过按下鼠标按钮在电脑屏幕上选择功能或项目）

894.definition: a person who uses the services or advice of a professional person or organization
894.example: She's a well-known lawyer with many famous clients.
894.translation: 客户（使用专业人员或组织的服务或建议的人）

895.definition: a high area of rock with a very steep side, often at the edge of the sea or ocean
895.translation: 悬崖（带有极陡峭侧面的高大岩石区域，常在海边）

896.definition: the regular pattern of weather conditions of a particular place
896.translation: 气候（某地天气的常规模式）

897.definition: an act of climbing up a mountain, rock or large number of steps; a period of time spent climbing
897.translation: 攀登（爬山、攀岩或爬楼梯的行为；攀爬的时间）

898.definition: to go up something towards the top
898.example: climb (up) something, to climb a mountain/tree

899.definition: to hold on tightly to somebody/something
899.example: cling to somebody/something, survivors clinging to a raft
899.translation: 紧紧抓住（紧紧握住某人/某物）

900.definition: a building or part of a hospital where people can go for special medical treatment or advice
900.example: Your local family planning clinic can give you advice about birth control.
900.translation: 诊所（医院的一部分或独立建筑，提供专门医疗或咨询）

901.definition: relating to the examination and treatment of patients and their illnesses
901.example: clinical research (= done on patients, not just considering theory)
901.translation: 临床的（与病人的检查和治疗有关的，而非仅基于理论）

902.definition: a short part of a film that is shown separately
902.example: Here is a clip from her latest movie.
902.translation: 剪辑（电影的一小部分，常单独播放）

903.definition: an instrument for measuring and showing time, in a room, on the wall of a building or on a computer screen (not worn or carried like a watch)
903.translation: 时钟（用于在房间、墙壁或电脑上测量和显示时间的仪器，非手表）

904.example: I had no idea the beach was so close.
904.translation: 近的（在空间或时间上靠近的）

906.definition: the end of a period of time or an activity
906.example: at the close of the seventeenth century
906.translation: 结束（一段时间或一项活动的终点）

907.definition: to put something into a position so that it covers an opening; to get into this position
907.translation: 关（将某物置于遮盖开口的位置；进入此位置）

909.example: He walked into the room, closely followed by the rest of the family.
909.translation: 紧密地（在空间或时间上靠近地）

910.definition: the situation when a factory, school, hospital, etc. shuts permanently
910.translation: 关闭（工厂、学校、医院等永久关闭的情况）

911.definition: material made by weaving or knitting cotton, wool, silk, etc.
911.translation: 布（通过编织棉、毛、丝等制成的材料）

912.definition: the things that you wear, such as trousers, dresses and jackets
912.example: I bought some new clothes for the trip.
912.translation: 衣服（人们穿着的物品，如裤子、连衣裙和夹克）

913.definition: clothes, especially a particular type of clothes
913.example: Workers at the factory wear protective clothing.
913.translation: 服装（衣服，尤指特定类型的衣服，如防护服）

914.definition: a grey or white mass that floats in the sky, made of very small drops of water
914.example: Dark clouds were gathering in the west.
914.translation: 云（天空中漂浮的灰色或白色水滴团块）

915.definition: an organization for people who share an interest or do a sport or activity together
915.translation: 俱乐部（由志趣相投或一起进行体育、活动的人组成的组织）

916.definition: an object, a piece of evidence or some information that helps the police solve a crime
916.translation: 线索（帮助警方破案的物体、证据或信息）

917.definition: a group of things of the same type that grow or appear close together
917.example: The telescope is focused on a dense cluster of stars at the edge of the galaxy.
917.translation: 簇，群（生长或出现在一起的一组同类事物）

918.definition: a person who trains a person or team in sport
918.translation: 教练（训练运动员或团队的人）

919.definition: to train somebody to play a sport, to do a job better, or to improve a skill
919.example: coach somebody, He has coached the team for five years.
919.translation: 指导，训练（训练某人进行体育运动、提高工作技能等）

920.definition: a hard black mineral that is found below the ground and burnt to produce heat
920.example: I put more coal on the fire.
920.translation: 煤（地下的黑色矿物，燃烧产生热量）

921.definition: a government formed by two or more political parties working together
921.example: The two parties have formed a coalition.
921.translation: 联盟（由两个或多个政党共同组成的政府）

922.definition: the land next to or near to the sea or ocean

923.translation: 海岸的（在海岸附近或属于海岸的）

924.definition: a piece of outdoor clothing that is worn over other clothes to keep warm or dry. Coats have sleeves (= parts covering the arms) and may be long or short.
924.translation: 大衣，外衣（穿在其他衣服外面以保暖或防雨的带袖外套）

925.definition: a drink usually made from a mixture of one or more spirits (= strong alcoholic drinks) and fruit juice. It can also be made without alcohol.
925.translation: 鸡尾酒（由烈酒和果汁等混合而成的饮料）

926.definition: a system of words, letters, numbers or symbols that represent a message or record information secretly or in a shorter form
926.example: to break/crack a code (= to understand and read the message)
926.translation: 代码，密码（用词语、字母、数字或符号表示信息或秘密记录信息的系统）

927.definition: the roasted seeds (called coffee beans) of a tropical bush; a powder made from them
927.translation: 咖啡（热带灌木的烤干种子，或由此制成的粉末）

928.definition: connected with mental processes of understanding
928.translation: 认知的（与思维理解过程有关的）

929.definition: a small flat piece of metal used as money
929.translation: 硬币（作为货币使用的扁平金属小块）

930.definition: to take place at the same time
930.example: It's a pity our trips to New York don't coincide.
930.translation: 同时发生（在同一时间发生）

931.definition: the fact of two things happening at the same time by chance, in a surprising way
931.translation: 巧合（两件事偶然且令人惊讶地在同一时间发生的事实）

932.definition: having a lower than usual temperature; having a temperature lower than the human body
932.example: I'm cold. Turn the heating up.
932.translation: 寒冷的（温度低于通常水平或低于人体的）

933.definition: a common illness that affects the nose and/or throat, making you cough, sneeze, etc.
933.translation: 感冒（影响鼻腔或喉咙的常见疾病，引起咳嗽、喷嚏等）

934.definition: to work together with somebody in order to produce or achieve something
934.example: Researchers around the world are collaborating to develop a new vaccine.
934.translation: 合作（与他人共同工作以生产或实现某事）

935.definition: the act of working with another person or group of people to create or produce something
935.example: It was a collaboration that produced extremely useful results.
935.translation: 合作（与他人或团体共同创造或生产某物的行为）

936.definition: a sudden failure of something, such as an institution, a business or a course of action
936.example: the collapse of the Soviet Union
936.translation: 崩溃，垮台（事物如机构、企业或行动方案的突然失败）

937.definition: to fall down or fall in suddenly, often after breaking apart
937.example: The roof collapsed under the weight of snow.
937.translation: 坍塌（突然倒塌，通常是在碎裂后）

938.definition: a person that you work with, especially in a profession or a business
938.translation: 同事（一起工作的人，尤指在专业领域或商业中）

939.definition: to bring things together from different people or places
939.translation: 收集（从不同的人或地方将物品聚集在一起）

940.definition: a group of objects, often of the same sort, that have been collected
940.example: He wanted to share his vast art collection with the world.
940.translation: 收藏品（收集在一起的一组物品，通常是同类的）

941.definition: done or shared by all members of a group of people; involving a whole group or society
941.translation: 集体的（由群体的所有成员共同完成或分享的；涉及整个社会或群体的）

942.definition: a person who collects things, either as a hobby or as a job
942.translation: 收藏家（以爱好或职业收集物品的人）

943.definition: (in the UK) a place where students go to study or to receive training after they have left school
943.translation: 学院，大学（学生在离校后接受进一步教育或培训的地方）

944.definition: an accident in which two vehicles or people crash into each other
944.example: collision between A and B, a collision between two trains
944.translation: 碰撞（两个车辆或人相撞的事故）

945.definition: connected with or belonging to a country that controls another country
945.translation: 殖民的（与控制他国的国家有关或属于该国的）

946.definition: a country or an area that is governed by people from another, more powerful, country
946.translation: 殖民地（由另一个更强大的国家的人民统治的国家或地区）

947.definition: the appearance that things have that results from the way in which they reflect light. Red, orange and green are colours.
947.translation: 颜色（物体反射光线所呈现的外观，如红、橙、绿）

948.definition: having a particular colour or different colours
948.translation: 有色的（具有特定颜色或多种颜色的）

949.definition: full of bright colours or having a lot of different colours
949.translation: 五颜六色的（充满明亮色彩或有许多不同颜色的）

950.definition: one of the straight sections from top to bottom into which text on a page or screen is divided
950.example: a dictionary with two columns per page
950.translation: 列，栏（页面或屏幕上文字划分的垂直部分）

951.definition: a journalist who writes regular articles for a newspaper or magazine
951.translation: 专栏作家（定期为报纸或杂志撰写文章的记者）

952.definition: fighting or a fight, especially during a time of war
952.example: in combat, He was killed in combat.
952.translation: 战斗（战斗或斗争，尤指在战争期间）

953.definition: to stop something unpleasant or harmful from happening or from getting worse
953.translation: 打击（停止不愉快或有害事物的发生或恶化）

954.definition: two or more things joined or mixed together to form a single unit
954.example: combination of something, The tragedy was due to a combination of factors.
954.translation: 结合（两个或更多事物加入或混合在一起形成的单元）

955.definition: to come together to form a single thing or group; to join two or more things or groups together to form a single one
955.example: combine to do something, Hydrogen and oxygen combine to form water.
955.translation: 结合，联合（共同形成一个单一的事物或群体）

956.definition: to move to or towards a person or place
956.example: + adv./prep., He left and said he was never coming back.
956.translation: 来（移动到或朝向某人或某地）

957.definition: a play, film or TV show that is intended to be funny, usually with a happy ending; plays, films and TV shows of this type
957.translation: 喜剧（旨在使人发笑的戏剧、电影或电视节目，通常有圆满结局）

958.definition: the state of being physically relaxed and free from pain; the state of having a pleasant life, with everything that you need
958.example: The hotel offers a high standard of comfort and service.
958.translation: 舒适，慰藉（身体放松且无痛的状态；生活愉快的状态）

959.definition: to make somebody who is worried or unhappy feel better by being kind and showing sympathy to them
959.example: comfort somebody, The victim's widow was today being comforted by family and friends.
959.translation: 安慰（通过友善和同情使忧虑或不快乐的人感到好受些）

960.definition: making you feel physically relaxed; pleasant to wear, sit on, etc.
960.translation: 舒适的（使身体感到放松的；穿戴或坐卧愉快的）

961.translation: 滑稽的（幽默且使人发笑的）

962.definition: a magazine, usually for children, that tells stories through pictures
962.translation: 连环画，漫画（通常供儿童阅读的通过图片讲故事的杂志）

963.definition: an order given to a person or an animal
963.example: Begin when I give the command.
963.translation: 命令（下达给某人或动物的指示）

964.definition: to tell somebody to do something
964.example: command somebody to do something, He commanded his men to retreat.
964.translation: 命令（告诉某人去做某事）

965.definition: a person who is in charge of something, especially an officer in charge of a particular group of soldiers or a military operation
965.translation: 指挥官（负责人，尤指负责某支部队或军事行动的军官）

966.definition: to begin to happen; to begin something
966.example: The meeting is scheduled to commence at noon.
966.translation: 开始（开始发生；开始某事）

967.definition: something that you say or write that gives an opinion on or explains somebody/something
967.example: comment on something, She made helpful comments on my work.
967.translation: 评论（表达观点或解释某人/某事所说或所写的内容）

968.definition: to express an opinion about something
968.example: He refused to comment until after the trial.

969.definition: a spoken description of an event that is given while it is happening, especially on the radio or television
969.translation: 解说（在事件发生时进行的口头描述，尤指在广播或电视上）

970.definition: a person who describes an event while it is happening, especially on television or radio
970.translation: 评论员（在事件发生时进行描述的人，尤指在电视或广播上）

971.definition: trade, especially between countries; the buying and selling of goods and services
971.example: Leaders of industry and commerce met at the summit in Paris.
971.translation: 商业，贸易（贸易，尤指国家间的贸易；买卖商品和服务）

972.definition: connected with the buying and selling of goods and services
972.translation: 商业的（与买卖商品和服务有关的）

973.definition: an advertisement on television, on the radio or on a website
973.translation: 商业广告（电视、广播或网站上的广告）

974.definition: an official group of people who have been given responsibility to control something, or to find out about something, usually for the government
974.example: The commission is expected to report its findings next month.
974.translation: 委员会（被赋予责任去控制或调查某事的官方团体，通常为政府服务）

975.definition: to officially ask somebody to write, make or create something or to do a task for you
975.example: commission somebody to do something, She has been commissioned to write a new national anthem.
975.translation: 委托（正式请求某人创作某物或为你完成一项任务）

976.definition: a member of a commission (= an official group of people who are responsible for controlling something or finding out about something)
976.example: the Church Commissioners (= the group of people responsible for controlling the financial affairs of the Church of England)
976.translation: 委员（委员会的成员，负责控制或调查某事）

977.definition: to do something wrong or illegal
977.translation: 犯（做错误或违法的事，如犯罪）

978.definition: a promise to do something or to behave in a particular way; a promise to support somebody/something; the fact of committing yourself
978.example: I'm not ready to make a long-term commitment.
978.translation: 承诺，奉献（承诺去做某事或以特定方式行事；支持某人的诺言）

979.definition: a group of people who are chosen, usually by a larger group, to make decisions or to deal with a particular subject
979.translation: 委员会（由较大群体选出以进行决策或处理特定事务的小组）

980.definition: a product or a raw material that can be bought and sold
980.example: rice, flour and other basic commodities
980.translation: 商品（可以买卖的产品或原材料，如大米、面粉等）

981.definition: happening often; existing in large numbers or in many places
981.translation: 常见的（经常发生的；大量存在或存在于多处的）

982.definition: usually; very often; by most people
982.example: Christopher is commonly known as Kit.
982.translation: 通常，普遍（通常地；非常频繁地；被大多数人地）

983.definition: to share or exchange information, news, ideas, feelings, etc.
983.translation: 交流，沟通（分享或交换信息、新闻、想法、情感等）

984.definition: the activity or process of expressing ideas and feelings or of giving people information
984.example: communication between A and B, Good communication between team leaders and members is essential.
984.translation: 交流，沟通（表达思想、情感或向人传递信息的活动或过程）

985.translation: 共产主义的（与共产主义有关的）

986.definition: all the people who live in a particular area, country, etc. when talked about as a group
986.example: The local community supported us from the start.
986.translation: 社区，群体（作为一个整体谈论的居住在特定地区或国家的所有人）

987.definition: a person or an animal that travels with you or spends a lot of time with you
987.translation: 同伴（与你一起旅行或共度大量时间的人或动物）

988.definition: a business organization that makes money by producing or selling goods or services
988.translation: 公司（通过生产或销售商品、服务赚钱的商业组织）

989.definition: similar to somebody/something else and able to be compared
989.example: A comparable house in the south of the city would cost twice as much.
989.translation: 可比的（与他物相似且可以进行比较的）

990.definition: measured or judged by how similar or different it is to something else
990.example: Then he was living in comparative comfort (= compared with others or with his own life at a previous time).
990.translation: 相对的，比较而言的（通过与他物比较来衡量或判断的）

991.definition: to examine people or things to see how they are similar and how they are different
991.example: compare A and B, It is interesting to compare their situation and ours.
991.translation: 比较（检查人或物以找出其相似和不同之处）

992.definition: the process of comparing two or more people or things
992.example: For Durkheim, comparison was the most important method of analysis in sociology.
992.translation: 比较（比较两个或更多人或事的过程）

993.definition: a strong feeling of sympathy for people or animals who are suffering and a desire to help them
993.translation: 同情，怜悯（对受苦的人或动物的强烈同情及帮助欲望）

994.definition: to force somebody to do something; to make something necessary
994.example: compel somebody to do something, The law can compel fathers to make regular payments for their children.
994.translation: 强迫（迫使某人做某事；使某事成为必要）

995.definition: that makes you pay attention to it because it is so interesting and exciting
995.example: Her latest book makes compelling reading.
995.translation: 引人入胜的（因非常有趣而使你不得不关注的）

996.definition: to provide something good to balance or reduce the bad effects of damage, loss, etc.
996.example: Nothing can compensate for the loss of a loved one.
996.translation: 补偿，弥补（提供好事以平衡或减轻损失、伤害等带来的负面影响）

997.definition: something, especially money, that somebody gives you because they have hurt you, or damaged something that you own; the act of giving this to somebody
997.translation: 补偿，赔偿（因伤害或损失而给予某人的金钱或其他补偿）

998.definition: to take part in a contest or game
998.example: The games were an outstanding success, with almost 2 400 athletes competing.

999.definition: the ability to do something well
999.example: to gain a high level of competence in English
999.translation: 能力，胜任（做好某事的能力）

1000.definition: having enough skill or knowledge to do something well or to the necessary standard
1000.example: He's very competent in his work.
1000.translation: 胜任的（具备做好某事或达到必要标准所需的技能或知识）

1001.definition: an event in which people compete with each other to find out who is the best at something
1001.translation: 竞争，比赛（人们互相竞争以找出谁在某方面最出色的活动）

1002.definition: used to describe a situation in which people or organizations compete against each other
1002.translation: 竞争的（描述人或组织相互竞争的情况）

1003.definition: a person who takes part in a competition

1004.definition: to produce a book, list, report, etc. by bringing together different items, articles, songs, etc.; to collect information in order to produce a book, list, etc.
1004.example: We are trying to compile a list of suitable people for the job.
1004.translation: 汇编，编辑（通过收集不同的项目、文章、歌曲等制作书、列表或报告）

1005.definition: to say that you are annoyed, unhappy or not satisfied about somebody/something
1005.example: She never complains, but she's obviously exhausted.
1005.translation: 抱怨（表示对某人/某事感到烦恼、不快或不满意）

1006.definition: a reason for not being satisfied; a statement that somebody makes saying that they are not satisfied
1006.translation: 投诉，抱怨（不满意的理由；表示不满意的陈述）

1007.definition: to add to something in a way that improves it or makes it more attractive
1007.example: The excellent menu is complemented by a good wine list.
1007.translation: 补充（以改善某物或使其更具吸引力的方式添加内容）

1008.definition: including all the parts, etc. that are necessary; whole
1008.translation: 完整的（包括所有必要部分的；整体的）

1009.definition: to finish making or doing something
1009.translation: 完成（结束制造或做某事）

1010.definition: in every way possible; in every part
1010.example: It was completely different from how I had imagined it.
1010.translation: 完全地（在每一个可能的方面；在每一个部分）

1011.definition: the act or process of finishing something; the state of being finished and complete
1011.example: the completion of the new hospital building
1011.translation: 完成，完工（结束某事的行为或过程；完成的状态）

1012.definition: made of many different things or parts that are connected; difficult to understand
1012.translation: 复杂的（由许多不同且相连的事物或部分组成的；难以理解的）

1013.definition: a group of buildings of a similar type together in one place
1013.translation: 综合体（在同一地点的一组类似类型的建筑，如体育或购物综合体）

1014.definition: the state of being formed of many parts; the state of being difficult to understand
1014.example: the increasing complexity of modern telecommunication systems
1014.translation: 复杂性（由许多部分组成的状态；难以理解的状态）

1015.definition: the practice of obeying rules or requests made by people in authority
1015.example: compliance (with something), procedures that must be followed to ensure full compliance with the law
1015.translation: 服从，遵守（遵守由权力部门制定的规则或请求的行为）

1016.definition: made of many different things or parts that are connected; difficult to understand
1016.translation: 复杂的（由许多不同且相连的部分组成的；难以理解的）

1017.definition: a thing that makes a situation more complicated or difficult
1017.example: The bad weather added a further complication to our journey.
1017.translation: 并发症，使复杂化的因素（使情况变得更复杂或困难的事物）

1018.definition: to obey a rule, an order, etc.; to meet particular standards
1018.example: They refused to comply with the UN resolution.
1018.translation: 遵守（服从规则、命令等；达到特定标准）

1019.definition: one of several parts of which something is made
1019.example: the different organizations involved in the design of the various components
1019.translation: 组件，部件（构成某物的几个部分之一）

1020.example: Mozart composed his last opera shortly before he died.

1021.definition: a person who writes music, especially classical music
1021.example: Verdi was a prolific composer of operas.
1021.translation: 作曲家（创作者，尤指古典音乐的创作者）

1022.definition: the different parts that something is made of; the way in which the different parts are organized
1022.example: the chemical composition of the soil
1022.translation: 构成，成分（某物所由构成的不同部分；各部分组织的方式）

1023.definition: a thing consisting of two or more separate things combined together
1023.translation: 化合物，复合物（由两个或更多独立事物结合而成的物体）

1024.definition: including all, or almost all, the items, details, facts, information, etc., that may be involved
1024.translation: 全面的（包括几乎所有可能涉及的项目、细节、事实或信息）

1025.definition: to have somebody/something as parts or members
1025.example: comprise something, The collection comprises 327 paintings.
1025.translation: 包含，构成（以某人/某物作为部分或成员）

1026.definition: an agreement made between two people or groups in which each side gives up some of the things they want so that both sides are happy at the end
1026.example: After lengthy talks the two sides finally reached a compromise.
1026.translation: 妥协，让步（两人或团体达成的各让一步的协议，使双方都满意）
