1027.definition: to give up some of your demands in order to reach an agreement after disagreeing with somebody
1027.example: Neither side is prepared to compromise.
1027.translation: 妥协，折衷（放弃部分要求以达成协议）

1028.definition: that must be done because of a law or a rule
1028.example: English is a compulsory subject at this level.
1028.translation: 强制的（因法律或规则而必须做的）

1029.example: The losses were computed at £5 million.
1029.translation: 计算（计算某事，如损失金额）

1030.definition: an electronic machine that can store, organize and find information, do processes with numbers and other data, and control other machines
1030.translation: 计算机（能存储、组织和查找信息、处理数据及控制其他机器的电子设备）

1031.example: conceal somebody/something, The paintings were concealed beneath a thick layer of plaster.

1032.definition: to admit that something is true, logical, etc. after first denying it or resisting it
1032.translation: 承认（在否认或抵制后，承认某事是真实的或合乎逻辑的）

1033.definition: to form an idea, a plan, etc. in your mind
1033.example: He conceived the idea of transforming the old power station into an arts centre.
1033.translation: 构思（在脑中形成主意、计划等）

1034.definition: to give all your attention to something and not think about anything else
1034.example: I can't concentrate with all that noise going on.
1034.translation: 集中，专注（将全部注意力放在某事上，不考虑其他）

1035.definition: the ability to direct all your effort and attention on one thing, without thinking of other things
1035.example: This book requires a great deal of concentration.
1035.translation: 专注，浓度（不考虑其他事物而将努力和注意力导向一件事的能力）

1036.definition: an idea or a principle that is connected with something abstract
1036.example: concept of something, the concept of social class
1036.translation: 概念（与抽象事物相关的想法或原则）

1037.definition: an understanding or a belief of what something/somebody is or what something/somebody should be
1037.example: conception of something, Marx’s conception of social justice
1037.translation: 观念，理解（对某事物/某人是什么或应该是什的理解或信念）

1038.definition: a feeling of worry, especially one that is shared by many people
1038.example: concern about something/somebody, Villagers expressed concern about the level of traffic.
1038.translation: 忧虑，关切（担心的感觉，尤指由许多人共有的）

1039.definition: to affect somebody/something; to involve somebody/something
1039.example: Don't interfere in what doesn't concern you.
1039.translation: 涉及，关系到（影响某人/某物；与某人/某物有关）

1040.definition: worried and feeling concern about something/somebody
1040.example: Concerned citizens can have a huge impact.
1040.translation: 担心的，有关的（感到忧虑或担心的）

1041.translation: 音乐会（音乐的公开演出）

1042.definition: something that you allow or do, or allow somebody to have, in order to end an argument or to make a situation less difficult
1042.example: The firm will be forced to make concessions if it wants to avoid a strike.
1042.translation: 让步（为了结束争论或缓解困难局面而允许或做出的事情）

1043.definition: to decide or believe something as a result of what you have heard or seen
1043.example: conclude something, It is too early for us to conclude anything.
1043.translation: 推断出（根据所听或所见做出的决定或相信的事）

1044.definition: something that you decide when you have thought about all the information connected with the situation
1044.example: We can safely draw some conclusions from our discussion.
1044.translation: 结论（在思考了所有相关信息后做出的决定）

1045.translation: 混凝土制的（由混凝土制成的）

1046.definition: building material that is made by mixing together cement, sand, small stones and water
1046.translation: 混凝土（由水泥、沙、碎石和水混合而成的建筑材料）

1047.definition: to say very strongly that you think something is bad, usually for moral reasons
1047.example: condemn somebody/something, The government issued a statement condemning the killings.
1047.translation: 谴责（通常出于道德原因强烈表示认为某事是错误的）

1048.definition: the state that something is in
1048.example: in… condition, to be in pristine/excellent/perfect condition
1048.translation: 状态，状况（事物所处的状况）

1049.definition: a person’s behaviour in a particular place or in a particular situation
1049.example: The sport has a strict code of conduct.
1049.translation: 品行，行为（一个人在特定场所或情况下的表现）

1050.definition: to organize and/or do a particular activity
1050.translation: 组织，进行（组织和/或进行特定的活动，如实验或调查）

1051.definition: to discuss something with somebody, in order to exchange opinions or get advice
1051.example: He wanted to confer with his colleagues before reaching a decision.
1051.translation: 商议（与某人讨论以交换意见或获得建议）

1052.definition: a large official meeting, usually lasting for a few days, at which people with the same work or interests come together to discuss their views
1052.example: The hotel is used for exhibitions, conferences and social events.
1052.translation: 会议（大型正式会议，通常持续数天，同行业或同兴趣的人在此讨论观点）

1053.definition: to admit, especially formally or to the police, that you have done something wrong or illegal
1053.example: After hours of questioning, the suspect confessed.
1053.translation: 承认，供认（承认，尤指正式或向警方承认做了错事或违法的事）

1054.definition: a statement that a person makes, admitting that they are guilty of a crime; the act of making such a statement
1054.example: After hours of questioning by police, she made a full confession.
1054.translation: 供词，坦白（承认犯罪的陈述；这种承认行为）

1055.definition: the feeling that you can trust, believe in and be sure about the abilities or good qualities of somebody/something
1055.example: The president's actions hardly inspire confidence.
1055.translation: 信心，信任（信任、相信并确信某人/某事的能力或优良品质的感觉）

1056.definition: feeling sure about your own ability to do things and be successful
1056.example: She was in a relaxed, confident mood.
1056.translation: 自信的（对自己的能力和成功感到确信的）

1057.definition: an arrangement of the parts of something or a group of things; the form or shape that this arrangement produces
1057.example: configuration of something, The design is based on four configurations of squares.
1057.translation: 配置（某物各部分的排列，或这种排列产生的形式或形状）

1058.definition: to keep somebody/something inside the limits of a particular activity, subject, area, etc.
1058.example: be confined to (doing) something, The work will not be confined to the Glasgow area.
1058.translation: 限制（将某人/某物保持在特定活动、主题或区域的范围内）

1059.definition: to state or show that something is definitely true or correct, especially by providing evidence
1059.example: confirm something, His guilty expression confirmed my suspicions.
1059.translation: 确认（通过提供证据说明某事肯定是真实或正确的）

1060.definition: a statement, letter, etc. that shows that something is true, correct or definite
1060.example: I'm still waiting for confirmation of the test results.
1060.translation: 确认，证实（说明某事真实、正确或确定的声明、信件等）

1061.definition: a situation in which people, groups or countries disagree strongly or are involved in a serious argument
1061.example: The violence was the result of political conflicts.
1061.translation: 冲突（人、团体或国家之间强烈分歧或陷入严重争论的情况）

1062.definition: if two ideas, beliefs, stories, etc. conflict, it is not possible for them to exist together or for them both to be true
1062.example: Reports conflicted on how much of the aid was reaching the famine victims.
1062.translation: 冲突，矛盾（如果两个想法、信仰等冲突，指它们不能共同存在或不同时为真）

1063.definition: to appear and need to be dealt with by somebody
1063.example: What is to be done about the economic problems confronting the country?
1063.translation: 面对，面临（出现并需要由某人处理）

1064.definition: a situation in which there is anger between people or groups who disagree because they have different opinions
1064.example: confrontation (with somebody), She wanted to avoid another confrontation with her father.
1064.translation: 对峙（因意见不同而在人或团体之间产生的愤怒局面）

1065.definition: to make somebody unable to think clearly or understand something
1065.example: confuse somebody, These two sets of statistics are guaranteed to confuse the public.
1065.translation: 使困惑（使某人无法清晰思考或理解某事）

1066.definition: unable to think clearly or to understand what is happening or what somebody is saying
1066.translation: 困惑的（无法清晰思考或理解正在发生的事或某人所说的话）

1067.example: The instructions on the box are very confusing.
1067.translation: 令人困惑的（难以理解的；不清晰的）

1068.definition: a state of not being certain about what is happening, what you should do, what something means, etc.
1068.example: The announcement caused a lot of confusion.
1068.translation: 混乱（对发生的事、该做什么或某事的含义不确定的状态）

1069.definition: to tell somebody that you are pleased about their success or achievements
1069.example: I congratulated them all on their results.
1069.translation: 祝贺（告诉某人你对其成功或成就感到高兴）

1070.definition: a group of people who are gathered together in a church for a religious service, not including the priest and choir
1070.example: The congregation stood to sing the hymn.
1070.translation: 会众（聚集在教堂进行宗教仪式的一群人，不包括牧师和合唱团）

1071.definition: related to or belonging to a congress or the Congress in the US
1071.translation: 国会的（与国会或美国国会有关的）

1072.definition: to join together two or more things; to be joined together
1072.example: connect A and B, The towns are connected by train and bus services.
1072.translation: 连接（将两个或更多事物连接在一起；被连接在一起）

1073.definition: (of two or more things or people) having a link between them
1073.example: We do not believe that the incidents are connected.
1073.translation: 连接的，相关的（两个或更多事物或人之间有联系的）

1074.definition: something that connects two facts, ideas, etc.
1074.example: connection between A and B, Scientists have established a connection between cholesterol levels and heart disease.
1074.translation: 连接，联系（连接两个事实、想法等的事物）

1075.definition: to take control of a country or city and its people by force
1075.translation: 征服（通过武力夺取对国家或城市的控制权）

1076.definition: the part of your mind that tells you whether your actions are right or wrong
1076.example: to have a clear/guilty conscience (= to feel that you have done right/wrong)
1076.translation: 良心（头脑中告诉你行为对错的部分）

1077.example: conscious of something, She's very conscious of the problems involved.
1077.translation: 意识到的（意识到某事；注意到某事）

1078.definition: the state of being able to use your senses and mental powers to understand what is happening
1078.example: I can't remember any more—I must have lost consciousness.
1078.translation: 意识（能够使用感官和思维能力理解正在发生的事的状态）

1079.definition: following one after another in a continuous series
1079.example: She was absent for nine consecutive days.
1079.translation: 连续的（在一个连续系列中一个接一个发生的）

1080.definition: an opinion that all members of a group agree with
1080.example: consensus (about/on something), She is skilled at achieving consensus on sensitive issues.
1080.translation: 共识（群体中所有成员都同意的意见）

1081.definition: permission to do something, especially given by somebody in authority
1081.example: The written consent of a parent is required.
1081.translation: 准许，同意（做某事的许可，尤指权力部门给予的）

1082.definition: to agree to something or give your permission for something
1082.example: When she told them what she intended, they readily consented.
1082.translation: 同意（同意某事或给予某事许可）

1083.definition: a result of something that has happened, especially an unpleasant result
1083.translation: 后果（发生之事的结果，尤指不愉快的结果）

1084.example: This poses a threat to agriculture and the food chain, and consequently to human health.
1084.translation: 因此，结果（作为结果；因此）

1085.definition: the protection of the natural environment
1085.example: to be interested in wildlife conservation
1085.translation: 保护，保护区（对自然环境的保护）

1086.definition: opposed to great or sudden social change; showing that you prefer traditional styles and values
1086.example: the conservative views of his parents
1086.translation: 保守的（反对重大或突然的社会变革；表现出更喜欢传统风格和价值）

1088.definition: to protect something and prevent it from being changed or destroyed
1088.example: new laws to conserve wildlife in the area
1088.translation: 保护（保护某物并防止其被改变或破坏）

1089.definition: to think about something carefully, especially in order to make a decision
1089.example: I'd like some time to consider.
1089.translation: 考虑（仔细思考某事，尤指为了做出决定）

1090.definition: great in amount, size, importance, etc.
1090.example: The project wasted a considerable amount of time and money.
1090.translation: 相当大的（在数量、规模、重要性等方面很大的）

1091.example: The need for sleep varies considerably from person to person.
1091.translation: 相当地（很大程度上；很多地）

1092.definition: the act of thinking carefully about something
1092.example: An employer is legally bound to give due consideration to the request.
1092.translation: 考虑，思考（仔细思考某事的行为）

1094.definition: the quality of always behaving in the same way or of having the same opinions, standard, etc.; the quality of being consistent
1094.example: She has played with great consistency all season.
1094.translation: 一致性（始终以相同方式行事或具有相同看法、标准的品质）

1095.definition: always behaving in the same way, or having the same opinions, standards, etc.
1095.example: a consistent approach to the problem
1095.translation: 一致的（始终以相同方式行事，或具有相同的看法、标准等）

1096.example: Her work has been of a consistently high standard.

1097.definition: to make a position of power or success stronger so that it is more likely to continue
1097.example: With this new movie he has consolidated his position as the country's leading director.
1097.translation: 巩固（使权力或成功的地位更稳固，使其更可能持续）

1098.definition: a secret plan by a group of people to do something harmful or illegal
1098.example: conspiracy (to do something), a conspiracy to overthrow the government
1098.translation: 阴谋（一群人为了做有害或违法的事而进行的秘密计划）

1099.definition: happening all the time or repeatedly
1099.translation: 不断的（一直发生或重复发生的）

1101.definition: a district that elects its own representative to parliament
1101.example: Unemployment is high in her constituency.
1101.translation: 选区（选举其议会代表的地区）

1102.definition: to be considered to be something
1102.example: Does such an activity constitute a criminal offence?
1102.translation: 构成（被认为是什么；组成）

1103.definition: the system of laws and basic principles that a state, a country or an organization is governed by
1103.example: your right to vote under the constitution
1103.translation: 宪法，章程（管理国家、州或组织的法律和基本原则体系）

1105.definition: a thing that limits something, or limits your freedom to do something
1105.translation: 限制，约束（限制某事或限制做某事自由的事物）

1106.definition: to build or make something such as a road, building or machine
1106.example: construct something, The building was constructed in 1993.
1106.translation: 建造（建造或制造某物，如道路、建筑或机器）

1107.definition: the process or method of building or making something, especially roads, buildings, bridges, etc.
1107.example: Construction began this year and will take approximately 18 months.
1107.translation: 建筑，施工（建造或制造某物——尤指道路、建筑、桥梁等——的过程或方法）

1108.definition: to go to somebody for information or advice
1108.example: consult somebody, If the pain continues, consult your doctor.
1108.translation: 咨询（向某人寻求信息或建议）

1109.definition: a person who knows a lot about a particular subject and is employed to give advice about it to other people
1109.translation: 顾问（在特定领域知识丰富并被雇佣提供建议的人）

1110.definition: the act of discussing something with somebody or with a group of people before making a decision about it
1110.translation: 商议，咨询（在做出决定前与某人或某群体讨论某事）

1111.definition: to use something, especially fuel, energy or time
1111.example: The electricity industry consumes large amounts of fossil fuels.
1111.translation: 消耗（使用某物，尤指燃料、能量或时间）

1112.definition: a person who buys goods or uses services
1112.translation: 消费者（购买商品或使用服务的人）

1113.definition: the act of using energy, food or materials; the amount used
1113.example: the production of fuel for domestic consumption (= to be used in the country where it is produced)
1113.translation: 消费，消耗量（使用能源、食物或材料的行为；使用的数额）

1114.definition: the act of communicating with somebody, especially regularly
1114.example: contact with somebody, I don't have much contact with my uncle.
1114.translation: 接触，联系（与某人交流的行为，尤其是定期的交流）

1115.definition: to communicate with somebody, for example by phone, letter or email
1115.example: I've been trying to contact you all day.
1115.translation: 联系（与某人交流，例如通过电话、信件或电子邮件）

1116.definition: if something contains something else, it has that thing inside it or as part of it
1116.example: This drink doesn't contain any alcohol.
1116.translation: 包含（如果一物包含另一物，指后者在前者内部或作为其一部分）

1117.definition: a box, bottle, etc. in which something can be stored or transported
1117.translation: 容器（用于储存或运输物品的盒子、瓶子等）

1118.definition: to think about whether you should do something, or how you should do something
1118.example: contemplate something, You're too young to be contemplating retirement.
1118.translation: 沉思，打算（思考是否应该或如何去做某事）

1119.example: We have no contemporary account of the battle (= written near the time that it happened).
1119.translation: 同时代的，当代的（属于同一时代的）

1120.definition: the feeling that somebody/something is without value and deserves no respect at all
1120.example: with contempt, She looked at him with contempt.
1120.translation: 蔑视（觉得某人/某事毫无价值且完全不值得尊敬的感觉）

1121.definition: to say that something is true, especially in an argument
1121.example: I would contend that the minister's thinking is flawed on this point.
1121.translation: 主张，争辩（声称某事为真，尤指在争论中）

1122.definition: a person or team with a chance of winning a competition
1122.example: contender (for something), a contender for a gold medal in the Olympics
1122.translation: 竞争者（有权参与竞争并有机会获胜的人或团队）

1123.definition: happy and satisfied with what you have
1123.example: He seemed more content, less bitter.
1123.translation: 满意的（对自己所拥有的感到快乐和满足）

1124.definition: the things that are contained in something
1124.example: He tipped the contents of the bag onto the table.
1124.translation: 内容（某物中所包含的事物）

1125.example: One area of contention is the availability of nursery care.
1125.translation: 争论，分歧（持不同意见的人之间的愤怒或争议）

1126.definition: a competition in which people try to win something
1126.translation: 竞赛（人们试图赢得某物的比赛）

1127.definition: to take part in a competition, election, etc. and try to win it
1127.translation: 参加竞赛（参加比赛、选举等并试图获胜）

1128.definition: the situation in which something happens and that helps you to understand it
1128.example: Such databases are being used in a wide range of contexts.
1128.translation: 背景，语境（事情发生的背景及其有助于理解的情况）

1129.definition: one of the large land masses of the earth such as Europe, Asia or Africa
1129.translation: 大陆，洲（地球上的大型陆地块，如欧洲、亚洲或非洲）

1130.definition: in a way that is repeated many times so that it is annoying
1130.translation: 不断地（多次重复以至于令人烦恼）

1131.definition: to keep existing or happening without stopping
1131.example: If the current trend continues, that number will increase 165 per cent by 2050.
1131.translation: 继续（持续存在或发生而不停止）

1132.definition: happening or existing for a period of time without being interrupted
1132.example: Recovery after the accident will be a continuous process that may take several months.
1132.translation: 连续的（在一段时间内持续发生或存在而不间断的）

1133.example: All employees have a written contract of employment.

1134.definition: to become less or smaller; to make something become less or smaller
1134.translation: 收缩（变小或变少；使某物变小或变少）

1135.definition: a person or company that has a contract to do work or provide goods or services for another company
1135.translation: 承包商（签订合同为另一公司工作、提供商品或服务的个人或公司）

1136.definition: a lack of agreement between facts, opinions, actions, etc.
1136.example: contradiction (between A and B), There is a contradiction between the two sets of figures.
1136.translation: 矛盾（事实、观点、行动等之间缺乏一致性）

1138.definition: the opposite fact, event or situation
1138.example: In the end the contrary was proved true: he was innocent and she was guilty.
1138.translation: 相反的事物（相反的事实、事件或情况）

1139.definition: a difference between two or more people or things that you can see clearly when they are compared or put close together; the fact of comparing two or more things in order to show the differences between them
1139.example: The two cities make an interesting contrast.
1139.translation: 对比（当两个或多个人/物被比较或靠近放置时可清晰看到的差异）

1140.definition: to compare two things in order to show the differences between them
1140.example: contrast A and B, The poem contrasts youth and age.
1140.translation: 对比（比较两个事物以展示其间的差异）

1141.definition: to give something, especially money or goods, to help achieve or provide something
1141.translation: 贡献（给予某物，尤指金钱或财物，以帮助实现或提供某事）

1142.definition: a gift or payment that is made to a person or an organization in order to help pay for something
1142.example: All contributions will be gratefully received.
1142.translation: 捐助，贡献（给予个人或组织的以帮助支付某项费用的礼物或款项）

1143.definition: a person who writes articles for a magazine, book or website, or who talks on a radio or television programme or at a meeting
1143.example: a regular contributor to this magazine
1143.translation: 投稿人，贡献者（为杂志、书籍等撰写文章的人，或在节目、会议中发言的人）

1144.definition: the power to make decisions about how a country, an area, an organization, etc. is run
1144.example: control of somebody/something, The party expects to gain control of the council in the next election.
1144.translation: 控制，控制权（对国家、地区、组织等运行方式做出决定的权力）

1145.definition: to have power over a person, company, country, etc. so that you are able to decide what they must do or how it is run
1145.example: By the age of 21 he controlled the company.
1145.translation: 控制（对人、公司、国家等拥有权力，能决定其必须做什么或其如何运行）

1146.definition: causing a lot of angry public discussion and disagreement
1146.translation: 有争议的（引起大量愤怒的公众讨论和分歧的）

1147.definition: public discussion and argument about something that many people strongly disagree about, think is bad, or are shocked by
1147.translation: 争议（关于许多人强烈反对、认为不好或感到震惊之事的公众讨论和争论）

1148.definition: the quality of being useful, easy or suitable for somebody
1148.example: We have provided seats for the convenience of our customers.
1148.translation: 便利，方便（对某人有用、容易或合适的品质）

1149.definition: useful, easy or quick to do; not causing problems
1149.example: Fruit is a convenient source of vitamins and energy.
1149.translation: 方便的（有用、容易或能快速完成的；不引起问题的）

1150.definition: the way in which something is done that most people in a society expect and consider to be polite or the right way to do it
1150.example: the rigid social conventions of Victorian Britain
1150.translation: 惯例，公约（社会中大多数人期望并认为是礼貌或正确的做事方式）

1151.definition: tending to follow what is done or considered acceptable by society in general; normal and ordinary, and perhaps not very interesting
1151.translation: 传统的（趋向于遵循社会普遍认可的做法；寻常的，可能不怎么有趣的）

1152.definition: an informal talk involving a small group of people or only two; the activity of talking in this way
1152.translation: 谈话（涉及两人或小团体的非正式谈话；谈话这种活动）

1153.definition: the act or process of changing something from one form, use or system to another
1153.example: Their main business is the conversion of farm buildings into family homes.
1153.translation: 转换，变换（将某物从一种形式、用途或系统改变为另一种的行为或过程）

1154.definition: to change or make something change from one form, purpose, system, etc. to another
1154.example: convert something, They took just nine months to convert the building.
1154.translation: 转换（使某物从一种形式、目的、系统等改变为另一种）

1155.definition: to make ideas, feelings, etc. known to somebody
1155.example: convey something, Colours like red convey a sense of energy and strength.
1155.translation: 传达（使想法、感情等被他人知晓）

1156.definition: to decide and state officially in court that somebody is guilty of a crime
1156.example: be convicted (of something), He was convicted of fraud.
1156.translation: 定罪（在法庭上正式裁定并宣布某人有罪）

1157.definition: the act of finding somebody guilty of a crime in court; the fact of having been found guilty
1157.example: He plans to appeal against his conviction.
1157.translation: 定罪（法庭裁定某人有罪的行为；被裁定有罪的事实）

1158.definition: to make somebody/yourself believe that something is true
1158.example: convince somebody/yourself, Are the prime minister's assurances enough to convince the public?
1158.translation: 说服（使某人/自己相信某事是真实的）

1159.example: Sam nodded but he didn't look convinced.
1159.translation: 确信的（对某事完全确定的）

1160.definition: that makes somebody believe that something is true
1160.translation: 有说服力的（使人相信某事属实的）

1161.definition: a person who cooks food or whose job is cooking
1161.example: John is a very good cook (= he cooks well).
1161.translation: 厨师（烹制食物的人或以此为业的人）

1162.definition: to prepare food by heating it, for example by boiling, baking or frying it
1162.example: Where did you learn to cook?
1162.translation: 烹饪（通过加热准备食物，如煮、烤或炸）

1163.definition: a large piece of equipment for cooking food, containing an oven and gas or electric rings on top
1163.translation: 炊具（用于烹饪的大型设备，包含烤箱和上方的炉圈）

1164.definition: the process of preparing food by heating it
1164.example: My husband does all the cooking.
1164.translation: 烹调（通过加热准备食物的过程）

1165.definition: fairly cold; not hot or warm
1165.translation: 凉爽的（相当冷；不热或不暖）

1166.definition: to become cool or cooler; to make somebody/something become cool or cooler
1166.translation: 变凉，冷却（变凉；使某人/某物变凉）

1167.definition: to work together with somebody else in order to achieve something
1167.example: The two groups agreed to cooperate with each other.
1167.translation: 合作（与他人共同工作以实现某事）

1168.definition: involving doing something together or working together with others towards a shared aim
1168.example: Cooperative activity is essential to effective community work.
1168.translation: 合作的（涉及共同行事或与他人为了共同目标而工作的）

1169.definition: to organize the different parts of an activity and the people involved in it so that it works well
1169.example: coordinate something, They appointed a new manager to coordinate the work of the team.
1169.translation: 协调（组织活动的不同部分及相关人员，使其运作良好）

1170.definition: the act of making parts of something, groups of people, etc. work together in an efficient and organized way
1170.example: The aim was to improve the coordination of services.
1170.translation: 协调（使事物各部分、各群体等以高效、有组织的方式共同工作的行为）

1171.definition: a person who organizes the different parts of an activity and the people involved in it so that it works well
1171.example: The campaign needs an effective coordinator.
1171.translation: 协调员（组织活动不同部分及相关人员使其运作良好的人）

1173.definition: to deal successfully with something difficult
1173.example: I got to the stage where I wasn't coping any more.
1173.translation: 应对（成功处理困难的事情）

1174.definition: a chemical element. Copper is a soft red-brown metal used for making electric wires, pipes and coins.
1174.translation: 铜（一种化学元素，红棕色软金属，用于电线、管道和硬币）

1175.definition: a thing that is made to be the same as something else, especially a document or a work of art
1175.example: The thieves replaced the original painting with a copy.
1175.translation: 副本，复印件（制作得与他物——尤指文件或艺术品——相同的东西）

1176.definition: to make something that is exactly like something else
1176.example: copy something, He taught himself by copying paintings in the Louvre.
1176.translation: 复制，抄袭（制作与他物完全相同的东西）

1177.definition: if a person or an organization holds the copyright on a piece of writing, music, etc., they are the only people who have the legal right to publish, broadcast, perform it, etc., and other people must ask their permission to use it or any part of it
1177.example: Copyright expires seventy years after the death of the author.
1177.translation: 版权（个人或组织对作品享有的法律出版、播放等权利）

1178.example: core subjects (= subjects that all the students have to study) such as English and mathematics
1178.translation: 核心的（最重要的；主要的或本质的）

1179.definition: the most important or central part of something
1179.example: This report goes to the core of the argument.
1179.translation: 核心（某物最重要或最中心的部分）

1180.definition: a part of something where two or more sides, lines or edges join
1180.example: the four corners of a square
1180.translation: 角落（两个或更多边、线、边缘连接的地方）

1181.definition: connected with a large business company
1181.translation: 公司的，社团的（与大型商业公司有关的）

1182.translation: 法人公司，大企业（大型商业公司）

1183.definition: accurate or true, without any mistakes
1183.example: Do you have the correct time?
1183.translation: 正确的（准确或真实的，没有任何错误）

1184.definition: to make something right or accurate, for example by changing it or removing mistakes
1184.example: correct something, to correct an error
1184.translation: 纠正（使某事变正确或准确，例如通过改变或删除错误）

1185.definition: a change that makes something more accurate than it was before
1185.example: I've made a few small corrections to your report.
1185.translation: 纠正，改正（使某事比以前更准确的变化）

1186.definition: in a way that is accurate or true, without any mistakes
1186.translation: 正确地（以准确或真实且无误的方式）

1187.definition: if two or more facts, figures, etc. correlate or if a fact, figure, etc. correlates with another, the facts are closely connected and affect or depend on each other
1187.example: The figures do not seem to correlate.
1187.translation: 相关（如果两个事实等相关，指它们紧密相连且相互影响或依赖）

1188.definition: a connection between two things in which one thing changes as the other does
1188.example: correlation between A and B, There is a direct correlation between exposure to sun and skin cancer.
1188.translation: 相关性（两事物间的一方随另一方改变的联系）

1189.definition: to be the same as or match something
1189.example: Your account and hers do not correspond.
1189.translation: 符合，一致（与某物相同或相匹配）

1190.definition: the letters, emails, etc. a person sends and receives
1190.translation: 通信，信件（一个人发送和收到的信件、电子邮件等）

1191.definition: a person who reports news from a particular country or on a particular subject for a newspaper or a television or radio station
1191.translation: 通讯员，记者（为报社或电台报道特定国家或特定主题新闻的人）

1192.definition: matching or connected with something that you have just mentioned
1192.example: A change in the money supply brings a corresponding change in expenditure.
1192.translation: 相应的（与刚提到的事物相匹配或相连的）

1193.definition: a long narrow passage in a building, with doors that open into rooms on either side
1193.example: His room is along the corridor.
1193.translation: 走廊（建筑内狭长的通道，两侧有通往房间的门）

1194.definition: willing to use their power to do dishonest or illegal things in return for money or to get an advantage
1194.example: It was seen as the only way to overthrow a corrupt regime.
1194.translation: 腐败的（为了金钱或利益而愿意利用权力做不诚实或违法之事的）

1195.definition: dishonest or illegal behaviour, especially of people in authority
1195.translation: 腐败（不诚实或违法的行为，尤指权力部门人员）

1196.definition: the amount of money that you need in order to buy, make or do something
1196.example: cost of something, the high/low cost of housing
1196.translation: 成本，费用（购买、制造或做某事所需的金额）

1197.definition: if something costs a particular amount of money, you need to pay that amount in order to buy, make or do it
1197.example: cost something, How much did it cost?
1197.translation: 花费（如果某物花费一定金额，指你需要支付该数额才能买、做或制造它）

1198.definition: costing a lot of money, especially more than you want to pay
1198.example: Buying new furniture may prove too costly.
1198.translation: 昂贵的（花费很多钱，尤指超过你所愿支付的）

1199.definition: the clothes worn by people from a particular place or during a particular historical period
1199.translation: 服装（特定地区或历史时期的穿着）

1200.definition: a small house, especially in the country
1200.translation: 小屋（小房子，尤指在农村）

1201.definition: a plant grown in warm countries for the soft white hairs around its seeds that are used to make cloth and thread
1201.example: From the age of six she worked in the fields, picking cotton.
1201.translation: 棉花（热带植物，其种子周围的软白毛用于制作布料和线）

1202.definition: used as the past tense of ‘can’
1202.example: She said that she couldn't come.

1203.definition: a group of people who are elected to govern an area such as a city or county
1203.translation: 委员会，政务会（选出以管理城市或县等地区的团体）

1204.definition: a member of a city or county council
1204.translation: 议员（市或县委员会的成员）

1205.example: The couple decided to go for relationship counselling.
1205.translation: 心理咨询（关于问题的专业建议）

1206.definition: a person who has been trained to advise people with problems, especially personal problems
1206.example: I went to see a debt counsellor and she agreed to come to the bank with me.
1206.translation: 顾问，辅导员（经过培训为有个人等问题的人提供建议的人）

1207.definition: an act of counting to find the total number of somebody/something
1207.example: If the election result is close, there will be a second count.
1207.translation: 计数（计数以找出总数的行为）

1208.definition: to say numbers in the correct order
1208.translation: 计数（按正确顺序说出数字）

1209.definition: a long flat surface over which goods are sold or business is done in a shop, bank, etc.
1209.example: behind the counter, I asked the woman behind the counter if they had any postcards.
1209.translation: 柜台（商店、银行等进行交易的长平表面）

1210.definition: to reply to somebody by trying to prove that what they said is not true
1210.example: counter somebody/something, Such arguments are not easily countered.
1210.translation: 反驳（通过试图证明对方所说不实来回应某人）

1211.definition: a person or thing that has the same position or function as somebody/something else in a different place or situation
1211.example: The Foreign Minister held talks with his Chinese counterpart.
1211.translation: 对应的人或物（在不同地点或情况下具有相同职位或功能的人或物）

1212.definition: very many; too many to be counted or mentioned
1212.translation: 无数的（极多的；多得数不清或说不完的）

1213.definition: an area of land that has or used to have its own government and laws
1213.translation: 国家（拥有或曾拥有自己政府和法律的一块陆地区域）

1214.definition: land outside towns and cities, with fields, woods, etc.
1214.example: The surrounding countryside is windswept and rocky.
1214.translation: 农村（城镇以外的有田野、树林等的土地）

1215.definition: one of a number of areas that some countries are divided into, each with its own local government
1215.example: rural counties west of the Mississippi
1215.translation: 县，郡（一些国家划分出的行政区域，各设地方政府）

1216.definition: a sudden change of government that is illegal and often violent
1216.example: He seized power in a military coup in 2008.
1216.translation: 政变（非法且通常伴随暴力的突然政权更迭）

1217.example: I saw a couple of men get out.
1217.translation: 两个，几个（两个人或事物；几个）

1218.definition: the ability to do something dangerous, or to face pain or opposition, without showing fear
1218.example: He showed great courage and determination.
1218.translation: 勇气（在不表现出恐惧的情况下做危险之事或面对痛苦、反对的能力）

1219.definition: a series of lessons or lectures on a particular subject
1219.translation: 课程（关于特定主题的一系列课或讲座）

1220.definition: the place where legal trials take place and where crimes, etc. are judged
1220.translation: 法院，法庭（进行法律审判及裁决犯罪等的地方）

1221.definition: polite behaviour that shows respect for other people
1221.example: I was treated with the utmost courtesy by the staff.
1221.translation: 礼貌，谦恭（表现出对他人的尊敬的礼貌行为）

1222.definition: a child of your aunt or uncle
1222.translation: 堂/表兄弟姐妹（姨妈或叔叔的孩子）

1223.definition: a thing that is put over or on another thing, usually to protect it or to decorate it
1223.example: Brighten up your room with some colourful cushion covers.
1223.translation: 覆盖物，封面（放在另一物之上或其上的东西，通常为了保护或装饰）

1224.definition: to place something over or in front of something in order to hide, protect or decorate it
1224.example: cover something with something, Cover the chicken loosely with foil.
1224.translation: 覆盖（将某物置于另一物之上或前面以隐藏、保护或装饰）

1225.definition: the reporting of news and sport in the media
1225.translation: 报道（媒体对新闻和体育的报道）

1226.definition: having a layer or amount of something on it
1226.example: His face was covered in blood.
1226.translation: 覆盖着的（其上有某一层或一定量的东西）

1227.definition: a large animal kept on farms to produce milk or beef
1227.translation: 奶牛（农场饲养的大型动物，用于产奶或牛肉）

1228.definition: a line on the surface of something where it has broken but not split into separate parts
1228.example: This cup has a crack in it.
1228.translation: 裂纹（物体表面破裂但未完全碎开的线）

1229.definition: to break without dividing into separate parts; to break something in this way
1229.example: The ice cracked as I stepped onto it.
1229.translation: 使破裂（破裂但未完全碎开；以此方式弄破某物）

1230.definition: an activity involving a special skill at making things with your hands
1230.translation: 手工艺（涉及手工制作物品的特殊技能的活动）

1231.definition: to make something using special skills, especially with your hands
1231.example: be crafted (from something), All the furniture is crafted from natural materials.
1231.translation: 精心制作（利用特殊技能——尤指手工——制作某物）

1232.definition: an accident in which a vehicle hits something, for example another vehicle, usually causing damage and often injuring or killing the passengers
1232.translation: 撞击，坠毁（车辆撞上某物——如另一辆车——的事故）

1233.definition: if a vehicle crashes or the driver crashes it, it hits an object or another vehicle, causing damage
1233.example: I was terrified that the plane would crash.
1233.translation: 撞击，坠毁（如果车辆撞击，指其撞上了物体或另一辆车并造成损坏）

1234.definition: to move forward on your hands and knees or with your body close to the ground
1234.example: Our baby is just starting to crawl.
1234.translation: 爬行（手脚着地或贴地向前移动）

1235.example: Are you crazy? We could get killed doing that.
1235.translation: 疯狂的（不明智的；愚蠢的）

1236.definition: between yellow and white in colour
1236.translation: 米色的（介于黄色和白色之间的颜色）

1237.definition: the thick white or pale yellow fatty liquid that rises to the top of milk, used in cooking or as a type of sauce to put on fruit, etc.
1237.example: We had strawberries and cream for dessert.
1237.translation: 奶油（牛奶表面上升的厚白色或淡黄色脂肪液体，用于烹饪或调味）

1238.definition: to make something happen or exist
1238.example: Scientists disagree about how the universe was created.
1238.translation: 创造（使某事发生或存在）

1239.definition: the act or process of making something that is new, or of causing something to exist that did not exist before
1239.example: Job creation needs to be the top priority.
1239.translation: 创造，创作（制造新事物或使原本不存在的事物存在的行为或过程）

1240.definition: involving the use of skill and the imagination to produce something new or a work of art
1240.example: a course on creative writing (= writing stories, plays and poems)
1240.translation: 创造性的（涉及使用技能和想象力来产生新事物或艺术作品）

1241.definition: the use of skill and imagination to produce something new or to produce art
1241.example: Creativity and originality are more important than technical skill.
1241.translation: 创造力（使用技能和想象力来产生新事物或艺术）

1242.definition: a person who has made or invented a particular thing
1242.example: Walt Disney, the creator of Mickey Mouse
1242.translation: 创造者（制造或发明了某特定事物的人）

1243.definition: a living thing, real or imaginary, that can move around, such as an animal
1243.translation: 生物（可以移动的真实或想象的生命体，如动物）

1244.definition: the quality that somebody/something has that makes people believe or trust them
1244.translation: 信誉（某人/某物具有的使人相信或信任的品质）

1245.definition: that can be believed or trusted
1245.translation: 可信的（可以被相信或信任的）

1246.definition: an arrangement that you make, with a shop for example, to pay later for something you buy
1246.translation: 信用（例如与商店达成的先取货后付钱的安排）

1247.definition: to add an amount of money to somebody’s bank account
1247.example: credit something, They credited my account two days later.
1247.translation: 存入（将一笔钱加入某人的银行账户）

1248.definition: to move slowly, quietly and carefully, because you do not want to be seen or heard
1248.example: I crept up the stairs, trying not to wake my parents.
1248.translation: 轻手轻脚地走（缓慢、安静且小心地移动，因不想被看见或听见）

1249.definition: all the people working on a ship, plane, etc.
1249.translation: 全体船员/机组人员（在船、飞机等上工作的所有人员）

1250.definition: activities that involve breaking the law
1250.example: This month's figures show an increase in violent crime.
1250.translation: 犯罪（涉及触犯法律的活动）

1251.translation: 犯罪的（与犯罪有关或涉及犯罪的）

1252.definition: a person who commits a crime

1253.definition: a time of great danger, difficulty or doubt when problems must be solved or important decisions must be made
1253.translation: 危机（必须解决问题或做出重大决定的大型危险、困难或怀疑时刻）

1254.definition: a standard or principle by which something is judged, or with the help of which a decision is made
1254.example: The main criterion is value for money.
1254.translation: 标准（评判某事或帮助做出决定的准则或原则）

1255.definition: a person who expresses opinions about the good and bad qualities of books, music, etc.
1255.translation: 评论家（对书籍、音乐等优劣发表评论的人）

1256.definition: saying what you think is bad about somebody/something
1256.example: You should just ignore any critical comments.
1256.translation: 批评的，批判性的（表达你认为某人/某事不好的看法）

1257.definition: in a way that says what you think is bad about somebody/something
1257.example: She spoke critically of her father.
1257.translation: 批评地（以表达你认为某人/某事不好的方式）

1258.definition: the act of expressing disapproval of somebody/something and opinions about their faults or bad qualities; a statement showing this disapproval
1258.translation: 批评（表达对某人/某事的不认可及对其缺点的看法；这种不认可的陈述）

1259.definition: to say that you think somebody/something is bad; to say what you do not like or think is wrong about somebody/something
1259.example: All you ever do is criticize!
1259.translation: 批评（说你认为某人/某事不好；指出你认为不对或不喜欢的地方）

1260.definition: a piece of written criticism of a set of ideas, a work of art, etc.
1260.example: She wrote a feminist critique of Freud's theories.
1260.translation: 评论文章（对一套想法、艺术作品等进行书面批评的文章）

1261.definition: a plant that is grown in large quantities, especially as food
1261.example: Sugar is an important crop on the island.
1261.translation: 农作物（大量种植的植物，尤指作为食物）

1262.definition: a mark or an object formed by two lines crossing each other (X or +); the mark (X) is often used on paper to show something
1262.example: I've put a cross on the map to show where the hotel is.
1262.translation: 十字，叉（由两条线交叉形成的标记或物体；常用于在纸上标示某物）

1263.definition: to go across; to pass or stretch from one side to the other
1263.example: As soon as traffic slowed down enough to safely cross, I started walking.
1263.translation: 横过，穿越（穿过；从一侧经过或延伸到另一侧）

1264.definition: a large number of people gathered together in a public place, for example in the streets or at a sports game
1264.example: He pushed his way through the crowd.
1264.translation: 人群（聚集在公共场所的一大群人，如在街上或体育赛场）

1265.definition: having a lot of people or too many people
1265.example: We made our way through the crowded streets.
1265.translation: 拥挤的（有很多人或太多人的）

1266.definition: an object in the shape of a circle, usually made of gold and precious stones, that a king or queen wears on his or her head on official occasions
1266.example: The crown was placed upon the new monarch's head.
1266.translation: 王冠（国王或女王在正式场合戴在头上的通常由黄金和宝石制成的圆状物）

1267.definition: extremely important, because it will affect other things
1267.example: The next few weeks are going to be crucial.
1267.translation: 至关重要的（极其重要，因为它会影响其他事情）

1268.definition: in its natural state, before it has been processed or refined
1268.translation: 天然的，原生的（处于自然状态，未经加工或精炼的）

1269.definition: having a desire to cause physical or mental pain and make somebody suffer
1269.example: He was known to be a cruel dictator.
1269.translation: 残忍的（渴望造成身体或心理痛苦并使人受苦的）

1270.definition: a journey by sea, visiting different places, especially as a holiday
1270.example: I'd love to go on a round-the-world cruise.
1270.translation: 邮轮游（乘船游览不同地方的旅行，尤其是作为度假）

1271.definition: to travel in a ship or boat visiting different places, especially as a holiday
1271.example: (+ adv./prep.), They cruised down the Nile.
1271.translation: 乘船游览（乘船访问不同地方，尤其是作为度假）

1272.definition: to press something so hard that it is damaged or injured, or loses its shape
1272.example: The car was completely crushed under the truck.
1272.translation: 压碎（用力挤压某物使其损坏或变形）

1273.definition: a loud sound without words that expresses a strong feeling
1273.example: cry of something, to give a cry of anguish/despair/pain/joy/alarm, etc.
1273.translation: 叫喊（表达强烈情感的无词响声）

1274.definition: to produce tears from your eyes because you are unhappy or hurt
1274.translation: 哭（因不快乐或疼痛而流泪）

1275.definition: a small piece of a substance with many even sides, that is formed naturally when the substance becomes solid
1275.translation: 结晶，晶体（物质自然凝固时形成的带平面的小块，如冰晶）

1276.definition: an action or event that is a signal for somebody to do something
1276.example: cue (for something), Jon's arrival was a cue for more champagne.
1276.translation: 信号，提示（作为信号提示某人做某事的行动或事件）

1277.definition: very popular with a particular group of people
1277.translation: 崇拜的，小众追捧的（在特定群体中非常受欢迎的）

1278.definition: a way of life, an attitude, an idea, etc. that has become very popular
1278.translation: 狂热，崇拜（变得非常流行的生活方式、态度或想法）

1279.definition: to prepare and use land for growing plants or crops
1279.example: The land around here has never been cultivated.
1279.translation: 耕种（准备并利用土地种植植物或庄稼）

1280.definition: connected with the culture of a particular society or group, its customs, beliefs, etc.
1280.example: Teachers need to be aware of cultural differences.
1280.translation: 文化的（与特定社会或群体的文化、习俗、信仰等有关的）

1281.definition: the customs and beliefs, art, way of life and social organization of a particular country or group
1281.translation: 文化（特定国家或群体的习俗、信仰、艺术、生活方式和组织）

1282.definition: a small container that is like a bowl in shape, usually with a handle, used for drinking tea, coffee, etc.
1282.example: He filled the cup with water.
1282.translation: 杯子（碗状的小容器，通常带柄，用于喝茶、咖啡等）

1283.definition: a piece of furniture with doors and shelves used for storing dishes, food, clothes, etc.
1283.translation: 橱柜（带有门和搁板的用于存放餐具、食物、衣服等的家具）

1284.definition: a medicine or medical treatment that cures an illness
1284.example: cure for something, the search for a cure for cancer
1284.translation: 药物，疗法（治愈疾病的药物或医疗手段）

1285.definition: to make a person or an animal healthy again after an illness
1285.example: cure somebody, Will you be able to cure him, Doctor?
1285.translation: 治愈（在疾病后使人或动物恢复健康）

1286.definition: a strong desire to know about something
1286.translation: 好奇心（想了解某事的强烈欲望）

1287.definition: having a strong desire to know about something
1287.example: He is such a curious boy, always asking questions.
1287.translation: 好奇的（有想了解某事的强烈欲望的）

1288.definition: having a lot of curls or a curved shape
1288.translation: 卷曲的（有很多卷曲或呈弯曲形状的）

1289.definition: the system of money that a country uses
1289.translation: 货币（国家使用的货币制度）

1290.definition: happening now; of the present time
1290.example: The necklace would be worth over $5 000 at current prices.
1290.translation: 当前的（现在发生的；当今时代的）

1291.definition: the movement of water in the sea or a river; the movement of air in a particular direction
1291.example: with the current, It's easier to go with the current.
1291.translation: 洋流，气流（海洋或河流中水的移动；朝特定方向的空气移动）

1293.definition: the subjects that are included in a course of study or taught in a school, college, etc.
1293.example: The school curriculum should be as broad as possible.
1293.translation: 课程（课程或学校中教授的科目）

1294.definition: a piece of cloth that is hung to cover a window
1294.example: to draw/pull/close the curtains (= to pull them across the window so they cover it)
1294.translation: 窗帘（挂起来遮挡窗口的布料）

1295.definition: a line or surface that bends gradually; a smooth bend
1295.example: curve of something, He admired the delicate curve of her ear.
1295.translation: 曲线（逐渐弯曲的线条或表面；平滑的弯曲）

1296.definition: to move or make something move in the shape of a curve; to be in the shape of a curve
1296.translation: 弯曲（以曲线形状移动或使之移动；呈曲线形状）

1298.definition: the legal right or duty to take care of or keep somebody/something; the act of taking care of something/somebody
1298.example: Who will have custody of the children?
1298.translation: 监护，拘留（照顾或保管某人/某物的法律权利或义务；照顾的行为）

1299.definition: an accepted way of behaving or of doing things in a society or a community
1299.translation: 习俗（社会或社区中公认的行事或表现方式）

1300.definition: a person or an organization that buys goods or services from a shop or business
1300.example: marketing strategies to target potential customers
1300.translation: 顾客（从商店或企业购买商品或服务的个人或组织）

1301.definition: a wound caused by something sharp
1301.example: cuts and bruises on the face
1301.translation: 切口，伤口（由锋利物品造成的伤口）

1302.definition: to make an opening or a wound in something, especially with a sharp tool such as a knife or scissors
1302.example: cut something, She cut her finger on a piece of glass.
1302.translation: 切，割（在某物上弄出开口或伤口，尤指用刀或剪刀）

1303.translation: 可爱的（漂亮且吸引人的）

1304.definition: an article or a story that you cut from a newspaper or magazine and keep
1304.translation: 剪报（从报纸或杂志上剪下的文章或故事）

1305.example: He was riding his cycle home when he was hit by a lorry.
1305.translation: 自行车，摩托车（两轮车辆）

1306.definition: to ride a bicycle; to travel by bicycle
1306.example: measures to encourage more people to cycle
1306.translation: 骑自行车（骑自行车或通过其旅行）

1307.definition: believing that people only do things to help themselves rather than for good or honest reasons
1307.translation: 愤世嫉俗的，悲观的（认为人们做事仅出于自私而非诚实动机的）

1309.definition: happening, done or produced every day
1309.example: Many people still read a daily newspaper.
1309.translation: 每日的（每天发生、执行或制作的）

1310.example: The machines are inspected twice daily.

1312.definition: milk, cheese and other milk products
1312.example: The doctor told me to eat less red meat and dairy.
1312.translation: 奶制品（牛奶、奶酪及其他乳制品）

1313.definition: a barrier that is built across a river in order to stop the water from flowing, used especially to make a reservoir (= a lake for storing water) or to produce electricity
1313.translation: 大坝，堤坝（横跨河流以拦截水流的屏障，常用于水库或发电）

1314.definition: physical harm caused to something which makes it less attractive, useful or valuable
1314.translation: 损坏，破坏（对某物造成的物理伤害，使其价值降低）

1315.definition: to have a bad or harmful effect on something/somebody
1315.example: The church was badly damaged by the 1997 earthquake.
1315.translation: 损害，伤害（对某人/某物产生不良或有害影响）

1316.definition: causing damage; having a bad effect on somebody/something
1316.translation: 破坏性的（造成损坏的；有不良影响的）

1317.definition: a series of movements and steps that are usually performed to music; a particular example of these movements and steps
1317.example: Do you know any other Latin American dances?
1317.translation: 舞蹈（伴随音乐进行的一系列动作和步伐）

1318.definition: to move your body to the sound and rhythm of music
1318.translation: 跳舞（随音乐的声音和节奏移动身体）

1319.definition: a person who dances or whose job is dancing
1319.translation: 舞者（跳舞的人或以此为业的人）

1320.example: There was music and dancing till two in the morning.
1320.translation: 跳舞（随音乐移动身体的行为）

1321.definition: the possibility of something happening that will injure, harm or kill somebody, or damage or destroy something
1321.translation: 危险（可能造成伤害、死亡或破坏的可能性）

1322.definition: likely to injure or harm somebody, or to damage or destroy something
1322.translation: 危险的（可能伤害某人或破坏某物的）

1323.definition: to be brave enough to do something
1323.example: She said it as loudly as she dared.

1324.definition: with no or very little light, especially because it is night
1324.translation: 黑暗的（光线很少或没有的，尤指在夜晚）

1325.definition: the lack of light in a place, especially because it is night
1325.example: Are the children afraid of the dark?
1325.translation: 黑暗（地方缺乏光亮的状态，尤指在夜晚）

1326.definition: the state of being dark, without any light
1326.example: After a few minutes our eyes got used to the darkness.
1326.translation: 黑暗（处于黑暗、无光的状态）

1327.definition: facts or information, especially when examined and used to find out things or to make decisions
1327.example: We collected publicly available data over a 10-day period.
1327.translation: 数据，资料（事实或信息，尤指经过检查用于决策或发现事实的）

1328.definition: an organized set of data that is stored in a computer and can be looked at and used in various ways
1328.translation: 数据库（存储在电脑中并可以多种方式查看使用的有组织的数据集）

1329.definition: a particular day of the month, sometimes in a particular year, given in numbers and words
1329.translation: 日期（特定的日期，有时包括年份）

1330.definition: to write or print the date on something
1330.example: Thank you for your letter dated 24th March.
1330.translation: 注明日期（在某物上写上或印上日期）

1331.example: We have two sons and a daughter.

1332.definition: the time of day when light first appears
1332.example: at dawn, They start work at dawn.
1332.translation: 黎明（光线初现的时间点）

1334.example: My mother's dead; she died in 2017.

1335.definition: a point in time by which something must be done
1335.example: I prefer to work to a deadline.
1335.translation: 截止日期（必须完成某事的时间点）

1336.definition: causing or likely to cause death
1336.translation: 致命的（造成或可能造成死亡的）

1337.definition: an agreement, especially in business, on particular conditions for buying or doing something
1337.translation: 交易，协议（尤指商业中关于买卖或做事的特定条件的协议）

1338.definition: to give cards to each player in a game of cards
1338.example: Whose turn is it to deal?
1338.translation: 发牌（在纸牌游戏中给每个玩家分牌）

1339.definition: a person whose business is buying and selling a particular product
1339.translation: 商人，交易商（以买卖特定产品为业的人）

1340.definition: used at the beginning of a letter before the name or title of the person that you are writing to
1340.translation: 亲爱的（信件开头，置于称呼前）

1341.definition: used in expressions that show that you are surprised, upset, annoyed or worried
1341.example: Oh dear! I think I've lost my purse!
1341.translation: 天哪（用于表达惊讶、沮丧、烦恼或忧虑）

1342.definition: the fact of somebody dying or being killed
1342.example: the anniversary of his wife’s death
1342.translation: 死亡（某人死亡或被杀的事实）

1343.definition: a formal discussion of an issue at a public meeting or in a parliament. In a debate two or more speakers express opposite views and then there is often a vote on the issue.
1343.example: the first ever televised presidential debate
1343.translation: 辩论（在公共会议或议会中对问题的正式讨论）

1344.definition: to discuss something, especially formally, before making a decision or finding a solution
1344.example: debate (something), Politicians will be debating the bill later this week.
1344.translation: 辩论（正式讨论某事以做出决定或寻找方案）

1345.definition: pieces of wood, metal, building materials, etc. that are left after something has been destroyed
1345.example: Emergency teams are still clearing the debris from the plane crash.
1345.translation: 残骸，碎片（某物被毁后留下的木头、金属等碎片）

1346.definition: a sum of money that somebody owes
1346.translation: 债务（欠他人的钱款总额）

1347.definition: the first public appearance of a performer or sports player
1347.example: He will make his debut for the first team this week.
1347.translation: 首演，处女秀（演艺人员或运动员的首次公开亮相）

1348.definition: a period of ten years, especially a continuous period, such as 1910–1919 or 2000–2009
1348.example: the early decades of the nineteenth century

1349.definition: the 12th and last month of the year
1349.translation: 十二月（一年中的最后一个月）

1350.definition: of a good enough standard or quality
1350.translation: 体面的，像样的（具有足够好的标准或质量的）

1351.definition: to think carefully about the different possibilities that are available and choose one of them
1351.example: It's up to you to decide.
1351.translation: 决定（仔细考虑各种可能性并做出选择）

1352.definition: a choice or judgement that you make after thinking and talking about what is the best thing to do
1352.example: I think I've made the right decision.
1352.translation: 决定（在思考和讨论什么是最好做法后做出的选择或判断）

1353.definition: the process of deciding about something important, especially in a group of people or in an organization
1353.translation: 决策（决定重要事情的过程，尤指在群体或组织中）

1354.definition: very important for the final result of a particular situation
1354.translation: 决定性的（对特定情况最终结果至关重要的）

1355.definition: the top outside floor of a ship or boat
1355.example: on deck, I was the only person on deck at that time of night.
1355.translation: 甲板（船或舰船顶部露天的甲板层）

1356.definition: an official or formal statement, especially about the plans of a government or an organization; the act of making such a statement
1356.translation: 声明，宣言（官方或正式的陈述，尤指关于政府计划；这种陈述行为）

1357.definition: to say something officially or publicly
1357.example: declare something, The government has declared a state of emergency.
1357.translation: 宣布，声明（正式或公开地表达某事）

1358.definition: a continuous decrease in the number, value, quality, etc. of something
1358.example: decline in something, There has been a 5 per cent decline in student numbers.
1358.translation: 下降，衰落（某物在数量、价值或质量上的持续减少）

1359.definition: to become smaller, fewer, weaker, etc.
1359.example: Support for the party continues to decline.
1359.translation: 下降，减少（变小、变少或变弱等）

1360.definition: to make something look more attractive by putting things on it
1360.example: decorate something with something, They decorated the room with flowers and balloons.
1360.translation: 装饰（通过在其上放置物品使某物看起来更有吸引力）

1361.definition: a thing that makes something look more attractive on special occasions
1361.translation: 装饰品（在特殊场合使某物看起来更有吸引力的物品）

1362.definition: the process of reducing something; the amount that something is reduced by
1362.example: Sales for May show a decrease compared with the same month last year.
1362.translation: 减少（减少某物的过程；缩减的数额）

1363.definition: to become smaller in size, number, etc.; to make something smaller in size, number, etc.
1363.example: Donations have decreased significantly over the past few years.
1363.translation: 减少（在规模、数量等方面变小；使某物变小）

1364.definition: working hard at something because it is very important to you
1364.translation: 献身的，专注的（因为某事对你很重要而努力工作）

1365.definition: the hard work and effort that somebody puts into an activity or a purpose because they think it is important
1365.translation: 奉献（因认为重要而投入到某项活动或目标中的辛勤工作和努力）

1366.definition: a thing that somebody does that is usually very good or very bad
1366.example: It's a stirring tale of heroic deeds.
1366.translation: 行为，事迹（某人所做的通常是非常好或非常坏的事）

1367.definition: to have a particular opinion about somebody/something
1367.example: deem somebody/something + noun, The evening was deemed a great success.
1367.translation: 认为，视作（对某人/某物持有特定看法）

1368.definition: having a large distance from the top or surface to the bottom
1368.translation: 深的（从顶部或表面到底部距离大的）

1369.definition: a long way below the surface of something or a long way inside or into something
1369.translation: 深深地（在某物表面之下很远或进入某物内部很深处）

1370.translation: 深深地，非常（很大程度上）

1371.definition: what happens or appears if you do not make any other choice or change, especially in a computer program
1371.translation: 默认（在没有做出其他选择时发生或出现的情况，尤指在电脑程序中）

1372.definition: failure to win or to be successful
1372.example: The party faces defeat in the election.
1372.translation: 失败，战败（未能获胜或成功）

1373.definition: to win against somebody in a war, competition, sports game, etc.
1373.example: defeat somebody/something, He defeated the champion in three sets.
1373.translation: 击败，战胜（在战争、比赛或运动中赢过某人）

1374.definition: a fault in something or in the way it has been made that means that it is not perfect
1374.translation: 缺陷（某物或其制造方式中使其不完美的错误）

1375.definition: the act of protecting somebody/something from attack, criticism, etc.
1375.example: in defence of somebody/something, soldiers who died in defence of their country
1375.translation: 防御，防御工事（保护某人/某物免受攻击、批评的行为）

1376.example: defend somebody/something, The role of the military is to defend the country.
1376.translation: 保卫，防御（保护某人/某物免受攻击）

1377.definition: a player who must stop the other team from scoring in games such as football (soccer), hockey, etc.
1377.example: a passionate defender of human rights
1377.translation: 后卫，维护者（在球类运动中阻止对方得分的球员；或人权的维护者）

1378.example: As a defensive measure he built a series of coastal forts and watchtowers.
1378.translation: 防御性的（保护某人/某物免受攻击的）

1379.definition: the state of not having, or not having enough of, something that is essential
1379.example: deficiency (in something), Vitamin deficiency in the diet can cause illness.
1379.translation: 缺乏，不足（没有或没有足够的必需品的状态）

1380.definition: the amount by which money spent or owed is greater than money earned in a particular period of time
1380.translation: 赤字（特定时期内支出超过收入的数额）

1381.definition: to say or explain what the meaning of a word or phrase is
1381.example: define something, The term ‘normal’ is difficult to define.
1381.translation: 定义（说明或解释单词、短语的含义）

1382.definition: sure or certain; unlikely to change
1382.example: Can you give me a definite answer by tomorrow?
1382.translation: 确定的（确信的；不太可能改变的）

1383.definition: a way of emphasizing that something is true and that there is no doubt about it
1383.example: I definitely remember sending the letter.
1383.translation: 肯定，无疑（强调某事属实且毫无疑问的方式）

1384.definition: an explanation of the meaning of a word or phrase, especially in a dictionary
1384.example: The dictionary provides clear, simple definitions.
1384.translation: 定义（对词语含义的解释，尤指词典中的）

1385.definition: to refuse to obey or show respect for somebody in authority, a law, a rule, etc.
1385.example: I wouldn't have dared to defy my teachers.
1385.translation: 违抗（拒绝服从或尊重权威、法律、规则等）

1386.example: at… degrees, Water freezes at 32 degrees Fahrenheit (32°F) or zero/nought degrees Celsius (0°C).
1386.translation: 度，程度（测量温度的单位）

1387.definition: a period of time when somebody/something has to wait because of a problem that makes something slow or late
1387.example: Commuters will face long delays on the roads today.
1387.translation: 延迟，延误（由于问题导致变慢或迟到的等待时间）

1388.definition: to make somebody/something late or force them to do something more slowly
1388.translation: 延迟，使延误（使某人迟到或迫使其放慢速度）

1389.definition: a person who is chosen or elected to represent the views of a group of people and vote and make decisions for them
1389.translation: 代表（选出代表群体观点并参与投票、决策的人）

1390.definition: a group of people who represent the views of an organization, a country, etc.
1390.example: the Dutch delegation to the United Nations
1390.translation: 代表团（代表组织、国家观点的一群人）

1391.definition: to remove something that has been written or printed, or that has been stored on a computer
1391.example: Your name has been deleted from the list.
1391.translation: 删除（移除书写、打印或存储在电脑中的内容）

1392.definition: done on purpose rather than by accident
1392.translation: 蓄意的（故意的，而非偶然发生的）

1393.definition: done in a way that was planned, not by chance
1393.example: She's been deliberately ignoring him all day.
1393.translation: 故意地（以计划好的而非偶然的方式）

1394.translation: 易碎的，精美的（容易损坏或破碎的）

1395.definition: having a very pleasant taste or smell
1395.example: Who cooked this? It's absolutely delicious.
1395.translation: 美味的（具有非常愉快的味道或气味的）

1397.definition: to give somebody a lot of pleasure and joy
1397.example: This news will delight his fans all over the world.
1397.translation: 使欣喜（给予某人大量快乐和喜悦）

1398.translation: 欣喜的，愉快的（非常高兴的）

1399.definition: to take goods, letters, etc. to the person or people they have been sent to
1399.example: deliver something, I get my food delivered from the supermarket to save time.
1399.translation: 递送（将货物、信件等送到收件人手中）

1400.definition: the act of taking goods, letters, etc. to the people they have been sent to
1400.translation: 递送（将货物、信件等送到人手中的行为）

1401.definition: a very strong request for something; something that somebody needs
1401.example: demand for something, a demand for higher pay
1401.translation: 需求（对某物的强烈要求；某人的需要）

1402.definition: to make a very strong request for something
1402.example: demand something, They are demanding the release of all political prisoners.

1403.definition: a system of government in which the people of a country can vote to elect their representatives
1403.translation: 民主（国民可以投票选举代表的政体）

1404.definition: controlled by representatives who are elected by the people of a country; connected with this system
1404.translation: 民主的（由民选代表控制的；与此制度相关的）

1405.example: The people believed the girl was possessed by demons.

1406.definition: to show something clearly by giving proof or evidence
1406.example: demonstrate that…, New research convincingly demonstrates that age-related memory loss is not inevitable.
1406.translation: 演示，证明（通过提供证据清晰地展示某事）

1407.definition: a public meeting or a march (= an organized walk by many people) at which people show that they are protesting against or supporting somebody/something
1407.example: to take part in/go on a demonstration
1407.translation: 游行，示威（公众聚会或行走以表示抗议或支持某事）

1408.definition: a statement that something is not true or does not exist; the action of denying something
1408.example: denial (of something), the prisoner’s repeated denials of the charges against him
1408.translation: 否认（声明某事不真实或不存在；拒绝承认的行为）

1409.definition: to strongly criticize somebody/something that you think is wrong, illegal, etc.
1409.example: denounce somebody/something, She publicly denounced the government's handling of the crisis.
1409.translation: 谴责（强烈批评你认为错误、违法的事物）

1410.definition: containing a lot of people, things, plants, etc. with little space between them
1410.translation: 稠密的，密集的（包含很多人、物或植物且间隙很小的）

1411.definition: the quality of being dense; the degree to which something is dense
1411.example: The population density in this city is very high.
1411.translation: 密度（密集的性质；密集的程度）

1412.definition: a person whose job is to take care of people’s teeth

1413.definition: to say that something is not true
1413.example: deny something, to deny an allegation/a charge/an accusation

1414.definition: to leave a place, especially to start a trip
1414.example: depart (for…) (from…), Flights for Rome depart from Terminal 3.
1414.translation: 离开（离开某地，尤指开始旅行）

1415.definition: a section of a large organization such as a government, business, university, etc.
1415.example: department of something, the Department of Health
1415.translation: 部门，系（大型组织中的一部分，如政府部门或大学科系）

1416.definition: an act of leaving a place
1416.example: His sudden departure threw the office into chaos.

1417.example: Starting salary varies from £26 000 to £30 500, depending on experience.

1418.definition: the state of needing the help and support of somebody/something in order to survive or be successful
1418.example: Our relationship was based on mutual dependence.
1418.translation: 依赖（为了生存或成功而需要他人帮助的状态）

1419.definition: needing somebody/something in order to survive or be successful
1419.example: a woman with several dependent children
1419.translation: 依赖的（为了生存或成功而需要他人的）

1420.definition: to show an image of somebody/something in a picture
1420.example: depict somebody/something (as somebody/something), a painting depicting the Virgin and Child
1420.translation: 描绘（在图片中展示某人/某物的形象）

1421.definition: to move soldiers or weapons into a position where they are ready for military action
1421.example: 2 000 troops were deployed in the area.
1421.translation: 部署（将士兵或武器调到准备战斗的位置）

1422.definition: the act of moving soldiers or weapons into a position where they are ready for military action
1422.translation: 部署（将士兵或武器调到准备战斗位置的行为）

1423.definition: a sum of money that is given as the first part of a larger payment
1423.example: They normally ask you to pay $100 (as a) deposit.
1423.translation: 定金（作为总款项的第一部分支付的钱）

1424.definition: to put money into a bank account
1424.example: Millions were deposited in Swiss bank accounts.
1424.translation: 存入（将钱存入银行账户）

1425.example: You mustn't let yourself get depressed.
1425.translation: 沮丧的（非常悲伤且没有希望的）

1426.definition: making you feel very sad and without enthusiasm
1426.translation: 令人沮丧的（使人感到悲伤和失去热情的）

1427.definition: a medical condition in which a person feels very sad, anxious and without hope and often has physical symptoms such as being unable to sleep, etc.
1427.example: She was diagnosed as having clinical depression.
1427.translation: 抑郁症（感到悲伤、焦虑、无望且常伴有生理症状的医疗状况）

1429.definition: the distance from the top or surface to the bottom of something; a particular distance down from the surface of something
1429.example: depth of something, What's the depth of the water here?
1429.translation: 深度（从顶部或表面到底部的距离；某物表面下的特定距离）

1430.definition: a person who is the next most important person below a business manager, a head of a school, a political leader, etc. and who does that person’s job when they are away
1430.example: I'm acting as deputy till the manager returns.
1430.translation: 副手，副职（职级仅次于经理、校长、领导的人，在其不在时代理工作）

1432.definition: to come or go down from a higher to a lower level
1432.translation: 下降（从高处向低处移动）

1433.definition: an action of coming or going down
1433.example: The plane began its descent to Heathrow.

1434.definition: to say what somebody/something is like
1434.example: describe somebody/something, The next section describes our findings in detail.
1434.translation: 描述（说明某人/某物是什么样的）

1435.definition: a piece of writing or speech that says what somebody/something is like; the act of writing or saying in words what somebody/something is like
1435.example: Follow the link below for a more detailed description.
1435.translation: 描述（说明某人/某物是什么样的文字或言语；这种说明行为）

1436.definition: a large area of land that has very little water and very few plants growing on it. Many deserts are covered by sand.
1436.translation: 沙漠（降水极少且植物稀少的大片土地，常覆盖沙子）

1437.definition: to leave somebody without help or support
1437.example: She was deserted by her husband.
1437.translation: 抛弃，遗弃（离开某人且不给予帮助或支持）

1438.definition: to do something or show qualities that mean a particular reaction, reward or punishment is appropriate
1438.example: deserve something, You deserve a rest after all that hard work.
1438.translation: 应得（所作所为或表现出的品质使得某种反应或奖惩是恰当的）

1439.definition: the general arrangement of the different parts of something that is made, such as a building, book, machine, etc.
1439.example: The basic design of the car is very similar to that of earlier models.
1439.translation: 设计（对制造出的物品——如建筑、书、机器——的总体安排）

1440.definition: to decide how something will look, work, etc., by drawing plans, making computer models, etc.
1440.example: design something, He designed and built his own house.
1440.translation: 设计（通过绘图、电脑建模等决定某物的外观、运作方式）

1441.definition: to say officially that somebody/something has a particular character or name; to describe somebody/something in a particular way
1441.example: be designated (as) something, This area has been designated (as) a National Park.
1441.translation: 指派，指定（正式说明某人/某物具有特定性质或名称）

1442.definition: a person whose job is to decide how things such as clothes, furniture, tools, etc. will look or work by making drawings, plans or patterns
1442.example: one of the country's top fashion designers
1442.translation: 设计师（通过制图、计划等决定衣服、家具等外观或运作方式的人）

1443.definition: that you would like to have or do; worth having or doing
1443.example: She chatted for a few minutes about the qualities she considered desirable in a secretary.
1443.translation: 理想的，值得拥有的（你想要拥有或做的；值得拥有的）

1444.definition: a strong wish to have or do something
1444.example: He now had enough money to satisfy all his desires.
1444.translation: 愿望，欲望（拥有或做某事的强烈愿望）

1445.definition: to want something; to wish for something
1445.example: desire something, We all desire health and happiness.
1445.translation: 渴望，想要（想要某物；希望得到某物）

1446.definition: a piece of furniture like a table, often with drawers (= parts like boxes in it with handles on the front for pulling them open), that you sit at to read, write, work, etc.
1446.example: at a desk, I spend all day sitting at a desk.
1446.translation: 课桌，书桌（类似桌子且通常带抽屉的家具，供阅读、书写、工作使用）

1447.definition: a screen on a computer that shows the icons of programs and files that can be used
1447.translation: 桌面（电脑屏幕，显示可使用的程序和文件图标）

1448.definition: feeling or showing that you have little hope and are ready to do anything without worrying about danger to yourself or others
1448.translation: 绝望的（感到或表现出几乎没有希望且准备不顾危险做任何事）

1449.definition: in a way that shows you have little hope and are ready to do anything without worrying about danger to yourself or others
1449.example: She looked desperately around for a weapon.
1449.translation: 绝望地（以表现出几乎没有希望且不顾危险的方式）

1450.definition: used to show that something happened or is true although something else might have happened to prevent it
1450.example: Her voice was shaking despite all her efforts to control it.
1450.translation: 尽管（用于表示尽管发生了某事，某情况仍属实）

1451.definition: a place to which somebody/something is going or being sent
1451.example: popular tourist/holiday destinations like the Bahamas
1451.translation: 目的地（某人/某物前往或被送往的地方）

1452.definition: to damage something so badly that it no longer exists, works, etc.
1452.example: The building was completely destroyed by fire.
1452.translation: 摧毁（严重损坏某物使其不再存在或无法工作）

1453.definition: the act of destroying something; the process of being destroyed
1453.translation: 破坏，摧毁（摧毁某事的行为；被摧毁的过程）

1454.example: The war demonstrated the destructive power of modern weapons.
1454.translation: 破坏性的（造成破坏或损坏的）

1455.definition: a small individual fact or item; a less important fact or item
1455.example: an expedition planned down to the last detail
1455.translation: 细节（微小的个人事实或项目；次要的事实）

1456.definition: to give a list of facts or all the available information about something
1456.example: The brochure details all the hotels in the area and their facilities.
1456.translation: 详述（列出某事的事实或所有可用信息）

1457.definition: giving many details and a lot of information; paying great attention to details
1457.example: a detailed description of the events
1457.translation: 详细的（提供许多细节和信息的；非常注重细节的）

1458.definition: to keep somebody in an official place, such as a police station, a prison or a hospital, and prevent them from leaving
1458.example: One man has been detained for questioning.
1458.translation: 拘留（将某人扣留在官方场所如警察局、监狱或医院，并阻止其离开）

1459.definition: to discover or notice something, especially something that is not easy to see, hear, etc.
1459.example: The tests are designed to detect the disease early.
1459.translation: 发现，察觉（发现或察觉到某事，尤其是那些不易发现的事）

1460.definition: the process of discovering or noticing something, especially something that is not easy to see, hear, etc.; the fact of being discovered or noticed
1460.translation: 发现，侦察（发现或察觉某事的过程；被发现的事实）

1461.definition: a person, especially a police officer, whose job is to investigate crimes and catch criminals
1461.translation: 侦探（调查犯罪并抓捕罪犯的人，尤指警察）

1462.definition: the state of being kept in a place, especially a prison, and prevented from leaving
1462.example: They were sentenced to 12 months' detention in a young offender institution.
1462.translation: 拘留（被扣留在某处——尤其是监狱——且不被允许离开的状态）

1463.example: Her health deteriorated rapidly, and she died shortly afterwards.

1464.definition: the quality that makes you continue trying to do something even when this is difficult
1464.translation: 决心（即使在困难时也让你继续尝试的品质）

1465.definition: to discover the facts about something; to calculate something exactly
1465.example: determine something, An inquiry was set up to determine the cause of the accident.
1465.translation: 决定，确定（发现某事的事实；精确计算某事）

1466.definition: having made a definite decision to do something and not letting anyone prevent you
1466.example: The opposition to her plan made her more determined than ever.
1466.translation: 果断的，有决心的（做出明确决定且不让任何人阻碍的）

1467.definition: to completely destroy a place or an area
1467.example: The bomb devastated much of the old part of the city.
1467.translation: 摧毁，使荒废（彻底摧毁一个地方或区域）

1468.definition: to gradually grow or become bigger, more advanced, stronger, etc.; to make something do this
1468.example: From birth to age 5, a child's brain develops rapidly.
1468.translation: 发展（逐渐成长、变大、变强或变得更先进；使某物这样做）

1469.definition: the steady growth of something so that it becomes more advanced, stronger, etc.
1469.example: a baby’s development in the womb
1469.translation: 发展（事物稳步增长以变得更先进、更强等的过程）

1470.definition: an object or a piece of equipment that has been designed to do a particular job
1470.translation: 设备，装置（为了完成特定工作而设计的物体或设备）

1471.translation: 魔鬼（最强大的邪恶存在）

1472.definition: to invent something new or a new way of doing something
1472.example: A new system has been devised to control traffic in the city.
1472.translation: 设计，构思（发明新事物或新的做事方式）

1474.definition: to say exactly what an illness or the cause of a problem is
1474.example: diagnose something, The test is used to diagnose a variety of diseases.
1474.translation: 诊断（确切说明疾病是什么或问题的原因是什么）

1475.definition: the act of discovering or identifying the exact cause of an illness or a problem
1475.translation: 诊断（发现或确定疾病/问题确切原因的行为）

1476.definition: a simple drawing using lines to explain where something is, how something works, etc.
1476.example: The results are shown in diagram 2.
1476.translation: 图表（使用线条说明位置、运作方式等的简单图画）

1477.definition: a conversation in a book, play or film or in language teaching materials
1477.example: Learners are asked to listen to three short dialogues.
1477.translation: 对话（书、戏、电影或教学材料中的对话）

1478.definition: a clear precious stone of pure carbon, the hardest substance known. Diamonds are used in jewellery and also in industry, especially for cutting glass.
1478.translation: 钻石（纯碳组成的透明宝石，已知最硬的物质，用于珠宝和工业）

1479.definition: a book in which you can write down the experiences you have each day, your private thoughts, etc.
1479.example: Do you keep a diary (= write one regularly)?
1479.translation: 日记（记录每天经历、私人想法等的本子）

1480.definition: to tell somebody what to do, especially in an annoying way
1480.example: dictate something (to somebody), They are in no position to dictate terms (= tell other people what to do).
1480.translation: 口述，命令（告诉某人该做什么，尤指以令人烦恼的方式）

1481.definition: a political leader who has complete power over a country, especially one who has gained it using military force
1481.example: The country suffered at the hands of a series of military dictators.
1481.translation: 独裁者（对国家拥有绝对权力的政治领导人，尤指通过武力取得权力的）

1482.definition: a book or electronic resource that gives a list of the words of a language in alphabetical order and explains what they mean, or gives a word for them in a foreign language
1482.translation: 词典（按字母顺序列出语言词汇并解释含义或提供外语对应词的资源）

1483.example: My father died suddenly at the age of 48.

1484.definition: the food and drink that you eat and drink regularly
1484.example: to eat a healthy, balanced diet
1484.translation: 饮食（定期摄入的食物和饮料）

1485.translation: 不同，相异（与某人/某物不同）

1486.definition: the way in which two people or things are not like each other; the way in which somebody/something has changed
1486.example: Americans and Brits speak the same language, but there are big cultural differences.
1486.translation: 区别，差异（两人或物不相似之处；某人/某物的改变方式）

1487.definition: not the same as somebody/something; not like somebody/something else
1487.example: different from somebody/something, American English is significantly different from British English.
1487.translation: 不同的（与某人/某物不一样的）

1488.definition: to recognize or show that two things are not the same
1488.example: differentiate (between) A and B, It's difficult to differentiate between the two varieties.
1488.translation: 区分，辨别（认识或展示两事物不相同）

1489.definition: in a different way from somebody/something
1489.example: Boys and girls may behave differently.
1489.translation: 不同地（以与某人/某物不同的方式）

1490.definition: not easy; needing effort or skill to do or to understand
1490.example: The competition judges were given a very difficult task.
1490.translation: 困难的（不容易的；做或理解时需要努力或技巧的）

1491.definition: a problem; a thing or situation that causes problems
1491.translation: 困难，困境（问题；引起麻烦的事物或情况）

1492.definition: to make a hole in the ground or to move soil from one place to another using your hands, a tool or a machine
1492.example: I think I'll do some digging in the garden.
1492.translation: 挖掘（在地面挖洞或用手、工具、机器移动土壤）

1493.definition: using a system of receiving and sending information as a series of the numbers one and zero, showing that an electronic signal is there or is not there
1493.translation: 数字的（使用0和1的二进制系统接收和发送信息的）

1494.definition: a calm and serious manner that deserves respect
1494.example: She accepted the criticism with quiet dignity.
1494.translation: 尊严（值得尊敬的冷静和严肃举止）

1495.definition: a situation that makes problems, often one in which you have to make a very difficult choice between things of equal importance
1495.example: I could see no way of resolving this moral dilemma.
1495.translation: 困境，两难（产生问题的情况，常指必须在同等重要的事物间做出艰难选择）

1496.definition: a measurement in space, for example how high, wide or long something is
1496.example: We measured the dimensions of the kitchen.
1496.translation: 尺寸，维度（空间测量值，如高度、宽度或长度）

1497.definition: to become smaller, weaker, etc.; to make something become smaller, weaker, etc.
1497.example: The world's resources are rapidly diminishing.
1497.translation: 减少，削弱（变小、变弱等；使某物变小、变弱等）

1498.definition: the main meal of the day, eaten either in the middle of the day or in the evening
1498.translation: 正餐，晚餐（一天中的主餐，在中午或晚上食用）
