1499.definition: to put something quickly into a liquid and take it out again
1499.example: dip something (into something), He dipped the brush into the paint.
1499.translation: 浸，蘸（将某物快速放入液体并取出）

1500.definition: a person whose job is to represent his or her country in a foreign country, for example, in an embassy
1500.translation: 外交官（代表国家驻外的工作人员，如在大使馆中）

1501.definition: connected with managing relations between countries (= diplomacy)
1501.translation: 外交的（与管理国家间关系即外交有关的）

1502.definition: going in the straightest line between two places without stopping or changing direction
1502.translation: 直达的，直接的（两地间最直的、不经停或改变方向的）

1503.definition: without stopping or changing direction or vehicle
1503.example: direct to something, We flew direct to Hong Kong.
1503.translation: 直接地（不经停或不改变方向/车辆地）

1504.definition: to control or be in charge of somebody/something
1504.example: He was asked to take command and direct operations.
1504.translation: 指挥，指导（控制或负责人/物）

1505.definition: the general position a person or thing moves or points towards
1505.example: in the direction of something, They headed in the direction of the village.
1505.translation: 方向（人或物移动或指向的大致位置）

1506.example: The path leads directly to the river.
1506.translation: 直接地（不经停或不改变方向地）

1507.definition: one of a group of senior managers who run a company
1507.translation: 董事，主管（管理公司的高级管理人员之一）

1508.definition: a book or electronic resource containing lists of information, usually in alphabetical order, for example people’s phone numbers or the names and addresses of businesses in a particular area
1508.translation: 名录，目录（包含信息列表——如电话或地址——的资源，通常按字母排序）

1509.definition: any substance that makes something dirty, for example dust, soil or mud
1509.example: His clothes were covered in dirt.
1509.translation: 尘土，污垢（使物体变脏的物质，如灰尘、土壤或泥土）

1511.definition: a physical or mental condition that makes it difficult for somebody to do some things that most other people can do
1511.translation: 残疾，缺陷（使人难以像他人一样做事的生理或心理状况）

1512.definition: having a condition that makes it difficult for you to do some things that most other people can do
1512.translation: 残疾的（患有使人难以像他人一样做事的生理或心理状况的）

1513.definition: something that causes problems and tends to stop somebody/something from succeeding or making progress
1513.translation: 劣势（引起问题并阻碍成功或进步的事物）

1514.definition: if two people disagree or one person disagrees with another about something, they have a different opinion about it
1514.translation: 不同意（对某事持有不同的意见）

1515.definition: a situation where people have different opinions about something and often argue
1515.example: disagreement (about/on/over/as to something), Disagreement arose about exactly how to plan the show.
1515.translation: 分歧（人们对某事有不同意见并常伴有争论的情况）

1517.definition: to make somebody feel sad because something that they hope for or expect to happen does not happen or is not as good as they hoped
1517.example: disappoint (somebody), Her decision to cancel the concert is bound to disappoint her fans.
1517.translation: 使失望（使某人因期望落空或结果不佳而感到悲伤）

1518.definition: upset because something you hoped for has not happened or been as good, successful, etc. as you expected
1518.example: The singer has promised to refund any disappointed fans.
1518.translation: 失望的（因期望落空或结果不佳而感到沮丧的）

1519.definition: not as good, successful, etc. as you had hoped; making you feel disappointed
1519.translation: 令人失望的（不如预期的好或成功，使人感到失望的）

1520.definition: the feeling of being sad because something has not happened or been as good, successful, etc. as you expected or hoped
1520.example: Book early for the show to avoid disappointment.
1520.translation: 失望（因期望未实现或结果不如意而产生的悲伤感）

1521.definition: an unexpected event, such as a very bad accident, a flood or a fire, that kills a lot of people or causes a lot of damage
1521.translation: 灾难（导致大量死亡或破坏的意外事件，如大事故、洪水、火灾）

1522.translation: 灾难性的（非常糟糕的、有害的或失败的）

1523.example: He wears an identity disc around his neck.

1524.definition: to get rid of something that you no longer want or need
1524.example: discard somebody/something, The room was littered with discarded newspapers.
1524.translation: 丢弃（扔掉不再想要或需要的东西）

1525.definition: to give somebody official permission to leave the police or the armed forces; to make somebody leave the police or the armed forces
1525.example: be discharged from something, He was discharged from the army following his injury.
1525.translation: 准许离开，退伍（给予官方许可离开警察或武装部队；或使其离开）

1526.definition: the practice of training people to obey rules and orders and punishing them if they do not; the controlled behaviour or situation that is the result of this training
1526.example: The school has a reputation for high standards of discipline.
1526.translation: 纪律，训练（训练人们遵守规则、若不遵守则惩罚的实践；这种训练产生的结果）

1527.definition: to give somebody information about something, especially something that was previously secret
1527.example: disclose something (to somebody), The spokesman refused to disclose details of the takeover to the press.
1527.translation: 透露，公开（向某人提供关于某事——尤指先前保密的事——的信息）

1528.definition: the act of making something known or public that was previously secret or private
1528.example: the newspaper’s disclosure of defence secrets
1528.translation: 披露（将先前保密或私人的事公之于众的行为）

1529.definition: an amount of money that is taken off the usual cost of something
1529.translation: 折扣（从通常成本中减去的金额）

1530.definition: to take an amount of money off the usual cost of something; to sell something at a discount
1530.example: be discounted by something, Most of our stock has been discounted by up to 40 per cent.
1530.translation: 打折（从通常成本中减去一定金额；折价出售）

1531.definition: to try to prevent something or to prevent somebody from doing something, especially by making it difficult to do or by showing that you do not approve of it
1531.example: discourage (doing) something, a campaign to discourage smoking among teenagers
1531.translation: 劝阻（通过增加困难或表示反对来试图阻止某事或某人做某事）

1532.definition: a long and serious treatment or discussion of a subject in speech or writing
1532.example: discourse on something, a discourse on issues of gender and sexuality
1532.translation: 论述（对一主题的长篇且严肃的口头或书面处理或讨论）

1533.definition: to be the first person to become aware that a particular place or thing exists
1533.example: Cook is credited with discovering Hawaii.
1533.translation: 发现（成为第一个意识到某地或某物存在的人）

1534.definition: an act or the process of finding somebody/something, or learning about something that was not known about before
1534.example: Researchers in this field have made some important new discoveries.
1534.translation: 发现（找到某人/某物或了解先前未知事物的过程）

1535.definition: the freedom or power to decide what should be done in a particular situation
1535.example: I'll leave it up to you to use your discretion.
1535.translation: 酌情决定权（在特定情况下决定该做什么的自由或权力）

1536.definition: the practice of treating somebody or a particular group in society less fairly than others
1536.example: age/racial/gender/sex discrimination (= because of somebody’s age, race or sex)
1536.translation: 歧视（对某人或社会中特定群体不公平对待的做法）

1537.definition: to talk about something with somebody, especially in order to decide something
1537.example: discuss something with somebody, Have you discussed the problem with anyone?
1537.translation: 讨论（与某人谈论某事，尤指为了做出决定）

1538.definition: a conversation about somebody/something; the process of discussing somebody/something
1538.example: I discovered something interesting during a family discussion.
1538.translation: 讨论（关于某人/某事的对话；讨论某事的过程）

1539.definition: an illness affecting humans, animals or plants, often caused by infection
1539.translation: 疾病（影响人类、动物或植物的病，通常由感染引起）

1540.definition: a flat shallow container for cooking food in or serving it from
1540.translation: 盘，碟（用于烹饪或盛放食物的浅平容器）

1541.definition: not honest; intending to trick people
1541.example: Beware of dishonest traders in the tourist areas.
1541.translation: 不诚实的（不诚实的；意图欺骗他人的）

1542.example: Red blood cells are roughly the shape of a disk.
1542.translation: 圆盘（扁平的圆形物体，如红细胞的形状）

1543.definition: a feeling of not liking somebody/something
1543.example: dislike of somebody/something, He did not try to hide his dislike of his boss.
1543.translation: 不喜欢（不喜欢某人/某事的感觉）

1544.example: dislike somebody/something, Why do you dislike him so much?
1544.translation: 不喜欢（不喜欢某人/某事）

1545.definition: to decide that somebody/something is not important and not worth thinking or talking about
1545.example: dismiss somebody/something, to dismiss a suggestion/a claim/an idea
1545.translation: 不予考虑，解雇（决定某人/某物不重要，不值得考虑或谈论）

1546.definition: the act of dismissing somebody from their job; an example of this
1546.example: He still hopes to win his claim against unfair dismissal.
1546.translation: 解雇（将某人从工作中辞退的行为；这种情况）

1547.definition: a condition or illness that causes problems with the way part of the body or brain works
1547.translation: 紊乱，失调（导致身体或大脑部分功能出现问题的状况或疾病）

1548.definition: to take the place of somebody/something
1548.example: be displaced (by somebody/something), Gradually factory workers have been displaced by machines.
1548.translation: 取代（取代某人/某物的位置）

1549.definition: an arrangement of things in a public place to inform or entertain people or advertise something for sale
1549.translation: 陈列，展示（在公共场所安排事物以告知、娱乐或促销的活动）

1550.definition: to put something in a place where people can see it easily; to show something to people
1550.example: display something, The exhibition gives local artists an opportunity to display their work.
1550.translation: 陈列，展示（将某物放在易见处；向人们展示某物）

1551.definition: the act of getting rid of something
1551.example: The council is responsible for waste disposal and street cleaning.
1551.translation: 处置，清理（丢弃某物的行为）

1552.definition: to arrange things or people in a particular way or position
1552.example: The visitors disposed themselves in a circle round the statue.
1552.translation: 布置，排列（以特定方式或位置安排人或物）

1553.definition: an argument between two people, groups or countries; discussion about a subject on which people disagree
1553.translation: 争端（人、群体或国家间的争论；关于分歧主题的讨论）

1554.definition: to question whether something is true or legally or officially acceptable
1554.example: dispute something, These figures have been disputed.
1554.translation: 对...表示异议（怀疑某事是否属实或在法律/官方上是否可接受）

1555.definition: to make it difficult for something to continue in the normal way
1555.example: Demonstrators succeeded in disrupting the meeting.
1555.translation: 中断，扰乱（使某事难以按正常方式继续）

1556.definition: a situation in which it is difficult for something to continue in the normal way; the act of stopping something from continuing in the normal way
1556.example: We aim to help you move house with minimum disruption to yourself.
1556.translation: 中断，扰乱（使某事难以按正常方式继续的情况；停止某事继续的行为）

1557.definition: to mix with a liquid and become part of it
1557.translation: 溶解（与液体混合并成为其一部分）

1558.definition: the amount of space between two places or things
1558.translation: 距离（两个地方或事物之间的空间量）

1559.definition: far away in space or time
1559.translation: 遥远的（在空间或时间上很远的）

1560.definition: easily or clearly heard, seen, felt, etc.
1560.example: There was a distinct smell of gas.
1560.translation: 清晰的（容易或清晰地被听到、看到、感觉到等）

1561.definition: a clear difference or contrast especially between people or things that are similar or related
1561.example: distinctions between traditional and modern societies
1561.translation: 区别，差别（清晰的差异或对比，尤指在相似或相关事物之间）

1562.definition: having a quality or characteristic that makes something different and easily noticed
1562.translation: 独特的（具有使某物不同且易于察觉的品质或特征的）

1563.definition: to recognize the difference between two people or things
1563.example: distinguish between A and B, At what age are children able to distinguish between right and wrong?
1563.translation: 区分（识别出两个或更多人或物之间的差异）

1564.definition: to change the shape, appearance or sound of something so that it is strange or not clear
1564.example: a fairground mirror that distorts your shape
1564.translation: 扭曲，歪曲（改变形状、外观或声音使其变得奇怪或不清晰）

1565.definition: to take somebody’s attention away from what they are trying to do
1565.example: You're distracting me from my work.
1565.translation: 分散注意力（将某人的注意力从其正在尝试做的事上引开）

1566.definition: a feeling of great worry or unhappiness; great mental pain
1566.example: The newspaper article caused the actor considerable distress.
1566.translation: 忧虑，苦恼（极度担忧或不快乐的感觉；极大的精神痛苦）

1567.definition: to make somebody feel very worried or unhappy
1567.example: distress somebody, It was clear that the letter had deeply distressed her.
1567.translation: 使苦恼（使某人感到非常担忧或不快乐）

1568.definition: to give things to a large number of people; to share something between a number of people
1568.example: distribute something, The leaflets have been widely distributed.
1568.translation: 分发，分配（将物品给予大量的人；在一定人数中分享某物）

1569.definition: the way that something is spread or exists over a particular area or among a particular group of people
1569.example: distribution of something, They studied the geographical distribution of the disease.
1569.translation: 分发，分布（某物在特定区域或人群中散布或存在的方式）

1570.definition: an area of a country or town, especially one that has particular features
1570.example: the City of London’s financial district
1570.translation: 区，地区（国家或城镇中的一个区域，尤指具有特定特征的）

1571.definition: to interrupt somebody when they are trying to work, sleep, etc.
1571.example: I'm sorry to disturb you, but can I talk to you for a moment?
1571.translation: 打扰（当某人尝试工作、睡觉等时打断他们）

1572.definition: making you feel anxious and upset or shocked
1572.translation: 令人不安的（使人感到焦虑、沮丧或震惊的）

1573.definition: a jump into deep water with your head first and your arms in front of you
1573.example: a spectacular high dive (= from high above the water)
1573.translation: 潜水，跳水（头朝前、手臂在前地跳入深水中）

1574.definition: to jump into water with your head and arms going in first
1574.example: dive (from/off something) (into something), We dived into the river to cool off.
1574.translation: 潜水，跳水（头和手臂在前地跳入水中）

1575.definition: very different from each other and of various kinds
1575.example: People from diverse cultures were invited to the event.
1575.translation: 多样的（彼此非常不同且种类繁多的）

1576.definition: a range of many people or things that are very different from each other
1576.example: the biological diversity of the rainforests
1576.translation: 多样性（一系列彼此非常不同的人或事物）

1577.example: be diverted, The course of the stream has now been diverted.
1577.translation: 使转向（使某人/某物改变方向）

1578.definition: a difference between two groups of people or two things that separates them from each other
1578.example: He offered advice on bridging cultural divides.
1578.translation: 分歧，鸿沟（将两群人或物分开的差异）

1579.definition: to separate into parts; to make something separate into parts
1579.example: The cells began to divide rapidly.
1579.translation: 划分，分开（分成部分；使某物分成部分）

1580.definition: coming from or connected with God or a god
1580.translation: 神圣的（来自上帝或神，或与之相关的）

1581.definition: the process or result of dividing into separate parts; the process or result of dividing something or sharing it out
1581.example: The organism begins as a single cell and grows by cell division.
1581.translation: 划分，部门（划分为独立部分的过程或结果；分发某物的过程）

1582.definition: the legal ending of a marriage
1582.example: The marriage ended in divorce in 1996.

1583.definition: to end your marriage to somebody legally
1583.translation: 离婚（与某人合法结束婚姻关系）

1584.definition: no longer married because your marriage has been legally ended
1584.translation: 离婚的（因婚姻合法终结而不再结婚的）

1585.definition: used to refer to actions that you do not mention by name or do not know about
1585.example: What are you doing this evening?
1585.translation: 做（用于指代你未指名或不知道的动作）

1586.definition: used before a full verb to form negative sentences and questions
1586.translation: （助动词）（用于实义动词前构成否定句和疑问句）

1587.definition: a person who has been trained in medical science, whose job is to treat people who are ill or injured
1587.example: You'd better see a doctor about that cough.
1587.translation: 医生（受过医学训练，工作是治疗病人的人）

1588.definition: a belief or set of beliefs held and taught by a Church, a political party, etc.
1588.translation: 教义，学说（教会、政党等持有并教授的一套信仰）

1589.definition: an official paper, book or electronic file that gives information about something, or that can be used as evidence or proof of something
1589.example: Please read and sign the attached document.
1589.translation: 文件（给予信息或可作为证据的官方纸张、书籍或电子文件）

1590.definition: to record something in the form of a written document, photograph, film, etc.
1590.example: Urban life in the nineteenth century is well documented.
1590.translation: 记录（以书面文件、照片、电影等形式记录某事）

1591.definition: a film or a radio or television programme giving facts about something
1591.example: There were some interesting interviews in the documentary.
1591.translation: 纪录片（给出关于某事事实的电影、广播或电视节目）

1592.definition: the documents that are required for something, or that give evidence or proof of something
1592.example: I couldn't enter the country because I didn't have all the necessary documentation.
1592.translation: 文件，记录（所需的或给出证据/证明的文件）

1593.definition: an animal with four legs and a tail, often kept as a pet or trained for work, for example hunting or guarding buildings. There are many types of dog, some of which are wild.
1593.example: I took the dog for a walk.
1593.translation: 狗（一种四条腿带尾巴的动物，常作为宠物或工作犬）

1594.definition: the unit of money in the US, Canada, Australia and several other countries
1594.example: You will be paid in American dollars.
1594.translation: 美元（美国、加拿大、澳大利亚等多国的货币单位）

1595.definition: an area of knowledge or activity; especially one that somebody is responsible for
1595.translation: 领域（知识或活动的范围；尤指某人负责的范围）

1596.definition: of or inside a particular country; not foreign or international
1596.translation: 国内的（特定国家内部的；非外国或国际的）

1597.definition: the fact of being more important, powerful or easy to notice than somebody/something else
1597.translation: 主导地位（比他人更重要、更有力或更显眼的事实）

1598.definition: more important, powerful or easy to notice than other things
1598.example: The firm has achieved a dominant position in the world market.
1598.translation: 主导的（比他物更重要、更有力或更显眼的）

1599.definition: to control or have a lot of influence over somebody/something, especially in an unpleasant way
1599.example: She always says a lot in meetings, but she doesn't dominate.
1599.translation: 支配，主导（控制或对某人/某物产生很大影响，尤指以令人不快的方式）

1600.definition: to give money, food, clothes, etc. to somebody/something, especially a charity
1600.example: donate something to somebody/something, He donated thousands of pounds to charity.
1600.translation: 捐赠（向某人/某物——尤指慈善机构——给予金钱、食物、衣服等）

1601.definition: something that is given to a person or an organization such as a charity, in order to help them; the act of giving something in this way
1601.translation: 捐款，捐赠物（给予个人或组织以提供帮助的东西；这种给予行为）

1602.definition: a person or an organization that makes a gift of money, clothes, food, etc. to a charity, etc.
1602.example: international aid donors (= countries that give money, etc. to help other countries)
1602.translation: 捐赠者（向慈善机构等赠送金钱、衣物、食物等的个人或组织）

1603.definition: a piece of wood, glass, etc. that is opened and closed so that people can get in and out of a room, building, car, etc.; a similar thing in a cupboard
1603.translation: 门（用于进出房间、建筑、汽车等的木、玻璃制品；橱柜门）

1604.definition: an amount of a medicine or a drug that is taken once, or regularly over a period of time
1604.translation: 剂量（一次或在一段时间内定期服用的药物量）

1605.definition: a small round mark, especially one that is printed
1605.example: There are dots above the letters i and j.
1605.translation: 点（一个小的圆标记，尤指打印出的）

1606.definition: twice as much or as many as usual
1606.translation: 两倍的（比通常多一倍的量或数）

1607.definition: in twos or in two parts
1607.example: I thought I was seeing double (= seeing two of something).
1607.translation: 成双地（成对地或分成两部分地）

1608.definition: twice as much or as many as

1609.definition: a number or amount that is twice as much or as many as another number or amount
1609.example: He gets paid double for doing the same job I do.
1609.translation: 两倍（另一数或量的两倍）

1610.definition: to become, or make something become, twice as much or as many
1610.example: Membership almost doubled in two years.
1610.translation: 加倍（变成或使某物变成原来的两倍）

1611.definition: a feeling of being uncertain about something or not believing something
1611.example: a feeling of doubt and uncertainty
1611.translation: 怀疑（对某事不确定或不相信的感觉）

1612.definition: to feel uncertain about something; to feel that something is not true, will probably not happen, etc.
1612.example: doubt something, There seems no reason to doubt her story.
1612.translation: 怀疑（对某事感到不确定；觉得某事不真实或可能不会发生）

1613.definition: to or at a lower place or position
1613.example: She jumped down off the chair.
1613.translation: 向下（向着或处于较低的地方或位置）

1614.definition: from a high or higher point on something to a lower one
1614.example: The stone rolled down the hill.
1614.translation: 沿着...向下（从某物的高处向低处移动）

1615.definition: data that is downloaded from another computer system
1615.example: A staggering 99.8 % of digital music downloads are to mobile handsets.
1615.translation: 下载内容（从另一计算机系统下载的数据）

1616.definition: to get data from another computer, usually using the internet
1616.translation: 下载（通常使用互联网从另一台电脑获取数据）

1617.definition: on a floor of a house or building lower than the one you are on, especially the one at ground level
1617.translation: 楼下的（在房子或建筑的较低层，尤指地面层）

1618.definition: down the stairs; on or to a floor of a house or building lower than the one you are on, especially the one at ground level
1618.example: I couldn't sleep so I went downstairs and watched TV.
1618.translation: 在楼下（沿着楼梯向下；在较低层，尤指地面层）

1619.definition: in, towards or typical of the centre of a city, especially its main business area
1619.translation: 市中心的（在或朝向城市中心——尤指其主要商业区——的）

1620.definition: in or towards the centre of a city, especially its main business area
1620.translation: 在市中心（在或朝向城市中心，尤指其主要商业区）

1621.definition: the centre of a city, especially its main business area
1621.example: a hotel in the heart of downtown
1621.translation: 市中心（城市中心，尤指其主要商业区）

1622.definition: towards the ground; towards a lower place or position
1622.example: She was lying face downwards on the grass.
1622.translation: 向下（朝向地面；朝向较低的地方或位置）

1623.definition: a group of twelve of the same thing
1623.translation: 一打（十二个同类事物的组合）

1624.definition: a group of twelve of the same thing
1624.translation: 一打（十二个同类事物的组合）

1625.definition: a rough written version of something that is not yet in its final form
1625.example: This is only the first draft of my speech.
1625.translation: 草稿（尚未定稿的初步书面版本）

1626.definition: to write the first rough version of something such as a letter, speech, book or law
1626.example: I'll draft a letter for you.
1626.translation: 起草（编写信件、演说、书、法律等的第一个粗略版本）

1627.definition: to pull somebody/something along with effort and difficulty
1627.example: drag somebody/something, The sack is too heavy to lift—you’ll have to drag it.
1627.translation: 拖，拽（费力地拉着某人/某物移动）

1628.definition: to make something empty or dry by removing the liquid from it; to become empty or dry in this way
1628.translation: 排出，排干（通过移除液体使某物排空或变干；以此方式变干）

1629.definition: a play for the theatre, television or radio
1629.translation: 戏剧（供剧院、电视或电台演出的剧本）

1630.definition: sudden, very great and often surprising
1630.translation: 剧烈的（突然、极大且常令人惊讶的）

1631.definition: very suddenly and to a very great and often surprising degree
1631.translation: 剧烈地（非常突然且程度极大、常令人惊讶地）

1632.definition: to make pictures, or a picture of something, with a pencil, pen or chalk (but not paint)
1632.translation: 画（用铅笔、钢笔或粉笔画图）

1633.definition: a picture made using a pencil or pen rather than paint
1633.translation: 绘画（使用铅笔或钢笔而非油漆制作的图画）

1634.definition: a series of images, events and feelings that happen in your mind while you are asleep
1634.example: I had a really weird dream last night.
1634.translation: 梦，梦想（睡眠时脑中出现的一系列图像、事件和感觉）

1635.definition: to experience a series of images, events and feelings in your mind while you are asleep
1635.example: Did I talk in my sleep? I must have been dreaming.
1635.translation: 做梦（睡眠时在脑中体验一系列图像、事件和感觉）

1636.definition: a piece of clothing that is made in one piece and hangs down to cover the body as far as the legs, sometimes reaching to below the knees, or to the ankles
1636.translation: 连衣裙（连体的一件式服装，向下覆盖身体，长度可达膝盖或脚踝）

1637.translation: 穿衣（给自己/某人穿上衣服）

1638.definition: wearing clothes and not naked or wearing clothes for sleeping
1638.translation: 穿好衣服的（穿着衣服的，而非赤裸或穿睡衣的）

1639.definition: to move along smoothly and slowly in water or air
1639.translation: 漂流，漂移（在水或空气中平稳缓慢地移动）

1640.definition: a liquid for drinking; an amount of a liquid that you drink
1640.translation: 饮料（供饮用的液体；饮用液体的量）

1641.definition: to take liquid into your mouth and then down your throat into your stomach
1641.example: drink something, I don't drink coffee.
1641.translation: 喝（将液体放入口中并咽入胃里）

1642.definition: a journey in a car or other vehicle
1642.translation: 开车旅行（乘车或其他车辆的旅程）

1643.definition: to operate a vehicle so that it goes in a particular direction
1643.translation: 驾驶（操作系统使车辆向特定方向行驶）

1644.definition: a person who drives a vehicle

1645.definition: strong and powerful; having a strong influence in making something happen
1645.example: Who was the driving force (= the person with the strongest influence) in the band?
1645.translation: 驱动的，强劲的（强大有力的；在使某事发生中具有强烈影响的）

1646.definition: the way that somebody drives a vehicle; the act of driving
1646.example: She was convicted of dangerous driving.
1646.translation: 驾驶（某人驾驶车辆的方式；驾驶的行为）

1647.definition: a very small amount of liquid that forms a round shape
1647.example: The first drops of rain fell.
1647.translation: 滴（形成圆形的极少量液体）

1648.definition: to allow something to fall by accident; to fall by accident
1648.example: drop something, Be careful not to drop that plate.
1648.translation: 掉落（无意中让某物落下；意外坠落）

1649.definition: a long period of time when there is little or no rain
1649.example: Farmers are facing ruin after two years of severe drought.
1649.translation: 干旱（降雨极少或无雨的长期时段）

1650.definition: to die because you have been underwater too long and you cannot breathe; to kill somebody by holding them underwater
1650.example: Two children drowned after falling into the river.
1650.translation: 淹死，溺亡（因在水下过久无法呼吸而死亡；以此方式杀人）

1651.definition: an illegal substance that some people smoke, inject, etc. for the physical and mental effects it has
1651.example: He does not smoke or take drugs.
1651.translation: 药物，毒品（一些人因其产生的生理和心理效果而吸食或注射的非法物质）

1652.definition: a musical instrument made of a hollow round frame with plastic or skin stretched tightly across one or both ends. You play it by hitting it with sticks or with your hands.
1652.translation: 鼓（一种由中空圆框及绷紧的皮/塑料组成的乐器，用棍或手击打）

1653.definition: having drunk so much alcohol that it is impossible to think or speak clearly
1653.example: They were clearly too drunk to drive.
1653.translation: 醉的（饮酒过多以至于无法清晰思考或说话的）

1654.definition: not wet or sticky; without water or moisture
1654.translation: 干的（不湿或不黏的；无水或无水分的）

1655.definition: to become dry; to make something dry
1655.example: He did the laundry and hung it out to dry.
1655.translation: 变干，弄干（变干；使某物变干）

1656.example: his dual role as composer and conductor
1656.translation: 双重的（具有两个部分或方面的）

1657.definition: to give somebody/something a particular name, often in a humorous or critical way
1657.example: The media dubbed anorexia ‘the slimming disease’.
1657.translation: 起绰号，称作（给某人/某物起特定名称，常带幽默或批评色彩）

1658.definition: caused by somebody/something; because of somebody/something
1658.example: The team's success was largely due to her efforts.
1658.translation: 由于（由某人/某物引起的；因为某人/某物）

1659.example: Life in a small town could be deadly dull.
1659.translation: 枯燥的（不有趣或不令人兴奋的）

1660.example: That was a pretty dumb thing to do.

1661.definition: to get rid of something you do not want, especially in a place that is not suitable
1661.example: Too much toxic waste is being dumped at sea.
1661.translation: 倾倒，堆放（丢弃不想要的东西，尤指在不合适的地点）

1662.definition: two people who perform together or are often seen or thought of together
1662.example: the comedy duo Laurel and Hardy
1662.translation: 二人组（一起表演或常被联系在一起的两个人）

1663.definition: the length of time that something lasts or continues
1663.example: The school was used as a hospital for the duration of the war.
1663.translation: 持续时间（某事持续或继续的时间长度）

1664.definition: all through a period of time
1664.translation: 在...期间（贯穿一段时期的全程）

1665.definition: a fine powder that consists of very small pieces of sand, earth, etc.
1665.example: A cloud of dust rose as the truck drove off.
1665.translation: 灰尘（由极小的沙、土等碎片组成的细粉）

1666.definition: something that you feel you have to do because it is your moral or legal responsibility
1666.example: duty to do something, It is my duty to report it to the police.
1666.translation: 责任，义务（因道德或法律责任而觉得必须做的事）

1667.definition: a disk on which large amounts of information, especially films, photographs and video, can be stored, for use on a DVD player or computer (the abbreviation for ‘digital versatile disc’ or ‘digital videodisc’)
1667.example: Let's just stay in and watch a DVD.
1667.translation: 数码光盘，DVD（可存储大量信息——尤指电影和照片——供播放器或电脑使用的光盘）

1668.definition: having a lot of energy and a strong personality
1668.translation: 充满活力的（充满能量且性格强硬的）

1669.definition: the way in which people or things behave and react to each other in a particular situation
1669.translation: 动力，动态（在特定情况下人或物相互表现和反应的方式）

1670.definition: used to refer to every one of two or more people or things, when you are thinking about them separately
1670.translation: 每一个（指代两个或更多人/物中的每一个，当分别考虑时）

1671.definition: used to refer to every one of two or more people or things, when you are thinking about them separately
1671.translation: 每个（指代两个或更多人/物中的每一个，当分别考虑时）

1672.definition: used to refer to every one of two or more people or things, when you are thinking about them separately
1672.translation: 每个（指代两个或更多人/物中的每一个，当分别考虑时）

1673.definition: very interested and excited by something that is going to happen or about something that you want to do; showing this
1673.translation: 渴望的，热切的（对将发生之事或想做之事非常感兴趣和兴奋的）

1674.definition: either of the organs on the sides of the head that you hear with
1674.translation: 耳朵（头部两侧用于听觉的器官）

1675.definition: near the beginning of a period of time, an event etc.
1675.translation: 早的（靠近一段时间或事件开端的）

1676.definition: near the beginning of a period of time, an event, a piece of work, etc.
1676.example: We arrived early the next day.
1676.translation: 早地（在一段时期、事件、工作等的开端附近）

1677.definition: to get money for work that you do
1677.example: earn (something), He earns about $40 000 a year.

1678.definition: the money that you earn for the work that you do
1678.translation: 收入，收益（通过工作赚得的钱）

1679.definition: the world; the planet that we live on
1679.translation: 地球（世界；我们生活的行星）

1680.definition: a sudden, violent shaking of the earth’s surface
1680.translation: 地震（地表突然、剧烈的震动）

1681.example: with ease, He passed the exam with ease.
1681.translation: 容易，自在（缺乏困难的状态）

1682.definition: to become less unpleasant, painful or severe; to make something less unpleasant, etc.
1682.translation: 减轻（变得不那么令人愉快、痛苦或严重；使减轻）

1683.example: The museum is easily accessible by car.
1683.translation: 容易地（没有问题或困难地）

1684.translation: 东方的（在东方或向东的）

1686.definition: the direction that you look towards to see the sun rise; one of the four main points of the compass
1686.translation: 东方（看日出的方向；罗盘四个主要点之一）

1687.definition: located in the east or facing east
1687.translation: 东部的（位于东方或面朝东方的）

1688.definition: not difficult; done or obtained without a lot of effort or problems
1688.example: an easy way to make bread
1688.translation: 容易的（不难的；无需大量努力或问题即可完成或获得的）

1689.definition: to put food in your mouth, bite it and swallow it
1689.example: I was too nervous to eat.
1689.translation: 吃（将食物放入口中，咀嚼并咽下）

1690.definition: the reflecting of sound off a wall or inside a particular space so that a noise appears to be repeated; a sound that is reflected back in this way
1690.example: There was an echo on the phone and I couldn't hear clearly.
1690.translation: 回声（声音在墙壁或空间反射产生的重复声；反射回来的声音）

1691.definition: if a sound echoes, it is reflected off a wall, the side of a mountain, etc. so that you can hear it again
1691.example: Her footsteps echoed in the empty room.
1691.translation: 发出回声（如果声音发出回声，指其在墙壁等反射以便再次听到）

1692.definition: connected with the relation of plants and living creatures to each other and to their environment
1692.example: We risk upsetting the ecological balance of the area.
1692.translation: 生态的（与生物及其环境之间关系相关的）

1693.definition: connected with the trade, industry and development of wealth of a country, an area or a society
1693.example: They discussed social, economic and political issues.
1693.translation: 经济的（与国家、地区或社会的贸易、工业和财富增长相关的）

1694.definition: the study of how a society organizes its money, trade and industry
1694.example: He studied politics and economics at Yale.
1694.translation: 经济学（研究社会如何组织其金钱、贸易和工业的学科）

1695.definition: a person who studies or writes about economics
1695.translation: 经济学家（研究或撰写经济学的人）

1696.definition: the relationship between production, trade and the supply of money in a particular country or region
1696.translation: 经济（特定国家或地区内生产、贸易和货币供应之间的关系）

1697.definition: the outside limit of an object, a surface or an area; the part furthest from the centre
1697.example: I gripped the edge of my desk to steady myself.
1697.translation: 边缘（物体、表面或区域的外部界限；离中心最远的部分）

1698.definition: to prepare a piece of writing, a book, etc. to be published by correcting the mistakes, making improvements to it, etc.
1698.example: edit (something), This draft text will need to be edited.
1698.translation: 编辑（通过纠错、改进等准备书稿、文章以供出版）

1699.definition: the form in which a book, newspaper, etc. is published
1699.translation: 版本（书籍、报纸等出版的形式，如平装版/精装版）

1700.definition: a person who is in charge of a newspaper, magazine, etc., or part of one, and who decides what should be included
1700.example: the editor of the Washington Post
1700.translation: 编辑（负责报纸、杂志等出版物内容的负责人）

1701.definition: connected with the task of preparing something such as a newspaper, a book or a television or radio programme, to be published or broadcast
1701.translation: 编辑的（与准备出版或广播的新闻、书籍或节目相关的）

1702.definition: to teach somebody over a period of time at a school, university, etc.
1702.example: be educated, She was educated in the US.
1702.translation: 教育（在学校、大学等机构长期教授某人）

1703.definition: having had the kind of education mentioned; having been to the school, college or university mentioned
1703.translation: 受过教育的（受过特定教育的；上过特定学校或大学的）

1704.definition: a process of teaching, training and learning, especially in schools, colleges or universities, to improve knowledge and develop skills
1704.translation: 教育（提高知识和发展技能的教学、培训和学习过程）

1706.definition: a person whose job is to teach or educate people
1706.translation: 教育工作者（工作是教学或教育他人的人）

1707.definition: a change that somebody/something causes in somebody/something else; a result
1707.translation: 效果，影响（某人/某事在他人/他物上引起的改变；结果）

1708.definition: producing the result that is wanted or intended; producing a successful result
1708.example: Aspirin is a simple but highly effective treatment.
1708.translation: 有效的（产生预期或想要的结果的；成功的）

1709.definition: in a way that produces the intended result or a successful result
1709.example: The company must reduce costs to compete effectively.
1709.translation: 有效地（以产生预期或成功结果的方式）

1710.definition: the fact of producing the result that is wanted or intended; the fact of producing a successful result
1710.example: to check the effectiveness of the security system
1710.translation: 有效性（产生预期或想要结果的事实）

1711.definition: the quality of doing something well with no waste of time or money
1711.example: improvements in efficiency at the factory
1711.translation: 效率（不浪费时间或金钱地做好某事的品质）

1712.definition: doing something in a good, careful and complete way with no waste of time, money or energy
1712.translation: 高效的（以良好、仔细且完整的方式做事，不浪费时间、金钱或精力）

1713.definition: in a good and careful way, with no waste of time, money or energy
1713.translation: 高效地（以良好且仔细的方式，不浪费时间、金钱或精力）

1714.definition: an attempt to do something especially when it is difficult to do
1714.example: The project was a team effort.
1714.translation: 努力（尝试做某事，尤其是困难的事）

1715.definition: a small oval object with a thin hard shell produced by a female bird and containing a young bird; a similar object (without a hard shell) produced by a female fish, insect, etc.
1715.example: The female sits on the eggs until they hatch.
1715.translation: 蛋（雌鸟产下的带壳卵，内含幼鸟；或鱼、昆虫产下的卵）

1716.definition: your sense of your own value and importance
1716.example: He has the biggest ego of anyone I've ever met.
1716.translation: 自我，自尊（对自身价值和重要性的意识）

1720.definition: used after negative phrases to state that a feeling or situation is similar to one already mentioned
1720.example: Pete can't go and I can't either.
1720.translation: 也（用于否定句后，表示情感或情况与前述相似）

1721.definition: one or the other of two; it does not matter which
1721.example: You can park on either side of the street.
1721.translation: 或者（两者中的任一个；哪一个都行）

1722.definition: one or the other of two; it does not matter which
1722.example: You can park on either side of the street.
1722.translation: 或者（两者中的任一个；哪一个都行）

1723.definition: very complicated and detailed; carefully prepared and organized
1723.translation: 精心制作的，详尽的（非常复杂且详细的；精心准备的）

1724.definition: the joint between the upper and lower parts of the arm where it bends in the middle
1724.example: She jabbed him with her elbow.
1724.translation: 手肘（手臂上下两部分连接处的关节）

1725.definition: used as a polite word for ‘old’
1725.translation: 年长的，年迈的（“老”的礼貌说法）

1726.definition: to choose somebody to do a particular job by voting for them
1726.example: elect somebody/something, Voters will elect a new president on 30 March next year.
1726.translation: 选举（通过投票选择某人担任特定工作）

1727.definition: the process of choosing a person or a group of people for a position, especially a political position, by voting
1727.translation: 选举（通过投票选择人员担任职位的过程，尤指政治职位）

1729.definition: connected with electricity; using, produced by or producing electricity
1729.translation: 电的（与电有关的；使用、产生电的）

1730.definition: connected with electricity; using or producing electricity
1730.example: an electrical fault in the engine
1730.translation: 电的（与电有关的；使用或产生电的）

1731.definition: a form of energy from charged elementary particles, usually supplied as electric current through cables, wires, etc. for lighting, heating, driving machines, etc.
1731.translation: 电（由电荷粒子产生的能源，通过电缆传输用于照明、加热等）

1732.definition: having or using many small parts, such as microchips, that control and direct a small electric current
1732.example: Airline passengers no longer have to turn off all electronic devices while on the plane.
1732.translation: 电子的（具有或使用微芯片等小部件来控制电流的）

1733.definition: the branch of science and technology that studies electric currents in electronic equipment
1733.translation: 电子学（研究电子设备中电流的科学和技术分支）

1734.definition: attractive and showing a good sense of style
1734.translation: 优雅的（有吸引力且表现出良好品味的）

1735.definition: a necessary or typical part of something; one of several parts that something contains
1735.example: There are three important elements to consider.
1735.translation: 元素，要素（事物必要或典型的部分；组成部分之一）

1736.definition: in or connected with the first stages of a course of study
1736.translation: 初级的，基础的（处于课程或研究第一阶段或与之相关的）

1737.definition: a very large animal with thick grey skin, large ears, two curved outer teeth called tusks and a long nose called a trunk. There are two types of elephant, the African and the Asian.
1737.translation: 大象（体型巨大、皮肤灰色、有长鼻和象牙的动物）

1738.definition: to give somebody/something a higher position or rank, often more important than they deserve
1738.example: elevate somebody/something (to something), He elevated many of his friends to powerful positions within the government.
1738.translation: 提升，抬高（给予某人/某物更高的职位或级别，常高于其应得的）

1739.example: There are only eleven of these rare animals left.

1740.definition: a person who is eligible for something or to do something, is able to have or do it because they have the right qualifications, are the right age, etc.
1740.example: eligible (for something), Only those over 70 are eligible for the special payment.
1740.translation: 有资格的（具备合适条件、年龄等从而能够拥有或做某事的）

1741.definition: to remove or get rid of something
1741.example: eliminate something, Credit cards eliminate the need to carry a lot of cash.
1741.translation: 消除，排除（移除或去掉某物）

1742.definition: a small group of people in a society, etc. who are powerful and have a lot of influence, because they are rich, intelligent, etc.
1742.example: a member of the ruling/intellectual elite
1742.translation: 精英（社会中因富有、聪明等而拥有权力和影响力的一小群人）

1743.definition: in addition to something already mentioned
1743.translation: 另外（在已提到事物之外的）

1744.definition: in, at or to another place or other places
1744.translation: 在别处（在、向或到另一个地方）

1745.definition: a way of sending messages and data to other people by means of computers connected together in a network
1745.example: I will be on vacation for a week in November, with no access to email.
1745.translation: 电子邮件（通过网络连接的电脑发送消息和数据的方式）

1746.definition: to send a message to somebody by email
1746.example: email somebody, Patrick emailed me yesterday.
1746.translation: 发送电子邮件（通过电子邮件向某人发送消息）

1747.definition: to get onto a ship or plane; to put somebody/something onto a ship or plane
1747.example: We stood on the pier and watched as they embarked.
1747.translation: 登船/机（登上船或飞机；将人/物放入船或飞机）

1748.definition: shy, uncomfortable or ashamed, especially in a social situation
1748.example: I've never felt so embarrassed in my life!
1748.translation: 尴尬的（在社交场合感到害羞、不自在或羞愧的）

1749.definition: making you feel shy, uncomfortable or ashamed
1749.translation: 令人尴尬的（使你感到害羞、不自在或羞愧的）

1750.definition: shy, uncomfortable or guilty feelings; a feeling of being embarrassed
1750.example: I nearly died of embarrassment when he said that.
1750.translation: 尴尬，难为情（害羞、不自在或内疚的感觉）

1751.definition: a group of officials led by an ambassador who represent their government in a foreign country
1751.translation: 大使馆（由大使领导的代表其政府驻国外的官员团体）

1752.definition: to fix something in a substance or solid object
1752.example: be embedded in something, an operation to remove glass that was embedded in his leg
1752.translation: 嵌入（将某物固定在物质或固体对象中）

1753.definition: to express or represent an idea or a quality
1753.example: embody something, a politician who embodied the hopes of black youth
1753.translation: 体现，代表（表达或代表一种想法或品质）

1754.definition: to put your arms around somebody as a sign of love or friendship
1754.example: They embraced and promised to keep in touch.
1754.translation: 拥抱（作为爱或友谊的象征抱住某人）

1755.definition: to move out of or away from something and become possible to see
1755.example: The crabs emerge at low tide to look for food.
1755.translation: 出现，显露（从某处出来或离开某处并变得可见）

1756.definition: the fact of somebody/something moving out of or away from something and becoming possible to see
1756.example: the island’s emergence from the sea 3 000 years ago
1756.translation: 出现（某人/某物从某处出来并变得可见的事实）

1757.definition: a sudden serious and dangerous event or situation that needs immediate action to deal with it
1757.example: This is a medical emergency needing urgent treatment with antibiotics.
1757.translation: 突发事件，紧急情况（需要立即采取行动处理的突然严重的危险情况）

1758.definition: the production or sending out of light, heat, gas, etc.
1758.example: the emission of carbon dioxide into the atmosphere
1758.translation: 排放（光、热、气体等的产生或散发）

1759.definition: a strong feeling such as love, fear or anger; the part of a person’s character that consists of feelings
1759.translation: 情感，情绪（强烈的感情，如爱、恐惧或愤怒；性格中情感的部分）

1760.definition: connected with people’s feelings (= with the emotions)
1760.translation: 情感的，情绪的（与人的感情相关的）

1761.definition: in a way that is connected with people's feelings (= with the emotions)
1761.translation: 情感上地（以与人的感情相关的方式）

1762.definition: special importance that is given to something
1762.example: emphasis on/upon something, Since the elections there has been a greater emphasis on education.
1762.translation: 强调（给予某物的特别重要性）

1763.definition: to give special importance to something
1763.example: emphasize something, His speech emphasized the importance of attracting industry to the town.
1763.translation: 强调（给予某事特别的重要性）

1764.definition: a group of countries or states that are controlled by one leader or government
1764.example: These invasions almost led to the collapse of the Roman Empire.
1764.translation: 帝国（由一个领导者或政府控制的一组国家或州）

1765.definition: based on experiments or experience rather than ideas or theories
1765.translation: 经验主义的（基于实验或经验而非想法或理论的）

1766.definition: to give somebody a job to do for payment
1766.example: employ somebody, How many people does the company employ?
1766.translation: 雇用（支付报酬给某人让其工作）

1767.definition: a person who is paid to work for somebody
1767.translation: 员工，雇员（受雇拿薪水工作的人）

1768.definition: a person or company that pays people to work for them
1768.example: They're very good employers (= they treat the people that work for them well).
1768.translation: 雇主（付钱让人们为其工作的人或公司）

1769.definition: work, especially when it is done to earn money; the state of being employed
1769.translation: 就业，职业（工作，尤指为了赚钱而做的；受雇状态）

1770.definition: to give somebody the power or authority to do something
1770.example: be empowered (to do something), The courts were empowered to impose the death sentence for certain crimes.
1770.translation: 授权（给予某人权力或权威去做某事）

1771.definition: with no people or things inside
1771.translation: 空的（里面没有物或人的）

1772.definition: to remove everything that is in a container, etc.
1772.example: empty something, She emptied the bins, washed the glasses and went to bed.
1772.translation: 倒空（移除容器内的所有东西）

1773.definition: to make it possible for somebody/something to do something
1773.example: This new programme will enable older people to study at college.
1773.translation: 使能够（使某人/某物做某事成为可能）

1774.example: (be) enacted (by somebody/something), legislation enacted by parliament

1775.definition: to include a large number or range of things
1775.example: The job encompasses a wide range of responsibilities.
1775.translation: 包含，涵盖（包括大量的项目或范围）

1776.definition: a meeting, especially one that is sudden, unexpected or violent
1776.translation: 遭遇，相遇（突然、意外或暴力的会面）

1777.definition: to experience something, especially something unpleasant or difficult, while you are trying to do something else
1777.example: We encountered a number of difficulties in the first week.
1777.translation: 遭遇，遇到（在尝试做别的事时体验到某事，尤指不愉快或困难的事）

1778.definition: to give somebody support, courage or hope
1778.example: encourage somebody, We were greatly encouraged by the positive response of the public.
1778.translation: 鼓励（给予某人支持、勇气或希望）

1779.definition: the act of encouraging somebody to do something; something that encourages somebody
1779.translation: 鼓励（鼓励某人的行为；激励某人的事物）

1780.definition: that gives somebody support, courage or hope
1780.example: This month's unemployment figures are not very encouraging.
1780.translation: 令人鼓舞的（给予某人支持、勇气或希望的）

1781.definition: the final part of a period of time, an event, an activity or a story
1781.example: It's the end of an era.
1781.translation: 结束（时间、事件、活动或故事的最后部分）

1782.definition: to finish; to reach a point and go no further; to make something finish
1782.translation: 结束（完成；达到终点并不再继续；使结束）

1783.definition: an attempt to do something, especially something new or difficult
1783.example: There have been great advances in the field of scientific endeavour.
1783.translation: 努力，尝试（尝试做某事，尤其是新的或困难的事）

1784.definition: the last part of a story, film, etc.
1784.example: His stories usually have a happy ending.
1784.translation: 结局（故事、电影等的最后部分）

1785.definition: very large in size or amount and seeming to have no end
1785.translation: 无止境的（规模或数量极大且似乎没有终点的）

1786.definition: to say publicly that you support a person, statement or course of action
1786.translation: 认可，支持（公开表示你支持某人、言论或行动）

1787.definition: a public statement or action showing that you support somebody/something
1787.example: The election victory is a clear endorsement of their policies.
1787.translation: 认可，背书（显示你支持某人/某事的公开声明或行动）

1788.definition: to experience and deal with something that is painful or unpleasant without giving up
1788.example: endure something, They had to endure a long wait before the case came to trial.
1788.translation: 忍受（体验并应对痛苦或不快的事而不放弃）

1789.definition: a person who hates somebody or who acts or speaks against somebody/something
1789.example: She didn't have an enemy in the world.
1789.translation: 敌人（仇恨某人或言行反对某人/某事的人）

1790.definition: the strength, effort and enthusiasm required for physical or mental activity, work, etc.
1790.example: It's a waste of time and energy.
1790.translation: 能量，精力（进行体力或脑力活动所需的强度、努力和热情）

1791.definition: to make sure that people obey a particular law or rule
1791.example: enforce something, It's the job of the police to enforce the law.
1791.translation: 强制，执行（确保人们遵守特定的法律或规则）

1792.definition: the act of making people obey a particular law or rule
1792.translation: 执法，强制执行（使人们遵守特定法律或规则的行为）

1793.definition: to succeed in attracting and keeping somebody’s attention and interest
1793.example: It is a movie that engages both the mind and the eye.
1793.translation: 吸引，占用（成功吸引并保持某人的注意力和兴趣）

1794.translation: 订婚的（已同意与某人结婚的）

1795.definition: an agreement to marry somebody; the period during which two people are engaged
1795.example: Their engagement was announced in the local paper.
1795.translation: 订婚（结婚的约定；订婚的期间）

1796.definition: interesting or pleasant in a way that attracts your attention
1796.translation: 迷人的，吸引人的（以吸引注意力的方式展现出有趣或愉快的）

1797.definition: the part of a vehicle that produces power to make the vehicle move
1797.translation: 引擎（车辆中产生动力使车辆移动的部分）

1798.definition: a person whose job involves designing and building engines, machines, roads, bridges, etc.
1798.example: We worked with a team of scientists and engineers.
1798.translation: 工程师（设计和建造引擎、机器、道路、桥梁等的人）

1799.definition: the activity of applying scientific knowledge to the design, building and control of machines, roads, bridges, electrical equipment, etc.
1799.example: The bridge is a triumph of modern engineering.
1799.translation: 工程学（将科学知识应用于机器、道路、电器等的设计、建造和控制）

1800.definition: to increase or further improve the good quality, value or status of somebody/something
1800.example: This is an opportunity to enhance the reputation of the company.
1800.translation: 增强，提升（增加或进一步改善某人/某物的优良品质、价值或地位）

1801.example: enjoy something, We thoroughly enjoyed our time in New York.
1801.translation: 喜欢，享受（从某事中获得乐趣）

1804.example: I hadn't trained enough for the game.
1804.translation: 足够地（达到必要的程度）

1805.definition: used before plural or uncountable nouns to mean ‘as many or as much as somebody needs or wants’
1805.translation: 足够的（用于复数或不可数名词前，意为“所需或所欲之多”）

1806.definition: as many or as much as somebody needs or wants
1806.translation: 足够（所需或所欲之多的量或数）

1807.definition: to ask somebody for some information
1807.example: enquire about somebody/something, I called the station to enquire about train times.
1807.translation: 询问（向某人询问某些信息）

1808.definition: an official process to find out the cause of something or to find out information about something
1808.translation: 询问，调查（找出某事原因或信息的官方过程）

1809.definition: to improve the quality of something, often by adding something to it
1809.example: The study of science has enriched all our lives.
1809.translation: 使丰富，充实（通常通过添加某物来提高某物的质量）

1810.definition: to arrange for yourself or for somebody else to officially join a course, school, etc.
1810.example: You need to enrol before the end of August.
1810.translation: 招收，入学（安排自己或他人正式加入课程、学校等）

1811.definition: to happen after or as a result of another event
1811.translation: 随之而来（在另一事件之后或由于其结果而发生）

1812.definition: to make sure that something happens or is definite
1812.example: ensure something, We are working to ensure the safety of people in the city.
1812.translation: 确保（确保某事发生或确定）

1813.definition: to come or go into something
1813.translation: 进入（进入或进入某物内部）

1814.example: He is in charge of an enterprise with a turnover of $26 billion.

1815.definition: to interest somebody or make somebody laugh in order to please them
1815.example: The aim of the series is both to entertain and inform.
1815.translation: 款待，娱乐（使某人感兴趣或发笑以取悦他们）

1816.definition: that you enjoy watching, listening to, doing or experiencing
1816.translation: 有趣的（看、听、做或体验时感到愉快的）

1817.definition: films, music, etc. used to entertain people; an example of this
1817.example: radio, television and other forms of entertainment
1817.translation: 娱乐（用于娱乐人们的电影、音乐等；其例子）

1818.definition: a strong feeling of excitement and interest in something and a desire to become involved in it
1818.example: Her voice was full of enthusiasm.
1818.translation: 热情（对某事的强烈兴奋和兴趣感，以及参与其中的愿望）

1819.definition: a person who is very interested in something and spends a lot of time doing it
1819.translation: 爱好者（对某事非常感兴趣并花大量时间去做的人）

1820.definition: feeling or showing a lot of excitement and interest about somebody/something
1820.translation: 热情的（对某人/某事表现出极大的兴奋和兴趣的）

1821.definition: including everything, everyone or every part
1821.translation: 整个的（包括所有的、每个人的或每一部分的）

1822.example: The experience was entirely new to me.
1822.translation: 完全地（在每一个可能的方面；完全地）

1823.definition: to give somebody the right to have or to do something
1823.example: be entitled to something, You will be entitled to your pension when you reach 65.
1823.translation: 赋权，给予权利（给予某人拥有或做某事的权利）

1824.definition: something that exists separately from other things and has its own identity
1824.example: The unit has become part of a larger department and no longer exists as a separate entity.
1824.translation: 实体（独立存在且具有自身身份的事物）

1825.definition: a door, gate, passage, etc. used for entering a room, building or place
1825.example: the front/back/side entrance of the house
1825.translation: 入口（用于进入房间、建筑或场所的门、门道、通道等）

1826.definition: a person who makes money by starting or running businesses, especially when this involves taking financial risks
1826.example: A creative entrepreneur, he was continually dreaming up new projects.
1826.translation: 企业家（通过创办或经营企业——尤指涉及财务风险——来赚钱的人）

1827.definition: an act of going into or getting into a place
1827.example: She made her entry to the sound of thunderous applause.
1827.translation: 进入，入口（进入或到达某地的行为）

1828.definition: a flat paper container used for sending letters in, with a part that you stick down to close it
1828.example: Writing paper and envelopes are provided in your room.
1828.translation: 信封（发送信件用的平纸容器，带封口部分）

1829.definition: the natural world in which people, animals and plants live
1829.example: The government should do more to protect the environment.
1829.translation: 环境（人、动物和植物生活的自然世界）

1830.definition: connected with the natural conditions in which people, animals and plants live; connected with the environment
1830.translation: 环境的（与人、动植物生活的自然条件相关的；与环境有关的）

1831.definition: a large number of cases of a particular disease or medical condition happening at the same time in a particular community
1831.example: the outbreak of a flu epidemic
1831.translation: 流行病（特定社区内同时发生的大量某种疾病或医疗状况）

1832.definition: one part of a story that is broadcast on television or radio in several parts
1832.example: The next episode has not yet been filmed.
1832.translation: 一集（电视或电台分集播出的故事中的一个部分）

1833.definition: the same in size, quantity, value, etc. as something else
1833.example: There is an equal number of boys and girls in the class.
1833.translation: 平等的（在规模、数量、价值等方面与他物相同）

1834.definition: a person or thing of the same quality or with the same status, rights, etc. as another
1834.example: She treats the people who work for her as her equals.
1834.translation: 对手，同等地位的人（在质量、地位、权利等方面与另一人/物相同的人或物）

1835.definition: to be the same in size, quantity, value, etc. as something else
1835.translation: 等于（在规模、数量、价值等方面与他物相同）

1836.definition: the fact of being equal in rights, status, advantages, etc.
1836.translation: 平等（在权利、地位、优势等方面相同的事实）

1837.definition: to the same degree; in the same or in a similar way
1837.example: Diet and exercise are equally important.
1837.translation: 同样地（以相同程度；以相同或相似的方式）

1838.definition: a statement showing that two amounts or values are equal, for example 2x + y = 54
1838.example: the numbers on the right-hand side of the equation
1838.translation: 等式，方程式（显示两个量或数值相等的陈述，如2x+y=54）

1839.definition: to provide yourself/somebody/something with the things that are needed for a particular purpose or activity
1839.example: equip something, to be fully/poorly equipped
1839.translation: 装备（为自己/他人/他物提供特定目的或活动所需的物品）

1840.definition: the things that are needed for a particular purpose or activity
1840.example: a useful piece of equipment for the kitchen
1840.translation: 装备，设备（特定目的或活动所需的物品）

1841.definition: equal in value, amount, meaning, importance, etc.
1841.example: 250 grams or an equivalent amount in ounces
1841.translation: 相等的，等值的（在价值、数量、意义、重要性等方面相同的）

1842.definition: a thing, amount, word, etc. that is equal in value, meaning or purpose to something else
1842.example: Send €20 or the equivalent in your own currency.
1842.translation: 相等物，等价物（在价值、意义或目的上与他物相同的人、物或词）

1843.definition: a period of time, usually in history, that is different from other periods because of particular characteristics or events
1843.translation: 时代，纪元（历史上因特定特征或事件而区别于其他时期的时段）

1844.translation: 建立，树立（建造某物，如教堂）

1845.definition: a mistake, especially one that causes problems or affects the result of something
1845.translation: 错误（失误，尤指引起问题或影响结果的）

1846.definition: when a volcano erupts or burning rocks, smoke, etc. erupt or are erupted, the burning rocks, etc. are thrown out from the volcano
1846.example: The volcano could erupt at any time.
1846.translation: 喷发，爆发（火山喷出岩石、烟雾等；或这些物质被喷出）

1847.definition: to become greater, worse, more serious, etc.; to make something greater, worse, more serious, etc.
1847.translation: 升级，加剧（变得更大、更糟、更严重等；使之变得更大、更糟等）

1848.definition: the act or a method of escaping from a place or an unpleasant or dangerous situation
1848.example: I had a narrow escape (= I was lucky to have escaped).
1848.translation: 逃跑，逃脱（从某处或不快、危险局面逃离的行为或方法）

1849.definition: to get away from a place where you have been kept as a prisoner or not allowed to leave
1849.translation: 逃跑，逃脱（从被关押或不被允许离开的地方逃离）

1850.definition: more with one person, thing, etc. than with others, or more in particular circumstances than in others
1850.example: Teenagers are very fashion conscious, especially girls.
1850.translation: 特别地，尤其是（对某人/某物比对其他更甚，或在特定情况下更甚）

1851.definition: a short piece of writing by a student as part of a course of study
1851.example: I have to write an essay this weekend.
1851.translation: 论文，短文（学生作为课程一部分撰写的简短文章）

1852.definition: the most important quality or feature of something, that makes it what it is
1852.example: His paintings capture the essence of France.
1852.translation: 本质，实质（某物最核心的品质或特征，使其成其为自身）

1853.definition: completely necessary; extremely important in a particular situation or for a particular activity
1853.translation: 必不可少的（在特定情况或活动中完全必要或极其重要的）

1854.definition: when you think about the true, important or basic nature of somebody/something
1854.example: There are three essentially different ways of tackling the problem.
1854.translation: 本质上（考虑某人/某物的真实、重要或基本性质时）

1855.definition: to start or create an organization, a system, etc. that is meant to last for a long time
1855.translation: 建立，创立（启动或创建一个旨在长期存在的组织、系统等）

1856.definition: an organization, a large institution or a hotel
1856.example: The visa is for foreign nationals wishing to study at a university, college or similar educational establishment.
1856.translation: 机构，大型设施（组织、大型机构或旅馆）

1857.definition: an area of land with a lot of houses or factories of the same type on it
1857.example: on an estate, She lives in a tower block on an estate in London.
1857.translation: 地产，庄园（有许多同类房屋或工厂的一块土地区域）

1858.definition: a judgement that you make without having the exact details or figures about the size, amount, cost, etc. of something
1858.translation: 估算（在没有确切细节或数字的情况下对规模、金额、成本等做出的判断）

1859.definition: to form an idea of the cost, size, value etc. of something, but without calculating it exactly
1859.example: estimate something, to estimate the cost/value/number of something
1859.translation: 估算（在未精确计算的情况下对成本、规模、价值等形成想法）

1860.definition: without an end; existing or continuing forever
1860.example: the promise of eternal life in heaven
1860.translation: 永恒的（无止境的；永远存在或持续的）

1861.definition: moral principles that control or influence a person’s behaviour
1861.translation: 伦理，道德规范（控制或影响人行为的道德原则）

1862.definition: connected with beliefs and principles about what is right and wrong
1862.translation: 伦理的，道德的（与关于对错的信念和原则相关的）

1863.definition: connected with or belonging to a group of people that share a cultural tradition
1863.translation: 民族的，种族的（与具有共同文化传统的群体相关或属于该群体的）

1864.definition: the unit of money of some countries of the European Union
1864.example: I paid five euros for it.
1864.translation: 欧元（部分欧盟国家的货币单位）

1865.definition: to move people from a place of danger to a safer place
1865.example: evacuate something, Police evacuated nearby buildings.
1865.translation: 撤离，疏散（将人们从危险地带移至更安全的地方）

1866.definition: to form an opinion of the amount, value or quality of something after thinking about it carefully
1866.example: evaluate something, The trial will evaluate the effectiveness of the different drugs.
1866.translation: 评估，评价（经过仔细思考后对某物的数量、价值或质量形成看法）

1867.definition: the act of forming an opinion of the amount, value or quality of something after thinking about it carefully
1867.example: an evaluation of the healthcare system
1867.translation: 评估，评价（仔细思考后对某物数量、价值或质量形成看法的行为）

1868.definition: that can be divided exactly by two

1869.definition: used to emphasize something unexpected or surprising
1869.example: She didn't even call to say she wasn't coming.
1869.translation: 甚至（用于强调出乎意料或令人惊讶的事）

1870.definition: the part of the day between the afternoon and the time you go to bed
1870.example: Remember to call me this evening.
1870.translation: 傍晚，晚上（下午之后到睡觉前的时间段）

1871.definition: a thing that happens, especially something important
1871.translation: 事件（发生的事情，尤其是重要的事）

1872.definition: at the end of a period of time or a series of events
1872.example: Our flight eventually left five hours late.
1872.translation: 最终（在一段时期或一系列事件结束时）

1873.definition: used in negative sentences and questions, or sentences with if to mean ‘at any time’
1873.translation: 曾经（用于否定、疑问或条件句，意为“在任何时间”）

1874.definition: used with singular nouns to refer to all the members of a group of things or people
1874.example: She knows every student in the school.
1874.translation: 每个（与单数名词连用，指代群体中的所有成员）

1875.translation: 每个人（每一个人；所有人）

1876.definition: used or happening every day or regularly; ordinary
1876.example: Change is a part of everyday life in business.
1876.translation: 日常的（每天使用或发生的；普通的）

1877.translation: 每个人（每一个人；所有人）

1879.definition: in, to or at every place; all places
1879.translation: 到处（在、向或处于每一个地方；所有地方）

1880.definition: the facts, signs or objects that make you believe that something is true
1880.example: evidence (of something), Researchers have found clear scientific evidence of a link between exposure to sun and skin cancer.
1880.translation: 证据，证明（使你相信某事属实的事实、迹象或物体）

1881.example: The orchestra played with evident enjoyment.

1882.definition: enjoying harming others; morally bad and cruel
1882.example: Police described the killer as ‘a desperate and evil man’.
1882.translation: 邪恶的（享受伤害他人的；道德败坏且残忍的）

1883.definition: a force that causes bad things to happen; morally bad behaviour
1883.example: the eternal struggle between good and evil
1883.translation: 邪恶（导致坏事发生的力量；道德败坏的行为）

1884.definition: to bring a feeling, a memory or an image into your mind
1884.example: The music evoked memories of her youth.
1884.translation: 引起，唤起（在脑海中产生一种感觉、记忆或图像）

1885.definition: the slow steady development of plants, animals, etc. during the history of the earth, as they adapt to changes in their environment
1885.example: the evolution of the human species
1885.translation: 进化（地球历史上动植物随着环境变化而进行的缓慢稳步的发展）

1886.definition: connected with evolution; connected with slow steady development and change
1886.translation: 进化的（与进化相关的；与缓慢稳步发展和变化相关的）

1887.definition: to develop gradually, especially from a simple to a more complicated form; to develop something in this way
1887.example: evolve (from something) (into something), The idea evolved from a drawing I discovered in the attic.
1887.translation: 进化，演变（逐渐发展，尤指从简单向复杂形式发展）

1888.example: The new palace is an exact replica of the original building.
1888.translation: 确切的（在每一个细节上都正确的）

1889.definition: used to emphasize that something is correct in every way or in every detail
1889.translation: 确切地（用于强调在各方面或各细节上都正确）

1890.definition: to make something seem larger, better, worse or more important than it really is
1890.example: The hotel was really filthy and I'm not exaggerating.
1890.translation: 夸大（使某事显得比实际更大、更好、更糟或更重要）

1891.definition: a formal written, spoken or practical test, especially at school or college, to see how much you know about a subject, or what you can do
1891.translation: 考试（学校或学院进行的正式测试，以检查知识或能力）

1892.definition: a formal written, spoken or practical test, especially at school or college, to see how much you know about a subject, or what you can do
1892.translation: 考试（学校或学院进行的正式测试，以检查知识或能力）

1893.definition: to consider or study an idea, a subject, etc. very carefully
1893.example: examine something, This study sets out to examine in detail the possible effects of climate change.
1893.translation: 检查，审视（非常仔细地考虑或研究一个想法、主题等）

1894.definition: something such as an object, a fact or a situation that shows, explains or supports what you say
1894.example: Let me give you an example.
1894.translation: 例子（显示、解释或支持你所说话语的物体、事实或情况）

1895.definition: to be greater than a particular number or amount
1895.translation: 超过，超出（大于特定的数字或金额）

1896.definition: the quality of being extremely good
1896.translation: 卓越，优秀（极其优秀的品质）

1898.definition: used before you mention something that makes a statement not completely true
1898.example: I didn't tell him anything except that I needed the money.
1898.translation: 除了（用于提到使陈述不完全真实的某事之前）

1899.definition: used before you mention the only thing or person about which a statement is not true
1899.example: We work every day except Sunday.
1899.translation: 除了（用于提到陈述对其不适用的唯一的人或物之前）

1900.definition: a person or thing that is not included in a general statement
1900.example: Most of the buildings in the town are modern, but the church is an exception.
1900.translation: 例外（不包括在一般陈述中的人或物）

1901.example: At the age of five he showed exceptional talent as a musician.
1901.translation: 卓越的，例外的（异常好的）

1902.definition: in addition to an amount that is necessary, usual or legal
1902.example: Excess food is stored as fat.
1902.translation: 过量的（超过必要、通常或法律数量的）

1903.definition: more than is necessary, reasonable or acceptable
1903.example: You can throw away any excess.
1903.translation: 过量（超过必要、合理或可接受的数量）

1904.definition: greater than what seems reasonable or appropriate
1904.example: They complained about the excessive noise coming from the upstairs flat.
1904.translation: 过度的（大于合理或恰当程度的）

1905.definition: an act of giving something to somebody or doing something for somebody and receiving something in return
1905.example: The exchange of prisoners took place this morning.
1905.translation: 交换（给予并接收回报的行为）

1906.definition: to give something to somebody and at the same time receive the same type of thing from them
1906.translation: 交换（给某人某物并同时收到同类物品）

1907.definition: feeling or showing happiness and enthusiasm
1907.example: Staff got excited when they heard they were getting a bonus.
1907.translation: 兴奋的（表现出快乐和热情的）

1908.definition: the state of feeling or showing happiness and enthusiasm
1908.example: The news caused great excitement among her friends.
1908.translation: 兴奋（快乐和热情的心理状态）

1909.example: This is an exciting opportunity for me.
1909.translation: 令人兴奋的（引起极大兴趣或兴奋的）

1910.definition: to deliberately not include something in what you are doing or considering
1910.example: The cost of borrowing has been excluded from the inflation figures.
1910.translation: 排除（故意不将某物包括在内）

1911.definition: the act of preventing somebody/something from entering a place or taking part in something
1911.example: exclusion (of somebody/something) (from something), He was disappointed with his exclusion from the England squad.
1911.translation: 排除，排除在外（阻止某人/某物进入或参与的行为）

1912.definition: only to be used by one particular person or group; only given to one particular person or group
1912.example: The hotel has exclusive access to the beach.
1912.translation: 独家的，排他的（仅供特定人或群体使用/给予的）

1913.definition: for only one particular person, group or use
1913.example: The resort caters almost exclusively for a high-society public.
1913.translation: 独家地，排他地（仅针对一个特定的人、群体或用途）

1914.definition: a reason, either true or invented, that you give to explain or defend your behaviour
1914.example: Late again! What's your excuse this time?
1914.translation: 借口，理由（解释或辩护行为的理由，真假均可）

1915.definition: to forgive somebody for something that they have done, for example not being polite or making a small mistake
1915.example: excuse something, Please excuse the mess.
1915.translation: 原谅（宽恕某人的过失，如失礼或小错）

1916.definition: to kill somebody, especially as a legal punishment
1916.example: be executed (for something), He was executed for treason.
1916.translation: 执行，处决（处死某人，尤指作为法律惩罚）

1917.definition: the act of killing somebody, especially as a legal punishment
1917.example: He faced execution by hanging for murder.
1917.translation: 执行，处决（处死某人的行为，尤指作为法律惩罚）

1918.definition: connected with managing a business or an organization, and with making plans and decisions
1918.example: She has an executive position in a finance company.
1918.translation: 行政的，执行的（与管理业务/组织及决策相关的）

1919.definition: a person who has an important job as a manager of a company or an organization
1919.translation: 主管，行政人员（在公司或组织担任管理要职的人）

1920.definition: physical or mental activity that you do to stay healthy or become stronger
1920.translation: 锻炼，运动（为了健康或增强体质进行的体力或脑力活动）

1921.definition: to do sports or other physical activities in order to stay healthy or become stronger; to make an animal do this
1921.example: an hour’s class of exercising to music
1921.translation: 锻炼，运动（进行体育活动以保持健康或增强体质）

1922.definition: to use power or influence to affect somebody/something
1922.example: He exerted all his authority to make them accept the plan.
1922.translation: 运用，施加（使用力量或影响力来影响某人/某物）

1923.definition: an object or a collection of objects put in a public place, for example a museum, so that people can see it
1923.example: The museum contains some interesting exhibits on Spanish rural life.
1923.translation: 展品（在博物馆等公共场所展出供人观看的物品）

1924.definition: to show something in a public place for people to enjoy or to give them information
1924.example: exhibit something (at/in…), They will be exhibiting their new designs at the trade fairs.
1924.translation: 展出（在公共场所展示某物供人欣赏或提供信息）

1925.definition: a collection of things, for example works of art, that are shown to the public
1925.example: Have you seen the Picasso exhibition?
1925.translation: 展览（向公众展示的一组物品，如艺术品）

1926.definition: the state of being sent to live in another country that is not your own, especially for political reasons or as a punishment
1926.translation: 流亡（被送往他国居住的状态，尤指出于政治或惩罚原因）

1927.definition: to be real; to be present in a place or situation
1927.example: Does life exist on other planets?
1927.translation: 存在（真实的；存在于某个地方或情况中）

1928.definition: the state or fact of being real or living or of being present
1928.example: I was unaware of his existence until today.
1928.translation: 存在（真实、生存或在场的状态或事实）

1929.definition: a way out of a public building or vehicle
1929.translation: 出口（公共建筑或车辆的出口处）

1930.definition: to go out; to leave a building, stage, vehicle, etc.
1930.example: (+ adv./prep.), The bullet entered her back and exited through her chest.
1930.translation: 离去，退出（走出；离开建筑、舞台、车辆等）

1931.definition: from or in another country, especially a tropical one; seeming exciting and unusual because it seems to be connected with foreign countries
1931.translation: 异国的，异域风情的（来自或在另一个国家的，尤指热带国家；显得新奇吸引人的）

1932.definition: to become greater in size, number or importance; to make something greater in size, number or importance
1932.example: Metals expand when they are heated.
1932.translation: 扩大，扩张（在大小、数量或重要性上变得更大）

1933.definition: an act of increasing or making something increase in size, amount or importance
1933.example: a period of rapid economic expansion
1933.translation: 扩张，扩展（增加大小、数量或重要性的行为）

1934.definition: to think or believe that something will happen or that somebody will do something
1934.example: expect something, The company is expecting record sales this year.
1934.translation: 期望，预料（认为或相信某事会发生或某人会做某事）

1935.definition: a belief that something will happen because it is likely
1935.example: expectation of something, We are confident in our expectation of a full recovery.
1935.translation: 期望（相信某事很有可能会发生的信念）

1936.example: Double the expected number of people came to the meeting.
1936.translation: 预期的（你认为会发生的）

1937.definition: an organized journey with a particular purpose, especially to find out about a place that is not well known
1937.translation: 探险，考察（有特定目的的有组织的旅行，尤指去未知地）

1938.definition: the act of spending or using money; an amount of money spent
1938.translation: 开支，支出（花钱的行为；所花的钱款数额）

1939.definition: the money that you spend on something
1939.example: The garden was transformed at great expense.
1939.translation: 费用，代价（在某事上花费的钱）

1941.definition: the knowledge and skill that you have gained through doing something for a period of time; the process of gaining this
1941.example: My lack of practical experience was a disadvantage.
1941.translation: 经验，经历（通过长期实践获得的知识和技能；获得这些的过程）

1942.definition: to have a particular situation affect you or happen to you
1942.example: Many people have never experienced these difficulties first-hand.
1942.translation: 经历，体验（受到特定情况的影响或发生该情况）

1943.definition: having knowledge or skill in a particular job or activity
1943.translation: 有经验的（在特定工作或活动中具备知识或技能的）

1944.definition: a scientific test that is done in order to study what happens and to gain new knowledge
1944.translation: 实验（为了研究和获得新知识而进行的科学测试）

1945.definition: to do a scientific experiment or experiments
1945.example: After experimenting at Columbia University, he realized that fission was the key to releasing nuclear energy.
1945.translation: 进行实验（做一个或多个科学实验）

1946.definition: based on new ideas, forms or methods that are used to find out what effect they have
1946.example: The school's experimental teaching methods include letting the children decide what to study.
1946.translation: 实验性的（基于新主意、形式或方法以发现其效果的）

1947.definition: done with, having or involving great knowledge or skill
1947.translation: 专家的（由具有丰富知识或技能的人完成的，或涉及这些的）

1948.definition: a person with special knowledge, skill or training in something
1948.translation: 专家（在某方面具有专门知识、技能或训练的人）

1949.definition: expert knowledge or skill in a particular subject, activity or job
1949.translation: 专门知识（在特定学科、活动或工作中的专家级知识或技能）

1950.definition: to be no longer legally acceptable because the period of time for which it could be used has ended
1950.example: When does your driving licence expire?
1950.translation: 过期（因期限届满而不再具有法律效力）

1951.definition: to tell somebody about something in a way that makes it easy to understand
1951.example: explain (something), He was trying to explain the difference between hip hop and rap.
1951.translation: 解释（以易于理解的方式告诉某人关于某事的情况）

1952.definition: a statement, fact, or situation that tells you why something happened; a reason given for something
1952.example: The most likely explanation is that his plane was delayed.
1952.translation: 解释（说明某事发生原因的陈述、事实或情况；给出的理由）

1953.definition: clear and easy to understand, so that you have no doubt what is meant
1953.example: He gave me very explicit directions on how to get there.
1953.translation: 明确的（清楚且易于理解的，使其含义毫无疑问）

1954.definition: clearly or directly, so that the meaning is easy to understand
1954.example: The report states explicitly that the system was to blame.
1954.translation: 明确地（清晰或直接地，使其含义易于理解）

1955.definition: to burst (= break apart) or make something burst loudly and violently, causing damage
1955.example: A second bomb exploded in a crowded market.
1955.translation: 爆炸（猛烈迸裂并发出巨响，造成破坏）

1956.definition: to treat a person or situation as an opportunity to gain an advantage for yourself
1956.example: He exploited his father's name to get himself a job.
1956.translation: 剥削，利用（利用人或情况作为为自己获取优势的机会）

1957.definition: a situation in which somebody treats somebody else in an unfair way, especially in order to make money from their work
1957.translation: 剥削，开发（以不公平方式对待他人，尤指为了从中赚钱的情况）

1958.definition: the act of travelling through a place in order to find out about it or look for something in it
1958.example: Budgets for space exploration have been cut back.
1958.translation: 探索，探测（为了解某地或寻找某物而在其中旅行的行为）

1959.definition: to travel to or around an area or a country in order to learn about it
1959.example: As soon as we arrived on the island we were eager to explore.
1959.translation: 探索（为了解某地或某国而前往或在其中旅行）

1960.definition: the sudden violent bursting and loud noise of something such as a bomb exploding; the act of deliberately causing something to explode
1960.translation: 爆炸（某物如炸弹突然剧烈迸裂和发出的巨响；故意导致爆炸的行为）

1961.definition: easily able or likely to explode
1961.translation: 爆炸性的（易于或很可能爆炸的）

1962.definition: a substance that is able or likely to cause an explosion
1962.translation: 炸药，爆炸物（能引起爆炸的物质）

1963.definition: the selling and transporting of goods to another country
1963.example: a ban on the export of live cattle
1963.translation: 出口（将商品销售并运输到另一个国家）

1964.definition: to sell and send goods to another country
1964.example: export (something), The islands export sugar and fruit.
1964.translation: 出口（将商品销售并运送到另一个国家）

1965.definition: to show something that is usually hidden
1965.example: expose something, He smiled suddenly, exposing a set of amazingly white teeth.
1965.translation: 暴露，显露（展示通常隐藏的事物）

1966.definition: the state of being in a place or situation where there is no protection from something harmful or unpleasant
1966.translation: 暴露，接触（处于没有保护措施免受有害或不快事物影响的状态）

1967.definition: to show or make known a feeling, an opinion, etc. by words, looks or actions
1967.example: express something, Teachers have expressed concern about the changes.
1967.translation: 表达（通过言语、神情或行动展示或告知情感、观点等）

1968.example: What's the meaning of the expression ‘on cloud nine’?
1968.translation: 表达，短语（一个词或短语）

1969.definition: to make something longer or larger
1969.translation: 延伸，扩展（使某物变得更长或更大）

1970.definition: the act of increasing the area of activity, group of people, etc. that is affected by something
1970.example: the extension of new technology into developing countries
1970.translation: 延伸，扩展（增加受某物影响的活动区域、人群等的行为）

1971.definition: covering a large area; great in amount
1971.translation: 广泛的（覆盖大面积的；数量巨大的）

1972.definition: in a way that covers a large area
1972.translation: 广泛地（以覆盖大面积的方式）

1973.definition: how large, important, serious, etc. something is
1973.example: It is difficult to assess the full extent of the damage.
1973.translation: 程度，范围（某事物有多大、多重要、多严重等）

1974.definition: connected with or located on the outside of something/somebody
1974.example: the external walls of the building
1974.translation: 外部的（与某物/某人外部相连或位于其外部的）

1975.definition: more than is usual, expected, or than exists already
