1975.translation: 额外的（比通常、预期或已有的更多）

1976.definition: in addition; more than is usual, expected or exists already
1976.translation: 额外地（另外；比通常、预期或已有的更多）

1977.definition: a thing that is added to something that is not usual, standard or necessary and that costs more
1977.example: The monthly fee is fixed and there are no hidden extras (= unexpected costs).
1977.translation: 额外费用（添加到非寻常、非标准或非必需事物上的、成本更高的东西）

1978.definition: a short passage from a book, piece of music, etc. that gives you an idea of what the whole thing is like
1978.example: The following extract is taken from her new novel.
1978.translation: 摘录（书籍、音乐等的一小段，让你了解全貌）

1979.definition: to remove or obtain a substance from something, for example by using an industrial or a chemical process
1979.example: a machine that extracts excess moisture from the air
1979.translation: 提取（从某物中移除或获得一种物质，例如通过工业或化学过程）

1980.example: What an extraordinary thing to say!
1980.translation: 非凡的（意想不到的、令人惊讶的或奇怪的）

1981.example: We are working under extreme pressure at the moment.

1982.definition: a feeling, situation, way of behaving, etc. that is as different as possible from another or is opposite to it
1982.translation: 极端（与另一种尽可能不同或相反的情感、情况、行为方式等）

1983.example: It is extremely important to follow the directions exactly.
1983.translation: 极其（达到非常高的程度）

1984.definition: a person whose opinions, especially about religion or politics, are extreme, and who may do things that are violent or illegal for what they believe
1984.translation: 极端分子（持极端观点——尤指关于宗教或政治——并可能为此采取暴力或违法行动的人）

1985.definition: either of the two organs on the face that you see with
1985.example: The suspect has dark hair and green eyes.
1985.translation: 眼睛（脸上用于看东西的两个器官之一）

1986.definition: material made by weaving wool, cotton, silk, etc., used for making clothes, curtains, etc. and for covering furniture
1986.example: They sell a wide variety of printed cotton fabric.
1986.translation: 织物，面料（通过编织羊毛、棉、丝等制成的材料，用于制作衣服、窗帘等）

1987.example: They put on a fabulous performance.

1988.definition: the front part of the head, where the eyes, nose and mouth are
1988.translation: 脸（头部的前部，包括眼、鼻和嘴）

1989.definition: to be opposite somebody/something; to have your face or front pointing towards somebody/something or in a particular direction
1989.example: face somebody/something, She turned and faced him.
1989.translation: 面对，面向（位于某人/某物对面；使面部或前部朝向某人/某物或特定方向）

1990.definition: to make an action or a process possible or easier
1990.example: The new trade agreement should facilitate more rapid economic growth.
1990.translation: 促进，使便利（使行动或过程成为可能或更容易）

1991.definition: buildings, services, equipment, etc. that are provided for a particular purpose
1991.translation: 设施，设备（为了特定目的提供的建筑、服务、设备等）

1992.definition: a thing that is known to be true, especially when it can be proved
1992.example: fact about something, First, some basic facts about healthy eating.
1992.translation: 事实（已知是真实的、尤指可以被证明的事物）

1993.definition: a small group of people within a larger one, whose members have some different aims and beliefs to those of the larger group
1993.example: There are rival factions within the administration.
1993.translation: 派系（大群体中的小群体，其成员具有一些与大群体不同的目标和信念）

1994.definition: one of several things that cause or influence something
1994.example: Obesity is a major risk factor for heart disease.
1994.translation: 因素（引起或影响某事的几个事物之一）

1995.definition: a building or group of buildings where goods are made, mainly by machine
1995.translation: 工厂（主要通过机器制造商品的建筑或建筑群）

1996.definition: a department or group of related departments in a college or university
1996.translation: 学院，系（学院或大学中的一个部门或一组相关部门）

1997.definition: to become or to make something become paler or less bright
1997.example: The curtains had faded in the sun.
1997.translation: 褪色（变淡或使某物颜色变淡、亮度降低）

1998.definition: to not be successful in achieving something
1998.example: Many diets fail because they are boring.
1998.translation: 失败（未能在实现某事上获得成功）

2000.definition: lack of success in doing or achieving something
2000.example: The success or failure of the plan depends on you.
2000.translation: 失败（在做或实现某事上缺乏成功）

2001.definition: acceptable and appropriate in a particular situation
2001.translation: 公平的（在特定情况下可接受且恰当的）

2002.definition: to some extent but not very
2002.translation: 相当地（在某种程度上，但不是非常）

2003.definition: the quality of treating people equally or in a way that is reasonable
2003.example: The fairness of the judicial system is being questioned.
2003.translation: 公平（平等或以合理方式对待他人的品质）

2004.definition: trust in somebody’s ability or knowledge; trust that somebody/something will do what has been promised
2004.example: If the company can retain its customers' faith, it could become the market leader.
2004.translation: 信念，信任（对某人能力或知识的信任；相信某人会履行诺言）

2005.definition: not what somebody claims it is; appearing to be something it is not
2005.example: There were a few stalls selling fake designer clothing.
2005.translation: 假的（非某人声称的那样；表现出并非其真实面貌的样子）

2006.example: I had a bad fall and broke my arm.

2007.definition: to drop down from a higher level to a lower level

2008.example: A whale is a fish. True or false?
2008.translation: 错误的（不对的；不正确或不真实的）

2009.definition: the state of being known and talked about by many people
2009.translation: 名声（被许多人知晓和谈论的状态）

2010.definition: well known to you; often seen or heard and therefore easy to recognize
2010.translation: 熟悉的（为你所熟知的；常看或常听到的因而易于识别的）

2011.definition: connected with the family or a particular family
2011.translation: 家庭的（与家庭或特定家庭相关的）

2012.definition: a group consisting of one or two parents and their children
2012.example: I introduced Neil to the other members of my family.
2012.translation: 家庭（由父母及其子女组成的群体）

2013.translation: 著名的（被许多人知晓的）

2014.definition: a person who admires somebody/something or enjoys watching or listening to somebody/something very much
2014.translation: 迷，爱好者（崇拜某人/某物或非常喜欢观看/聆听某人/某物的人）

2015.definition: unusually complicated, often in an unnecessary way; intended to impress other people
2015.example: a kitchen full of fancy gadgets
2015.translation: 花哨的（异常复杂的，常以不必要的方式；旨在给人留下深刻印象的）

2016.definition: to want something or want to do something
2016.translation: 想要（想要某物或想做某事）

2017.translation: 极好的（极其好的；优秀的）

2018.definition: a pleasant situation that you imagine but that is unlikely to happen
2018.example: He spoke of his childhood fantasies about becoming a famous football player.
2018.translation: 幻想（你想象的但不太可能发生的愉快情况）

2019.definition: at a greater distance away from you
2019.example: I saw her on the far side of the road.

2021.definition: the money that you pay to travel by bus, plane, taxi, etc.
2021.translation: 票价（乘坐公交、飞机、出租车等支付的费用）

2022.definition: an area of land, and the buildings on it, used for growing crops and/or keeping animals
2022.translation: 农场（用于种植作物和/或养殖动物的一块土地及建筑）

2023.definition: to use land for growing crops and/or keeping animals
2023.example: The family has farmed in Kent for over two hundred years.
2023.translation: 务农（利用土地种植作物和/或养殖动物）

2024.definition: a person who owns or manages a farm
2024.translation: 农民（拥有或管理农场的人）

2025.definition: the business of managing or working on a farm
2025.translation: 务农（管理农场或在农场工作的业务）

2026.translation: 迷人的（极其有趣且吸引人的）

2027.definition: a popular style of clothes, hair, etc. at a particular time or place; the state of being popular
2027.translation: 时尚（在特定时间或地点流行的衣服、发型等风格；流行状态）

2028.definition: following a style that is popular at a particular time
2028.translation: 时髦的（遵循特定时期流行风格的）

2029.definition: moving or able to move quickly
2029.translation: 快的（移动得快或能够快速移动的）

2031.definition: to close or join together the two parts of something; to become closed or joined together
2031.example: fasten something, Fasten your seat belts, please.
2031.translation: 系紧（将某物的两个部分关闭或连接在一起；使之关闭或连接）

2032.definition: having too much flesh on it and weighing too much
2032.translation: 胖的（身上有太多肉且体重超标的）

2033.definition: a white or yellow substance in the bodies of animals and humans, stored under the skin
2033.translation: 脂肪（人和动物体内储存在皮肤下的白色或黄色物质）

2034.translation: 致命的（引起或以死亡告终的）

2035.definition: the things, especially bad things, that will happen or have happened to somebody/something
2035.example: The fate of the three men is unknown.
2035.translation: 命运（将要或已经发生在某人/某物身上的事情，尤指坏事）

2036.definition: a male parent of a child or an animal; a person who is acting as the father to a child
2036.translation: 父亲（孩子或动物的雄性亲本；扮演父亲角色的人）

2037.definition: the responsibility for something wrong that has happened or been done
2037.example: Why should I say sorry when it's not my fault?
2037.translation: 责任，过错（对已发生或已做的错误之事的责任）

2038.definition: a thing that you do to help somebody
2038.example: Could you do me a favour and pick up Sam from school today?
2038.translation: 恩惠，帮助（你为了帮助某人而做的一件事）

2039.definition: to prefer one system, plan, way of doing something, etc. to another
2039.example: favour something, Many countries favour a presidential system of government.
2039.translation: 青睐，偏爱（比起另一种系统、计划、方式等，更喜欢这一种）

2040.definition: making people have a good opinion of somebody/something
2040.example: She made a favourable impression on his parents.
2040.translation: 赞成的，有利的（使人们对某人/某物产生好感的）

2041.definition: liked more than others of the same kind
2041.example: It's one of my favourite movies.
2041.translation: 最喜爱的（比同类中其他更受喜欢的）

2042.definition: a person or thing that you like more than the others of the same type
2042.translation: 心头好（你比同类中其他更喜欢的人或物）

2043.definition: the bad feeling that you have when you are in danger or when a particular thing frightens you
2043.translation: 恐惧（处于危险或受惊吓时产生的不良感觉）

2044.definition: to be frightened of somebody/something or frightened of doing something
2044.example: fear somebody/something, All his employees fear him.
2044.translation: 害怕（害怕某人/某物或害怕做某事）

2045.definition: an action or a piece of work that needs skill, strength or courage
2045.example: The tunnel is a remarkable feat of engineering.
2045.translation: 功绩，壮举（需要技能、力量或勇气的行动或工作）

2046.definition: one of the many soft light parts covering a bird’s body
2046.translation: 羽毛（覆盖鸟类身体的许多柔软轻巧的部分之一）

2047.definition: something important, interesting or typical of a place or thing
2047.example: An interesting feature of the city is the old market.
2047.translation: 特征（某地或某物中重要、有趣或典型的部分）

2048.definition: to include a particular person or thing as a special feature
2048.example: feature somebody/something as somebody/something, The film features Cary Grant as a professor.
2048.translation: 以...为特色（将特定的人或物作为特别的看点包括在内）

2049.definition: the 2nd month of the year, between January and March
2049.translation: 二月（一年中的第二个月）

2050.definition: having a system of government in which the individual states of a country have control over their own affairs, but are controlled by a central government for national decisions, etc.
2050.translation: 联邦的（各州拥有自主权但在国家决策等方面受中央政府控制的政体）

2051.definition: an amount of money that you pay for professional advice or services
2051.example: Employees are reimbursed for any legal fees incurred when they relocate.
2051.translation: 费用（为专业建议或服务支付的金额）

2052.definition: a meal of milk for a young baby; a meal for an animal
2052.translation: 喂养（给婴儿的奶餐；给动物的喂食）

2053.definition: to give food to a person or an animal
2053.example: feed somebody/something/yourself, Have you fed the cat yet?
2053.translation: 喂养（给某人或动物食物）

2054.definition: advice, criticism or information about how good or useful something or somebody’s work is
2054.translation: 反馈（关于某物或某人工作有多好或多有用的建议、批评或信息）

2055.definition: the feeling you get when you touch something or are touched
2055.example: You can tell it's silk by the feel.
2055.translation: 手感（当你触摸某物或被触摸时产生的感觉）

2056.definition: to experience a particular feeling or emotion
2056.example: + adj., The bus ride made me feel sick.
2056.translation: 感觉（经历特定的情感或情绪）

2057.definition: something that you feel through the mind or through the senses
2057.example: a feeling of something, a feeling of guilt/helplessness/anger/sadness
2057.translation: 感觉，情感（通过心灵或感官感知到的事物）

2058.definition: used to describe somebody who is the same as you in some way, or in the same situation
2058.translation: 同伴（用于描述在某方面或某种情况下与你相同的人）

2059.definition: being a woman or a girl

2060.definition: an animal that can lay eggs or give birth to babies; a plant that can produce fruit
2060.example: One adult female can lay 400 to 500 eggs.
2060.translation: 雌性（能产卵或生育后代的动物；能结果实的植物）

2061.definition: having or based on the belief that women should have the same rights and opportunities as men
2061.translation: 女权主义的（持有或基于女性应享有与男性相同权利和机会信念的）

2062.definition: a person who supports the belief that women should have the same rights and opportunities as men
2062.example: Nineteenth-century feminists demanded equal education and employment opportunities for single women.
2062.translation: 女权主义者（支持女性应享有与男性相同权利和机会信念的人）

2063.definition: a structure made of wood or wire supported with posts that is put between two areas of land as a boundary, or around a garden, field, etc. to keep animals in, or to keep people and animals out
2063.example: The two women chatted over the garden fence.
2063.translation: 篱笆，栅栏（用木头或金属丝制成的结构，作为界线或围起花园、田地）

2064.definition: a series of performances of music, plays, films, etc., usually organized in the same place once a year; a series of public events connected with a particular activity or idea
2064.translation: 节日（通常每年在同一地点举行的一系列音乐、戏剧或电影演出）

2065.definition: a medical condition in which a person has a temperature that is higher than normal
2065.translation: 发烧（人体温高于正常的医疗状况）

2066.definition: used with plural nouns and a plural verb to mean ‘a small number’, ‘some’
2066.translation: 一些，几个（与复数名词连用，意为“少量”、“一些”）

2067.definition: used with plural nouns and a plural verb to mean ‘a small number’, ‘some’
2067.translation: 一些，几个（与复数名词连用，意为“少量”、“一些”）

2068.definition: a small number of people, things or places; some
2068.example: I recognized a few of the other people.
2068.translation: 一些，几个（少量的人、物或地点；一些）

2069.definition: the part of food that helps to keep a person healthy by keeping the bowels working and moving other food quickly through the body
2069.translation: 纤维（食物中通过保持肠道运作和快速移动其他食物来帮助保持健康的部分）

2070.definition: a type of literature that describes imaginary people and events, not real ones
2070.translation: 虚构小说（描写虚构而非真实人物和事件的文学类型）

2071.definition: an area of land in the country used for growing crops or keeping animals in, usually surrounded by a fence, etc.
2071.example: We had to walk across a ploughed field.
2071.translation: 田地（乡下用于种植作物或放养动物的一块土地，通常有围栏包围）

2072.definition: angry and aggressive in a way that is frightening
2072.translation: 凶猛的（愤怒且具有攻击性，令人害怕的）

2075.example: She was born in the fifties.

2076.definition: a struggle against somebody/something using physical force
2076.translation: 战斗，争吵（使用体力的对抗行为）

2077.definition: to take part in a war or battle against an enemy
2077.translation: 战斗（参加针对敌人的战争或战役）

2078.definition: the activity of being involved in a battle against an enemy
2078.example: Fighting broke out in three districts of the city last night.
2078.translation: 战斗（参与针对敌人战斗的活动）

2079.definition: a number representing a particular amount, especially one given in official information
2079.translation: 数字（代表特定金额的数字，尤指官方信息中给出的）

2080.definition: to be part of a process, situation, etc. especially an important part
2080.example: My feelings about the matter didn't seem to figure at all.
2080.translation: 出现，成为重要部分（成为过程、情况等的一部分，尤指重要部分）

2081.definition: a box or folded piece of card for keeping loose papers together and in order
2081.translation: 文件，文件夹（用于存放零散纸张并保持整齐的盒子或折叠纸板）

2082.definition: to put and keep paper documents in a particular place and in a particular order so that you can find them easily; to put a paper document in a box, file, etc.
2082.example: file something (+ adv./prep.), The forms should be filed alphabetically.
2082.translation: 存档（按特定顺序存放纸质文件以便查找；将文件放入盒子、文件夹等）

2083.definition: to make something full of something; to become full of something
2083.example: fill something, Please fill this glass for me.
2083.translation: 装满，填充（使某物装满某物；变得充满某物）

2084.definition: a series of moving pictures recorded with sound that tells a story, watched at a cinema or on a television or other device
2084.example: Let's stay in and watch a film.
2084.translation: 电影（在影院或电视等观看的、记录有声音的讲述故事的一系列移动画面）

2085.definition: to make a film of a story or a real event; to record somebody/something on film
2085.example: They are filming in Moscow right now.
2085.translation: 拍摄（将故事或真实事件拍成电影；在胶片上记录某人/某物）

2086.translation: 电影制作人（电影制作人）

2087.definition: a device containing paper, sand, chemicals, etc. that a liquid or gas is passed through in order to remove any materials that are not wanted
2087.translation: 过滤器（装有纸、沙、化学品等，用于移除液体或气体中不想要物质的装置）

2088.definition: to pass liquid, light, etc. through a special device, especially to remove something that is not wanted
2088.example: All drinking water must be filtered.
2088.translation: 过滤（使液体、光等通过特殊装置，尤指为了移除不想要的物质）

2089.definition: being or happening at the end of a series of events, actions, statements, etc.
2089.example: his final act as party leader
2089.translation: 最后的（处于或发生在一系列事件、行动或陈述结尾的）

2090.definition: the last of a series of games or competitions, in which the winner is decided
2090.example: She reached the final of the 100m hurdles.
2090.translation: 决赛（决定获胜者的一系列比赛中的最后一场）

2091.definition: after a long time, especially when there has been some difficulty or delay
2091.example: The performance finally started half an hour late.
2091.translation: 最后，终于（在很长一段时间后，尤指经历了困难或延迟后）

2092.definition: money used to run a business, an activity or a project
2092.example: The project will only go ahead if they can raise the necessary finance.
2092.translation: 财务，资金（用于运行业务、活动或项目的钱）

2093.definition: to provide money for a project
2093.example: finance something, He took a job to finance his stay in Germany.
2093.translation: 资助（为一个项目提供资金）

2094.translation: 财政的，金融的（与金钱和财务相关的）

2095.definition: to discover somebody/something unexpectedly or by chance
2095.example: find somebody/something, Look what I've found!
2095.translation: 找到（出乎意料或偶然地发现某人/某物）

2096.definition: information that is discovered as the result of research into something
2096.example: Our research findings indicate that pregnant women benefit from this treatment.
2096.translation: 调查结果，研究结果（作为某事研究结果而发现的信息）

2098.definition: a sum of money that must be paid as punishment for breaking a law or rule
2098.example: I got a parking fine for parking on double yellow lines.
2098.translation: 罚款（因违反法律或规则而必须支付的钱款）

2099.definition: to make somebody pay money as an official punishment
2099.example: fine somebody (something), The magistrate fined him $400.
2099.translation: 罚款（使某人作为正式惩罚支付金钱）

2100.definition: one of the four long thin parts that stick out from the hand (or five, if the thumb is included)
2100.example: She ran her fingers through her hair.
2100.translation: 手指（手部伸出的四根长形部分之一；若包括拇指则为五根之一）

2101.definition: the last part or the end of something
2101.example: It was a close finish as they had predicted.
2101.translation: 结尾，终点（事物的最后部分或终结）

2102.definition: to stop doing something or making something because it is complete
2102.example: finish (something), Haven't you finished your homework yet?
2102.translation: 完成，结束（因圆满而停止做某事或制作某物）

2103.definition: the flames, light and heat, and often smoke, that are produced when something burns
2103.example: Most animals are afraid of fire.
2103.translation: 火（物体燃烧时产生的火焰、光和热，常伴有烟雾）

2104.definition: to shoot bullets, etc. from a gun or other weapon
2104.example: The officer ordered his men to fire.
2104.translation: 开火（从枪或其他武器中射出子弹等）

2105.definition: a gun that can be carried
2105.example: The police were issued with firearms.
2105.translation: 火器，枪支（可以携带的枪支）

2106.definition: a person whose job is to put out fires
2106.example: Firefighters were called to a house in Summertown.
2106.translation: 消防员（职业是灭火的人）

2107.definition: a small device containing powder that burns or explodes and produces bright coloured lights and loud noises, used especially at celebrations
2107.example: (British English), to let off a few fireworks
2107.translation: 烟花（含有可燃烧或爆炸粉末的小装置，产生彩色光和响声，用于庆祝）

2108.definition: fairly hard; not easy to press into a different shape
2108.translation: 坚硬的，稳固的（相当硬；不易挤压变形的）

2109.translation: 公司，商号（商业机构或公司）

2110.definition: in a strong or definite way
2110.translation: 坚定地，稳固地（以强力或确定的方式）

2111.definition: before anyone or anything else; at the beginning
2111.example: ‘Do you want a drink?’ ‘I'll finish my work first.’
2111.translation: 首先（在任何人或事之前；在开始时）

2112.definition: happening or coming before all other similar things or people; 1st
2112.translation: 第一的（在所有同类事物或人之前发生或到来的；1st）

2113.definition: the person or thing that comes or happens before all other similar people or things
2113.example: I was the first in my family to go to college.
2113.translation: 第一（在所有同类人或事物中排在最前的那个）

2114.definition: happening or coming before all other similar things or people; 1st
2114.translation: 第一的（在所有同类事物或人之前发生或到来的；1st）

2115.definition: used to introduce the first of a list of points you want to make in a speech or piece of writing
2115.example: There are two reasons for this decision: firstly…
2115.translation: 首先（用于引入演说或文章中的第一项要点）

2116.definition: a creature that lives in water, breathes through gills, and uses fins and a tail for swimming
2116.translation: 鱼（生活在水中、用鳃呼吸、用鳍和尾游泳的生物）

2117.definition: to try to catch fish with nets, a fishing line, etc.
2117.example: The trawler was fishing off the coast of Iceland.
2117.translation: 钓鱼，捕鱼（尝试用网、钓线等捕获鱼类）

2118.definition: the sport or business of catching fish
2118.translation: 钓鱼，捕鱼业（捕鱼的运动或业务）

2119.definition: healthy and strong, especially because you do regular physical exercise
2119.example: Top athletes have to be very fit.
2119.translation: 健康的，强健的（健康的且强壮的，尤指因定期锻炼）

2120.definition: a sudden attack of an illness, such as epilepsy, in which somebody becomes unconscious and their body may make violent movements
2120.translation: 发作（某种疾病如癫痫的突然发作，伴有失去意识或身体抽搐）

2121.definition: to be the right shape and size for somebody/something
2121.example: I tried the dress on but it didn't fit.
2121.translation: 合身（尺寸或形状对某人/某物合适）

2122.definition: the state of being physically healthy and strong
2122.example: a magazine on health and fitness
2122.translation: 健康，强健（身体健康且强壮的状态）

2123.example: There are only five cookies left.

2124.definition: a solution to a problem, especially an easy or temporary one
2124.example: Luckily there is an easy fix.
2124.translation: 解决方法（问题的解决方案，尤指简便或暂时的）

2125.example: The car won't start—can you fix it?
2125.translation: 修理，固定（修理或纠正某物）

2126.definition: staying the same; not changing or able to be changed
2126.example: These fixed prices give farmers a degree of financial security.
2126.translation: 固定的（保持不变的；不能改变的）

2127.definition: a sports event that has been arranged to take place on a particular date and at a particular place
2127.example: There are plans to make the race an annual fixture.
2127.translation: 常规赛，固定项目（安排在特定日期和地点进行的体育赛事）

2128.definition: a piece of cloth with a special coloured design on it that may be the symbol of a particular country or organization, may be used to give a signal or may have a particular meaning. A flag can be attached to a pole (= a long thin straight piece of wood or metal) or held in the hand.
2128.translation: 旗帜（带有特定颜色设计的布片，作为国家、组织的象征或信号）

2129.definition: a hot bright stream of burning gas that comes from something that is on fire
2129.example: the tiny yellow flame of a match
2129.translation: 火焰（从燃烧物体中冒出的炽热明亮的气流）

2130.definition: a sudden bright light that shines for a moment and then disappears
2130.translation: 闪光（瞬间闪烁随后消失的突然强光）

2131.definition: to shine very brightly for a short time; to make something shine in this way
2131.translation: 闪烁（短时间内发出非常亮的光；使某物闪光）

2132.definition: having a level surface, not curved or sloping, and without holes or any bits sticking out
2132.translation: 平坦的（表面平整，无弯曲、倾斜、孔洞或突出的）

2133.definition: a set of rooms for living in, usually on one floor of a building
2133.example: They're renting a furnished flat on the third floor.
2133.translation: 公寓（通常位于建筑一层的一套住房）

2134.example: The tomatoes give extra flavour to the sauce.
2134.translation: 味道，风味（食物或饮料尝起来的味道）

2135.definition: a mistake in something that means that it is not correct or does not work correctly
2135.example: The argument is full of fundamental flaws.
2135.translation: 缺陷，瑕疵（某物中的错误，使其不正确或无法正常工作）

2136.definition: having a flaw; not perfect or correct
2136.translation: 有缺陷的（有瑕疵的；不完美或不正确的）

2137.definition: to leave a person or place very quickly, especially because you are afraid of possible danger
2137.example: She burst into tears and fled.
2137.translation: 逃跑（极快地离开人或地方，尤指因害怕潜在危险）

2138.definition: a group of military ships commanded by the same person
2138.translation: 舰队（由同一人指挥的一组军舰）

2139.definition: the soft substance between the skin and bones of animal or human bodies
2139.example: The trap had cut deeply into the rabbit's flesh.
2139.translation: 肉，血肉（动物或人体内皮肤与骨骼之间的柔软物质）

2140.definition: the ability to change to suit new conditions or situations
2140.example: The new system offers a much greater degree of flexibility in the way work is organized.
2140.translation: 灵活性（适应新条件或新情况的能力）

2141.definition: able to change to suit new conditions or situations
2141.translation: 灵活的（能改变以适应新条件或新情况的）

2142.definition: a journey made by air, especially in a plane
2142.translation: 飞行，航班（空中旅行，尤指乘飞机）

2143.definition: to move slowly on water or in the air
2143.example: A group of swans floated by.
2143.translation: 漂浮（在水面或空气中缓慢移动）

2144.definition: a large amount of water covering an area that is usually dry
2144.example: The heavy rain has caused floods in many parts of the country.
2144.translation: 洪水（覆盖通常干燥区域的大量积水）

2145.definition: if a place floods or something floods it, it becomes filled or covered with water
2145.example: The cellar floods whenever it rains heavily.
2145.translation: 淹没（如果地方被淹没，指其被水充满或覆盖）

2146.definition: the surface of a room that you walk on
2146.translation: 地板，地面（房间内行走的表面）

2147.definition: a fine white or brown powder made from grain, especially wheat, and used in cooking for making bread, cakes, etc.
2147.example: Sift the flour and salt into a bowl.
2147.translation: 面粉（由谷物——尤指小麦——磨成的粉末，用于烹饪烘焙）

2148.definition: to develop quickly and become successful or common
2148.example: Few businesses are flourishing in the present economic climate.
2148.translation: 繁荣，兴旺（快速发展并变得成功或普遍）

2149.definition: the steady and continuous movement of something/somebody in one direction
2149.example: the flow of an electric current
2149.translation: 流动（某物/某人向一个方向的稳步连续移动）

2150.definition: to move steadily and continuously in one direction
2150.example: She lost control and the tears began to flow.
2150.translation: 流，流动（稳步且连续地向一个方向移动）

2151.definition: the coloured part of a plant from which the seed or fruit develops. Flowers usually grow at the end of a stem and last only a short time.
2151.example: The plant has a beautiful bright red flower.
2151.translation: 花（植物中产生种子或果实的彩色部分，通常长在茎端）

2152.definition: a serious disease caused by a virus, that causes a high temperature, severe pains and weakness
2152.example: The whole family has the flu.
2152.translation: 流感（由病毒引起的严重疾病，伴有高烧、疼痛和虚弱）

2153.definition: a liquid; a substance that can flow
2153.translation: 流体，液体（液体；能流动的物质）

2154.definition: a small flying insect with two wings. There are many different types of fly and many of them spread disease.
2154.example: A fly was buzzing against the window.
2154.translation: 苍蝇（有两只翅膀的小型飞行昆虫，常传播疾病）

2155.definition: to move through the air, using wings
2155.translation: 飞（利用翅膀在空中移动）

2157.translation: 飞行，航空（乘飞机旅行的行为）

2158.definition: the thing or person that people are most interested in; the act of paying special attention to something and making people interested in it
2158.example: focus of something, It was the main focus of attention at the meeting.
2158.translation: 焦点，中心（人们最感兴趣的事物或人；给予特别关注的行为）

2159.definition: to give attention, effort, etc. to one particular subject, situation or person rather than another
2159.example: She was distracted and finding it hard to focus.
2159.translation: 集中，聚焦（将注意力、努力等投入到特定主题、情况或人上）

2160.definition: a part of something, especially cloth, that is folded or hangs as if it had been folded
2160.translation: 褶皱（某物——尤指布料——折叠或垂挂产生的部分）

2161.definition: to bend something, especially paper or cloth, so that one part lies on top of another part
2161.example: fold something, First, fold the paper in half/in two.
2161.translation: 折叠（折弯某物——尤指纸或布——使一部分叠在另一部分上）

2162.definition: that can be folded, so that it can be carried or stored in a small space
2162.translation: 可折叠的（可以折叠以便携带或存放于狭小空间的）

2163.definition: traditional and typical of the ordinary people of a country or community
2163.example: We visited an exhibition of folk art.
2163.translation: 民间的（传统的且属于国家或社区普通人的）

2164.translation: 人们，各位（通常指一般的人，或普通劳动阶层）

2165.definition: to come or go after or behind somebody/something
2165.translation: 跟随（在某人/某物之后移动或行进）

2166.definition: that is/are going to be mentioned next
2166.translation: 接下来的（紧接着要提到的）

2167.definition: the thing or things that you will mention next; the person or people that you will mention next
2167.example: The following is a summary of events.
2167.translation: 下述内容（紧接着要提到的事物或人）

2168.definition: after or as a result of a particular event
2168.example: He took charge of the family business following his father's death.
2168.translation: 在...之后（在特定事件之后或由于该事件）

2169.definition: having warm or loving feelings for somebody, especially somebody you have known for a long time
2169.example: Over the years, I have grown quite fond of her.
2169.translation: 喜爱的（对某人有温暖或爱慕的情感，尤指认识很久的人）

2170.definition: things that people or animals eat
2170.example: Pat had prepared food and drink for the work party.
2170.translation: 食物（人或动物吃的食物）

2171.definition: a person who you think behaves or speaks in a way that lacks intelligence or good judgement
2171.translation: 傻瓜（表现或言谈缺乏智慧或良好判断的人）

2172.definition: the lowest part of the leg, below the ankle, on which a person or an animal stands
2172.translation: 脚（腿部最低的部分，位于脚踝以下，用于站立移动）

2173.definition: part of a film showing a particular event
2173.example: old film footage of the moon landing
2173.translation: 素材，片段（电影中展示特定事件的一部分）

2174.definition: a game played by two teams of 11 players, using a round ball that players kick up and down the playing field. Teams try to kick the ball into the other team’s goal.
2174.example: The kids were outside playing football.
2174.translation: 足球（两队各11名球员使用圆球踢入对方球门的比赛）

2175.definition: used to show who is intended to have or use something or where something is intended to be put
2175.translation: 为了，给（显示某物预定给谁使用或放在何处）

2176.definition: to order somebody not to do something; to order that something must not be done
2176.example: forbid somebody (from doing something), He forbade them from mentioning the subject again.
2176.translation: 禁止（命令某人不做某事；命令某事不得进行）

2177.definition: violent physical action used to obtain or achieve something
2177.example: The release of the hostages could not be achieved without the use of force.
2177.translation: 武力，力量（为了获得或实现某事而使用的暴力物理行为）

2178.definition: to make somebody do something that they do not want to do
2178.example: be forced into doing something, The President was forced into resigning.
2178.translation: 强迫（使某人做其不想做的事）

2179.definition: a statement about what will happen in the future, based on information that is available now
2179.translation: 预报，预测（基于现有信息对未来将发生之事的陈述）

2180.definition: to say what you think will happen in the future based on information that you have now
2180.example: forecast something, Experts are forecasting a recovery in the economy.
2180.translation: 预报，预测（根据现有信息说明你认为未来会发生什么）

2181.definition: in or from a country that is not your own
2181.example: What foreign languages do you speak?
2181.translation: 外国的（在或来自非本国的国家）

2182.definition: a person who comes from a different country
2182.example: The fact that I was a foreigner was a big disadvantage.
2182.translation: 外国人（来自不同国家的人）

2183.definition: a large area of land that is thickly covered with trees
2183.translation: 森林（覆盖着茂密树木的大片土地）

2184.definition: used to say that a particular situation or state will always exist
2184.translation: 永远（用于表示某种情况或状态将一直存在）

2185.definition: to put a lot of effort into making something successful or strong so that it will last
2185.example: a move to forge new links between management and workers
2185.translation: 锻造，建立（投入大量努力使某事成功、稳固且持久）

2186.definition: to not remember to do something that you ought to do, or to bring or buy something that you ought to bring or buy
2186.example: ‘Why weren't you at the meeting?’ ‘Sorry—I forgot.’
2186.translation: 忘记（不记得应该做某事，或忘记带、买应该有的东西）

2187.definition: to stop feeling angry with somebody who has done something to harm, annoy or upset you; to stop feeling angry with yourself
2187.example: forgive somebody, Can you ever forgive me?
2187.translation: 原谅（停止对伤害、困扰或让你不快的人——或你自己——感到生气）

2188.definition: a tool with a handle and three or four sharp points (called prongs), used for picking up and eating food
2188.example: to eat with a knife and fork
2188.translation: 叉子（带有柄和三四个尖头的餐具，用于叉取和食用食物）

2189.definition: a type or variety of something
2189.example: all the millions of different life forms on the planet today
2189.translation: 形式，类型（某事物的种类或品种）

2190.definition: to produce something in a particular way or make it have a particular shape
2190.example: form something, Bend the wire so that it forms a ‘V’.
2190.translation: 形成（以特定方式产生某物或使其具有特定形状）

2191.definition: very correct and suitable for official or important occasions
2191.translation: 正式的（非常正确且适合官方或重要场合的）

2192.definition: the general arrangement, plan, design, etc. of something
2192.example: The format of the new quiz show has proved popular.
2192.translation: 格式，安排（某事物的总体安排、计划、设计等）

2193.definition: the action of forming something; the process of being formed
2193.example: the formation of a new government
2193.translation: 形成（形成某物的动作；被形成的过程）

2194.example: This fine ruin was, in former times, a royal castle.
2194.translation: 以前的，前任的（在早期时代存在的）

2195.example: Namibia, formerly known as South West Africa
2195.translation: 以前，从前（在过去；以前被称为...）

2196.definition: a series of letters, numbers or symbols that represent a rule or law
2196.example: This formula is used to calculate the area of a circle.
2196.translation: 公式（代表规则或法律的一系列字母、数字或符号）

2197.definition: to create or prepare something carefully, giving particular attention to the details
2197.example: formulate something, to formulate a policy/theory/plan/proposal
2197.translation: 制定，阐述（仔细地创建或准备某事，特别注重细节）

2198.translation: 向前，出来（离开某地；出来）

2199.definition: going to happen, be published, etc. very soon
2199.translation: 即将到来的（很快将发生、出版等的）

2200.definition: having or bringing an advantage, an opportunity, a piece of good luck, etc.
2200.example: Remember those less fortunate than yourselves.
2200.translation: 幸运的（拥有或带来优势、机会、好运等的）

2201.example: I was late, but fortunately the meeting hadn't started.

2202.example: He made a fortune in real estate.

2204.definition: an event or medium where people can exchange opinions and ideas on a particular issue; a meeting organized for this purpose
2204.example: forum (on something), to hold an international forum on drug abuse
2204.translation: 论坛（人们可以就特定问题交换意见和想法的场合或媒介）

2205.definition: directed or moving towards the front
2205.example: The door opened, blocking his forward movement.
2205.translation: 向前的（指向或朝向前方移动的）

2206.definition: towards a place or position that is in front
2206.example: She leaned forward and kissed him on the cheek.
2206.translation: 向前（朝向前方的位置或位置）

2207.definition: the parts of a dead animal or a plant that have become hard and turned into rock
2207.example: fossils over two million years old
2207.translation: 化石（变成岩石的死后动物或植物的部分）

2208.example: The club's aim is to foster better relations within the community.
2208.translation: 培养，促进（鼓励某事发展）

2209.definition: to start something, such as an organization or an institution, especially by providing money
2209.translation: 创立，建立（创办组织或机构，尤指通过提供资金）

2210.definition: a principle, an idea or a fact that something is based on and that it grows from
2210.example: Respect and friendship provide a solid foundation for marriage.
2210.translation: 基础（某事物基于其上并由此发展的原则、想法或事实）

2211.definition: a person who starts an organization, institution, etc. or causes something to be built
2211.example: the founder and president of the company
2211.translation: 创始人（创办组织、机构等或发起某项建设的人）

2215.definition: a small part or amount of something
2215.example: Only a small fraction of a bank's total deposits will be withdrawn at any one time.
2215.translation: 小部分，分数（某物的一小部分或少量）

2216.translation: 易碎的（容易破碎或损坏的）

2217.definition: a small part of something that has broken off or comes from something larger
2217.example: fragment (of something), Police found fragments of glass near the scene.
2217.translation: 碎片（从某物上折断或脱落的小部分）

2218.definition: a strong border or structure of wood, metal, etc. that holds a picture, door, piece of glass, etc. in position
2218.translation: 框架，框（固定图片、门、玻璃等位置的坚固边缘或结构）

2219.definition: to put or make a frame or border around something
2219.example: be framed, The photograph had been framed.
2219.translation: 给...装框（在某物周围放置或制作框架）

2220.definition: the parts of a building or an object that support its weight and give it shape
2220.translation: 框架，结构（建筑或物体中支撑重量并赋予形状的部分）

2221.definition: formal permission given by a company to somebody who wants to sell its goods or services in a particular area; formal permission given by a government to somebody who wants to operate a public service as a business
2221.translation: 特许经营权（公司给予他人销售其商品/服务的正式许可；或政府给出的经营许可）

2222.definition: in an honest and direct way that people might not like
2222.example: He spoke frankly about the ordeal.
2222.translation: 坦率地（以诚实、直接但可能不讨人喜欢的方式）

2223.definition: the crime of cheating somebody in order to get money or goods illegally
2223.example: She was charged with credit card fraud.
2223.translation: 欺诈（为了非法获得金钱或商品而欺骗他人的罪行）

2224.definition: without particular plans or arrangements; not busy
2224.example: Are you free on Saturday? We're having a barbecue.
2224.translation: 空闲的（没有特别计划或安排的；不忙的）

2226.definition: to allow somebody to leave prison or somewhere they have been kept against their will
2226.example: free somebody, The hijackers agreed to free a further ten hostages.
2226.translation: 释放（允许某人离开监狱或违背其意愿被关押的地方）

2227.definition: the power or right to do or say what you want without anyone stopping you
2227.translation: 自由（在没有阻碍的情况下做或说你想做之事的权力或权利）

2228.definition: without anyone trying to prevent or control something
2228.example: the country’s first freely elected president
2228.translation: 自由地（在没有人试图阻碍或控制的情况下）

2229.definition: to become hard, and often turn to ice, as a result of extreme cold; to make something do this
2229.translation: 冻结（因极冷而变得坚硬，常转变为冰；使某物这样做）

2230.definition: the rate at which something happens or is repeated
2230.example: Fatal road accidents have decreased in frequency over recent years.
2230.translation: 频率（某事发生或重复的速率）

2231.example: He is a frequent visitor to this country.
2231.translation: 频繁的（经常发生的或经常做某事的）

2232.example: Buses run frequently between the city and the airport.

2233.definition: recently produced or picked and not frozen, dried or preserved in tins or cans
2233.translation: 新鲜的（最近生产或采摘的，且未经冷冻、干燥或罐装保存的）

2234.definition: the day of the week after Thursday and before Saturday
2234.translation: 星期五（周四之后、周六之前的一天）

2235.definition: a piece of electrical equipment in which food is kept cold so that it stays fresh
2235.example: The kids tend to raid the fridge when they get home from school.
2235.translation: 冰箱（保持食物寒冷以防变质的电器）

2236.definition: a person you know well and like, and who is not usually a member of your family
2236.translation: 朋友（你熟悉且喜欢的人，通常不是家庭成员）

2237.definition: behaving in a kind and pleasant way because you like somebody or want to help them
2237.translation: 友好的（因为喜欢某人或想帮助某人而表现得和蔼愉快）

2238.example: They formed a close friendship at college.

2239.definition: to make somebody suddenly feel afraid
2239.example: frighten (somebody), Sorry, I didn't mean to frighten you.
2239.translation: 吓唬（使某人突然感到害怕）

2240.translation: 受惊的（害怕的；感到恐惧的）

2241.translation: 吓人的（使你感到害怕的）

2242.definition: a small animal with smooth skin, that lives both on land and in water (= is an amphibian). Frogs have very long back legs for jumping, and no tail.
2242.translation: 青蛙（皮肤光滑、生活在陆地和水中的两栖动物）

2243.definition: used to show where somebody/something starts
2243.example: She began to walk away from him.
2243.translation: 从，来自（用于说明某人/某物起始的地点）

2244.definition: on or at the front of something
2244.translation: 前面的（在某物的前部或位于前部的）

2245.definition: the part or side of something that faces forward; the side of something that you look at first
2245.example: The front of the building was covered with ivy.
2245.translation: 前部（朝向前方的一面或部分；你首先看到的一面）

2246.definition: kept at a very low temperature in order to preserve it
2246.translation: 冷冻的（保持在极低温度下以保存的）

2247.definition: the part of a plant that consists of one or more seeds and a soft inner part, can be eaten as food and usually tastes sweet
2247.example: tropical fruits, such as bananas and pineapples
2247.translation: 水果（植物中含种子和柔软内部、可食用的部分，通常味甜）

2248.definition: feeling annoyed and impatient because you cannot do or achieve what you want
2248.example: It's very easy to get frustrated in this job.
2248.translation: 沮丧的（因无法实现目标而感到恼火和不耐烦的）

2249.definition: causing you to feel annoyed and impatient because you cannot do or achieve what you want
2249.example: It's frustrating to have to wait so long.
2249.translation: 令人沮丧的（使人因无法实现目标而感到恼火和不耐烦的）

2250.example: in frustration, Dave thumped the table in frustration.
2250.translation: 沮丧，挫败感（感到沮丧的情绪）

2251.definition: to cook something in hot fat or oil; to be cooked in hot fat or oil
2251.translation: 油炸（在热油脂或油中烹制食物；被油炸）

2252.definition: any material that produces heat or power, usually when it is burnt
2252.translation: 燃料（燃烧时产生热量或动力的任何材料）

2253.definition: to supply something with material that can be burnt to produce heat or power
2253.example: Uranium is used to fuel nuclear plants.
2253.translation: 为...提供动力（为某物提供可燃烧产生热量或动力的材料）

2254.definition: to do or achieve what was hoped for or expected
2254.translation: 实现，履行（做或实现所希望或预期的事情）

2255.definition: containing or holding as much or as many as possible; having no empty space
2255.translation: 满的（装满或容纳了尽可能多的；没有空位的）

2256.definition: for all the hours of a week during which people normally work or study, rather than just for a part of it
2256.translation: 全职的（占据一周内通常工作或学习的所有小时的）

2257.definition: for all the hours of a week during which people normally work or study, rather than just for a part of it
2257.translation: 全职地（占据一周内通常工作或学习的所有小时地）

2259.example: She's really fun to be with.
2259.translation: 有趣的（你喜欢的，和你在一起很有趣的）

2260.definition: the feeling of enjoying yourself; activities that you enjoy
2260.example: We had a lot of fun at Sarah's party.
2260.translation: 乐趣（享受自己的感觉；让你愉快的活动）

2261.definition: a special activity or purpose of a person or thing
2261.example: The club serves a useful function as a meeting place.
2261.translation: 功能，作用（人或物的特别活动或目的）

2262.definition: to work in the correct way
2262.example: We now have a functioning shower.
2262.translation: 运行，工作（以正确的方式工作）

2263.definition: practical and useful; with little or no decoration
2263.example: Bathrooms don't have to be purely functional.
2263.translation: 实用的，功能的（实用且有用的；几乎没有装饰的）

2264.definition: an amount of money that has been saved or has been made available for a particular purpose
2264.translation: 基金，资金（为了特定目的而积攒或提供的钱）

2265.definition: to provide money for something, usually something official
2265.translation: 资助（为某事提供资金，通常是官方项目）

2266.definition: serious and very important; affecting the most central and important parts of something
2266.example: the fundamental principles of scientific method
2266.translation: 基本的（严肃且非常重要的；影响事物核心部分的）

2267.definition: in every way that is important; completely
2267.example: The two approaches are fundamentally different.
2267.translation: 从根本上（在每一个重要的方面；完全地）

2268.definition: money for a particular purpose; the act of providing money for such a purpose
2268.translation: 资金，拨款（用于特定目的的钱；提供此类资金的行为）

2269.definition: the activity of collecting money for a charity or organization, often by organizing social events or entertainments
2269.example: The hospice is planning a major fundraising event for June.
2269.translation: 筹款（为慈善机构或组织收集资金的活动）

2270.definition: a ceremony, often a religious one, for burying or cremating (= burning) a dead person
2270.example: Hundreds of people attended the funeral.
2270.translation: 葬礼（埋葬或火化死者的仪式，通常是宗教性的）

2272.definition: the soft thick mass of hair that grows on the body of some animals
2272.example: The cat carefully licked its fur.
2272.translation: 皮毛（某些动物身上长着的柔软浓密的毛）

2274.definition: objects that can be moved, such as tables, chairs and beds, that are put into a house or an office to make it suitable for living or working in
2274.translation: 家具（桌子、椅子、床等搬入房屋或办公室使其适于居住工作的物品）

2275.translation: 进一步的（更多的；额外的）

2276.definition: at or to a greater distance
2276.example: We had walked a bit further than I had realized.
2276.translation: 进一步（在更远的距离处）

2277.definition: in addition to what has just been stated. Furthermore is used especially to add a point to an argument.
2277.example: He said he had not discussed the matter with her. Furthermore, he had not even contacted her.
2277.translation: 此外（除已陈述内容之外；尤用于在论辩中增加论点）

2278.definition: taking place or existing at a time after the present
2278.example: The land will remain untouched for future generations to enjoy.
2278.translation: 未来的（在现在之后的时间发生的或存在的）

2279.definition: the time that will come after the present or the events that will happen then
2279.example: We need to plan for the future.
2279.translation: 未来（现在之后将到来的时间或那时将发生的事件）

2280.definition: an increase in the amount of something, especially in wealth or weight
2280.example: The opposition made unexpected gains in the last election.
2280.translation: 获得，收益（某物数量的增加，尤指财富或重量）

2281.definition: to obtain or win something, especially something that you need or want
2281.example: gain something, They managed to gain access to secret files.
2281.translation: 获得（获得或赢得你所需要或想要的东西）

2282.definition: a room or building for showing works of art, especially to the public
2282.translation: 画廊，美术馆（展示艺术作品的房间或建筑，尤指对公众开放的）

2283.definition: a unit for measuring liquid. In the UK, Canada and other countries it is equal to about 4.5 litres; in the US it is equal to about 3.8 litres. There are four quarts in a gallon.
2283.example: The tankers carried 130 000 gallons of fuel.
2283.translation: 加仑（液体测量单位；英制约4.5升，美制约3.8升）

2284.definition: the activity of playing games of chance for money and of betting on horses, etc.
2284.translation: 赌博（为了金钱进行的机遇性游戏或赛马投注活动）

2285.definition: an activity that you do to have fun, often one that has rules and that you can win or lose; the equipment for a game
2285.example: The kids were playing a game with their balloons.
2285.translation: 游戏，比赛（为了好玩而进行的活动，常有规则且可输赢；游戏器材）

2287.translation: 帮派，团伙（有组织的犯罪群体）

2288.definition: a space where something is missing
2288.example: Extra funding is needed to plug the gap.
2288.translation: 间隙，差距（缺失某物后的空间）

2289.definition: a building for keeping one or more cars or other vehicles in
2289.example: a double garage (= one for two cars)
2289.translation: 车库（存放一辆或多辆汽车或其他车辆的建筑）

2290.definition: a piece of land next to or around your house where you can grow flowers, fruit, vegetables, etc., usually with a lawn (= an area of grass)
2290.translation: 花园（房屋旁或周围用于种植花草果菜的土地，通常有草坪）

2291.definition: any substance like air that is neither a solid nor a liquid, for example hydrogen or oxygen
2291.example: Air is a mixture of gases.
2291.translation: 气体（类似空气、非固体也非液体的物质，如氢或氧）

2292.definition: a barrier like a door that is used to close an opening in a fence or a wall outside a building
2292.translation: 大门（栅栏或围墙开口处的像门一样的屏障）

2293.definition: to come together, or bring people together, in one place to form a group
2293.translation: 聚集（来到或带人来到一处形成群体）

2294.definition: a meeting of people for a particular purpose
2294.translation: 聚会（为了特定目的的人员集会）

2295.definition: sexually attracted to people of the same sex
2295.translation: 同性恋的（对同性有性吸引力的）

2296.definition: a long, steady look at somebody/something
2296.example: He met her gaze (= looked at her while she looked at him).
2296.translation: 凝视（长时间、稳定的注视）

2297.definition: to look steadily at somebody/something for a long time, either because you are very interested or surprised, or because you are thinking of something else
2297.example: She gazed at him in amazement.
2297.translation: 凝视（由于感兴趣、惊讶或思考而长时间稳定地注视某人/某物）

2298.definition: equipment in a vehicle that changes the relation between engine speed (or pedal speed on a bicycle) and the speed of the wheels moving forwards or backwards
2298.example: Careless use of the clutch may damage the gears.
2298.translation: 齿轮，变速器（车辆中改变引擎速度与车轮速度关系的设备）

2299.definition: the fact of being male or female, especially when considered with reference to social and cultural differences, rather than differences in biology; members of a particular gender as a group
2299.example: issues of class, race and gender
2299.translation: 性别（男性或女性的身份，尤指基于社会和文化而非生物差异）

2300.definition: a unit inside a cell that controls a particular quality in a living thing that has been passed on from its parents
2300.translation: 基因（细胞内控制生物遗传特性的基本单位）

2301.definition: affecting all or most people, places or things
2301.example: books of general interest (= of interest to most people)
2301.translation: 普遍的，一般的（影响所有或大多数人、地方或事物的）

2302.example: The initiative was generally considered a success.
2302.translation: 通常，一般地（被大多数人地；在大多数情况下）

2303.example: The wind turbines are used to generate electricity.
2303.translation: 产生（产生能源，尤指电力）

2304.definition: all the people who were born at about the same time
2304.translation: 一代，一代人（大约在同一时间出生的人）

2305.definition: shared by, including or typical of a whole group of things; not specific
2305.example: ‘Vine fruit’ is the generic term for currants and raisins.
2305.translation: 通用的，总称的（整体群体的共同特征；非特定的）

2306.definition: giving or willing to give freely; given freely
2306.example: The gallery was named after its most generous benefactor.
2306.translation: 慷慨的，大方的（乐于自由给予的；免费给予的）

2307.definition: connected with genes (= the units in the cells of a living thing that control its physical characteristics) or genetics (= the study of genes)
2307.translation: 遗传的（与基因或遗传学相关的）

2308.definition: unusually great intelligence, skill or artistic ability
2308.translation: 天才（异常卓越的智慧、技能或艺术才能）

2309.definition: the murder of a large number of people from a particular nation or ethnic group, with the aim of destroying that nation or group
2309.example: Refugees gave accounts of the mass genocide.
2309.translation: 种族灭绝（旨在毁灭某一民族或族群的大规模屠杀）

2310.definition: a particular type or style of literature, art, film or music that you can recognize because of its special features
2310.translation: 类型，体裁（文学、艺术、电影或音乐的特定风格）

2311.definition: calm and kind; doing things in a quiet and careful way
2311.translation: 温和的，和蔼的（冷静且仁慈的；以安静小心的方式做事的）

2312.definition: a man who is polite and well educated, who has excellent manners and always behaves well
2312.example: You acted like a true gentleman.
2312.translation: 绅士（受过良好教育、举止优雅、行为端正的男子）

2313.definition: real; exactly what it appears to be; not artificial
2313.example: Is the painting a genuine Picasso?
2313.translation: 真正的（真实的；与其表现完全一致的；非人造的）

2314.definition: truly; in a way that is exactly what it appears to be and is not artificial
2314.example: There are some genuinely funny moments in the film.
2314.translation: 真正地（真实地；以完全真实而非人造的方式）

2315.definition: the scientific study of the earth’s surface, physical features, divisions, products, population, etc.
2315.translation: 地理（研究地球表面、物理特征、划分、人口等的科学）

2316.definition: a movement that you make with your hands, your head or your face to show a particular meaning
2316.example: He made a rude gesture at the driver of the other car.
2316.translation: 手势，姿态（用手、头或脸部做出的表达特定含义的动作）

2317.example: I got a call from Dave this morning.

2318.definition: the spirit of a dead person that a living person believes they can see or hear
2318.example: Do you believe in ghosts (= believe that they exist)?
2318.translation: 鬼魂，灵魂（活人相信能看见或听到的死者的灵魂）

2319.definition: very large; much larger or more important than similar things usually are
2319.example: The match was shown on a giant screen outside the town hall.
2319.translation: 巨大的（非常大的；远大于同类通常规模的）

2320.definition: (in stories) a very large strong person who is often cruel and stupid
2320.translation: 巨人（故事中巨大、强壮且常表现残忍愚蠢的人）

2321.definition: a thing that you give to somebody, especially on a special occasion or to say thank you
2321.translation: 礼物，赠品（送给某人的物品，尤指在特殊场合或表示感谢）

2322.definition: a performance by musicians playing popular music or jazz in front of an audience; a similar performance by a comedian
2322.example: They're doing a gig in Boston tonight.
2322.translation: 演出，演出场次（音乐人在观众前进行的流行乐或爵士乐表演）

2324.definition: a girl or a woman that somebody is having a romantic relationship with
2324.translation: 女朋友（某人与其有浪漫关系的女孩或女人）

2325.definition: to hand something to somebody so that they can look at it, use it or keep it for a time
2325.example: give something to somebody, Give the letter to your mother when you've read it.
2325.translation: 给（将某物交给某人以便其查看、使用或保存）

2327.example: to take/have a glance at the newspaper headlines

2328.translation: 瞥，扫视（快速地看某人/某物）

2329.definition: a hard, usually clear, substance used, for example, for making windows and bottles
2329.translation: 玻璃（坚硬、通常透明的物质，用于制作窗户、瓶子等）

2330.definition: a sight of somebody/something for a very short time, when you do not see the person or thing completely
2330.example: glimpse (of somebody/something), He caught a glimpse of her in the crowd.
2330.translation: 瞥见（极短时间内看到某人/某物，未看清全貌）

2331.definition: covering or affecting the whole world
2331.example: This year the global economy will grow by about 4 per cent.
2331.translation: 全球的（覆盖或影响全世界的）

2333.definition: the world (used especially to emphasize its size)
2333.example: tourists from every corner of the globe
2333.translation: 地球，球体（世界，尤指强调其规模大时）

2334.definition: deserving or bringing great success and making somebody/something famous
2334.example: We congratulate you on this glorious victory.
2334.translation: 光荣的（值得或带来巨大成功并使之出名的）

2335.definition: great success that brings somebody praise and honour and makes them famous
2335.translation: 光荣，荣耀（带来赞誉、荣誉并使人出名的巨大成功）

2336.definition: a piece of clothing for the hand, made of wool, leather, etc. with separate parts for each finger and the thumb
2336.translation: 手套（手部的服装，分手指和拇指部分，由羊毛、皮革等制成）

2337.definition: a person’s turn to move or play in a game or an activity
2337.translation: 尝试，轮到（在游戏或活动中轮到某人行动或玩）

2338.definition: to move or travel from one place to another
2338.example: + adv./prep., She went into her room and shut the door behind her.
2338.translation: 去，行走（从一处移动或旅行到另一处）

2339.definition: a frame with a net into which players must kick or hit the ball in order to score a point
2339.example: He headed the ball into an open goal (= one that had nobody defending it).
2339.translation: 球门，目标（球员必须将球踢入或击入以得分的带网框架）

2340.definition: the being or spirit that is worshipped and is believed to have created the universe
2340.translation: 上帝，神（被崇拜并被认为创造了宇宙的生命或神灵）

2341.definition: bright yellow in colour, like gold
2341.example: The company name was spelled out in gold letters.

2342.definition: a chemical element. Gold is a yellow precious metal used for making coins, jewellery, beautiful objects, etc.
2342.translation: 黄金（一种黄色贵金属化学元素，用于制造钱币、珠宝等）

2344.definition: a game played over a large area of ground using sticks with a special shape to hit a small hard ball (a golf ball) into a series of 9 or 18 holes, using as few shots as possible
2344.translation: 高尔夫球（在草地上使用特制球杆将硬球击入一系列洞中的运动）

2345.definition: of high quality or an acceptable standard
2345.translation: 好的（高质量或达到可接受标准的）

2346.definition: behaviour that is morally right or acceptable
2346.example: Do they even know the difference between good and evil?
2346.translation: 善（在道德上正确或可接受的行为）

2347.definition: used when you are leaving somebody or when somebody else is leaving
2347.example: Goodbye! It was great to meet you.

2348.definition: used when you are leaving somebody or when somebody else is leaving
2348.example: Goodbye! It was great to meet you.

2349.example: the essential goodness of human nature

2350.definition: things that are produced to be sold
2350.translation: 货物，商品（生产出来供出售的物品）

2351.definition: very beautiful and attractive; giving great pleasure
2351.translation: 华丽的，极漂亮的（非常美丽迷人的；给予极大愉悦的）

2352.definition: to legally control a country or its people and be responsible for introducing new laws, organizing public services, etc.
2352.example: The country is governed by elected representatives of the people.
2352.translation: 统治，管理（合法地控制国家或人民，负责制定法律、组织服务等）

2353.definition: the activity of governing a country or controlling a company or an organization; the way in which a country is governed or a company or institution is controlled
2353.example: He emphasized the company's commitment to high standards of corporate governance.
2353.translation: 治理，管理（统治国家或控制公司、机构的活动或方式）

2354.definition: the group of people who are responsible for controlling a country or a state
2354.translation: 政府（负责控制国家或州的群体）

2355.definition: a person who is the official head of a country or region that is governed by another country
2355.example: the former governor of the colony
2355.translation: 总督，州长（受他国管辖的国家或地区的官方首脑；州的最高行政长官）

2356.definition: to take or hold somebody/something with your hand suddenly or roughly
2356.example: grab somebody/something, She grabbed his arm as he got up to leave.
2356.translation: 抓取（突然或粗暴地用手拿住某人/某物）

2357.definition: an attractive quality of movement that is smooth and done with control; a simple and beautiful quality
2357.example: She moves with the natural grace of a ballerina.
2357.translation: 优雅，优美（平稳且有控制力的迷人动作；简单美观的特质）

2358.definition: a mark given in an exam or for a piece of school work
2358.example: (British English), She got good grades in her exams.
2358.translation: 成绩，等级（考试或作业给出的分数）

2359.definition: to give a grade to a student or to a piece of their written work
2359.example: grade somebody/something, I spent all weekend grading papers.
2359.translation: 评分（给学生或其作业定等级）

2360.definition: slowly, over a long period of time
2360.translation: 逐渐地（缓慢地，在较长时间内）

2361.definition: a person who has a university degree
2361.translation: 毕业生（拥有大学学位的人）

2362.definition: to get a degree, especially your first degree, from a university or college
2362.example: She taught in France after she graduated.
2362.translation: 毕业（从大学或学院获得学位，尤指首个学位）

2363.definition: the small hard seeds of food plants such as wheat, rice, etc.; a single seed of such a plant
2363.example: Russia sold 12 million tons of grain abroad last year.
2363.translation: 谷物（小麦、水稻等粮食作物的微小硬种子；这种种子的一粒）

2364.example: It's not a very grand house.
2364.translation: 宏伟的（壮观且规模大或重要的）

2365.definition: the father of your father or mother
2365.example: The firm had been founded by his grandfather.
2365.translation: 祖父，外祖父（父亲或母亲的父亲）

2366.definition: the mother of your father or mother
2366.example: I always loved going to visit my grandmother.
2366.translation: 祖母，外祖母（父亲或母亲的母亲）

2367.definition: the father or mother of your father or mother
2367.example: The children are staying with their grandparents.
2367.translation: 祖父母（父亲或母亲的父亲或母亲）

2368.definition: a sum of money that is given by the government or by another organization to be used for a particular purpose
2368.translation: 补助金，拨款（政府或组织给予特定目的使用的款项）

2369.definition: to agree to give somebody what they ask for, especially formal or legal permission to do something
2369.example: grant something, My request was granted.
2369.translation: 准予，授予（同意给予某人所要求的，尤指正式或法律许可）

2370.definition: connected with drawings and design, especially in the production of books, magazines, websites, etc.
2370.translation: 绘图的，图表的（与绘画、设计相关的，尤指在书籍、网站制作中）

2371.definition: designs, drawings or pictures that are used especially in the production of books, magazines, websites, etc.
2371.example: Text and graphics are prepared separately and then combined.
2371.translation: 图形（用于书籍、网站等制作的设计、绘画或图片）

2372.definition: a strong hold of somebody/something or control over somebody/something
2372.example: I grabbed him, but he slipped from my grasp.
2372.translation: 紧握，控制（对某人/某物的有力握持或控制）

2373.definition: to take a strong hold of somebody/something
2373.example: He grasped my hand and shook it warmly.
2373.translation: 抓紧（有力地握住某人/某物）

2374.definition: a common wild plant with narrow green leaves and stems that are eaten by cows, horses, sheep, etc.
2374.translation: 草（一种常见的野生植物，叶狭长，供牛羊等食用）

2375.definition: feeling or showing thanks because somebody has done something kind for you or has done as you asked
2375.example: Thank you for doing this. I really am so grateful.
2375.translation: 感激的（因他人做了善事或按要求行事而感到谢谢的）

2376.definition: very serious and important; giving you a reason to feel worried
2376.example: The police have expressed grave concern about the missing child's safety.
2376.translation: 严重的，沉重的（非常严肃重要的；让人感到担心的）

2377.definition: a place in the ground where a dead person is buried
2377.translation: 坟墓（埋葬死者的地下之处）

2378.definition: the force that attracts objects in space towards each other, and that on the earth pulls them towards the centre of the planet, so that things fall to the ground when they are dropped
2378.translation: 重力，地心引力（空间物体相互吸引及使地球物体下落的力量）

2379.translation: 伟大的，极好的（非常好的或令人愉快的）

2380.example: People's reaction to the film has varied greatly.

2381.definition: having the colour of grass or the leaves of most plants and trees
2381.translation: 绿色的（草或大多数植物叶子的颜色）

2382.definition: the colour of grass and the leaves of most plants and trees
2382.translation: 绿色（草或大多数植物叶子的颜色）

2384.definition: to say hello to somebody or to welcome them
2384.example: greet somebody, He greeted all the guests warmly as they arrived.
2384.translation: 问候，欢迎（向某人打招呼或表示欢迎）

2385.definition: having the colour of smoke or ashes
2385.translation: 灰色的（烟雾或灰烬的颜色）

2386.definition: the colour of smoke or ashes
2386.example: the dull grey of the sky
2386.translation: 灰色（烟雾或灰烬的颜色）

2387.definition: a pattern of straight lines, usually crossing each other to form squares
2387.translation: 网格（通常相交形成正方形的直线模式，如街道网格）

2388.definition: a very sad feeling, especially when somebody dies
2388.example: She was overcome with grief when her husband died.
2388.translation: 悲伤（非常难过的感觉，尤指有人去世时）

2390.example: They grinned with delight when they heard our news.

2391.definition: to break or press something into very small pieces between two hard surfaces or using a special machine
2391.translation: 磨碎（在硬表面间或使用机器将某物压碎成细小碎片）

2392.definition: an act of holding somebody/something tightly; a particular way of doing this
2392.example: Keep a tight grip on the rope.
2392.translation: 紧握，控制（紧紧握住某人/某物的行为；特定方式）

2393.example: grip something, ‘Please don't go,’ he said, gripping her arm.

2394.definition: a shop that sells food and other things used in the home. In American English ‘grocery store’ is often used to mean ‘supermarket’.
2394.translation: 杂货店（出售食品和家居用品的商店；美式英语常指超市）

2395.definition: being the total amount of something before anything is taken away
2395.example: gross weight (= including the container or wrapping)
2395.translation: 总的（扣除前的总数，如总重量）

2396.definition: the solid surface of the earth
2396.example: on the ground, I found her lying on the ground.

2397.definition: a number of people or things that are together in the same place or that are connected in some way
2397.example: group of somebody/something, a group of people/students/friends
2397.translation: 组，群体（在一起或有某种联系的若干人或物）

2398.definition: to increase in size, number, strength or quality
2398.example: The sector is growing at a phenomenal rate.
2398.translation: 生长，增加（在大小、数量、强度或质量上增加）

2399.definition: the process in people, animals or plants of growing physically, mentally or emotionally
2399.example: Lack of water will stunt the plant's growth.
2399.translation: 增长（人、动物或植物在生理、心理或情感上的成长过程）

2400.definition: a formal promise that you will do something or that something will happen
2400.example: They are demanding certain guarantees before they sign the treaty.
2400.translation: 保证，担保（你会做某事或某事将发生的正式承诺）

2401.definition: to promise to do something; to promise something will happen
2401.example: guarantee something, Basic human rights, including freedom of speech, are now guaranteed.
2401.translation: 保证（承诺做某事；承诺某事会发生）

2402.definition: a person, such as a soldier, a police officer or a prison officer, who protects a place or people, or prevents prisoners from escaping
2402.translation: 卫兵，警卫（保护场所或人、或防止囚犯逃跑的士兵/警察等）

2403.definition: to protect property, places or people from attack or danger
2403.translation: 守卫，保护（保护财产、场所或人免受攻击或危险）

2404.definition: a member of a small group of soldiers who are not part of an official army and who fight against official soldiers, usually to try to change the government
2404.example: urban guerrillas (= those who fight in towns)
2404.translation: 游击队员（非正规军的小组成员，通常为改变政权而战）

2405.definition: an attempt to give an answer or an opinion when you cannot be certain if you are right
2405.translation: 猜测（在不确定的情况下尝试给出答案或观点）

2406.definition: to try and give an answer or make a judgement about something without being sure of all the facts
2406.example: I don't really know. I'm just guessing.
2406.translation: 猜测（在不确定所有事实的情况下尝试给出答案或判断）

2407.definition: a person that you have invited to your house or to a particular event that you are paying for
2407.example: They only use the dining room when they have guests.
2407.translation: 客人（被邀请到家或参加由你付钱的活动的人）

2408.definition: help or advice that is given to somebody, especially by somebody older or with more experience
2408.example: guidance for teachers on how to use video in the classroom
2408.translation: 指导，咨询（给予某人的帮助或建议，尤指来自长辈或经验丰富者）

2409.definition: a person who shows other people the way to a place, especially somebody employed to show tourists around interesting places
2409.example: Our tour guide showed us around the old town.
2409.translation: 导游，向导（向他人指路的人，尤指受雇带游客参观者）

2410.definition: to show somebody the way to a place, often by going with them; to show somebody a place that you know well
2410.example: guide somebody, It's a dangerous route—you'll need someone to guide you.
2410.translation: 指引，引导（向某人指路，常通过陪同；或介绍熟悉的地方）

2411.definition: a set of rules or instructions that are given by an official organization telling you how to do something, especially something difficult
2411.example: The government has drawn up guidelines for schools during the pandemic.
2411.translation: 指导方针（官方组织给出的说明如何做某事的规则或指示）

2412.definition: the unhappy feelings caused by knowing or thinking that you have done something wrong
2412.example: She had feelings of guilt about leaving her children and going to work.
2412.translation: 内疚（因知道或认为自己做了错事而产生的不快感觉）

2413.definition: feeling ashamed because you have done something that you know is wrong or have not done something that you should have done
2413.example: Matt and Chrissy both looked equally guilty.
2413.translation: 内疚的，有罪的（因做错事或未尽责而感到羞愧的；被判有罪的）

2414.definition: a musical instrument that usually has six strings and that you play with your fingers or with a plectrum
2414.translation: 吉他（通常有六根弦、用手指或拨片弹奏的乐器）

2415.definition: a weapon that is used for firing bullets or shells
2415.example: I have never fired a gun in my life.
2415.translation: 枪（用于发射子弹或炮弹的武器）

2416.definition: the tube in the body through which food passes when it leaves the stomach
2416.example: It can take up to 72 hours for food to pass through the gut.
2416.translation: 肠道（食物离开胃后经过的身体管道）

2418.definition: a room or hall with equipment for doing physical exercise, for example in a school
2418.example: The school has recently built a new gym.
2418.translation: 健身房，体育馆（配备健身器材的房间或大厅，如在学校中）

2419.definition: a thing that you do often and almost without thinking, especially something that is hard to stop doing
2419.example: You need to change your eating habits.
2419.translation: 习惯（经常做且几乎不假思索的事，尤指难以戒掉的）

2420.definition: the place where a particular type of animal or plant is normally found
2420.example: The panda's natural habitat is the bamboo forest.
2420.translation: 栖息地（特定类型的动物或植物通常被发现的地方）

2421.definition: to describe somebody/something as being very good or special, especially in newspapers, etc.
2421.example: be hailed (as) something, The conference was hailed as a great success.
2421.translation: 称赞（将某人/某物描述为非常好或特别，尤指在报纸等媒介中）

2422.definition: the substance that looks like a mass of fine threads growing on a person's head
2422.translation: 头发（长在人头上的丝状物质）

2423.translation: 一半地（达到一半的程度）

2424.definition: an amount equal to half of something/somebody
2424.example: I'll see you in half an hour.
2424.translation: 一半的（等于某物一半的量）

2425.definition: either of two equal parts into which something is or can be divided
2425.translation: 一半（事物可以被平分成的两部分之一）

2426.definition: an amount equal to half of something/somebody
2426.example: I'll see you in half an hour.
2426.translation: 一半（等于某物一半的量）

2427.definition: at an equal distance between two points; in the middle of a period of time
2427.example: It's about halfway between London and Bristol.
2427.translation: 半路（在两点间相距相等的位置；在时间段的中间）

2428.definition: a space or passage inside the entrance or front door of a building
2428.example: in a hall, Her brother was standing in the front hall.
2428.translation: 大厅，门厅（建筑入口或正门内的空间或过道）

2429.definition: an act of stopping the movement or progress of somebody/something
2429.example: Work came to a halt when the machine broke down.
2429.translation: 停顿，停止（停止移动或进展的行为）

2430.definition: to stop; to make somebody/something stop
2430.example: She walked towards him and then halted.
2430.translation: 停下（停止；使某人/某事停止）

2431.definition: the part of the body at the end of the arm, including the fingers and thumb
2431.example: Ian placed a hand on her shoulder.
2431.translation: 手（手臂末端的部分，包括手指和拇指）

2432.definition: to pass or give something to somebody
2432.example: hand something to somebody, She handed the letter to me.
2432.translation: 递给（将某物传递或给予某人）

2433.definition: the amount of something that can be held in one hand
2433.translation: 一把（一只手能握住的量）

2434.definition: the part of a door, window, etc. that you use to open it
2434.example: She turned the handle and opened the door.
2434.translation: 把手（门、窗等用于开启的部分）

2435.definition: to deal with a situation, a person, an area of work or a strong emotion
2435.example: handle something/somebody, A new man was appointed to handle the crisis.
2435.translation: 处理（处理情况、人、工作领域或强烈情感）

2436.definition: the way that somebody deals with or treats a situation, a person, an animal, etc.
2436.example: I was impressed by his handling of the affair.
2436.translation: 处理方式（某人处理或对待情况、人、动物等的方式）

2437.definition: easy to use or to do
2437.translation: 便利的，手边的（易于使用或完成的；在手边的）

2438.definition: to attach something, or to be attached, at the top so that the lower part is free or loose
2438.example: hang something + adv./prep., Hang your coat on the hook.
2438.translation: 悬挂（在顶部连接使下部自由垂下；挂起）

2439.definition: to take place, especially without being planned
2439.translation: 发生（发生，尤指非计划地）

2440.definition: in a cheerful way; with feelings of pleasure
2440.example: children playing happily on the beach
2440.translation: 快乐地（以愉快的方式；带着愉快的情绪）

2441.definition: the state of feeling or showing pleasure
2441.translation: 幸福（感到或表现出愉快的状态）

2442.translation: 快乐的（感到或表现出愉快的；高兴的）

2443.definition: the act of annoying or worrying somebody by putting pressure on them or saying or doing unpleasant things to them
2443.translation: 骚扰（通过施压或言行不快来烦扰或困扰某人的行为）

2444.definition: an area of water on the coast, protected from the open sea by strong walls, where ships can shelter
2444.example: Several boats lay at anchor in the harbour.
2444.translation: 港口（海岸边受围墙保护、供船只避风的水域）

2445.definition: difficult to do, understand or answer
2445.translation: 困难的（难以做、理解或回答的）

2447.definition: almost no; almost not; almost none
2447.translation: 几乎不（几乎没有；几乎不）

2448.definition: the machines and electronic parts in a computer or other electronic system
2448.example: We supply computer hardware to businesses.
2448.translation: 硬件（电脑或其他电子系统中的机器和电子零件）

2449.definition: damage or injury that is caused by a person or an event
2449.example: He would never frighten anyone or cause them any harm.
2449.translation: 伤害（由人或事件造成的损害或受伤）

2450.definition: to hurt or injure somebody or to damage something
2450.translation: 伤害（伤害某人或损坏某物）

2451.definition: causing damage or injury to somebody/something, especially to a person’s health or to the environment
2451.translation: 有害的（对某人/某物造成损坏或伤害的，尤指健康或环境）

2452.definition: a state of peaceful existence and agreement
2452.translation: 和谐（和平共处与一致的状态）

2453.example: The punishment was harsh and unfair.
2453.translation: 严厉的，残酷的（残忍、严厉且不友善的）

2454.definition: the time of year when the crops are gathered in on a farm, etc.; the act of cutting and gathering crops
2454.translation: 收获，收获期（农场庄稼收割的时节；收割行为）

2455.definition: to cut and gather a crop; to catch a number of animals or fish to eat
2455.example: The nuts are ready to harvest in September.
2455.translation: 收获（收割庄稼；捕获动物或鱼食用）

2456.definition: a piece of clothing made to fit the head, often with a brim (= a flat edge that sticks out), usually worn out of doors
2456.translation: 帽子（贴合头部的衣物，常带边，通常在室外戴）

2457.definition: a very strong feeling of dislike for somebody
2457.example: She gave him a look of real hate.
2457.translation: 恨（对某人的极其强烈的厌恶感）

2458.example: hate somebody/yourself, The two boys hated each other.
2458.translation: 恨（非常不喜欢某人/某物）

2459.definition: a very strong feeling of dislike for somebody/something
2459.example: He looked at me with intense hatred.
2459.translation: 仇恨（对某人/某物非常强烈的厌恶感）

2460.definition: if the ghost of a dead person haunts a place, people say that they have seen it there
2460.example: A headless rider haunts the country lanes.
2460.translation: 出没，常去（如果死者的鬼魂出没于某处，指人们称在此见过它）

2461.definition: to own, hold or possess something
2461.example: He had a new car and a boat.
2461.translation: 有（拥有、持有或具有某物）

2462.definition: used with the past participle to form perfect tenses
2462.translation: （助动词）（与过去分词连用构成完成时态）

2463.definition: used to show that you must do something
2463.translation: 必须（用于表示必须做某事）

2464.definition: something that can be dangerous or cause damage
2464.translation: 危险，隐患（可能造成危险或损坏的事物）

2465.definition: a male person or animal that has already been mentioned or is easily identified
2465.example: Everyone liked my father—he was the perfect gentleman.
2465.translation: 他（代指已提到或易识别的男性或雄性动物）

2466.definition: the part of the body on top of the neck containing the eyes, nose, mouth and brain
2466.example: She nodded her head in agreement.
2466.translation: 头（脖子上方包含眼、鼻、嘴和脑的部分）

2467.definition: to move in a particular direction
2467.translation: 朝...前进（向特定方向移动）

2468.definition: a continuous pain in the head

2469.definition: the title of a news article printed in large letters, especially at the top of the front page on a newspaper or the home page on a news website
2469.translation: 标题，头条（新闻文章的大字标题，尤指报纸头版或网站主页）

2470.definition: a place from which an organization or a military operation is controlled; the people who work there
2470.example: The firm’s headquarters is/are in London.
2470.translation: 总部（管理组织或军事行动的地点；其工作人员）

2471.definition: to become healthy again; to make something healthy again
2471.example: It took a long time for the wounds to heal.
2471.translation: 愈合，治愈（恢复健康；使健康）

2472.definition: the condition of a person’s body or mind
2472.example: to be good/bad for your health
2472.translation: 健康（人身体或精神的状况）

2473.definition: the service of providing medical care
2473.example: the costs of healthcare for the elderly
2473.translation: 医疗保健（提供医疗服务的业务）

2474.definition: having good health and not likely to become ill
2474.translation: 健康的（身体健康且不易生病的）

2475.definition: to be aware of sounds with your ears

2477.definition: the organ in the chest that sends blood around the body, usually on the left in humans
2477.example: The patient's heart stopped beating for a few seconds.
2477.translation: 心脏（胸腔内向全身输送血液的器官，人类常在左侧）

2479.definition: to make something hot or warm; to become hot or warm
2479.example: heat (something), Heat the oil and add the onions.
2479.translation: 加热，变热（使某物变热或变暖；变热）

2480.definition: the process of supplying heat to a room or building; a system used to do this
2480.translation: 取暖，供暖（向房间或建筑提供热量的过程；这种系统）

2481.definition: the place believed to be the home of God where good people go when they die, sometimes imagined to be in the sky
2481.translation: 天堂（被认为是上帝住所、好人死后去的地方，有时想象在空中）

2482.definition: to a great degree; in large amounts
2482.translation: 重地，剧烈地（程度极大地；大量地）

2483.definition: weighing a lot; difficult to lift or move
2483.translation: 重的（重量大的；难以举起或移动的）

2484.definition: the back part of the foot below the ankle
2484.example: Apply the cream to dry, cracked heels before bed.
2484.translation: 脚后跟（足部在脚踝下方的后部）

2485.definition: the measurement of how tall a person or thing is
2485.example: Height: 210 mm. Width: 57 mm. Length: 170 mm.
2485.translation: 高度（人或物多高的测量值）

2486.definition: if a feeling or an effect heightens, or something heightens it, it becomes stronger or increases
2486.example: Tension has heightened after the recent bomb attack.
2486.translation: 加剧，增强（如果情感或效果加剧，指其变得更强或增加）

2487.definition: an aircraft without wings that has large blades (= long flat parts) on top that go round. It can fly straight up from the ground and can also stay in one position in the air.
2487.translation: 直升机（无翼飞机，顶部有大型旋转叶片，能垂直起降和悬停）

2488.definition: the place believed to be the home of devils and where bad people go after death
2488.example: He was terrified of going to hell when he died.
2488.translation: 地狱（被认为是恶魔住所、坏人死后去的地方）

2489.definition: used as a greeting when you meet somebody, in an email, when you answer the phone or when you want to attract somebody’s attention
2489.translation: 你好（打招呼、接电话或吸引注意力时使用）

2490.definition: used as a greeting when you meet somebody, in an email, when you answer the phone or when you want to attract somebody’s attention
2490.translation: 你好（打招呼、接电话或吸引注意力时使用）

2491.definition: a type of hard hat that protects the head, worn, for example, by a police officer, a soldier or a person riding a bike or motorbike or playing some sports
2491.example: Police in riot helmets lined the streets.
2491.translation: 头盔（保护头部的硬帽，如警察、士兵、骑车人戴的）

2492.definition: the act of helping somebody to do something
2492.example: Thank you for all your help.
2492.translation: 帮助（帮助某人做某事的行为）

2493.definition: to make it easier or possible for somebody to do something by doing something for them or by giving them something that they need
2493.example: What can I do to help?
2493.translation: 帮助（通过为他人做某事或提供所需使之更容易或可能）

2494.definition: able to improve a particular situation
2494.translation: 有帮助的（能改善特定情况的）

2495.example: We suspect they are trying to hide something, hence the need for an independent inquiry.
