2496.definition: of or belonging to a woman or girl who has already been mentioned or is easily identified
2496.translation: 她的（属于已提到或易识别的女性或雌性动物的）

2497.definition: used as the object of a verb, after the verb be or after a preposition to refer to a woman or girl who has already been mentioned or is easily identified
2497.example: We're going to call her Sophie.
2497.translation: 她（用作宾语、介词后或be动词后，指代已提到的女性）

2498.definition: a plant whose leaves, flowers or seeds are used to add taste to food, in medicines or for their pleasant smell. parsley, mint and oregano are all herbs.
2498.translation: 草本植物，香草（叶、花、子用于调味、药用或散发香味的植物，如薄荷）

2499.definition: used after a verb or preposition to mean ‘in, at or to this position or place’
2499.translation: 这里（在动词或介词后使用，意为“在此位置或地点”）

2500.definition: the history, traditions, buildings and objects that a country or society has had for many years and that are considered an important part of its character
2500.translation: 遗产（国家或社会长期拥有的历史、传统、建筑及被视为其特征重要部分的物品）

2501.definition: a person who is admired by many people for doing something brave or good
2501.example: a war hero (= somebody who was very brave during a war)
2501.translation: 英雄（因英勇或善举而受多人钦佩的人）

2503.definition: used when the woman or girl who performs an action is also affected by it
2503.translation: 她自己（当女性执行者同时也受到动作影响时使用）

2504.definition: to be slow to speak or act because you feel uncertain or nervous
2504.translation: 犹豫（因不确定或紧张而说话或行动缓慢）

2505.definition: used to attract somebody’s attention or to express interest, surprise or anger
2505.example: Hey, can I just ask you something?
2505.translation: 嘿（用于吸引注意力或表达兴趣、惊讶或愤怒）

2507.definition: something that is hidden is kept or located in a place where it cannot be seen
2507.example: Hidden dangers lurk in the ocean depths.
2507.translation: 隐藏的（被保存在或位于看不见的地方的）

2508.definition: to put or keep somebody/something in a place where they/it cannot be seen or found
2508.example: hide somebody/something + adv./prep., He hid the letter in a drawer.
2508.translation: 隐藏（将某人/某物放在看不见或找不到的地方）

2509.definition: a system, especially in a society or an organization, in which people are organized into different levels of importance from highest to lowest
2509.translation: 等级制度（尤指社会或组织中按重要性从高到低排列的体系）

2510.definition: measuring a long distance from the bottom to the top
2510.example: What's the highest mountain in the US?
2510.translation: 高的（从底部到顶部距离长的）

2511.definition: at or to a position or level that is a long way up from the ground or from the bottom
2511.translation: 高高地（在地面或底部之上很高的位置）

2512.translation: 最高水平（最高水平或最高数字）

2513.definition: receiving or involving a lot of attention and discussion in the media
2513.translation: 高调的，引人注目的（在媒体中受到大量关注和讨论的）

2514.definition: the best, most interesting or most exciting part of something
2514.example: One of the highlights of the trip was seeing the Taj Mahal.
2514.translation: 亮点（某事物中最精彩、最有趣或最令人兴奋的部分）

2515.definition: to emphasize something, especially so that people give it more attention
2515.example: The report highlighted the importance of exercise to maintain a healthy body.
2515.translation: 强调，突出（强调某事，尤指为了使其获得更多关注）

2516.example: It is highly unlikely that she'll be late.

2517.definition: a main road for travelling long distances, especially one connecting and going through cities and towns
2517.example: Plans were being made for the construction of a new interstate highway system.
2517.translation: 公路（连接城市间长距离旅行的主要道路）

2519.definition: an area of land that is higher than the land around it, but not as high as a mountain
2519.example: a region of gently rolling hills
2519.translation: 小山（高出周围土地但不如山脉高的区域）

2520.definition: used as the object of a verb, after the verb be or after a preposition to refer to a male person or animal that has already been mentioned or is easily identified
2520.translation: 他（用作宾语、介词后或be动词后，指代已提到的男性）

2521.definition: used when the man or boy who performs an action is also affected by it
2521.translation: 他自己（当男性执行者同时也受到动作影响时使用）

2522.definition: something that you say or do in an indirect way in order to show somebody what you are thinking
2522.example: He gave a broad hint (= one that was obvious) that he was thinking of retiring.
2522.translation: 暗示，提示（以间接方式表达想法的言行）

2523.definition: to suggest something in an indirect way
2523.example: hint at something, What are you hinting at?
2523.translation: 暗示（以间接方式提议或说明某事）

2524.definition: the area at either side of the body between the top of the leg and the middle part of the body; the joint at the top of the leg that connects it with the top part of the body
2524.example: She stood with her hands on her hips.
2524.translation: 臀部，髋部（腿部顶端与身体中部连接的区域或关节）

2525.definition: the act of paying to use something for a short time
2525.translation: 租用（付钱短时间使用某物的行为）

2526.example: She was hired three years ago.

2527.definition: of or belonging to a man or boy who has already been mentioned or is easily identified
2527.translation: 他的（属于已提到或易识别的男性或雄性动物的）

2528.example: He took my hand in his.

2529.definition: a person who studies or writes about history; an expert in history
2529.example: No serious historian today accepts this theory.
2529.translation: 历史学家（研究或撰写历史的人；历史专家）

2530.definition: important in history; likely to be thought of as important at some time in the future
2530.translation: 有历史意义的（在历史上重要的；未来可能被认为重要的）

2531.example: You must place these events in their historical context.

2532.definition: all the events that happened in the past
2532.example: in history, The battle was a turning point in human history.
2532.translation: 历史（过去发生的所有事件）

2533.definition: an act of hitting somebody/something with your hand or with an object held in your hand
2533.translation: 击打（用手或手中物体打击的行为）

2534.definition: to bring your hand, or an object you are holding, against somebody/something quickly and with force
2534.example: hit somebody/something, I was afraid he was going to hit me.
2534.translation: 击中（迅速有力地将手或手中物体撞向某人/某物）

2535.definition: an activity that you do for pleasure when you are not working
2535.translation: 爱好（工作之余为了消遣而进行的活动）

2536.definition: a game played on a field by two teams of 11 players, with curved sticks and a small hard ball. Teams try to hit the ball into the other team’s goal.
2536.translation: 曲棍球（两队各11名球员在场上使用弯曲球棍击打硬球入网的比赛）

2537.definition: the action of holding somebody/something; the way you are holding somebody/something
2537.example: hold on somebody/something, His hold on her arm tightened.
2537.translation: 握住，控制（握住某人/某物的动作；握持的方式）

2538.definition: to have somebody/something in your hand, arms, etc.
2538.example: hold somebody/something, She was holding a large box.
2538.translation: 拿，握（手中拿住或怀中抱着某人/某物等）

2539.definition: a hollow space in something solid or in the surface of something
2539.example: He dug a deep hole in the garden.
2539.translation: 洞，坑（固体中或物体表面的中空空间）

2540.definition: a period of time when you are not at work or school
2540.translation: 假期（不工作或不上学的时段）

2541.definition: having a hole or empty space inside
2541.translation: 中空的（内部有孔或空的空间的）

2542.definition: connected with God or a particular religion
2542.translation: 神圣的（与上帝或特定宗教相关的）

2543.definition: connected with the place where you live
2543.translation: 家里的（与居住地相关的）

2544.definition: to or at the place where you live
2544.example: Come on, it's time to go home.
2544.translation: 回家（向着或处于你居住的地方）

2545.definition: the house or flat that you live in, especially with your family
2545.example: Old people prefer to stay in their own homes.
2545.translation: 家（你居住的房子或公寓，尤指与家人同住）

2546.definition: the country where a person was born
2546.example: Many refugees have been forced to flee their homeland.
2546.translation: 祖国（一个人出生所在的国家）

2547.definition: having no home, and therefore typically living on the streets
2547.example: The scheme has been set up to help homeless people.
2547.translation: 无家可归的（没有房子，通常生活在街头的）

2548.definition: work that is given by teachers for students to do at home
2548.example: I always do my homework on the bus.
2548.translation: 家庭作业（教师布置给学生在家里完成的工作）

2549.definition: always telling the truth, and never stealing or cheating
2549.translation: 诚实的（始终说实话，从不偷窃或欺骗的）

2550.example: She answered all my questions with her usual honesty.

2551.example: the guest of honour (= the most important one)
2551.translation: 荣誉（对他人的极度尊敬；荣幸）

2552.definition: to do something that shows great respect for somebody/something
2552.translation: 尊敬，授予荣誉（通过行动展示对他人的极大尊敬）

2553.definition: a curved piece of metal, plastic or wire for hanging things on, catching fish with, etc.
2553.translation: 钩子（金属、塑料或金属丝制成的弯曲物，用于挂东西、钓鱼等）

2554.definition: to fasten or hang something on something else using a hook; to be fastened or hanging in this way
2554.example: hook something + adv./prep., We hooked the trailer to the back of the car.
2554.translation: 钩住，挂（用钩子将一物固定或挂在另一物上）

2555.definition: a feeling of wanting and expecting a particular thing to happen; something that you wish for
2555.translation: 希望（渴望并期待某事发生的感觉；愿望）

2556.definition: to want something to happen and think that it is possible
2556.example: All we can do now is wait and hope.
2556.translation: 希望（想要某事发生并认为有可能）

2557.definition: believing that something you want will happen
2557.example: hopeful (that…), I feel hopeful that we'll find a suitable house very soon.
2557.translation: 有希望的（相信想要的事会发生的）

2558.definition: used to express what you hope will happen
2558.translation: 有希望地（用于表达希望会发生什么）

2559.definition: the furthest that you can see, where the sky seems to meet the land or the sea
2559.example: The sun sank below the horizon.
2559.translation: 地平线（天与地或海交接的最远处）

2560.definition: a hard pointed part that grows, usually in pairs, on the heads of some animals, such as sheep and cows. Horns are often curved.
2560.example: a large bull with curved horns
2560.translation: 角（部分动物头上成对生长的硬尖物，常弯曲，如牛羊角）

2561.definition: very bad or unpleasant; used to describe something that you do not like
2561.translation: 可怕的（非常坏或令人不快的；描述不喜欢的事物）

2562.definition: a feeling of great shock or fear
2562.example: The thought of being left alone filled her with horror.
2562.translation: 恐惧，恐怖（极度震惊或害怕的感觉）

2563.definition: a large animal with four legs, a mane (= long thick hair on its neck) and a tail. Horses are used for riding on, pulling carriages, etc.
2563.translation: 马（四条腿的大型动物，有鬃毛和尾巴，用于骑行或拉车）

2564.definition: a large building where people who are ill or injured are given medical treatment and care
2564.example: to/into (the) hospital, (British English), He had to go to/into hospital for treatment.
2564.translation: 医院（为伤病员提供医疗和护理的大型建筑）

2565.definition: a person who invites guests to a meal, a party, etc. or who has people staying at their house
2565.example: Ian, our host, introduced us to the other guests.
2565.translation: 主人（邀请客人用餐、聚会或留宿的人）

2566.definition: to organize an event to which others are invited and make all the arrangements for them
2566.example: to host an event/a conference/a meeting
2566.translation: 主办，主持（组织他人参加的活动并做出所有安排）

2567.definition: a person who is captured and held prisoner by a person or group, and who may be injured or killed if people do not do what the person or group is asking
2567.example: Three children were taken hostage during the bank robbery.
2567.translation: 人质（被他人抓获并扣押的人，若要求未满足可能受伤害或被杀）

2568.definition: aggressive or unfriendly and ready to argue or fight
2568.example: The speaker got a hostile reception from the audience.
2568.translation: 敌对的（具有攻击性或不友好的，准备争吵或战斗的）

2569.definition: aggressive or unfriendly feelings or behaviour
2569.example: There was a barely veiled hostility in her tone.
2569.translation: 敌意（攻击性或不友好的情感或行为）

2570.definition: having a high temperature; producing heat
2570.translation: 热的（温度高的；产生热量的）

2571.definition: a building where people stay, usually for a short time, paying for their rooms and meals
2571.translation: 旅馆，酒店（供人住宿并付房费和餐费的建筑）

2572.definition: 60 minutes; one of the 24 parts that a day is divided into
2572.example: I spent an hour on the phone.
2572.translation: 小时（60分钟；一天的24分之一）

2573.definition: a building for people to live in, usually for one family
2573.example: in a house, We live in a two-bedroom house.
2573.translation: 房子（供人们居住的建筑，通常供一个家庭使用）

2574.definition: to provide a place for a person or an animal to live
2574.example: The government is committed to housing the refugees.
2574.translation: 提供住房（为某人或动物提供居住地）

2575.definition: all the people living together in a house or flat
2575.example: Most households now own at least one car.
2575.translation: 住户，家庭（住在一起的一家人或一群人）

2576.definition: houses, flats, etc. that people live in, especially when referring to their type, price or condition
2576.translation: 住房（供人居住的房子、公寓等，尤指其类型、价格或状况）

2577.translation: 如何（以何种方式或方法）

2578.definition: used to introduce a statement that contrasts with something that has just been said
2578.example: He was feeling bad. He went to work, however, and tried to concentrate.
2578.translation: 然而（用于引入与前述内容对比的陈述）

2579.definition: extremely large in size or amount; great in degree
2579.example: The sums of money involved are potentially huge.
2579.translation: 巨大的（在规模、数量或程度上极大的）

2580.definition: of or connected with people rather than animals, machines or gods
2580.translation: 人的（与人而非动物、机器或神相关的）

2581.definition: a person rather than an animal or a machine
2581.example: Dogs can hear much better than humans.
2581.translation: 人（作为个体的人，而非动物或机器）

2582.definition: connected with helping people who are suffering and improving the conditions that they are living in
2582.example: to provide humanitarian aid to the war zone
2582.translation: 人道主义的（与帮助受难者及改善其生活条件相关的）

2583.example: He was found guilty of crimes against humanity.
2583.translation: 人类（通常指一般的人类）

2584.definition: showing you do not think that you are as important as other people
2584.example: Be humble enough to learn from your mistakes.
2584.translation: 谦卑的（表现出不认为自己比他人重要的）

2585.definition: funny; showing a sense of humour
2585.example: He gave a humorous account of their trip to Spain.
2585.translation: 幽默的（滑稽的；展现幽默感的）

2586.definition: the quality in something that makes it funny; the ability to laugh at things that are funny
2586.example: It was a story full of gentle humour.
2586.translation: 幽默（事物中滑稽的特质；对滑稽事物的发笑能力）

2587.example: One hundred (of the children) have already been placed with foster families.

2588.definition: the state of not having enough food to eat, especially when this causes illness or death
2588.example: Around fifty people die of hunger every day in the camp.
2588.translation: 饥饿（没有足够食物吃的状态，尤指引起疾病或死亡时）

2589.definition: feeling that you want to eat something
2589.translation: 饥饿的（感到想吃东西的）

2590.definition: an act of looking for somebody/something that is difficult to find
2590.example: The hunt is on for a suitable candidate.
2590.translation: 寻找，搜寻（寻找难以找到的人或物的行为）

2591.definition: to go after wild animals in order to catch or kill them for food, sport or to make money
2591.translation: 打猎，猎取（追捕野生动物以获取食物、运动或金钱）

2592.definition: going after and killing wild animals as a sport or for food
2592.translation: 打猎（作为运动或为了食物追捕并杀死野生动物）

2593.definition: a violent storm with very strong winds, especially in the western Atlantic Ocean
2593.example: A powerful hurricane hit the Florida coast.
2593.translation: 飓风（伴有强风的剧烈风暴，尤指在西大西洋）

2594.definition: the need or wish to get something done quickly
2594.translation: 匆忙（快速完成某事的需要或愿望）

2595.definition: to move or act quickly because there is not much time
2595.example: You'll have to hurry if you want to catch that train.
2595.translation: 赶快（因时间不多而快速移动或行动）

2596.example: None of the passengers were badly hurt.

2597.definition: a feeling of unhappiness because somebody has been unkind or unfair to you
2597.example: There was hurt and real anger in her voice.
2597.translation: 伤害（因他人不友善或不公平而产生的不快乐感）

2598.definition: to cause physical pain to somebody/yourself; to injure somebody/yourself
2598.example: hurt something, He hurt his back playing squash.
2598.translation: 伤害（造成身体疼痛；使某人/自己受伤）

2599.definition: the man that somebody is married to; a married man
2599.translation: 丈夫（某人与之结婚的男子；已婚男子）

2601.definition: an idea or explanation of something that is based on a few known facts but that has not yet been proved to be true or correct
2601.translation: 假设（基于少数事实但尚未证实的想法或解释）

2602.definition: used as the subject of a verb when the speaker or writer is referring to himself/herself
2602.example: I think I'd better go now.
2602.translation: 我（当说话者指代自己时用作主语）

2603.definition: water that has frozen and become solid
2603.example: There was ice on the windows.

2604.definition: a type of sweet frozen food made from milk fat, tasting of fruit, chocolate, etc. and often eaten as a dessert; a small amount of this food intended for one person, often served in a container made of biscuit that is like a cone in shape
2604.example: Desserts are served with cream or ice cream.
2604.translation: 冰淇淋（由乳脂制成的甜味冷冻食品，味道多样）

2605.definition: a small symbol on a computer or smartphone screen that represents a program or a file
2605.example: Click on the printer icon with the mouse.
2605.translation: 图标（电脑或手机屏幕上代表程序或文件的微小符号）

2606.definition: an official way of showing who you are, for example a document with your name, date of birth and often a photograph on it (the abbreviation for ‘identity’ or ‘identification’)
2606.example: You must carry ID at all times.
2606.translation: 身份证件（证明身份的官方方式，如带名字、生日和照片的文件）

2607.definition: a plan, thought or suggestion, especially about what to do in a particular situation
2607.example: It would be a good idea to call before we leave.
2607.translation: 主意，想法（计划、思考或建议，尤指在特定情况下做什么）

2608.translation: 理想的（完美的；最合适的）

2609.definition: an idea or standard that seems perfect, and worth trying to achieve or obtain
2609.example: He was accused of betraying his political ideals.
2609.translation: 理想（似乎完美且值得努力实现的观念或标准）

2610.translation: 完全相同的（在每个细节上都相似的）

2611.definition: the process of showing, proving or recognizing who or what somebody/something is
2611.example: The identification of the crash victims was a long and difficult task.
2611.translation: 识别，鉴定（显示、证明或认出某人/某物是谁/是什么的过程）

2612.definition: to recognize somebody/something and be able to say who or what they are
2612.example: identify somebody/something, She was able to identify her attacker.
2612.translation: 识别，认出（认出某人/某物并能说出其是谁/是什么）

2613.example: The police are trying to discover the identity of the killer.
2613.translation: 身份（某人/某物是谁或是什么）

2614.definition: based on or connected with an ideology
2614.translation: 意识形态的（基于或与意识形态相关的）

2615.definition: a set of ideas that an economic or political system is based on
2615.translation: 意识形态（经济或政治体系所基于的一套想法）

2616.definition: a rude way to refer to somebody who you think is very stupid
2616.example: When I lost my passport, I felt such an idiot.
2616.translation: 笨蛋（指责某人非常愚蠢的粗鲁说法）

2617.definition: used to say that one thing can, will or might happen or be true, depending on another thing happening or being true
2617.example: If you see him, give him this note.
2617.translation: 如果（用于说明一件事的发生取决于另一件事）

2618.definition: a lack of knowledge or information about something
2618.example: They fought a long battle against prejudice and ignorance.
2618.translation: 无知（对某事缺乏知识或信息）

2619.definition: to pay no attention to something
2619.example: He ignored all the ‘No Smoking’ signs and lit up a cigarette.
2619.translation: 忽视（不对某事给予关注）

2620.definition: suffering from an illness or disease; not feeling well
2620.example: Her father is seriously ill in St Luke's hospital.
2620.translation: 生病的（患有疾病的；感觉不舒服的）

2622.definition: the state of being physically or mentally ill
2622.example: The virus can cause illness in humans.
2622.translation: 疾病（身体或精神生病的状态）

2623.definition: a false idea or belief, especially about somebody or about a situation
2623.example: under the illusion that…, She's under the illusion that (= believes wrongly that) she'll get the job.
2623.translation: 错觉，幻想（虚假的想法或信念，尤指关于某人或某情况）

2624.definition: to use pictures, photographs, diagrams, etc. in a book, etc.
2624.example: illustrate something, She illustrated her own books.
2624.translation: 说明，图解（在书中使用图片、照片、图表等）

2625.definition: a drawing or picture in a book, magazine, for decoration or to explain something
2625.translation: 插图（书、杂志中用于装饰或解释的图画或图片）

2626.definition: a picture, photograph or statue that represents somebody/something
2626.example: Most simple leaflets will include text and images.
2626.translation: 图像，形象（代表某人/某物的图片、照片或雕像）

2627.definition: language that produces pictures in the minds of people reading or listening
2627.translation: 意象（在读音或听众脑海中产生画面的语言）

2628.definition: existing only in your mind or imagination
2628.example: The equator is an imaginary line around the middle of the earth.
2628.translation: 想象的（仅存在于头脑或想象中的）

2629.definition: the ability to create pictures in your mind; the part of your mind that does this
2629.translation: 想象力（在脑中创造画面的能力；这种能力的来源）

2630.definition: to form a picture in your mind of what something might be like
2630.example: imagine something, The house was just as she had imagined it.
2630.translation: 想象（在脑中构思某事可能的样子）

2631.translation: 立即的（不延迟地发生或完成的）

2633.example: There is still an immense amount of work to be done.
2633.translation: 巨大的（极其大的或伟大的）

2634.definition: a person who has come to live permanently in a different country from the one they were born in
2634.example: immigrant from…, immigrants from other European countries
2634.translation: 移民（永久定居于非出生国的人）

2635.definition: the process of coming to live permanently in a different country from the one you were born in; the number of people who do this
2635.translation: 移民（永久定居于非出生国的过程；进行此行为的人数）

2636.translation: 即将来临的（很可能很快发生的）

2637.definition: that cannot catch or be affected by a particular disease or illness
2637.example: Adults are often immune to German measles.
2637.translation: 免疫的（不会感染或受特定疾病影响的）

2638.definition: the powerful effect that something has on somebody/something
2638.translation: 影响，冲击（某事物对某人/某物产生的强大效果）

2639.definition: to have an effect on somebody/something
2639.example: impact on/upon somebody/something, Her father's death impacted greatly on her childhood years.
2639.translation: 产生影响（对某人/某物产生效果）

2640.definition: annoyed by somebody/something, especially because you have to wait for a long time
2640.example: I'd been waiting for twenty minutes and I was getting impatient.
2640.translation: 不耐烦的（对某人/某事感到恼火，尤指因等待时间过长）

2641.definition: to make something that has been officially decided start to happen or be used
2641.translation: 实施，执行（使官方决定的事项开始发生或被使用）

2642.definition: the act of making something that has been officially decided start to happen or be used
2642.example: the implementation of the new system
2642.translation: 实施，执行（使官方决定事项开始发生或被使用的行为）

2643.definition: a possible effect or result of an action or a decision
2643.example: They failed to consider the wider implications of their actions.
2643.translation: 影响，暗示（行动或决定的可能效果或结果）

2644.definition: to suggest that something is true or that you feel or think something, without saying so directly
2644.example: imply (that)…, Are you implying (that) I am wrong?
2644.translation: 暗示（间接提议某事为真或表达某种感觉/想法）

2645.definition: a product or service that is brought into one country from another
2645.example: import from…, food imports from abroad
2645.translation: 进口（从他国带入本国的产品或服务）

2646.definition: to bring a product, a service, an idea, etc. into one country from another
2646.example: import something, The country has to import most of its raw materials.
2646.translation: 进口（将产品、服务、想法等从他国带入本国）

2647.example: She stressed the importance of careful preparation.

2648.definition: having a great effect on people or things; of great value
2648.translation: 重要的（对人或物有重大影响的；有巨大价值的）

2649.definition: to introduce a new law, rule, tax, etc.; to order that a rule, punishment, etc. be used
2649.example: impose something, The UN Security Council imposed sanctions in 1992.
2649.translation: 强加（引入新法律、规则等；命令使用某种规则、惩罚）

2650.definition: that cannot exist or be done; not possible
2650.translation: 不可能的（不能存在或做到的；不可行的）

2651.definition: if a person or thing impresses you, you admire them or it
2651.example: impress (somebody), We interviewed a number of candidates but none of them impressed us.
2651.translation: 给人留下深刻印象（如果你使某人钦佩你，指你给其留下了深刻印象）

2652.definition: admiring somebody/something because you think they are particularly good, interesting, etc.
2652.example: I must admit I am impressed.
2652.translation: 印象深刻的（因认为某人/某物特别好或有趣而钦佩的）

2653.definition: an idea, a feeling or an opinion that you get about somebody/something, or that somebody/something gives you
2653.example: My first impression of him was favourable.
2653.translation: 印象（你对某人/某物的看法、感觉或其给你的感觉）

2654.definition: making you admire them, because they are very large, good, skilful, etc.
2654.translation: 给人深刻印象的（因规模大、质量好、技艺高而使你钦佩的）

2655.definition: to put somebody in a prison or another place from which they cannot escape
2655.example: be imprisoned (for something), They were imprisoned for possession of drugs.
2655.translation: 监禁（将某人关入监狱或其他无法逃脱的地方）

2656.definition: the act of putting somebody in a prison or another place from which they cannot escape; the state of being there
2656.example: to be sentenced to life imprisonment for murder
2656.translation: 监禁（将某人关入监狱的行为；被关在那里的状态）

2657.definition: to become better than before; to make something/somebody better than before
2657.example: Overall the situation has improved dramatically.
2657.translation: 改进，提高（变得比以前更好；使某人/某物变得更好）

2658.definition: the act of making something better; the process of something becoming better
2658.example: The economy has shown significant improvement over the past 9 months.
2658.translation: 改进，提高（使某事变好的行为；变好的过程）

2659.definition: into an object, an area or a substance
2659.example: She opened the door and went in.
2659.translation: 在里面（进入一个物体、区域或物质内部）

2660.definition: at a point within an area or a space
2660.translation: 在...中（在某个区域或空间内的某一点）

2661.definition: the fact of not being able to do something
2661.example: the government’s inability to provide basic services
2661.translation: 无能，无力（不能做某事的事实）

2662.translation: 不充足的（不够的；不够好的）

2663.definition: not suitable or appropriate in a particular situation
2663.translation: 不恰当的（在特定情况下不合适或不恰当的）

2664.definition: something that encourages you to do something
2664.example: There is no incentive for people to save fuel.
2664.translation: 激励，动机（鼓励你去做某事的事物）

2665.definition: a unit for measuring length or height, equal to 2.54 centimetres. There are 12 inches in a foot.
2665.example: She's a few inches taller than me.
2665.translation: 英寸（长度单位，等于2.54厘米；12英寸等于1英尺）

2666.definition: the extent to which something happens or has an effect
2666.example: an area with a high incidence of crime
2666.translation: 发生率（某事发生或产生效果的程度）

2667.definition: something that happens, especially something unusual or unpleasant
2667.example: His bad behaviour was just an isolated incident.
2667.translation: 事件（发生的事情，尤指不寻常或不愉快的）

2668.example: She was inclined to trust him.

2669.definition: if one thing includes another, it has the second thing as one of its parts
2669.example: include something, The tour included a visit to the Science Museum.
2669.translation: 包括（如果一物包含另一物，指后者是前者的一部分）

2670.translation: 包括在内的（作为某事的一部分包含在内的）

2671.definition: having something as part of a group or set
2671.example: I've got three days' holiday including New Year's Day.
2671.translation: 包括（作为群体或集合的一部分包含某物）

2672.definition: the fact of including somebody/something; the fact of being included
2672.example: His inclusion in the team is in doubt.
2672.translation: 包含，包括（包含某人/某事的事实；被包含的事实）

2673.definition: the money that a person, a region, a country, etc. earns from work, from investing money, from business, etc.
2673.translation: 收入（个人、地区、国家等从工作、投资或业务中赚得的钱）

2674.definition: to include something so that it forms a part of something
2674.example: incorporate something, The new car design incorporates all the latest safety features.
2674.translation: 包含，并入（包括某物使其成为另一物的一部分）

2675.translation: 不正确的（不准确或不真实的）

2676.definition: a rise in the amount, number or value of something
2676.translation: 增加（某物在数量、数额或价值上的上升）

2677.definition: to become greater in amount, number, value, etc.; to make something greater in amount, number, value, etc.
2677.translation: 增加（在数量、价值等方面变大；使某物变大）

2678.definition: more and more all the time
2678.example: Tourism is playing an increasingly important role in the region's economy
2678.translation: 日益，越来越多地（一直不断地增加）

2679.definition: impossible or very difficult to believe
2679.translation: 难以置信的（不可能或非常难以相信的）

2681.definition: if you incur something unpleasant, you are in a situation in which you have to deal with it
2681.example: She had incurred the wrath of her father by marrying without his consent.
2681.translation: 引起，遭受（如果你遭遇不快的事，指你处于必须处理它的境地）

2682.definition: used after very and an adjective or adverb to emphasize a statement, description, etc.
2682.translation: 确实，的确（用于very及形容词/副词后以强调陈述）

2683.definition: freedom from political control by other countries
2683.example: Cuba gained independence from Spain in 1898.
2683.translation: 独立（不受他国政治控制的自由）

2684.translation: 独立的（拥有自己政府的）

2685.definition: a list of names or topics that are referred to in a book, etc., usually arranged at the end of a book in alphabetical order or listed in a separate file or book
2685.example: Look it up in the index.
2685.translation: 索引，索引表（书中提到的名称或主题列表，通常按字母序排列）

2686.definition: to show that something is true or exists
2686.example: indicate something, Initial tests indicate the presence of oxygen.
2686.translation: 表明，指示（显示某事属实或存在）

2687.definition: a remark or sign that shows that something is happening or what somebody is thinking or feeling
2687.example: indication of something, They gave no indication of how the work should be done.
2687.translation: 迹象，暗示（显示事情正在发生或某人想法、感觉的言语或迹象）

2688.definition: a sign that shows you what something is like or how a situation is changing
2688.example: The economic indicators are better than expected.
2688.translation: 指标（显示某物是什么样的或情况如何变化的标志）

2689.definition: a sign that a system, society, etc. is very bad or very wrong
2689.example: The poverty in our cities is a damning indictment of modern society.
2689.translation: 控诉，控告（体系、社会等非常糟糕或错误的迹象）

2690.definition: coming from a particular place and having lived there for a long time before other people came there; relating to, belonging to or developed by these people
2690.example: the indigenous peoples/languages of an area
2690.translation: 土著的，原住民的（来自特定地方并在此居住很久的；与这些人相关的）

2691.definition: happening not as the main aim, cause or result of a particular action, but in addition to it
2691.example: the indirect effects of the war
2691.translation: 间接的（非作为主要目标或结果发生，而是作为其补充发生的）

2692.definition: considered separately rather than as part of a group
2692.example: We interviewed each individual member of the community.
2692.translation: 个人的，个体的（单独考虑而非作为群体一部分的）

2693.definition: a person considered separately rather than as part of a group
2693.example: The competition is open to both teams and individuals.
2693.translation: 个人，个体（被单独考虑的人）

2694.definition: located, done or used inside a building
2694.translation: 室内的（位于、在建筑内部完成或使用的）

2695.example: I prefer to stay indoors in this really hot weather.
2695.translation: 在室内（在建筑内部或进入建筑内部）

2696.definition: to persuade or influence somebody to do something
2696.example: Nothing would induce me to take the job.
2696.translation: 引诱，导致（劝说或影响某人做某事）

2697.definition: to allow yourself to have or do something that you like, especially something that is considered bad for you
2697.example: indulge in something, They went into town to indulge in some serious shopping.
2697.translation: 沉溺，纵容（允许自己拥有或做喜欢的事，尤指被认为不好的事）

2698.translation: 工业的，工业化的（与工业相关的）

2699.definition: the production of goods from raw materials, especially in factories
2699.translation: 工业（从原材料生产商品，尤指在工厂中）

2700.definition: the unfair difference between groups of people in society, when some have more wealth, status or opportunities than others
2700.example: We need to tackle inequality of opportunity wherever we find it.
2700.translation: 不平等（社会中群体间的这种不公平差异，如财富、地位或机会的不同）

2701.definition: that you cannot avoid or prevent
2701.example: It was an inevitable consequence of the decision.
2701.translation: 不可避免的（无法回避或防止的）

2702.example: Inevitably, the press exaggerated the story.
2702.translation: 不可避免地（必然会发生地）

2703.definition: well known for being bad or evil
2703.example: a general who was infamous for his brutality
2703.translation: 声名狼藉的（因坏事或邪恶而众所周知的）

2704.definition: a baby or very young child
2704.example: a nursery for infants under two
2704.translation: 婴儿（婴儿或极年幼的儿童）

2705.definition: to make a disease or an illness spread to a person, an animal or a plant
2705.example: infect somebody/something (with something), It is not possible to infect another person through kissing.
2705.translation: 感染（使疾病传染给他人、动物或植物）

2706.definition: the act or process of causing or getting a disease
2706.translation: 感染（导致或患上疾病的行为或过程）

2707.definition: to reach an opinion or decide that something is true on the basis of information that is available
2707.example: infer something (from something), Much of the meaning must be inferred from the context.
2707.translation: 推断（根据现有信息得出观点或判断某事属实）

2708.definition: a general rise in the prices of services and goods in a particular country, resulting in a fall in the value of money; the rate at which this happens
2708.translation: 通货膨胀（国家商品和服务价格的普遍上涨，导致货币贬值；通胀率）

2709.definition: to make somebody/something suffer something unpleasant
2709.example: inflict something on/upon somebody/something, They inflicted a humiliating defeat on the home team.
2709.translation: 造成，施加（使某人/某物遭受不快之事，如失败或打击）

2710.definition: the effect that somebody/something has on the way a person thinks or behaves or on the way that something works or develops
2710.example: His early work shows the influence of Cézanne and Matisse.
2710.translation: 影响（某人/某事对他人思维、行为或事物运作、发展产生的作用）

2711.definition: to have an effect on the way that somebody behaves or thinks, especially by giving them an example to follow
2711.example: influence somebody/something, His writings have influenced the lives of millions.
2711.translation: 影响（对某人的行为或思维产生作用，尤指通过榜样作用）

2712.definition: having a lot of influence on somebody/something
2712.translation: 有影响力的（对某人/某事有很大影响的）

2714.definition: to tell somebody about something, especially in an official way
2714.example: inform somebody, The government took this decision without consulting Parliament or informing the public.
2714.translation: 通知，告知（告诉某人某事，尤指以官方方式）

2715.definition: relaxed and friendly; not following strict rules of how to behave or do something
2715.translation: 非正式的（放松友好的；不遵循严格规则的）

2716.translation: 信息（关于某人/某事的事实或细节）

2718.definition: one of the things from which something is made, especially one of the foods that are used together to make a particular dish
2718.example: Mix all the ingredients in a bowl.
2718.translation: 原料，成分（构成某物的要素之一，尤指烹饪中的食材）

2719.definition: a person or an animal that lives in a particular place
2719.example: the oldest inhabitant of the village
2719.translation: 居民（居住在特定地方的人或动物）

2720.definition: that is a basic or permanent part of somebody/something and that cannot be removed
2720.example: the difficulties inherent in a study of this type
2720.translation: 固有的（某人/某物基本或永久的一部分，且无法去除的）

2721.definition: to receive money, property, etc. from somebody when they die
2721.example: inherit something from somebody, She inherited a fortune from her father.
2721.translation: 继承（在某人死后收到其金钱、财产等）

2722.definition: to prevent something from happening or make it happen more slowly or less frequently than normal
2722.example: A lack of oxygen may inhibit brain development in the unborn child.
2722.translation: 抑制（阻止某事发生或使其发生得更慢、更不频繁）

2723.example: There is an initial payment of £60 followed by ten instalments of £25.
2723.translation: 最初的（开始时发生的；第一的）

2725.example: to initiate legal proceedings against somebody
2725.translation: 开始，发起（使某事开始，如发起法律诉讼）

2726.definition: a new plan for dealing with a particular problem or for achieving a particular purpose
2726.translation: 倡议，主动性（处理问题或实现目标的新的计划）

2727.definition: to put a drug or other substance into a person’s or an animal’s body using a syringe
2727.example: inject something (into yourself/somebody/something), Adrenaline was injected into the muscle.
2727.translation: 注射（使用注射器将药物等注入人体或动物体）

2728.definition: an act of injecting somebody with a drug or other substance
2728.translation: 注射（给某人注射药物的行为）

2729.definition: to harm yourself or somebody else physically, especially in an accident
2729.example: He injured his knee playing hockey.
2729.translation: 伤害（使自己或他人身体受损，尤指在事故中）

2730.example: His injured leg prevented him from walking.
2730.translation: 受伤的（身体受损的；患伤的）

2731.definition: harm done to a person’s or an animal’s body, for example in an accident
2731.translation: 伤害（对人或动物身体造成的损害，例如在事故中）

2732.definition: the fact of a situation being unfair and of people not being treated equally; an unfair act or an example of unfair treatment
2732.example: We are committed to fighting against poverty and injustice.
2732.translation: 不公正（情况不公平、人们未受平等对待的事实；不公平的行为）

2733.definition: coloured liquid for writing, drawing and printing
2733.translation: 墨水（用于书写、绘画和打印的彩色液体）

2734.definition: one of the people living in an institution such as a prison or a psychiatric hospital
2734.translation: 囚犯，同住者（住在监狱或精神病院等机构中的人）

2735.definition: inside; towards or close to the centre of a place
2735.translation: 内部的（在里面的；朝向或靠近地方中心的）

2736.definition: not guilty of a crime, etc.; not having done something wrong
2736.example: They have imprisoned an innocent man.
2736.translation: 无罪的，天真的（未犯罪的；未做错事的；单纯的）

2737.definition: the introduction of new things, ideas or ways of doing something
2737.translation: 创新（新事物、想法或做事方式的引入）

2738.definition: introducing or using new ideas, ways of doing something, etc.
2738.example: There will be a prize for the most innovative design.
2738.translation: 创新的（引入或使用新想法、新方式的）

2739.definition: time, knowledge, ideas, etc. that you put into work, a project, etc. in order to make it succeed; the act of putting something in
2739.example: I'd appreciate your input on this.
2739.translation: 投入，输入（投入工作、项目等的资源、知识或主意；输入的行为）

2740.definition: an official process to find out the cause of something or to find out information about something
2740.translation: 调查，询问（找出某事原因或信息的官方过程）

2741.definition: any small creature with six legs and a body divided into three parts. Insects usually also have wings. Ants, bees and flies are all insects.
2741.example: Most birds spend most of the day eating insects.
2741.translation: 昆虫（有六条腿、身体分三部分的微小生物，通常带翅膀）

2742.definition: to put something into something else or between two things
2742.example: insert something (in/into something), Insert coins into the slot and press for a ticket.
2742.translation: 插入（将某物放入另一物中或两物之间）

2743.definition: the act of putting something inside something else; a thing that is put inside something else
2743.example: An examination is carried out before the insertion of the tube.
2743.translation: 插入（将某物放入另一物内部的行为；被插入之物）

2744.definition: forming the inner part of something; not on the outside
2744.example: the inside pages of a newspaper
2744.translation: 里面的（构成事物内部的；非外部的）

2745.example: She shook it to make sure there was nothing inside.

2746.definition: the inner part, side or surface of something
2746.example: The inside of the box was blue.
2746.translation: 内部（事物的内部部分、侧面或表面）

2747.definition: on or to the inner part of something/somebody; within something/somebody
2747.translation: 在...里面（在某人/某物的内部；在...之内）

2748.definition: a person who knows a lot about a group or an organization, because they are part of it
2748.example: The situation was described by one insider as ‘absolute chaos’.
2748.translation: 知情者，内部人员（因身处其中而对群体或组织非常了解的人）

2749.definition: an understanding of what something is like
2749.example: There are many valuable insights in her book.
2749.translation: 洞察力（对事物本质的理解）

2750.definition: to demand that something happen or that somebody agree to do something
2750.example: I didn't really want to go but he insisted.
2750.translation: 坚持（要求某事发生或某人同意做某事）

2751.definition: to look closely at something/somebody, especially to check that everything is as it should be
2751.example: inspect something/somebody, The teacher walked around inspecting their work.
2751.translation: 检查（仔细查看，尤指为了核实是否符合要求）

2752.definition: an official visit to a school, factory, etc. in order to check that rules are being obeyed and that standards are acceptable
2752.example: Regular inspections are carried out at the prison.
2752.translation: 检查，视察（对学校、工厂等的官方访问，以核实规则遵守及标准情况）

2753.definition: an officer of middle rank in the police force
2753.translation: 督察，检查员（警察部门的中级官员；或负责检查的官员）

2754.definition: the process that takes place when somebody sees or hears something that causes them to have exciting new ideas or makes them want to create something, especially in art, music or literature
2754.example: Dreams can be a rich source of inspiration for an artist.
2754.translation: 灵感（看到或听到某物后产生新想法或创作欲望的过程，尤指在艺术领域）

2755.definition: to give somebody the desire, confidence or enthusiasm to do something well
2755.example: inspire somebody, The actors' enthusiasm inspired the kids.
2755.translation: 激励，鼓舞（给予某人做好某事的渴望、信心或热情）

2756.definition: to fix equipment or furniture into position so that it can be used
2756.example: They're planning to install a new drainage system.
2756.translation: 安装（将设备或家具固定到位以便使用）

2757.definition: the act of fixing equipment or furniture in position so that it can be used
2757.translation: 安装（将设备或家具固定到位的行为）

2758.definition: a particular example or case of something
2758.example: instance of somebody/something, The report highlights a number of instances of injustice.
2758.translation: 例子，事例（某事物的特定示例或情况）

2759.example: This account gives you instant access to your money.

2761.example: Lee was ill so I went instead.
2761.translation: 代替（作为某人/某物的替代）

2762.definition: a natural quality that makes people and animals tend to behave in a particular way using the knowledge and abilities that they were born with rather than thought or training
2762.example: She did not seem to have any of the usual maternal instincts.
2762.translation: 本能（人或动物天生的行为特质，基于生而具有的知识而非学习）

2763.definition: an organization that has a particular purpose, especially one that is connected with education or a particular profession; the building used by this organization
2763.example: The report was compiled by Germany's five leading economic research institutes.
2763.translation: 学院，学会（具有特定目的的组织，尤指与教育或专业相关的；其建筑）

2764.definition: a large important organization that has a particular purpose, for example a university or bank
2764.example: The deal is backed by one of the country's largest financial institutions.
2764.translation: 机构，制度（具有特定目的的大型重要组织，如大学或银行）

2765.definition: connected with a large important organization, for example a university or bank
2765.translation: 制度的，机构的（与大型重要组织相关的）

2766.definition: to tell somebody to do something, especially in a formal or official way
2766.example: instruct somebody to do something, The letter instructed him to report to headquarters immediately.
2766.translation: 指示，指导（告诉某人去做某事，尤指以正式或官方方式）

2767.definition: detailed information on how to do or use something
2767.example: Follow the instructions on the packet carefully.
2767.translation: 说明，指令（关于如何做或使用某物的详细信息）

2768.definition: a person whose job is to teach somebody a practical skill or sport
2768.translation: 教练，教员（职业是教人实用技能或体育的人）

2769.definition: an object used for producing musical sounds, for example a piano or a drum
2769.translation: 乐器，仪器（用于产生乐音的物体；或测量仪器）

2770.example: The Conservation Trust performs an instrumental role in the protection of rural environments.
2770.translation: 起作用的，有帮助的（在使某事发生中起重要作用的）

2771.definition: not large, strong or important enough for a particular purpose
2771.translation: 不足的（对特定目的来说不够大、不够强或不够重要的）

2772.definition: a remark or an action that is said or done in order to offend somebody
2772.example: The crowd were shouting insults at the police.
2772.translation: 侮辱（为了冒犯某人而说的言语或做的行为）

2773.definition: to say or do something that offends somebody
2773.example: I have never been so insulted in my life!
2773.translation: 侮辱（说或做冒犯某人的事）

2774.definition: an arrangement with a company in which you pay them regular amounts of money and they agree to pay the costs, for example, if you die or are ill, or if you lose or damage something
2774.translation: 保险（与公司达成的安排，定期交费以在出事时获得经济补偿）

2775.example: Most of the house remains intact even after two hundred years.
2775.translation: 完好无损的（完整的且未受损的）

2776.definition: the amount of food, drink, etc. that you take into your body
2776.translation: 摄入量（摄入体内的食物、饮料等的数量）

2777.definition: being an essential part of something
2777.example: Music is an integral part of the school's curriculum.
2777.translation: 不可或缺的（作为某物基本组成部分的）

2778.definition: to combine two or more things so that they work together; to combine with something else in this way
2778.example: integrate into/with something, These programs will integrate with your existing software.
2778.translation: 整合，结合（将两个或更多事物结合使之共同工作）

2779.definition: in which many different parts are closely connected and work successfully together
2779.example: an integrated programme of patient care
2779.translation: 整合的，综合的（各部分紧密联系并成功协作的）

2780.definition: the act or process of combining two or more things so that they work together
2780.example: The aim is to promote closer economic integration.
2780.translation: 整合，一体化（结合两个或更多事物使之共同工作的行为或过程）

2781.definition: the quality of being honest and having strong moral principles
2781.translation: 正直，诚信（诚实且具有强烈的道德原则的品质）

2782.definition: connected with or using a person’s ability to think in a logical way and understand things
2782.example: Gifted children typically show great intellectual curiosity and a wide range of interests.
2782.translation: 智力的，理智的（与使用逻辑思维理解事物的能力相关的）

2783.definition: a person who is well educated and enjoys activities in which they have to think seriously about things
2783.example: He was a leading intellectual of his day.
2783.translation: 知识分子（受过良好教育且喜欢严肃思考的人）

2784.definition: the ability to learn, understand and think in a logical way about things; the ability to do this well
2784.translation: 智力（逻辑学习、理解和思考的能力；做好这些的能力）

2785.definition: good at learning, understanding and thinking in a logical way about things; showing this ability
2785.translation: 聪明的（擅长逻辑学习、理解和思考的；表现出这种能力的）

2786.definition: to have a plan, result or purpose in your mind when you do something
2786.example: We finished later than we had intended.
2786.translation: 打算（做某事时脑中有计划、结果或目的）

2787.definition: that you are trying to achieve or reach
2787.translation: 预期的（你尝试去实现或达到的）

2788.example: We were all suffering in the intense heat.
2788.translation: 强烈的（程度极大的；非常强劲的）

2789.definition: to increase in degree or strength; to make something increase in degree or strength
2789.translation: 加强，加剧（在程度或强度上增加；使之增加）

2790.definition: the state or quality of being intense
2790.translation: 强度（强烈程度的状态或品质）

2791.definition: involving a lot of work or activity done in a short time
2791.translation: 密集的（涉及在短时间内进行大量工作或活动的）

2792.example: She denies possessing the drug with intent to supply.

2793.definition: what you intend or plan to do; your aim
2793.example: intention of doing something, I have no intention of going to the wedding.
2793.translation: 意图，目的（你打算或计划做的事；你的目标）

2794.definition: to communicate with somebody, especially while you work, play or spend time with them
2794.example: Teachers have a limited amount of time to interact with each child.
2794.translation: 互动（与他人交流，尤指在工作、玩耍或共处时）

2795.definition: the act of communicating with somebody, especially while you work, play or spend time with them
2795.example: the interaction between performers and their audience
2795.translation: 互动（与他人交流的行为，尤指在工作、玩耍或共处时）

2796.definition: that allows information to be passed continuously and in both directions between a computer or other device and the person who uses it
2796.translation: 互动的（允许用户与电脑/设备间进行双向、连续信息传递的）

2797.definition: the feeling that you have when you want to know or learn more about somebody/something
2797.example: Her research has generated interest around the world.
2797.translation: 兴趣，趣味（想了解或学习更多关于某人/某事的感觉）

2798.definition: to attract your attention and make you feel interested; to make yourself give your attention to something
2798.example: interest somebody, Politics doesn't interest me.
2798.translation: 使感兴趣（吸引你的注意力并使你感到好奇；让自己关注某事）

2799.definition: giving your attention to something because you enjoy finding out about it or doing it; showing interest in something and finding it exciting
2799.translation: 感兴趣的（因为喜欢了解或做某事而投入关注的；感到兴奋的）

2800.definition: attracting your attention because it is/they are special, exciting or unusual
2800.example: The article raises several interesting questions.
2800.translation: 有趣的（因特别、兴奋或不寻常而吸引注意力的）

2801.definition: the way a computer program presents information to a user or receives information from a user, in particular the layout of the screen and the menus
2801.translation: 界面（电脑程序向用户展示信息或接收信息的方式，尤指屏幕布局）

2802.definition: to get involved in and try to influence a situation that should not really involve you, in a way that annoys other people
2802.example: I wish my mother would stop interfering and let me make my own decisions.
2802.translation: 干涉（介入并尝试影响本不该涉及你的情况，以令人烦恼的方式）

2803.definition: the act of getting involved in and trying to influence a situation that should not really involve you, in a way that annoys other people
2803.example: interference (in something), They resent foreign interference in the internal affairs of their country.
2803.translation: 干涉（介入并尝试影响本不该涉及你的情况的行为）

2804.definition: intended to last for only a short time until somebody/something more permanent is found
2804.translation: 临时的（旨在持续短时间，直到找到更永久的替代品）

2805.definition: connected with the inside part of something
2805.translation: 内部的（与事物内部相关的）

2806.example: the interior of a building/a car

2807.definition: located between two places, things, states, etc.
2807.example: an intermediate stage/step in a process
2807.translation: 中间的，中级的（位于两个地方、事物、状态等之间的）

2808.definition: connected with the inside of something
2808.example: the internal structure of a building
2808.translation: 内部的（与事物内部相连的）

2809.definition: connected with or involving two or more countries
2809.translation: 国际的（涉及两个或更多国家的）

2810.definition: an international computer network connecting other networks and computers that allows people to share information around the world
2810.translation: 互联网（连接全球电脑的国际网络，允许人们分享信息）

2811.definition: to explain the meaning of something
2811.example: The students were asked to interpret the poem.
2811.translation: 解释，翻译（解释某事的含义）

2812.definition: the particular way in which something is understood or explained
2812.example: Her evidence suggests a different interpretation of the events.
2812.translation: 解释，演绎（理解或解释某事的特定方式）

2813.definition: to say or do something that makes somebody stop what they are saying or doing
2813.example: Sorry to interrupt, but there's someone to see you.
2813.translation: 打断（说话或做事时使某人停止）

2814.definition: a period of time between two events
2814.example: The interval between major earthquakes might be 200 years.
2814.translation: 间隔（两个事件之间的时间段）

2815.definition: to become involved in a situation in order to improve or help it
2815.example: She might have been killed if the neighbours hadn't intervened.
2815.translation: 干预（介入某种情况以改善或提供帮助）

2816.definition: action taken to improve or help a situation
2816.example: calls for government intervention to save the steel industry
2816.translation: 干预（为了改善或帮助情况而采取的行动）

2817.definition: a formal meeting at which somebody is asked questions to see if they are suitable for a particular job, or for a course of study at a college, university, etc.
2817.translation: 面试，访谈（评估某人是否适合工作或学习的正式会议；或媒体访谈）

2818.definition: to talk to somebody and ask them questions at a formal meeting to find out if they are suitable for a job, course of study, etc.
2818.example: interview somebody, The university interviews all potential candidates.
2818.translation: 面试，访谈（在正式会议上提问以确定某人是否适合工作、学习等）

2819.definition: having a close and friendly relationship
2819.translation: 亲密的（具有紧密且友好的关系的）

2820.definition: to a position in or inside something
2820.translation: 进入（到某物内部或某个位置）

2821.definition: very interesting because of being unusual or not having an obvious answer
2821.translation: 引人入胜的（因不寻常或无明显答案而非常有趣的）

2822.definition: to tell two or more people who have not met before what each other’s names are; to tell somebody what your name is
2822.example: introduce somebody, Allow me to introduce my mother.
2822.translation: 介绍（告知未见过面的人彼此的名字；自我介绍）

2823.definition: the first part of a book or speech that gives a general idea of what is to follow
2823.example: a book with an excellent introduction and notes
2823.translation: 介绍，引言（书籍或演说的开头部分，给出后续内容的概括）

2824.definition: to enter a country, town, etc. using military force in order to take control of it
2824.example: Troops invaded on August 9th that year.
2824.translation: 入侵，侵略（使用武力进入国家、城镇等以夺取控制权）

2825.definition: the act of an army entering another country by force in order to take control of it
2825.example: the German invasion of Poland in 1939
2825.translation: 入侵，侵略（军队强行进入他国以夺取控制权的行为）

2826.definition: to produce or design something that has not existed before
2826.translation: 发明（制造或设计以前不存在的东西）

2827.definition: a thing or an idea that has been invented
2827.example: Fax machines were a wonderful invention at the time.
2827.translation: 发明（被发明出来的东西或想法）

2828.definition: to buy property, shares in a company, etc. in the hope of making a profit
2828.example: Now is a good time to invest.
2828.translation: 投资（购买房产、股份等以期获利）

2829.definition: to carefully examine the facts of a situation, an event, a crime, etc. to find out the truth about it or how it happened
2829.example: The FBI has been called in to investigate.
2829.translation: 调查（仔细检查情况、事件、犯罪等的事实以找出真相）

2830.definition: an official examination of the facts about a situation, crime, etc.
2830.translation: 调查（对情况、犯罪等事实的官方检查）

2831.definition: a person who examines a situation such as an accident or a crime to find out the truth
2831.translation: 调查员（检查事故或犯罪等情况以找出真相的人）

2832.definition: the act of investing money in something
2832.translation: 投资（将钱投入某事物的行为）

2833.definition: a person or an organization that invests money in something
2833.translation: 投资者（将钱投入某事物的个人或组织）

2834.example: a wizard who could make himself invisible
2834.translation: 看不见的（不能被看到的）

2835.definition: a spoken or written request to somebody to do something or to go somewhere
2835.translation: 邀请（向某人发出的做某事或去某处的口头或书面请求）

2836.definition: to ask somebody to come to a social event
2836.example: invite somebody to something, Have you been invited to their party?
2836.translation: 邀请（要求某人参加社交活动）

2837.definition: to mention or use a law, rule, etc. as a reason for doing something
2837.example: It is unlikely that libel laws will be invoked.
2837.translation: 援引，调用（提及或使用法律、规则等作为做某事的理由）

2838.definition: if a situation, an event or an activity involves something, that thing is an important or necessary part or result of it
2838.example: involve something, Any investment involves an element of risk.
2838.translation: 涉及，包含（如果一个情况/活动涉及某物，指其为重要组成或结果）

2839.definition: taking part in something; being part of something or connected with something
2839.example: Some people tried to stop the fight but I didn't want to get involved.
2839.translation: 参与其中的，涉及的（参加某事；成为某事的一部分或与之有联系）

2840.definition: the act of taking part in something or dealing with somebody
2840.example: involvement in something, US involvement in European wars
2840.translation: 参与，介入（参加某事或与他人打交道的行为）

2841.definition: a chemical element. Iron is a hard strong metal that is used to make steel and is also found in small quantities in blood and food.
2841.translation: 铁（一种金属化学元素，用于制造钢，也存在于血液和食物中）

2842.definition: to make clothes, etc. smooth by using an iron
2842.example: He was ironing when I arrived.
2842.translation: 熨烫（使用熨斗使衣服平整）

2843.definition: showing that you really mean the opposite of what you are saying; expressing irony
2843.translation: 讽刺的（表现出所言与本意相反的；表达讽刺的）

2844.definition: in a way that shows that you really mean the opposite of what you are saying; in a way that expresses irony
2844.translation: 讽刺地（以表现出所言与本意相反的方式；表达讽刺地）

2845.definition: the funny or strange aspect of a situation that is very different from what you expect; a situation like this
2845.example: It was one of life's little ironies.
2845.translation: 讽刺（情况中与预期完全不同的滑稽或奇怪的一面；这种情况）

2846.definition: not important to or connected with a situation
2846.translation: 无关的（对情况不重要或不相关的）

2847.definition: a piece of land that is completely surrounded by water
2847.translation: 岛屿（完全被水包围的一块陆地）

2848.definition: to separate somebody/something physically or socially from other people or things
2848.example: isolate somebody/yourself/something, Patients with the disease should be isolated.
2848.translation: 隔离，孤立（在物理上或社交上使某人/某物与他人/他物分开）

2849.translation: 偏远的，孤立的（远离其他的）

2850.definition: the act of separating somebody/something; the state of being separate
2850.translation: 隔离，孤立（使某人/某物分开的行为；分开的状态）

2851.definition: an important topic that people are discussing or arguing about
2851.translation: 问题，议题（人们正在讨论或争论的重要话题）

2852.example: issue something, They issued a joint statement denying the charges.
2852.translation: 发布，发行（正式使某事为人所知）

2853.definition: the study and use of electronic processes and equipment to store and send information of all kinds, including words, pictures and numbers (the abbreviation for ‘information technology’)
2853.example: the increasing use of IT in all aspects of today's society
2853.translation: 信息技术，IT（使用电子设备存储和发送各类信息——文字、图片、数字等——的学科）

2854.definition: used to refer to an animal or a thing that has already been mentioned or that is being talked about now
2854.translation: 它（指代已提到或正在谈论的动物或事物）

2855.definition: one thing on a list of things to buy, do, talk about, etc.
2855.example: What's the next item on the agenda?
2855.translation: 项目，项（购买、执行、谈论清单上的一件事）

2856.definition: belonging to or connected with a thing, an animal or a baby
2856.example: Turn the box on its side.
2856.translation: 它的（属于或与某物、动物、婴儿相关的）

2857.definition: used when the animal or thing that does an action is also affected by it
2857.translation: 它自己（当动物或事物执行动作并受其影响时使用）

2858.definition: a piece of clothing worn on the top half of the body over a shirt, etc. that has arms and fastens down the front; a short, light coat
2858.translation: 夹克（穿在衬衫外、带袖子、在前部系紧的短上衣）

2859.example: She spent a year in jail.

2860.example: be jailed (for something), He was jailed for life for murder.

2861.definition: a thick sweet substance made by boiling fruit with sugar, often sold in jars and spread on bread
2861.translation: 果酱（通过糖煮水果制成的浓稠甜味物质，常涂在面包上）

2862.definition: the 1st month of the year, between December and February
2862.translation: 一月（一年中的第一个月）

2863.definition: a type of music with strong rhythms, in which the players often improvise (= make up the music as they are playing), originally created by African American musicians at the beginning of the 20th century
2863.translation: 爵士乐（20世纪初由非裔美国音乐人开创的带强节奏和即兴演奏的音乐）

2864.definition: trousers made of denim (= a type of strong cotton)
2864.translation: 牛仔裤（粗棉布制成的长裤）

2865.definition: a plane driven by jet engines
2865.translation: 喷气式飞机（由喷气发动机驱动的飞机）

2866.definition: objects such as rings and necklaces that people wear as decoration
2866.translation: 珠宝（人们佩戴作为装饰的戒指、项链等物品）

2867.definition: work for which you receive regular payment
2867.example: I don't have a job at present.
2867.translation: 工作，职业（获得定期报酬的工作）

2868.definition: to fix or connect two or more things together
2868.example: join A to/onto B, Join one section of pipe to the next.
2868.translation: 连接，加入（将两个或更多事物固定或连接在一起）

2869.definition: involving two or more people together
2869.example: a joint account (= a bank account in the name of more than one person, for example shared by a couple)
2869.translation: 共同的，联合的（涉及两个或更多人在一起的，如联名账户）

2870.definition: a place where two bones are joined together in the body in a way that enables them to bend and move
2870.translation: 关节（身体中两块骨头连接并能弯曲移动的地方）

2871.definition: something that you say or do to make people laugh, for example a funny story that you tell
2871.translation: 玩笑，笑话（说或做以使人发笑的事，如幽默故事）

2872.definition: to say something to make people laugh; to tell a funny story
2872.example: She was laughing and joking with the children.
2872.translation: 开玩笑（说些让人发笑的话；讲幽默故事）

2873.definition: a newspaper or magazine that deals with a particular subject or profession
2873.translation: 期刊，杂志（涉及特定主题或专业的报纸或杂志）

2874.definition: the work of collecting and writing news stories for newspapers, magazines, radio, television or online news sites; the news stories that are written
2874.example: I'd like a career in journalism.
2874.translation: 新闻业（为媒体搜集并撰写新闻故事的工作；所写的这些故事）

2875.definition: a person whose job is to collect and write news stories for newspapers, magazines, radio, television or online news sites
2875.translation: 记者（职业是为媒体搜集并撰写新闻故事的人）

2876.definition: an act of travelling from one place to another, especially when they are far apart
2876.example: They went on a long train journey across India.
2876.translation: 旅行，旅程（从一处移动到另一处的行为，尤指距离较远时）

2877.example: Her books have brought joy to millions.

2878.definition: a person in a court who has the authority to decide how criminals should be punished or to make legal decisions
2878.translation: 法官，裁判（法庭上有权决定惩罚或做出法律判决的人；比赛裁判）

2879.definition: to form an opinion about somebody/something, based on the information you have
2879.example: As far as I can judge, all of them are to blame.
2879.translation: 判断（根据现有信息对某人/某物形成看法）

2880.definition: the ability to make sensible decisions after carefully considering the best thing to do
2880.translation: 判断力（在仔细考虑后做出明智决定的能力）

2881.definition: connected with a court, a judge or legal judgement
2881.translation: 司法的（与法院、法官或法律判决相关的）

2882.definition: the liquid that comes from fruit or vegetables; a drink made from this
2882.translation: 果汁（来自水果或蔬菜的液体；由此制成的饮料）

2883.definition: the 7th month of the year, between June and August
2883.example: in July, She was born in July.
2883.translation: 七月（一年中的第七个月）

2885.definition: to move quickly off the ground or away from a surface by pushing yourself with your legs and feet
2885.translation: 跳（通过双腿发力快速离开地面或表面）

2886.definition: the place where two or more roads or railway lines meet
2886.example: It was near the junction of City Road and Old Street.
2886.translation: 交叉点，枢纽（两条或更多道路/铁路线汇合的地方）

2887.definition: the 6th month of the year, between May and July
2887.translation: 六月（一年中的第六个月）

2888.definition: having a low rank in an organization or a profession
2888.translation: 资历较浅的，初级的（在组织或行业中职级较低的）

2889.definition: the authority that an official organization has to make legal decisions about somebody/something
2889.example: jurisdiction over somebody/something, The English court had no jurisdiction over the defendants.
2889.translation: 管辖权（官方机构对某人/某物做出法律判决的权力）

2890.definition: a group of members of the public who listen to the facts of a case in a court and decide whether or not somebody is guilty of a crime, or whether a claim has been proved
2890.translation: 陪审团（法庭上听取事实并裁定是否有罪或主张是否成立的公众小组）

2891.definition: that most people consider to be morally fair and reasonable
2891.translation: 公正的（大多数人认为在道德上公平合理的）

2892.example: There is just one method that might work.

2893.example: She spent her life fighting for social justice and equality for women.
2893.translation: 正义，公正（对人的公平对待）

2894.definition: a good reason why something exists or is done
2894.example: justification for doing something, I can see no possible justification for any further tax increases.
2894.translation: 理由，辩解（某事存在或被执行的充足理由）

2895.definition: to show that somebody/something is right or reasonable
2895.example: justify doing something, How can they justify paying such huge salaries?
2895.translation: 证明...有理（证明某人/某事是正确或合理的）

2896.definition: wanting to do something or wanting something to happen very much
2896.example: keen to do something, John was very keen to help.
2896.translation: 热衷的（非常想要做某事或希望某事发生的）

2897.definition: to continue to have something and not give it back or throw it away
2897.translation: 保持，保留（继续拥有某物而不归还或丢弃）

2898.translation: 关键的（最重要的；必不可少的）

2899.definition: a piece of metal with a special shape used for locking a door, starting a car, etc.
2899.example: to put/turn the key in the lock
2899.translation: 钥匙（用于锁门、启动汽车等的特殊形状的金属片）

2900.definition: to put information into a computer using a keyboard
2900.example: key something, I was busy keying data.
2900.translation: 输入（使用键盘将信息输入电脑）

2901.definition: the set of keys for operating a computer or typewriter, or the set of letters that you can touch to write on a smartphone or tablet
2901.example: The program locks the keyboard until a password is given.
2901.translation: 键盘（用于操作电脑或打字机的一组按键；或智能手机上的虚拟字母键）

2902.definition: a movement with the foot or the leg, usually to hit something with the foot
2902.example: the first kick of the game
2902.translation: 踢，一脚（用脚或腿部的移动，通常指用脚击打某物）

2903.definition: to hit somebody/something with your foot

2905.definition: to take somebody away illegally and keep them as a prisoner, especially in order to get money or something else for returning them
2905.example: Two businessmen have been kidnapped by terrorists.
2905.translation: 绑架（非法带走某人并将其扣押为囚犯，尤指为了勒索赎金）

2906.definition: either of the two organs in the body that remove waste products from the blood and produce urine
2906.translation: 肾脏（人体内从血液中移除废物并产生尿液的两个器官之一）

2907.example: kill (somebody/something), Cancer kills thousands of people every year.

2908.definition: an act of killing somebody deliberately
2908.example: Their leader condemned the torture and killing of innocent civilians.
2908.translation: 谋杀，杀戮（蓄意杀死某人的行为）

2909.definition: a unit for measuring distance; 1 000 metres
2909.example: The industrial estate is 6 kilometres from the city centre.
2909.translation: 千米，公里（长度测量单位；1000米）

2910.definition: caring about others; gentle, friendly and generous
2910.example: a very kind and helpful person
2910.translation: 仁慈的，友好的（关心他人；温和、友好且慷慨的）

2911.definition: a group of people or things that are the same in some way; a particular variety or type
2911.example: kind of somebody/something, three kinds of cakes/cake
2911.translation: 种类，类型（在某方面相同的一组人或物；特定品种）

2912.definition: the male ruler of an independent state that has a royal family
2912.example: the kings and queens of England
2912.translation: 国王（拥有皇室家族的独立国家的男性统治者）

2913.definition: a country that has a king or queen as head of state (= official leader of the country)
2913.translation: 王国（以国王或女王为国家首脑的国家）

2914.example: Come here and give me a kiss!
2914.translation: 吻（亲吻某人/某物的行为）

2915.definition: to touch somebody with your lips as a sign of love or sexual desire or when saying hello or goodbye
2915.example: They stood in a doorway kissing (= kissing each other).
2915.translation: 亲吻（作为爱、欲望或问候的表现用嘴唇接触某人）

2916.definition: a set of tools or equipment that you use for a particular purpose
2916.translation: 成套工具，装备（为了特定目的使用的一套工具或设备）

2917.definition: a room in which meals are cooked or prepared
2917.example: We ate at the kitchen table.
2917.translation: 厨房（烹饪或准备饭菜的房间）

2918.definition: the joint between the top and bottom parts of the leg where it bends in the middle
2918.translation: 膝盖（腿部上下两部分连接处的中间弯曲关节）

2919.definition: a sharp blade (= metal edge) with a handle, used for cutting or as a weapon
2919.translation: 刀（带有手柄的锋利刀刃，用于切割或作为武器）

2920.definition: the sound of somebody hitting a door, window, etc. with their hand or with something hard to attract attention
2920.example: knock on/at something, There was a knock at the door.
2920.translation: 敲门声（为了吸引注意用手或硬物敲击门、窗的声音）

2921.definition: to hit a door, etc. in order to attract attention
2921.example: He knocked three times and waited.
2921.translation: 敲，击（为了吸引注意而敲门等）

2922.definition: to have information in your mind as a result of experience or because you have learned or been told it
2922.example: know something, No one knows the answer.
2922.translation: 知道，了解（由于经验、学习或被告知而脑中拥有信息）

2923.definition: the information, understanding and skills that you gain through education or experience
2923.translation: 知识，学识（通过教育或经验获得的各种信息、理解和技能）

2925.definition: a piece of paper, etc. that is attached to something and that gives information about it
2925.translation: 标签，标记（贴在某物上并给出其信息的纸片等）

2926.definition: to fix a label on something or write information on something
2926.example: label something, Make sure that your luggage is clearly labelled.
2926.translation: 贴标签，标示（在某物上固定标签或写上信息）

2927.definition: a room or building used for scientific research, experiments, testing, etc.
2927.translation: 实验室（用于科学研究、实验、测试等的房间或建筑）

2928.example: manual labour (= work using your hands)
2928.translation: 劳动，劳动力（工作，尤其是体力工作）

2929.definition: the state of not having something or not having enough of something
2929.example: lack of something, a lack of understanding/knowledge
2929.translation: 缺乏（没有或没有足够的某物的状态）

2930.definition: to have none or not enough of something
2930.translation: 缺乏，缺少（完全没有或没有足够的某物）

2931.example: Things have changed since I was a lad.
2931.translation: 小伙子，少年（男孩或年轻男子）

2932.definition: a piece of equipment for climbing up and down a wall, the side of a building, etc., consisting of two lengths of wood or metal that are joined together by steps or rungs
2932.example: to climb up/fall off a ladder
2932.translation: 梯子（由两根木头或金属通过踏板连接的用于上下攀爬的设备）

2933.definition: a word used to mean ‘woman’ that some people, especially older people, consider is more polite
2933.example: There's a lady waiting to see you.
2933.translation: 女士，夫人（指代“女人”的礼貌词，尤受年长者青睐）

2934.definition: a large area of water that is surrounded by land
2934.example: in a lake, We swam in the lake.
2934.translation: 湖（被陆地环绕的大片水域）

2935.definition: a device that uses electricity, oil or gas to produce light
2935.translation: 灯（利用电、油或气体产生光线的装置）

2936.definition: the surface of the earth that is not sea
2936.example: The new project will reclaim the land from the sea.
2936.translation: 陆地，土地（地球表面非海洋的部分）

2937.definition: to come down through the air onto the ground or another surface
2937.translation: 着陆，降落（从空中降落到地面或其他表面）

2938.definition: an act of bringing an aircraft or a spacecraft down to the ground after a journey
2938.translation: 着陆，降落（飞机或航天器在旅程后降落到地面的行为）

2939.definition: a person or company from whom you rent a room, a house, an office, etc.
2939.example: a buy-to-let landlord (= who buys houses and flats in order to rent them out)
2939.translation: 房东，地主（你向其租用房间、房屋、办公室等的个人或公司）

2940.definition: something, such as a large building, that you can see clearly from a distance and that will help you to know where you are
2940.example: The Empire State Building is a familiar landmark on the New York skyline.
2940.translation: 地标，里程碑（从远处能清晰看到并有助于识别位置的大型建筑等）

2941.definition: everything you can see when you look across a large area of land, especially in the country
2941.example: the woods and fields that are typical features of the English landscape
2941.translation: 景观，风景（向远处眺望时看到的大片土地的全景，尤指在乡村）

2942.definition: a narrow road in the country
2942.translation: 小路，车道（乡村狭窄的道路；或车道）

2943.definition: the system of communication in speech and writing that is used by people of a particular country or area
2943.translation: 语言（特定国家或地区人们使用的口头和书面交流系统）

2944.definition: the top part of your legs that forms a flat surface when you are sitting down
2944.example: on somebody's lap, There's only one seat so you'll have to sit on my lap.
2944.translation: 大腿部（坐下时两腿顶部形成的平坦表面）

2945.definition: a small computer that can work with a battery and be easily carried
2945.example: I opened my laptop and started typing.
2945.translation: 笔记本电脑（可以电池供电且易于携带的小型电脑）

2946.translation: 大的（在尺寸或数量上很大的）

2947.definition: involving many people or things, especially over a wide area
2947.example: Large areas of the forest will be cleared for ranching as part of a large-scale development plan.
2947.translation: 大规模的（涉及许多人或物，尤指覆盖广泛区域的）

2948.definition: to a great extent; mostly or mainly
2948.example: The manager was largely responsible for the team’s victory.
2948.translation: 很大程度上（在很大程度上；主要地）

2949.definition: a device that gives out light in which all the waves oscillate (= change direction and strength) together, typically producing a powerful beam of light that can be used for cutting metal, in medical operations, etc.
2949.translation: 激光（产生所有波长同步振荡的光束的装置，常用于切割或医疗）

2950.definition: after anyone or anything else; at the end
2950.example: He came last in the race.
2950.translation: 最后地（在所有人或事之后；在结尾）

2951.definition: happening or coming after all other similar things or people
2951.example: We caught the last bus home.
2951.translation: 最后的（在所有其他同类事物或人之后发生的）

2952.definition: the person or thing that comes or happens after all other similar people or things
2952.example: Sorry I'm late—am I the last?
2952.translation: 最后的人或物（在所有其他同类人或物之后出现或发生的）

2953.definition: to continue for a particular period of time
2953.example: Each game lasts about an hour.
2953.translation: 持续（在一段时间内持续存在）

2954.definition: arriving, happening or done after the expected, arranged or usual time
2954.translation: 迟的，晚的（在预期、安排或通常时间之后到达或发生的）

2955.definition: after the expected, arranged or usual time
2955.translation: 迟地，晚地（在预期、安排或通常时间之后）

2956.translation: 最近，近来（在不久前的过去）

2957.definition: coming after something else or at a time in the future
2957.translation: 晚期的，后期的（在某事之后或在未来的时间）

2958.definition: at a time in the future; after the time you are talking about
2958.translation: 后来（在未来的某个时间；在你谈论的时间之后）

2959.translation: 最新的（最近的或最崭新的）

2960.definition: the most recent or the newest thing or piece of news
2960.example: the latest (in something), This is the latest in robot technology.
2960.translation: 最新消息/事物（最近的或最新的事物或新闻）

2961.definition: used to refer to the second of two things or people mentioned
2961.translation: （两者中的）后者（用于指代提到的两物或两人中的第二个）

2962.definition: the second of two things or people mentioned
2962.example: He presented two solutions. The latter seems much better.
2962.translation: 后者（提到的两物或两人中的第二个）

2963.definition: the sound you make when you think that something is funny or silly
2963.translation: 笑声，笑（认为某事滑稽或愚蠢时发出的响声）

2964.definition: to make the sounds and movements of your face that show you think something is funny or silly
2964.translation: 笑（认为某事滑稽或愚蠢时面部表现出的动作和声音）

2965.definition: the act or sound of laughing
2965.translation: 笑，笑声（笑的行为或声音）

2966.translation: 发射，启动（发射某物的行为，如导弹发射）

2967.definition: to start an activity, especially an organized one
2967.example: The government recently launched a national road safety campaign.
2967.translation: 发起，启动（开始一项活动，尤指有组织的活动）

2968.definition: a rule that deals with a particular crime, agreement, etc.
2968.example: to pass a law (= officially make it part of the system of laws)
2968.translation: 法律（涉及特定犯罪、协议等规则的总称）

2969.definition: an area of ground covered in short grass in a garden or park, or used for playing a game on
2969.example: In summer we have to mow the lawn twice a week.
2969.translation: 草坪（花园或公园里覆盖着短草的区域）

2970.definition: a claim or complaint against somebody that a person or an organization can make in court
2970.example: He filed a lawsuit against his record label.
2970.translation: 诉讼（个人或组织在法庭上向他人提出的索赔或投诉）

2971.definition: a person who is trained and qualified to advise people about the law and to represent them in court, and to write legal documents
2971.translation: 律师（受过法律训练并有资格提供建议、代理出庭及起草法律文件的人）

2972.definition: to put somebody/something in a particular position, especially when it is done gently or carefully
2972.example: lay somebody/something + adv./prep., He laid a hand on my arm.
2972.translation: 放置，铺设（将某人/某物放在特定位置，尤指轻轻地或小心地）

2973.definition: a quantity or sheet of something that lies over a surface or between surfaces
2973.example: layer (of something), A thin layer of dust covered everything.
2973.translation: 层（覆盖在表面或介于表面之间的一定量或一片物质）

2974.definition: the way in which the parts of something such as the page of a book, a website, a garden or a building are arranged
2974.translation: 布局（书籍页面、网站、花园或建筑各部分的排列方式）

2975.definition: unwilling to work or be active; doing as little as possible
2975.example: He was not stupid, just lazy.
2975.translation: 懒惰的（不愿工作或活动的；做得尽可能少的）

2977.definition: to go with or in front of a person or an animal to show the way or to make them go in the right direction
2977.translation: 引导（走在人或动物前面指路或使其向正确方向走）

2978.definition: a person who leads a group of people, especially the head of a country, an organization, etc.
2978.translation: 领导者（领导一群人的人，尤指国家、组织的首脑）

2979.definition: the state or position of being a leader
2979.translation: 领导地位（作为领导者的状态或职位）

2980.translation: 主要的，领先的（最重要的或最成功的）

2981.definition: a flat green part of a plant, growing from a stem or branch or from the root
2981.translation: 叶子（植物从茎或分枝长出的绿色扁平部分）

2982.definition: a printed sheet of paper or a few printed pages that are given free to advertise or give information about something
2982.example: We picked up a few leaflets on local places of interest.
2982.translation: 传单（免费分发的、用于广告或提供信息的打印纸张）

2983.definition: a group of sports teams who all play each other to earn points and find which team is best
2983.example: Castleford have led the league for most of the season.
2983.translation: 联盟，联赛（一组相互比赛以积分并决出最强队的体育团队）

2984.definition: a small hole that lets liquid or gas flow in or out of something by accident
2984.translation: 漏洞，泄漏（因意外导致液体或气体流出的孔洞）

2985.definition: to allow liquid or gas to get in or out through a small hole
2985.translation: 泄漏（使液体或气体通过小孔流出或流入）

2986.definition: to bend or move from a straight position to a sloping position
2986.example: I leaned back in my chair.
2986.translation: 倾斜（从垂直位置向侧面或向后弯曲或移动）

2987.translation: 跳跃（长距离或高度的跳跃）

2988.definition: to jump high or a long way
2988.example: + adv./prep., A dolphin leapt out of the water.

2989.definition: to gain knowledge or skill by studying, from experience, from being taught, etc.
2989.example: learn something, to learn a language/skill/trade
2989.translation: 学习（通过研究、经验、被教导等获得知识或技能）

2991.example: He always turns up just when you least expect him.

2992.definition: smallest in size, amount, degree, etc.
2992.example: He's the best teacher, even though he has the least experience.
2992.translation: 最少的（在尺寸、数量、程度等方面最小的）

2993.definition: smallest in size, amount, degree, etc.
2993.example: He's the best teacher, even though he has the least experience.
2993.translation: 最少（在尺寸、数量、程度等方面最小的量）

2994.definition: material made by removing the hair or fur from animal skins and preserving the skins using special processes
2994.translation: 皮革（通过去除动物皮上的毛并发酵等过程制成的材料）

2995.definition: a period of time when you are allowed to be away from work for a holiday or for a special reason
2995.example: to take a month’s paid/unpaid leave
2995.translation: 休假，假期（被允许离开工作去度假或因特殊原因休假的一段时间）

2996.definition: to go away from a person or a place
2996.example: Come on, it's time we left (= time for us to leave).

2997.definition: a talk that is given to a group of people to teach them about a particular subject, often as part of a university or college course
2997.translation: 讲座（向一群人教授特定主题的演说，常作为大学课程）
