3506.definition: if you nod, nod your head or your head nods, you move your head up and down to show agreement, understanding, etc.
3506.example: I asked him if he would help me and he nodded.
3506.translation: 点头（通过上下移动头部来表示同意、理解等）

3507.definition: a sound, especially when it is loud, unpleasant or frightening
3507.example: There was a rattling noise coming from the back of the car.
3507.translation: 噪音（响亮、不快或令人恐惧的声音）

3508.translation: 吵闹的（发出很大响声的）

3509.definition: to formally suggest that somebody/something should be chosen for an important role, prize, position, etc.
3509.example: nominate somebody/something (for something), She has been nominated for the presidency.
3509.translation: 提名（正式建议某人/某物被选为重要的角色、奖项或职位）

3510.definition: the act of suggesting or choosing somebody as a candidate in an election, or for a job or an award; the fact of being suggested for this
3510.example: Membership of the club is by nomination only.
3510.translation: 提名（建议或选择某人作为候选人或获奖者的行为）

3511.definition: a person who has been formally suggested for a job, a prize, etc.
3511.example: He was chosen as the party's presidential nominee.
3511.translation: 被提名者（被正式建议担任某工作或领取某奖项的人）

3512.definition: without the aim of making a profit
3512.translation: 非营利性的（不以营利为目的的）

3513.definition: not one of a group of people or things; not any
3513.translation: 一个也没有（一群人或物中没有任何一个）

3514.example: The book is too long but, nonetheless, informative and entertaining.
3514.translation: 尽管如此（尽管有此事实）

3515.definition: ideas, statements or beliefs that you think are silly or not true
3515.example: Reports that he has resigned are nonsense.
3515.translation: 废话，胡说（你认为愚蠢或不真实的想法、陈述或信念）

3516.definition: 12 o’clock in the middle of the day
3516.example: We should be there by noon.

3517.example: She seemed neither surprised nor worried.

3518.example: She seemed neither surprised nor worried.

3519.definition: a situation or a pattern of behaviour that is usual or expected
3519.example: The new design is a departure from the norm.
3519.translation: 规范，常态（通常或预期的行为模式或情况）

3520.definition: typical, usual or ordinary; what you would expect
3520.translation: 正常的（典型的、寻常的或普通的；预料中的）

3521.definition: the usual or average state, level or standard
3521.example: above/below normal, The rainfall has been above normal for the time of year.
3521.translation: 常态，正常水平（寻常或平均的状态、水平或标准）

3522.example: I would never normally discuss this.
3522.translation: 通常（通常地；在正常情况下）

3523.translation: 北方的（在北方或向北的）

3525.definition: the direction that is on your left when you watch the sun rise; one of the four main points of the compass
3525.translation: 北方（看日出时在你左侧的方向；罗盘四个主要点之一）

3526.definition: located in the north or facing north; connected with or typical of the north part of the world or a region
3526.example: the northern slopes of the mountains
3526.translation: 北方的（位于北方或面向北方的；与北方地区相关的）

3527.definition: the part of the face that sticks out above the mouth, used for breathing and smelling things
3527.example: She had dark eyes and a long narrow nose.
3527.translation: 鼻子（脸上突出的用于呼吸和嗅觉的部分）

3528.definition: used with be, do or have to form the negative of verbs; used to form the negative of modal verbs like can or must
3528.translation: 不（与be、do、have连用构成动词否定；或用于情态动词否定）

3529.definition: deserving to be noticed or to receive attention; important
3529.translation: 显著的，值得注意的（值得被注意或关注的；重要的）

3530.definition: used for giving a good or the most important example of something
3530.example: The house had many drawbacks, most notably its price.
3530.translation: 尤其是，特别地（用于给出某事物中一个好或最重要的例子）

3531.definition: a short piece of writing to help you remember something
3531.example: Please make a note of the dates.
3531.translation: 笔记，便条（为了帮助记忆而写的短句）

3532.definition: to notice or pay careful attention to something
3532.example: note something, Note the fine early Baroque altar inside the chapel.
3532.translation: 注意（察觉或仔细关注某事）

3533.definition: a small book of plain paper for writing notes in
3533.example: The police officer wrote the details down in his notebook.
3533.translation: 笔记本（用于记笔记的小薄本）

3534.example: There was nothing in her bag.
3534.translation: 没有什么（没有任何东西；没有任何一件事）

3535.definition: a sheet of paper giving written or printed information, usually put in a public place
3535.example: There was a notice on the board saying the class had been cancelled.
3535.translation: 通知，布告（通常张贴在公共场所的给出书面信息的一张纸）

3536.definition: to see or hear somebody/something; to become aware of somebody/something
3536.example: People were making fun of him but he didn't seem to notice.
3536.translation: 注意到（看到或听到某人/某事；察觉到）

3537.definition: to formally or officially tell somebody about something
3537.example: notify somebody, Competition winners will be notified by post.
3537.translation: 通知，告知（正式或官方地告诉某人某事）

3538.definition: an idea, a belief or an understanding of something
3538.example: notion of something, a political system based on the notions of equality and liberty
3538.translation: 观念，见解（对某事的想法、信仰或理解）

3539.translation: 臭名昭著的（因坏事而众所周知的）

3540.definition: different from anything known before; new, interesting and often seeming slightly strange
3540.translation: 新颖的（与以前所知不同的；新奇有趣的，常带有一点奇怪感）

3541.definition: a story long enough to fill a complete book, in which the characters and events are usually imaginary
3541.translation: 小说（足够填满一整本书的长篇虚构故事）

3543.definition: the 11th month of the year, between October and December
3543.translation: 十一月（一年中的第十一个月）

3545.definition: because the thing mentioned is happening or has just happened
3545.example: Now that the kids have left home we've got a lot of extra space.
3545.translation: 既然（因为提到的事情正在发生或刚刚发生）

3546.definition: at the present time, in contrast with the past
3546.example: Nowadays most kids prefer going online to reading books.
3546.translation: 现今（与过去相比的现时）

3547.definition: not in or to any place
3547.example: I had nowhere to live, so I was sleeping on my sister's couch.
3547.translation: 无处（不在或不到任何地方）

3548.definition: using, producing or resulting from nuclear energy
3548.translation: 核能的，原子的（使用、产生核能或由核能产生的）

3549.definition: a word or symbol that represents an amount or a quantity
3549.example: Think of a number and multiply it by two.
3549.translation: 数字，数量（代表数额或数量的词或符号）

3550.definition: to give a number to something as part of a series or list
3550.example: number something, All the seats in the stadium are numbered.
3550.translation: 给...编号（作为系列或列表的一部分给某物标号）

3551.example: He has been late on numerous occasions.
3551.translation: 许多的，众多的（大量存在的）

3552.definition: a person whose job is to take care of sick or injured people, usually in a hospital
3552.translation: 护士（工作是照料病人和伤员的人，通常在医院）

3553.definition: a place where young children are cared for while their parents are at work; a day nursery or nursery school
3553.example: at nursery, Her youngest child is at nursery now.
3553.translation: 托儿所（父母工作时照顾幼儿的地方）

3554.definition: the job or skill of caring for people who are sick or injured
3554.translation: 护理（照料病人和伤员的工作或技能）

3555.definition: a small hard fruit with a very hard shell that grows on some trees
3555.example: to crack a nut (= open it)
3555.translation: 坚果（生长在某些树上的带硬壳的小硬果）

3556.definition: the process by which living things receive the food necessary for them to grow and be healthy
3556.translation: 营养（生物摄取生长和健康所需食物的过程）

3557.definition: used with the numbers 1 to 12 when telling the time, to mean an exact hour
3557.example: He left between five and six o'clock.

3558.definition: the quality or fact of being very fat, in a way that is not healthy
3558.example: Obesity can increase the risk of heart disease.
3558.translation: 肥胖（过胖以至于不健康的品质或事实）

3559.definition: to do what you are told or expected to do
3559.example: obey something, to obey a command/an order/rules/the law
3559.translation: 服从（按被告知或被预期的要求去做）

3560.definition: a thing that can be seen and touched, but is not alive
3560.example: everyday objects such as cups and saucers
3560.translation: 物体，物体（能看见并触摸但没有生命的实体）

3561.definition: to say that you disagree with or oppose something
3561.example: If nobody objects, we'll postpone the meeting till next week.
3561.translation: 反对（表示不同意或反对某事）

3562.definition: a reason why you do not like or are opposed to something; a statement about this
3562.example: I'd like to come too, if you have no objection.
3562.translation: 反对，异议（不喜欢或反对某事的理由；相关的陈述）

3563.definition: not influenced by personal feelings or opinions; considering only facts
3563.example: an objective assessment of the situation
3563.translation: 客观的（不受个人感情影响的；仅考虑事实的）

3564.definition: something that you are trying to achieve
3564.translation: 目标（你试图实现的事物）

3565.definition: the state of being forced to do something because it is your duty, or because of a law, etc.
3565.example: obligation to do something, You are under no obligation to buy anything.
3565.translation: 义务（因职责、法律等而被迫做某事的状态）

3566.definition: to force somebody to do something, by law, because it is a duty, etc.
3566.example: Parents are obliged by law to send their children to school.
3566.translation: 迫使（因法律或职责等迫使某人做某事）

3567.definition: the act of watching somebody/something carefully for a period of time, especially to learn something
3567.example: Most information was collected by direct observation of the animals' behaviour.
3567.translation: 观察（在一段时间内仔细观看某人/某事，尤指为了学习）

3568.example: observe somebody/something, Have you observed any changes lately?
3568.translation: 观察（看到或察觉到某人/某物）

3569.example: According to observers, the plane exploded shortly after take-off.
3569.translation: 观察者（观看某人/某事的人）

3570.definition: to completely fill your mind so that you cannot think of anything else, in a way that is not reasonable or normal
3570.example: be obsessed by somebody/something, He's obsessed by computers.
3570.translation: 使着迷（以一种不合理的方式完全占据某人的头脑）

3571.definition: the state in which a person’s mind is completely filled with thoughts of one particular thing or person in a way that is not reasonable or normal
3571.example: Her fear of flying is bordering on obsession.
3571.translation: 痴迷（脑中完全充满了对某人/某事想法的状态，常不合理）

3572.definition: a situation, an event, etc. that makes it difficult for you to do or achieve something
3572.example: So far, we have managed to overcome all the obstacles that have been placed in our path.
3572.translation: 障碍（使你难以去做或实现某事的情况、事件等）

3573.definition: to get something, especially by making an effort
3573.translation: 获得（获得某物，尤指通过努力）

3574.example: I know you don't like her but try not to make it so obvious.
3574.translation: 明显的（易于看见或理解的）

3575.definition: used when giving information that you expect other people to know already or agree with
3575.example: Obviously, we don't want to spend too much money.
3575.translation: 显而易见地（用于给出你预料他人已知道或同意的信息）

3576.definition: a particular time when something happens
3576.example: on an occasion, on this/that occasion
3576.translation: 时刻，场合（某事发生的特定时间）

3577.definition: happening or done sometimes but not often
3577.example: He works for us on an occasional basis.
3577.translation: 偶尔的（有时发生或做的，但不频繁）

3578.example: We occasionally meet for a drink after work.
3578.translation: 偶尔地（有时但不是经常地）

3579.example: Please state your name, age and occupation below.

3580.definition: to fill or use a space, an area or an amount of time
3580.example: The bed seemed to occupy most of the room.
3580.translation: 占据（填充或使用空间、区域或一段时间）

3581.example: When exactly did the incident occur?

3582.translation: 发生的事情（发生或存在的事物）

3583.definition: the mass of salt water that covers most of the earth’s surface
3583.example: The ship was dredged from the depths of the ocean.
3583.translation: 海洋（覆盖地球表面大部分区域的大片咸水）

3584.definition: the 10th month of the year, between September and November
3584.translation: 十月（一年中的第十个月）

3585.translation: 奇特的，古怪的（奇怪或不寻常的）

3586.definition: the degree to which something is likely to happen
3586.example: The odds are very much in our favour (= we are likely to succeed).
3586.translation: 几率，胜算（某事发生的可能性程度）

3587.definition: belonging to somebody; relating to somebody
3587.translation: ...的（属于某人的；与某人相关的）

3588.definition: used to say that something has been removed or become separated
3588.example: He's had his beard shaved off.
3588.translation: 掉，脱落（用于说明某物被移除或分开了）

3589.definition: down or away from a place or at a distance in space or time
3589.translation: 离开，从...（从某处向下、移开或在空间/时间上有距离）

3590.translation: 犯罪，违法行为（违法行为）

3591.definition: to make somebody feel upset because of something you say or do that is rude or embarrassing
3591.example: They'll be offended if you don't go to their wedding.
3591.translation: 冒犯（因粗鲁或令人尴尬的言行使某人感到不快）

3592.definition: a person who commits a crime
3592.translation: 违法者（犯罪的人，尤指惯犯）

3593.definition: rude in a way that causes somebody to feel upset or annoyed because it shows a lack of respect
3593.translation: 冒犯性的（因缺乏尊重而使人感到不快或恼火的言行）

3594.definition: an act of saying that you are willing to do something for somebody or give something to somebody
3594.translation: 提议，出价（表示愿意为某人做某事或给予某物的行为）

3595.definition: to say that you are willing to give something to somebody
3595.example: offer (something), Josie had offered her services as a guide.
3595.translation: 提供（表示愿意给某人某物）

3596.definition: something that is produced for other people to use, watch, enjoy, etc.
3596.example: the latest offering from the Canadian-born writer
3596.translation: 提供的作品/物品（为他人使用、观看、欣赏而生产出来的东西）

3597.definition: a room, set of rooms or building where people work, usually sitting at desks
3597.example: The company is moving to new offices on the other side of town.
3597.translation: 办公室（人们通常坐在办公桌前工作的房间或建筑）

3598.definition: a person who is in a position of authority in the armed forces
3598.translation: 官员，军官（在武装部队中担任领导职位的人）

3599.definition: agreed to, said, done, etc. by somebody who is in a position of authority
3599.translation: 官方的（由具有权力的人同意、说出、做出的）

3600.definition: a person who is in a position of authority in a large organization
3600.example: She is the government official in charge of the project.
3600.translation: 官员（在大型组织中担任管理职位的人）

3601.definition: a child of a particular person or couple
3601.example: the problems parents have with their teenage offspring
3601.translation: 后代，子女（特定人或夫妇的孩子）

3603.definition: used when you are reacting to something that has been said, especially if you did not know it before
3603.example: ‘I saw Ben yesterday.’ ‘Oh yes, how is he?’
3603.translation: 噢（对刚听到或不知道的事产生反应时使用）

3604.definition: a thick liquid that is found in rock underground
3604.example: Several companies are drilling for oil in the region.
3604.translation: 油，石油（在地底岩石中发现的浓稠液体）

3605.definition: safe and well; in a calm or happy state
3605.translation: 好的（安全健康的；处于冷静或快乐状态的）

3606.definition: safe and well; in a calm or happy state
3606.translation: 好的（安全健康的；处于冷静或快乐状态的）

3608.example: be… years, months, etc. old, The baby was only a few hours old.

3609.translation: 过时的（不现代的；不再流行的）

3610.translation: 穿上，戴上（在身体上；穿着状态）

3611.definition: in or into a position covering, touching or forming part of a surface
3611.translation: 在...上（在覆盖、接触或形成表面一部分的位置）

3612.definition: on one occasion only; one time

3613.example: We didn't know how we would cope once the money had gone.

3614.example: Do you want one or two?

3615.example: Do you want one or two?

3616.definition: used to avoid repeating a noun, when you are referring to somebody/something that has already been mentioned, or that the person you are speaking to knows about
3616.example: I'd like an ice cream. Are you having one, too?
3616.translation: （代词）一个（用于避免名词重复，指代已提到或已知的人或物）

3617.translation: 进行中的（持续存在或发展的）

3618.definition: a round vegetable with many layers inside each other and a brown, red or white skin. Onions have a strong smell and taste.
3618.translation: 洋葱（带有许多层次、皮棕/红/白色的圆形蔬菜，气味重）

3619.definition: available on or done using the internet or other computer network
3619.example: Online shopping is both cheap and convenient.
3619.translation: 在线的（在互联网或计算机网络上可用或进行的）

3620.definition: onto the internet; using the internet or other computer network
3620.example: Many children would rather go online than watch television.
3620.translation: 在线地（连接到互联网；使用互联网或计算机网络）

3621.definition: used to say that no other or others of the same group exist or are there
3621.translation: 唯一的（表示该群体中没有其他的人或物）

3622.example: There are only a limited number of tickets available.
3622.translation: 只有，仅仅（除了...之外别无）

3623.definition: used with verbs to express movement on or to a particular place or position
3623.example: Move the books onto the second shelf.
3623.translation: 到...之上（与动词连用表示向特定位置移动）

3624.definition: allowing things or people to go through; not closed or blocked
3624.example: A wasp flew in the open window.
3624.translation: 开着的（允许事物或人通过的；未关闭或阻塞的）

3625.definition: to move a door, window, lid, etc. into a position that is no longer closed; to get into this position
3625.example: Mr Chen opened the car door for his wife.
3625.translation: 打开（将门、盖等移至不再关闭的位置）

3626.definition: a space or hole that somebody/something can pass through
3626.example: We could see the stars through an opening in the roof.
3626.translation: 开口，孔（某人/某物能通过的空间或孔洞）

3627.definition: without hiding any feelings, opinions or information
3627.example: Can you talk openly about sex with your parents?
3627.translation: 公开地（不隐藏任何感情、观点或信息地）

3628.definition: a dramatic work in which all or most of the words are sung to music; works of this type as an art form or entertainment
3628.translation: 歌剧（全部或大部分台词用歌唱表现的戏剧作品）

3629.definition: to work in a particular way
3629.example: Most domestic freezers operate at below −18°C.
3629.translation: 运作，操作（以特定方式工作）

3630.definition: the process of cutting open a part of a person’s body in order to remove or repair a damaged part
3630.example: Will I need to have an operation?
3630.translation: 手术（为了移除或修复受损部位而切开人体的过程）

3631.definition: connected with the way in which a business, machine, system, etc. works
3631.translation: 运作的（与业务、机器、系统运行方式相关的）

3632.definition: a person who operates equipment or a machine
3632.translation: 操作员（操作设备或机器的人）

3633.definition: your feelings or thoughts about somebody/something, rather than a fact
3633.example: He has very strong political opinions.
3633.translation: 观点，意见（对某事的感觉或想法，而非事实）

3634.definition: a person that you are playing or fighting against in a game, competition, argument, etc.
3634.translation: 对手（在游戏、比赛、争论等中与你对抗的人）

3635.definition: a time when a particular situation makes it possible to do or achieve something
3635.translation: 机会（使实现某事成为可能的时机或情况）

3636.definition: to disagree strongly with somebody’s plan, policy, etc. and try to change it or prevent it from succeeding
3636.example: oppose somebody/something, This party would bitterly oppose the re-introduction of the death penalty.
3636.translation: 反对（强烈不同意某人的计划、政策并试图阻止其成功）

3637.definition: disagreeing strongly with something and trying to stop it
3637.example: opposed to something, He was strongly opposed to modernism in art.
3637.translation: 反对的（强烈不同意某事并试图停止它的）

3638.definition: on the other side of a particular area from somebody/something and usually facing them
3638.example: Answers are given on the opposite page.
3638.translation: 对面的（在特定区域另一侧并通常面向某人/某物的）

3639.definition: on the other side of a particular area from somebody/something and usually facing them
3639.example: There's a newly married couple living opposite (= on the other side of the road).
3639.translation: 在对面（在特定区域另一侧）

3640.definition: a person or thing that is as different as possible from somebody/something else
3640.translation: 相反的事物（与某人/某物尽可能不同的事物）

3641.definition: on the other side of a particular area from somebody/something, and usually facing them
3641.example: I sat opposite him during the meal (= on the other side of the table).
3641.translation: 在...对面（在某人/某物另一侧且通常面向其）

3642.definition: the act of strongly disagreeing with somebody/something, especially with the aim of preventing something from happening
3642.translation: 反对（强烈不同意某人/某事，尤指为了阻止其发生）

3643.definition: to choose to take or not to take a particular course of action
3643.example: opt for/against something, After graduating she opted for a career in music.
3643.translation: 选择（选择采取或不采取特定的行动方案）

3644.definition: connected with the sense of sight or the relationship between light and sight
3644.translation: 光学的（与视觉或光与视觉的关系相关的）

3645.definition: a feeling that good things will happen and that something will be successful
3645.translation: 乐观（相信好事会发生且某事会成功的这种感觉）

3646.definition: expecting good things to happen or something to be successful; showing this feeling
3646.example: We are now taking a more optimistic view.
3646.translation: 乐观的（期待好事发生或某事成功的）

3647.definition: something that you can choose to have or do; the freedom to choose what you do
3647.example: As I see it, we have two options…
3647.translation: 选择，选项（你可以选择拥有或做的事物；选择的自由）

3648.example: Is your sister older or younger than you?
3648.translation: 或者（用于引入另一种可能性）

3649.example: a test of both oral and written French
3649.translation: 口头的（口说的而非书写的）

3650.definition: between red and yellow in colour
3650.translation: 橙色的（介于红色和黄色之间的颜色）

3651.definition: a round citrus fruit with thick skin of a colour between red and yellow and a lot of sweet juice
3651.translation: 橙子，柑橘（圆形柑橘类水果，皮色介于红黄之间，果汁甜）

3652.definition: a large group of people who play various musical instruments together, led by a conductor
3652.example: She plays the flute in the school orchestra.
3652.translation: 管弦乐队（在指挥带领下一起演奏多种乐器的大型团体）

3653.definition: the way in which people or things are placed or arranged in relation to each other
3653.example: in… order, The names are listed in alphabetical order.
3653.translation: 顺序（人或物相互排列的方式）

3654.definition: to ask for something to eat or drink in a restaurant, bar, etc.
3654.example: order (something), I ordered a coffee and a sandwich.
3654.translation: 订购，点餐（在餐厅等要求食物或饮料）

3655.definition: not unusual or different in any way
3655.translation: 平凡的（没有任何不寻常或不同的）

3656.definition: a part of the body that has a particular purpose, such as the heart or the brain; part of a plant with a particular purpose
3656.translation: 器官（身体中具有特定用途的部分，如心脏或大脑）

3657.definition: produced or practised without using artificial chemicals
3657.translation: 有机的（不使用人工化学物质生产或实践的）

3658.definition: a group of people who form a business, club, etc. together in order to achieve a particular aim
3658.example: He's the president of a large international organization.
3658.translation: 组织，机构（为了实现特定目标共同组成的业务、俱乐部等）

3659.definition: connected with the way in which the different parts of something are arranged; connected with an organization
3659.translation: 组织的（与事物各部分的排列或与组织相关的）

3660.definition: to make all the arrangements for something to happen or be provided
3660.example: He helped to organize various events.
3660.translation: 组织（为某事的发生或提供做出所有安排）

3661.definition: involving large numbers of people who work together to do something in a way that has been carefully planned
3661.translation: 有组织的（涉及大量人员协作且经过仔细计划的）

3662.definition: a person who makes the arrangements for something
3662.translation: 组织者（为某事做出安排的人）

3663.definition: a person’s basic beliefs or feelings about a particular subject
3663.translation: 取向，定位（一个人对特定主题的基本信念或感觉）

3664.definition: the point from which something starts; the cause of something
3664.example: origin of something, the origins of life on earth
3664.translation: 起源，起因（某事开始的点；某事的原因）

3665.definition: existing at the beginning of a particular period, process or activity
3665.example: The room still has many of its original features.
3665.translation: 原始的，最初的（在特定时期、过程或活动开始时存在的）

3666.definition: a document, work of art, etc. produced for the first time, from which copies are later made
3666.example: This painting is a copy; the original is in Madrid.
3666.translation: 原件，原作（首次制作的文件、艺术品，副本由此产生）

3667.definition: used to describe the situation that existed at the beginning of a particular period or activity, especially before something was changed
3667.example: The school was originally very small.
3667.translation: 最初（用于描述在改变前、在一段时期开端存在的情况）

3668.definition: to happen or appear for the first time in a particular place or situation
3668.example: The disease is thought to have originated in the tropics.
3668.translation: 起源于（在特定地点或情况首次发生或出现）

3669.definition: used to refer to people or things that are additional or different to people or things that have been mentioned or are known about
3669.example: Mr Harris and Mrs Bate and three other teachers were there.
3669.translation: 其他的（用于指代提到或已知的之外的人或物）

3670.definition: used to refer to people or things that are additional or different to people or things that have been mentioned or are known about
3670.example: Mr Harris and Mrs Bate and three other teachers were there.
3670.translation: 其他的（用于指代提到或已知的之外的人或物）

3671.definition: used to state what the result would be if something did not happen or if the situation were different
3671.example: My parents lent me the money. Otherwise, I couldn't have afforded the trip.
3671.translation: 否则（用于说明如果情况不同或某事不发生会产生什么结果）

3672.definition: used to say what is the right thing to do
3672.translation: 应当（用于表示什么是正确该做的事）

3673.definition: belonging to us; connected with us
3673.translation: 我们的（属于我们的；与我们相关的）

3674.definition: the one or ones that belong to us
3674.example: Their house is very similar to ours, but ours is bigger.
3674.translation: 我们的（属于我们的那一个或那些）

3675.definition: the reflexive form of we; used when you and another person or other people together cause and are affected by an action
3675.example: We shouldn't blame ourselves for what happened.

3676.definition: away from the inside of a place or thing
3676.example: She ran out into the corridor.

3677.definition: away from the inside of a place or thing
3677.example: She ran out into the corridor.

3678.definition: the sudden start of something unpleasant, especially violence or a disease
3678.translation: 爆发（不快之事——尤指暴力或疾病——的突然开始）

3679.definition: the result or effect of an action or event
3679.example: The likely outcome is a compromise.
3679.translation: 结果（行动或事件的结果或影响）

3680.definition: used, happening or located outside rather than in a building
3680.translation: 户外的（在户外而非在建筑内使用、发生或位于户外的）

3681.definition: outside, rather than in a building
3681.example: The rain prevented them from eating outdoors.
3681.translation: 在户外（在外面，而非在建筑内部）

3682.example: the outer layers of the skin

3683.definition: a set of clothes that you wear together, especially for a particular occasion or purpose
3683.example: She was wearing an expensive new outfit.
3683.translation: 全套服装（为了特定场合或目的穿在一起的一套衣服）

3684.definition: a trip that you go on for pleasure or education, usually with a group of people and lasting no more than one day
3684.translation: 远足，郊游（为了娱乐或教育进行的短途旅行，通常为期一天内）

3685.definition: a shop or an organization that sells goods made by a particular company or of a particular type
3685.example: The business has 34 retail outlets in this state alone.
3685.translation: 零售店，直销店（销售特定公司或特定类型商品的商店或组织）

3686.definition: a description of the main facts or points involved in something
3686.example: outline of something, This is a brief outline of the events.
3686.translation: 概要（涉及某事的主要事实或要点的描述）

3687.definition: to give a description of the main facts or points involved in something
3687.example: outline something, He outlined his plan to leave St. Petersburg.
3687.translation: 概述（给出涉及某事的主要事实或要点的描述）

3688.definition: the attitude to life and the world of a particular person, group or culture
3688.translation: 观点，看法（特定个人、群体或文化对生活和世界的态度）

3689.definition: the amount of something that a person, a machine or an organization produces
3689.example: Manufacturing output has increased by 8 per cent.
3689.translation: 产量，产出（人、机器或组织生产的某物的数量）

3690.definition: a strong feeling of shock and anger
3690.example: The judge's remarks caused public outrage.
3690.translation: 愤慨，义愤（极度震惊和愤怒的感觉）

3691.definition: to make somebody very shocked and angry
3691.example: He was outraged at the way he had been treated.
3691.translation: 激怒（使某人感到极度震惊和愤怒）

3692.definition: of, on or facing the outer side
3692.translation: 外面的（外部的，面向外侧的）

3693.definition: not in a room, building or container but on or to the outside of it
3693.example: I'm seeing a patient—please wait outside.
3693.translation: 在外面（不在房间、建筑内而是在其外部）

3694.definition: the outer side or surface of something
3694.example: The outside of the house needs painting.

3695.definition: on or to a place on the outside of something
3695.example: You can park your car outside our house.
3695.translation: 在...外面（在某物外部的某个地方）

3696.definition: a person who is not accepted as a member of a society, group, etc.
3696.example: Here she felt she would always be an outsider.
3696.translation: 局外人（不被社会、群体等接受为成员的人）

3697.translation: 出色的，杰出的（极其好的；优秀的）

3698.definition: the part of a cooker that is like a box with a door on the front, in which food is cooked or heated
3698.example: Take the cake out of the oven.
3698.translation: 烤箱（炊具中像盒子一样的部分，带前门，用于烹饪或加热食物）

3699.definition: across a street, an open space, etc.
3699.translation: 越过（穿过街道、开阔空间等）

3700.definition: resting on the surface of somebody/something and partly or completely covering them/it
3700.example: She put a blanket over the sleeping child.
3700.translation: 在...上方（在某人/某物表面之上，并部分或全部遮盖）

3701.definition: including all the things or people that are involved in a particular situation; general
3701.example: There will be winners in each of three age groups, and one overall winner.
3701.translation: 全面的，总体的（包括特定情况涉及的所有人或物；总体的）

3702.definition: including everything or everyone; in total
3702.example: The company will invest $1.6m overall in new equipment.
3702.translation: 总共，总计（包括一切或所有人；总计）

3703.definition: to succeed in dealing with or controlling a problem that has been preventing you from achieving something
3703.example: She overcame injury to win the Olympic gold medal.
3703.translation: 克服，控制（成功处理或控制阻碍你实现目标的问题）

3704.definition: to fail to see or notice something
3704.example: He seems to have overlooked one important fact.
3704.translation: 忽视，忽略（未能看到或注意到某事）

3705.example: I'm not overly fond of pasta.

3706.example: We stayed overnight in London after the theatre.
3706.translation: 在夜间，一夜之间（在夜间或持续整个晚上）

3707.definition: connected with foreign countries, especially those separated from your country by the sea or ocean
3707.example: The firm is expanding into overseas markets.
3707.translation: 海外的，国外的（与外国相关的，尤指隔海相望的国家）

3708.definition: to or in a foreign country, especially those separated from your country by the sea or ocean
3708.translation: 在海外，向国外（到外国或在外国，尤指隔海相望的国家）

3709.definition: to watch somebody/something and make sure that a job or an activity is done correctly
3709.example: United Nations observers oversaw the elections.
3709.translation: 监督，监视（观看某人/某物并确保工作或活动正确进行）

3710.definition: if something overturns, or if somebody overturns it, it turns into a position in which the top of it is where the bottom of it normally is or on its side
3710.translation: 推翻，翻转（使某物翻转到顶部朝下或侧向的位置）

3711.definition: to have such a strong emotional effect on somebody that it is difficult for them to resist or know how to react
3711.example: She was overwhelmed by feelings of guilt.
3711.translation: 使受不了，淹没（产生极强烈的情感影响，使人难以抵抗或不知如何反应）

3712.definition: very great or very strong; so powerful that you cannot resist it or decide how to react
3712.example: The evidence against him was overwhelming.
3712.translation: 压倒性的，巨大的（极大的或极强烈的；强大到无法抵抗或不知如何反应）

3713.definition: to have to pay somebody for something that you have already received or return money that you have borrowed
3713.example: owe somebody something, She still owes her father £3 000.
3713.translation: 欠（必须为已收到的东西付钱，或归还借来的钱）

3714.definition: used to emphasize that something belongs to or is connected with somebody
3714.translation: 自己的（用于强调某物属于某人或与其相关）

3715.definition: used to emphasize that something belongs to or is connected with somebody
3715.translation: 自己的（用于强调某物属于某人或与其相关）

3716.definition: to have something that belongs to you, especially because you have bought it
3716.example: Do you own your house or do you rent it?
3716.translation: 拥有（拥有属于你的东西，尤指通过购买获得的）

3717.translation: 所有者，物主（拥有某物的人）

3718.translation: 所有权（拥有某物的事实）

3719.definition: a chemical element. Oxygen is a gas that is present in air and water and is necessary for people, animals and plants to live.
3719.example: The patient didn't seem to be getting enough oxygen.
3719.translation: 氧气（存在于空气和水中、维持生命必需的化学元素气体）

3720.definition: the speed at which somebody/something walks, runs or moves
3720.example: at a… pace, to set off at a steady/gentle/leisurely pace
3720.translation: 速度，步调（某人/某物行走、奔跑或移动的速度）

3721.definition: to walk up and down in a small area many times, especially because you are feeling nervous or angry
3721.example: + adv./prep., She paced up and down outside the room.
3721.translation: 踱步（在狭小区域内多次来回走动，尤指因紧张或愤怒）

3722.definition: a container, usually made of paper, that holds a number of the same thing or an amount of something, ready to be sold
3722.example: pack of something, a pack of cigarettes/gum
3722.translation: 包，捆（通常为纸制，装有一定数量同类物品供售卖的容器）

3723.definition: to put clothes, etc. into a bag in preparation for a trip away from home
3723.translation: 打包，收拾（将衣服等放入包中准备外出旅行）

3724.definition: something that is wrapped in paper or put into a thick envelope so that it can be sent by mail, carried easily, or given as a present
3724.example: A large package has arrived for you.
3724.translation: 包裹（用纸包装或装在厚信封中寄送、携带或作为礼物的物品）

3725.definition: to put something into a box, bag, etc. to be sold or transported
3725.translation: 包装（将某物放入盒子、袋子等以便售卖或运输）

3726.definition: a small container made of paper or card in which goods are packed for selling
3726.translation: 小包（装有供售卖商品的纸或卡片制成的小容器）

3727.definition: a thick piece of soft material that is used, for example, for cleaning or protecting something or for holding liquid
3727.example: medicated cleansing pads for sensitive skin
3727.translation: 垫，护垫（用于清洁、保护或吸液的厚软材料块）

3728.definition: one side or both sides of a sheet of paper in a book, magazine, etc.
3728.translation: 页（书、杂志等中纸张的一面或两面）

3729.definition: the feelings that you have in your body when you have been hurt or when you are ill
3729.translation: 疼痛（受伤或生病时身体产生的感觉）

3731.definition: a liquid that is put on surfaces to give them a particular colour; a layer of this liquid when it has dried on a surface
3731.translation: 油漆，涂料（涂在表面赋予颜色的液体；或干后的涂层）

3732.definition: to cover a surface or object with paint
3732.example: paint something with something, Paint the shed with weather-resistant paint.
3732.translation: 油漆，绘画（用油漆覆盖表面或物体）

3733.definition: a person whose job is painting buildings, walls, etc.
3733.example: He works as a painter and decorator.
3733.translation: 油漆工（职业是给建筑、墙壁等刷油漆的人）

3734.definition: a picture that has been painted

3735.definition: two things of the same type, especially when they are used or worn together
3735.translation: 一对，一双（两件同类型的物品，尤指配套使用或穿戴的）

3736.definition: the official home of a king, queen, president, etc.
3736.translation: 宫殿（国王、女王、总统等的官方住所）

3737.definition: having skin that is very light in colour; having skin that has less colour than usual because of illness, a strong emotion, etc.
3737.translation: 苍白的（肤色很浅的；或因病、激动导致面色无华的）

3738.definition: a straight tree with a mass of long leaves at the top, growing in tropical countries. There are several types of palm tree, some of which produce fruit.
3738.translation: 棕榈树（热带国家生长的一种顶部有长叶的长直树木）

3740.definition: a square or rectangular piece of wood, glass or metal that forms part of a larger surface such as a door or wall
3740.example: One of the glass panels in the front door was cracked.
3740.translation: 面板，镶板（构成门、墙等大表面一部分的正方形或长方形木/玻璃/金属片）

3741.definition: a sudden feeling of great fear that cannot be controlled and prevents you from thinking clearly
3741.translation: 恐慌（无法控制且阻碍清晰思考的突然的极大恐惧感）

3743.definition: the thin material that you write and draw on and that is also used for wrapping and packing things
3743.translation: 纸（用于书写、绘图及包装的薄材料）

3744.definition: a public celebration of a special day or event, usually with bands in the streets and decorated vehicles
3744.translation: 游行（特殊节日或事件的公众庆祝活动，常有乐队和彩车）

3745.definition: a section of a piece of writing, usually consisting of several sentences dealing with a single subject. The first sentence of a paragraph starts on a new line.
3745.translation: 段落（文章的一节，通常由数句组成，首行缩进）

3746.definition: two or more lines that are parallel to each other are the same distance apart at every point
3746.translation: 平行的（两条或多条线间距处处相等）

3747.definition: a person, a situation, an event, etc. that is very similar to another, especially one in a different place or time
3747.example: These ideas have parallels in Freud's thought too.
3747.translation: 相似物，平行（与另一人/事非常相似的人、情况或事件，尤指在不同时空）

3748.definition: something that decides or limits the way in which something can be done
3748.translation: 参数（决定或限制某事完成方式的因素）

3749.example: He's still living with his parents.

3750.definition: connected with a parent or parents

3751.definition: an area that has its own church and that a priest is responsible for
3751.translation: 教区（拥有自己的教堂并由一名牧师负责的区域）

3752.definition: an area of public land in a town or a city where people go to walk, play and relax
3752.translation: 公园（城镇中供人散步、玩耍和放松的公共绿地）

3753.definition: to leave a vehicle that you are driving in a particular place for a period of time
3753.translation: 停车（将驾驶的车辆留在某处一段时间）

3754.definition: the act of stopping a vehicle at a place and leaving it there for a period of time
3754.example: There is no parking here between 9 a.m. and 6 p.m.
3754.translation: 停车（停止车辆并将其留在某处一段时间的行为）

3755.definition: the group of people who are elected to make and change the laws of a country
3755.example: The German parliament is called the ‘Bundestag’.
3755.translation: 议会，国会（被选出制定和修改国家法律的群体）

3756.definition: connected with a parliament; having a parliament
3756.translation: 议会的（与议会相关的；拥有议会的）

3757.definition: some but not all of a thing
3757.example: We spent part of the time in the museum.
3757.translation: 部分（事物的一部分，而非全部）

3758.definition: for part of the day or week in which people work
3758.example: She's looking for a part-time job.
3758.translation: 兼职的（仅占据部分工作或学习时间的）

3759.example: It was only a partial solution to the problem.
3759.translation: 部分的，局部的（不完全或不完整的）

3760.example: The road was partially blocked by a fallen tree.
3760.translation: 部分地（在某种程度上；不完全地）

3761.definition: a person who is taking part in an activity or event
3761.example: The average age of study participants was 48 years.
3761.translation: 参与者（参加活动或事件的人）

3762.definition: to take part in or become involved in an activity
3762.example: Anyone who wishes to participate is welcome.
3762.translation: 参与（参加或投入某项活动）

3763.definition: the act of taking part in an activity or event
3763.example: a show with lots of audience participation
3763.translation: 参与（参加活动或事件的行为）

3764.definition: used to emphasize that you are referring to one individual person, thing or type of thing and not others
3764.example: There is one particular patient I'd like you to see.
3764.translation: 特定的（用于强调指代某个体，而非其他）

3765.definition: especially; more than usual or more than others
3765.translation: 特别地（尤其地；比通常或比其他更甚地）

3766.example: Some people are unwilling to attend the classes partly because of the cost involved.
3766.translation: 部分地（在某种程度上；不完全地）

3767.definition: a person that you are doing an activity with, such as dancing or playing a game
3767.translation: 伙伴，搭档（与你共同进行某项活动的人，如跳舞或游戏）

3768.definition: the state of being a partner in business
3768.example: to be in/to go into partnership
3768.translation: 合伙关系（在商业中担任合伙人的状态）

3769.definition: a social occasion, often in a person’s home, at which people eat, drink, talk, dance and enjoy themselves
3769.translation: 聚会，政党（社交场合；或政党）

3770.definition: an official document or ticket that shows that you have the right to enter or leave a place, to travel on a bus or train, etc.
3770.example: a boarding pass (= for a plane)
3770.translation: 通行证，入场券（证明你有权进入、离开或乘坐交通工具的官方文件或票据）

3771.definition: to achieve the required standard in an exam, a test, etc.
3771.example: I'm not really expecting to pass first time.
3771.translation: 通过（达到考试、测试要求的标准）

3772.definition: a long narrow area with walls on either side that connects one room or place with another
3772.example: A dark narrow passage led to the main hall.
3772.translation: 过道，通道（连接两房间或地方的两侧带墙的长窄区域）

3773.definition: a person who is travelling in a car, bus, train, plane or ship and who is not driving it or working on it
3773.translation: 乘客（乘车、船、飞机等旅行且非驾驶或工作人员的人）

3774.definition: the process of time going by
3774.example: The colour of the wood darkens with the passing of time.

3775.definition: a very strong feeling of love, hate, anger, enthusiasm, etc.
3775.example: I admire the passion and commitment shown by the players.
3775.translation: 激情（爱、恨、愤怒、热情等极强烈的情感）

3776.definition: having or showing strong feelings of sexual love or of anger, etc.
3776.translation: 热情的（具有或表现出强烈情感的）

3777.definition: accepting what happens or what people do without trying to change anything or oppose them
3777.example: He played a passive role in the relationship.
3777.translation: 被动的（不试图改变或反对，顺从发生之事的）

3778.definition: an official document that identifies you as a citizen of a particular country, and that you may have to show when you enter or leave a country
3778.translation: 护照（证明国籍身份、出入国境时需出示的官方文件）

3779.definition: a series of letters, numbers, etc. that you must type into a computer or computer system in order to be able to use it
3779.example: Enter a username and password to get into the system.
3779.translation: 密码（进入电脑系统必须输入的一系列字符）

3780.translation: 过去的（在时间上已经过去的）

3781.definition: from one side of something to the other
3781.example: She smiled at me as she walked past.

3782.definition: the time that has gone by; things that happened in an earlier time
3782.example: in the past, I used to go there often in the past.
3782.translation: 过去（已经流逝的时间；早期发生的事件）

3783.translation: 晚于...（在时间上晚于某点）

3784.definition: a minister in charge of a Christian church or group, especially in some Nonconformist churches
3784.example: He was ordained a pastor in the Lutheran Church.
3784.translation: 牧师（负责基督教堂或团体的神职人员）

3785.definition: a small area of something, especially one which is different from the area around it
3785.example: a black dog with a white patch on its back
3785.translation: 补丁，斑块（某物上的一个小区域，尤指与周围不同者）

3786.definition: an official right to be the only person to make, use or sell a product or an invention; a document that proves this
3786.example: patent on something, to apply for/obtain/take out a patent on an invention
3786.translation: 专利（制造、使用或销售发明物的独家官方权利；证明此权利的文件）

3787.definition: a way or track that is built or is made by the action of people walking
3787.translation: 小路（供人行走的道路或痕迹）

3788.definition: a track that serves as a path
3788.example: They came out of the woods and onto a pathway.
3788.translation: 路径（作为路径使用的痕迹）

3789.definition: the ability to stay calm and accept a delay or something annoying without complaining
3789.example: She has little patience with (= will not accept or consider) such views.
3789.translation: 耐心（保持冷静、接受延迟或恼人之事而不抱怨的能力）

3790.definition: able to wait for a long time or accept annoying behaviour or difficulties without becoming angry
3790.example: You'll just have to be patient and wait till I'm finished.
3790.translation: 有耐心的（能长时间等待或接受烦人行为而不生气的）

3791.definition: a person who is receiving medical treatment, especially in a hospital
3791.translation: 病人（接受医疗的人，尤指在医院）

3792.definition: the act of going to different parts of a building, an area, etc. to make sure that there is no trouble or crime
3792.example: Security guards make regular patrols at night.
3792.translation: 巡逻（为了确保无混乱或犯罪而巡视建筑、区域的行为）

3793.definition: to go around an area or a building at regular times to check that it is safe and that there is no trouble
3793.example: Troops patrolled the border day and night.
3793.translation: 巡逻（定期环绕区域或建筑巡视以确保安全）

3794.definition: a person who gives money and support to artists and writers
3794.example: Frederick the Great was the patron of many artists.
3794.translation: 资助人，赞助人（资助和支持艺术家、作家的人）

3795.definition: the regular way in which something happens or is done
3795.translation: 模式（某事发生或执行的常规方式）

3796.definition: a period of time during which somebody stops talking or stops what they are doing
3796.example: There was a long pause before she answered.
3796.translation: 暂停（说话或行动停止的一段时间）

3797.definition: to stop talking or doing something for a short time before continuing
3797.example: Anita paused for a moment, then said: ‘All right’.
3797.translation: 暂停（在继续前停止说话或行动一小会儿）

3798.definition: the money that somebody gets for doing regular work
3798.example: Her job is hard work, but the pay is good.
3798.translation: 工资（做常规工作得到的报酬）

3799.definition: to give somebody money for work, goods, services, etc.
3799.translation: 支付（为工作、商品或服务给某人钱）

3800.definition: the act of paying somebody/something or of being paid
3800.example: What method of payment do you prefer?
3800.translation: 支付（付钱给某人/某物或收到钱的行为）

3801.definition: a situation or a period of time in which there is no war or violence in a country or an area
3801.translation: 和平（国家或地区没有战争或暴力的局面或时期）

3802.definition: not involving a war, violence or argument
3802.translation: 和平的（不涉及战争、暴力或争论的）

3803.definition: the point when somebody/something is best, most successful, strongest, etc.
3803.example: Traffic reaches its peak between 8 and 9 in the morning.
3803.translation: 顶峰，高峰（某人/某事最优秀、最成功或最强的时刻）

3804.definition: (especially in the past, or in poorer countries) a farmer who owns or rents a small piece of land
3804.translation: 农民（拥有或租种小块土地的农民，尤指过去或在穷国）

3805.definition: strange or unusual, especially in a way that is unpleasant or makes you worried
3805.translation: 奇怪的，独特的（奇怪或不寻常的，尤指令人不快或忧虑的）

3806.definition: a person who is the same age or who has the same social status as you
3806.example: She enjoys the respect of her peers.
3806.translation: 同龄人，同辈（年龄或社会地位相同的人）

3807.definition: an instrument made of plastic or metal used for writing with ink (= coloured liquid for writing, etc.)
3807.translation: 笔（使用墨水的书写工具）

3808.definition: a punishment for breaking a law, rule or contract
3808.translation: 处罚，刑罚（违反法律、规则或合同的惩罚）

3809.definition: a narrow piece of wood, or a metal or plastic case, containing a black or coloured substance, used for drawing or writing
3809.example: I'll get a pencil and paper.
3809.translation: 铅笔（内含黑色或彩色物质的木制或金属/塑料制书写绘图工具）

3810.definition: a small British coin and unit of money. There are 100 pence in one pound (£1).
3810.example: He had a few pennies in his pocket.
3810.translation: 便士（英国的小面额硬币，100便士等于1英镑）

3812.definition: human beings; men, women and children
3812.example: At least ten people were killed in the crash.
3812.translation: 人们（人类个体；男、女、儿童的总称）

3813.definition: a powder made from dried berries (called peppercorns), used to give a hot, spicy taste to food
3813.translation: 胡椒，胡椒粉（干浆果磨成的粉，赋予食物辛辣味）

3814.definition: used to express the cost or amount of something for each person, number used, distance travelled, etc.
3814.example: Rooms cost £50 per person, per night.
3814.translation: 每（用于表示每人、每数、每距离等的成本或数量）

3815.definition: by, in or for every hundred
3815.example: a 15 per cent rise in price
3815.translation: 百分之...（在每百个中的比例）

3816.definition: by, in or for every hundred
3816.example: a 15 per cent rise in price
3816.translation: 百分之...（在每百个中的比例）

3817.example: per cent of something/somebody, Poor families spend about 80 to 90 per cent of their income on food.
3817.translation: 百分比（每一百个中的一部分）

3818.definition: to understand or think of somebody/something in a particular way
3818.example: perceive somebody/something/yourself (as something), This discovery was perceived as a major breakthrough.
3818.translation: 感知，认为（以特定方式理解或看待某人/某物）

3819.definition: the number, amount or rate of something, expressed as if it is part of a total that is 100; a part or share of a whole
3819.example: percentage of something/somebody, What percentage of the population is/are overweight?
3819.translation: 百分比（某物占总数（100）的数量、金额或比率；整体中的一部分）

3820.definition: an idea, a belief or an image you have as a result of how you see or understand something
3820.example: a campaign to change public perception of the police
3820.translation: 感知，见解（由观察或理解方式产生的想法、信念或形象）

3821.definition: having everything that is necessary; complete and without faults or weaknesses
3821.translation: 完美的（具备所有必需要素的；完整无瑕疵的）

3822.example: It's perfectly normal to feel like this.

3823.definition: to entertain an audience by playing a piece of music, acting in a play, etc.
3823.translation: 表演，演出（演奏、表演戏剧等以娱乐观众）

3824.definition: the act of performing a play, concert or some other form of entertainment
3824.translation: 表演，演出（表演戏剧、音乐会或其他娱乐形式的行为）

3825.example: ‘Are you going to come?’ ‘Perhaps. I'll see how I feel.’

3827.definition: lasting for a long time or for all time in the future; existing all the time
3827.example: She was unable to find a permanent job.
3827.translation: 永久的（长期持续或未来永远存在的；一直存在的）

3828.definition: in a way that lasts for a long time or for all time in the future; in a way that exists all the time
3828.example: The stroke left his right side permanently damaged.
3828.translation: 永久地（以长期持续或一直存在的方式）

3829.definition: the act of allowing somebody to do something, especially when this is done by somebody in a position of authority
3829.example: permission for something, You must ask permission for all major expenditure.
3829.translation: 许可（允许某人做某事的行为，尤指权力部门做出的）

3830.definition: an official document that gives somebody the right to do something, especially for a limited period of time
3830.translation: 许可证（给予某人做某事权利的官方文件，尤指限期内的）

3831.definition: to allow somebody to do something or to allow something to happen
3831.example: be permitted, Mobile phones are not permitted in the examination room.
3831.translation: 允许（允许某人做某事或允许某事发生）

3832.definition: to continue to do something despite difficulties or opposition, in a way that can seem unreasonable
3832.example: persist in doing something, Why do you persist in blaming yourself for what happened?
3832.translation: 坚持（不顾困难或反对地继续做某事，有时显得不合理）

3833.definition: determined to do something despite difficulties, especially when other people are against you and think that you are being annoying or unreasonable
3833.example: How do you deal with persistent salesmen who won't take no for an answer?
3833.translation: 执着的，坚持不懈的（不顾困难坚定地做某事的，尤指在他人反对时）

3834.example: What sort of person would do a thing like that?

3835.definition: your own; not belonging to or connected with anyone else
3835.example: The novel is written from personal experience.
3835.translation: 个人的（你自己的；不属于或不与他人相关的）

3836.definition: the various aspects of a person’s character that combine to make them different from other people
3836.example: His wife has a strong personality.
3836.translation: 人格，性格（构成一个人区别于他人的各种性格特征）

3837.definition: used to show that you are giving your own opinion about something
3837.example: Personally, I prefer the second option.
3837.translation: 就个人而言（用于表示你在给出自己的观点）

3838.definition: the people who work for an organization or one of the armed forces
3838.example: There is a severe shortage of skilled personnel.
3838.translation: 人员，员工（在组织或武装部队工作的人们）

3839.definition: a particular attitude towards something; a way of thinking about something
3839.translation: 视角，观点（对某事的特定态度或思考方式）

3840.definition: to make somebody do something by giving them good reasons for doing it
3840.example: persuade somebody to do something, Try to persuade him to come.
3840.translation: 说服（通过给出好理由使某人做某事）

3841.definition: an animal, a bird, etc. that you have at home for pleasure, rather than one that is kept for work or food
3841.translation: 宠物（在家中养着玩而非为了工作或食物的动物或鸟）

3842.definition: a written document signed by a large number of people that asks somebody in a position of authority to do or change something
3842.example: petition against something, Would you like to sign our petition against experiments on animals?
3842.translation: 请愿书（由多人签署的要求权威人士执行或改变某事的书面文件）

3843.definition: a liquid obtained from petroleum, used as fuel in car engines, etc.
3843.example: to fill a car up with petrol
3843.translation: 汽油（从石油中提取的用于汽车引擎等的液体燃料）

3844.definition: a stage in a process of change or development
3844.translation: 阶段（变化或发展过程中的一个时段）

3845.definition: a fact or an event in nature or society, especially one that is not fully understood
3845.translation: 现象（自然或社会中的事实或事件，尤指尚未被完全理解的）

3846.definition: a person who studies or writes about philosophy
3846.example: We studied the writings of the Greek philosopher Aristotle.
3846.translation: 哲学家（研究或撰写哲学的人）

3848.definition: the study of the nature and meaning of the universe and of human life
3848.example: philosophy of something, the philosophy of science
3848.translation: 哲学（研究宇宙本质及人类生活意义的学科）

3849.definition: a piece of equipment for talking to people who are not in the same place as you
3849.example: I have to make a phone call.
3849.translation: 电话（与不在同处的人谈话的设备）

3850.definition: to make a phone call to somebody
3850.example: I was just phoning up for a chat.
3850.translation: 打电话（给某人打座机或手机电话）

3851.definition: a picture that is made by using a camera that stores images in digital form or that has a film sensitive to light inside it
3851.translation: 照片（使用相机制作的数字或胶片图像）

3852.definition: a picture that is made by using a camera that stores images in digital form or that has a film sensitive to light inside it
3852.example: aerial photographs of the crash site
3852.translation: 照片（使用相机制作的数字或胶片图像）

3853.definition: to take a photograph of somebody/something
3853.example: photograph somebody/something, a workshop on photographing wildlife
3853.translation: 拍照（拍摄某人/某物的照片）

3854.definition: a person who takes photographs, especially as a job
3854.translation: 摄影师（拍摄照片的人，尤指以此为业者）

3855.definition: the art, process or job of taking photographs or filming something
3855.example: Her hobbies include hiking and photography.
3855.translation: 摄影（拍摄照片或录制视频的艺术、过程或工作）

3856.definition: a group of words that have a particular meaning when used together
3856.translation: 短语（组合在一起具有特定含义的一组词）

3857.definition: connected with a person’s body rather than their mind
3857.translation: 身体的，物理的（与人的身体而非精神相关的）

3858.definition: a doctor, especially one who is a specialist in general medicine and not surgery
3858.example: Dr Dennett is a practicing family physician in Atlanta.
3858.translation: 医师，内科医生（医生，尤指全科医生而非外科医生）

3859.definition: the scientific study of matter and energy and the relationships between them, including the study of forces, heat, light, sound, electricity and the structure of atoms
3859.translation: 物理学（研究物质、能量及其相互关系的科学，包括力、热、光等）

3860.definition: a large musical instrument played by pressing the black and white keys on the keyboard. The sound is produced by small hammers hitting the metal strings inside the piano.
3860.translation: 钢琴（通过按下黑白键使小锤击打琴弦发声的大型乐器）

3862.definition: to choose somebody/something from a group of people or things
3862.example: pick somebody/something, Pick a number from one to twenty.
3862.translation: 挑选（从一群人或物中选择某人/某物）

3863.definition: a painting or drawing, etc. that shows a scene, a person or thing
3863.example: He likes books with lots of pictures in them.
3863.translation: 图片（显示场景、人或物的绘画或素描等）

3864.definition: to imagine somebody/something; to create an image of somebody/something in your mind
3864.example: picture somebody/something, I could picture the scene clearly.
3864.translation: 想象（在脑中构思某人/某物的形象）

3865.definition: an amount of something that has been cut or separated from the rest of it; a standard amount of something
3865.example: piece of something, She wrote something on a small piece of paper.
3865.translation: 块，件（从整体中切下或分离出的量；标准量）

3866.definition: an animal with pink, black or brown skin, short legs, a broad nose and a short curly tail. Pigs are kept on farms for their meat (called pork) or live in the wild.
3866.translation: 猪（粉、黑或棕色皮肤的长鼻短尾动物，常饲养以获取猪肉）

3867.definition: a number of things that have been placed on top of each other
3867.example: pile of something, a pile of clothes/paper
3867.translation: 堆（堆放在一起的若干物体）

3868.definition: to put things one on top of another; to form a pile
3868.example: pile something, She piled the boxes one on top of the other.
3868.translation: 堆叠（将东西一个接一个叠放；形成堆）

3869.definition: a small flat round piece of medicine that you swallow whole, without biting it
3869.translation: 药片（不经咀嚼直接吞服的小扁圆药物）

3870.definition: a person who operates the controls of an aircraft, especially as a job
3870.translation: 飞行员（操作飞行器控制器的人，尤指以此为业者）

3871.definition: a short thin piece of stiff wire with a sharp point at one end and a round head at the other, used especially for fastening together pieces of cloth when sewing
3871.example: Use pins to keep the patch in place while you sew it on.
3871.translation: 别针，大头针（一端尖、另一端圆头的细硬金属线，用于缝纫等固定）

3872.definition: to attach something onto another thing or fasten things together with a pin, etc.
3872.example: She pinned the badge onto her jacket.
3872.translation: 钉住，别住（用别针等将某物附着在另一物上或固定在一起）

3874.definition: the colour that is produced when you mix red and white together
3874.translation: 粉红色（红白混合产生的颜色）

3875.definition: a person who is the first to study and develop a particular area of knowledge, culture, etc. that other people then continue to develop
3875.example: a pioneer in the field of microsurgery
3875.translation: 先驱（第一个研究和开发特定领域知识、文化的人，后来者继续跟进）

3876.definition: when somebody pioneers something, they are one of the first people to do, discover or use something new
3876.example: a new technique pioneered by surgeons in a London hospital
3876.translation: 开创（当某人开创某事时，指其是最早做、发现或使用新事物的人之一）

3877.definition: a tube through which liquids and gases can flow
3877.example: Both hot and cold water pipes should be properly insulated.
3877.translation: 管子（液体或气体流动的管道）

3878.definition: a series of pipes that are usually underground and are used for carrying oil, gas, etc. over long distances
3878.example: There are plans to lay a gas pipeline through the region.
3878.translation: 管线（通常位于地下的用于长距离运输油、气等的系列管道）

3879.definition: (especially in the past) a person on a ship who attacks other ships at sea in order to steal from them
3879.example: There were reports that a pirate ship had come looking for treasure in the cove.
3879.translation: 海盗（尤指过去，在海上袭击他船并抢劫的人）

3880.definition: a large deep hole in the ground
3880.example: We dug a deep pit in the yard.

3881.definition: an area of ground specially prepared and marked for playing a sports game
3881.translation: 球场（专为体育比赛准备并标有界线的地面区域）

3882.definition: used to show that you are disappointed about something
3882.example: a pity (that…), It's a pity that you can't stay longer.
3882.translation: 遗憾（用于表示对某事感到失望）

3883.definition: a particular position, point or area
3883.example: in a place, Keep your purse in a safe place.
3883.translation: 地方（特定的位置、点或区域）

3884.definition: to put something in a particular place, especially when you do it carefully or deliberately
3884.example: He placed his hand on her shoulder.
3884.translation: 放置（将某物置于特定位置，尤指小心或故意地）

3885.definition: the act of finding somebody a suitable job or place to live
3885.translation: 安置（为某人寻找合适工作或住所的行为）

3886.translation: 简单的，朴素的（未装饰或不复杂的；简单的）

3887.definition: something that you intend to do or achieve
3887.example: plan for something, Do you have any plans for the summer?
3887.translation: 计划（你打算去做或实现的事）

3888.definition: to make detailed arrangements for something you want to do in the future
3888.example: plan something, to plan a trip
3888.translation: 计划（为未来想做的事做出详细安排）

3889.definition: a flying vehicle with wings and one or more engines
3889.translation: 飞机（带机翼和引擎的飞行工具）

3890.definition: a large round object in space that moves around a star (such as the sun) and receives light from it
3890.example: the planets of our solar system
3890.translation: 行星（绕恒星运行并接收其光线的大型球体）

3891.definition: the act or process of making plans for something
3891.example: The department is responsible for all financial planning.
3891.translation: 规划（制定计划的行为或过程）

3892.definition: a living thing that grows in the earth and usually has a stem, leaves and roots, especially one that is smaller than a tree or bush
3892.example: All plants need light and water.
3892.translation: 植物（生长在土里、通常带茎叶根且小于树木的生物）

3893.definition: to put plants, seeds, etc. in the ground to grow
3893.translation: 种植（将植物、种子等种入土里）

3894.translation: 塑料制的（由塑料制成的）

3895.definition: a light strong material that is produced by chemical processes and can be formed into shapes when heated. There are many different types of plastic, used to make different objects and fabrics.
3895.example: The pipes should be made of plastic.
3895.translation: 塑料（化学产生、加热可成型的轻质强韧材料；种类繁多）

3896.definition: a flat, usually round, dish that you put food on
3896.translation: 盘子（放食物的扁平通常为圆形的餐具）

3897.definition: the raised flat area next to the track at a train station where you get on or off the train
3897.example: (British English), What platform does it go from?
3897.translation: 站台（火车站台旁供上下车的升高平坦区域）

3898.definition: a piece of writing performed by actors in a theatre or on television or radio
3898.translation: 剧本，戏剧（演员在剧院、电视或电台表演的文学作品）

3899.definition: to do things for pleasure, as children do; to enjoy yourself, rather than work
3899.example: You'll have to play inside today.
3899.translation: 玩耍（为了快乐而做事，如儿童所为；娱乐而非工作）

3900.definition: a person who takes part in a game or sport
3900.translation: 选手，运动员（参加比赛或运动的人）

3901.definition: a serious emotional request, especially for something needing action now
3901.example: plea for something, She made an impassioned plea for help.
3901.translation: 恳求，请求（严肃的情感请求，尤指需要立即采取行动的）

3902.definition: to ask somebody for something in a very strong and serious way
3902.example: plead (with somebody) (to do something), She pleaded with him not to go.
3902.translation: 恳求（以非常强烈和严肃的方式请求某人某事）

3903.translation: 愉快的（有趣的、吸引人的或给予愉悦感的）

3904.definition: used as a polite way of asking for something or telling somebody to do something
3904.translation: 请（用于礼貌地请求或告知他人做某事）

3905.example: please somebody, You can't please everybody.
3905.translation: 使高兴（使某人感到快乐）

3906.translation: 高兴的（对某事感到快乐的）

3907.definition: a state of feeling or being happy or satisfied
3907.example: His eyes lit up with pleasure.
3907.translation: 快乐，愉悦（感到快乐或满意的状态）

3908.example: pledge (of something), a pledge of support

3909.definition: to formally promise to give or do something
3909.example: pledge something, Japan has pledged $100 million in humanitarian aid.
3909.translation: 保证，承诺（正式承诺给予或做某事）

3910.definition: a large amount; as much or as many as you need
3910.translation: 大量，充足（大量的；达到你所需之多的）

3911.definition: the series of events that form the story of a novel, play, film, etc.
3911.example: It's hard to follow the plot of the film.
3911.translation: 情节（小说、戏剧、电影等构成的故事系列事件）

3912.definition: to make a secret plan to harm somebody, especially a government or its leader
3912.example: plot with somebody, It is claimed he plotted with the country's enemies.
3912.translation: 策划（秘密计划伤害某人，尤指政府或其领导人）

3913.definition: a small plastic object with two or three metal pins that connects a piece of electrical equipment to the main supply of electricity
3913.example: The iron is fitted with a three-pin plug.
3913.translation: 插头（带有金属插脚的将电器连接到电源的塑料装置）

3914.definition: to fill a hole with a substance or piece of material that fits tightly into it
3914.example: He plugged the hole in the pipe with an old rag.
3914.translation: 塞住（用物质或紧固材料填满孔洞）

3915.definition: to move or make somebody/something move suddenly forwards and/or downwards
3915.example: + adv./prep., She lost her balance and plunged 100 feet to her death.
3915.translation: 纵身跳入，暴跌（突然向前和/或向下移动）

3916.definition: used after a number to show that the real number or amount is more than the one mentioned
3916.translation: 加，多（用于数字后，表示实际数量多于所提到的）

3917.example: I've got too much on at work. Plus my father is not well.
3917.translation: 加，而且（用于添加更多信息）

3918.example: Knowledge of French is a plus in her job.

3919.definition: used when the two numbers or amounts mentioned are being added together
3919.translation: 加，加上（用于两个数或量相加时）

3920.definition: a small piece of material like a small bag sewn into or onto a piece of clothing so that you can carry things in it
3920.translation: 口袋（缝在衣服上用于装东西的小袋子）

3921.definition: a piece of writing in which the words are chosen for their sound and the images they suggest, not just for their obvious meanings. The words are arranged in separate lines, usually with a repeated rhythm, and often the lines rhyme at the end.
3921.example: His collected poems were published after the war.
3921.translation: 诗，诗歌（根据音韵和意象而非仅字面意思选词撰写的文学作品）

3923.definition: poems in general; poems as a genre of literature
3923.translation: 诗歌（诗歌的总称；作为文学体裁的诗歌）

3924.definition: a thing that somebody says or writes giving their opinion or stating a fact
3924.example: She made several interesting points in the article.
3924.translation: 观点，点（某人发表意见或陈述事实时所说的话）

3925.definition: to stretch out your finger or something held in your hand towards somebody/something in order to show somebody where a person or thing is
3925.example: point at somebody/something, ‘What's your name?’ he asked, pointing at the child with his pen.
3925.translation: 指向，指出（伸出手指或手中物向他人展示位置）

3927.definition: a substance that causes death or harm if it gets into the body
3927.example: Some mushrooms contain a deadly poison.
3927.translation: 毒药（进入体内会造成伤害或死亡的物质）

3928.definition: to harm or kill a person or an animal by giving them poison
3928.example: poison somebody/yourself, He was believed to poison his enemies.
3928.translation: 下毒（给某人下毒以伤害或杀死他们）

3929.definition: causing death or illness if swallowed or taken into the body
3929.translation: 有毒的（如果吞下或进入体内会造成死亡或疾病的）

3930.definition: a long thin straight piece of wood or metal, especially one with the end placed in the ground, used as a support
3930.translation: 杆，柱（长而直的木制或金属制支撑物）

3931.definition: an official organization whose job is to make people obey the law and to prevent and solve crime; the people who work for this organization
3931.example: Get out of the house or I'll call the police.
3931.translation: 警察（负责维护法律、预防犯罪的官方组织；或其成员）

3933.definition: a plan of action agreed or chosen by a political party, a business, etc.
3933.example: policy on something, the present government’s policy on education
3933.translation: 政策，方针（政党或企业等商定或选择的行动计划）

3934.definition: having or showing good manners and respect for the feelings of others
3934.example: polite to somebody, Please be polite to our guests.
3934.translation: 有礼貌的（举止得体且尊重他人感受的）

3935.definition: connected with the state, government or public affairs
3935.translation: 政治的（与国家、政府或公共事务相关的）

3936.definition: a person whose job involves politics, especially as an elected member of parliament, etc.
3936.translation: 政治家（职业涉及政治的人，尤指民选代表）

3937.definition: the activities involved in getting and using power in public life, and being able to influence decisions that affect a country or a society
3937.translation: 政治（涉及公共生活中获取和使用权力的活动）

3938.definition: the process of questioning people who are representative of a larger group in order to get information about the general opinion
3938.translation: 民意调查（通过询问代表性人群获取公众意见的过程）

3939.definition: the process of making air, water, soil, etc. dirty; the state of being dirty
3939.translation: 污染（使空气、水、土壤等变脏的过程；脏的状态）

3940.definition: a small area of still water, especially one that is artificial
3940.translation: 池塘（小面积的静水，尤指人工挖掘的）

3941.definition: an area of water that has been created for people to swim in
3941.translation: 游泳池（专为人游泳而建造的水域）

3942.definition: having very little money; not having enough money for basic needs
3942.example: They were too poor to buy shoes for the kids.
3942.translation: 贫穷的（钱很少的；没有足够钱满足基本需求的）

3943.translation: 流行的（与现代流行音乐相关的）

3944.definition: popular music of the sort that has been popular since the 1950s, usually with a strong rhythm and simple tunes, often contrasted with rock, soul and other forms of popular music
3944.translation: 流行乐（自20世纪50年代以来流行的、带有强节奏和简单曲调的音乐）

3945.definition: to make a short explosive sound; to cause something to make this sound
3945.translation: 砰的一声（发出短促爆炸声；使发出此响声）

3946.definition: liked or enjoyed by a large number of people
3946.example: Andalucia is a popular tourist destination.
3946.translation: 受欢迎的（被大量人喜爱或欣赏的）

3947.definition: the state of being liked, enjoyed or supported by a large number of people
3947.translation: 受欢迎程度（被大量人喜爱、欣赏或支持的状态）

3948.definition: all the people who live in a particular area, city or country; the total number of people who live there
3948.example: One third of the world’s population consumes/consume two thirds of the world’s resources.
3948.translation: 人口，全体居民（居住在特定区域的所有人；其总数）

3949.definition: a town or city with a harbour, especially one where ships load and unload goods
3949.translation: 港口（带有港湾的城镇或城市，尤指供船只装卸货物的）

3950.definition: a thin flat case used for carrying documents, drawings, etc.
3950.example: I left my portfolio on the train.
3950.translation: 文件夹，作品集（用于携带文件、图纸等的平薄夹子）

3951.example: a substantial/significant portion of the population
3951.translation: 部分（较大事物中的一个部分）

3952.definition: a painting, drawing or photograph of a person, especially of the head and shoulders
3952.example: portrait of somebody, a portrait of his wife
3952.translation: 肖像，画像（人的绘画、素描或照片，尤指头部和肩膀）

3953.definition: to show somebody/something in a picture; to describe somebody/something in a piece of writing
3953.example: The painting portrays the duke’s third wife.
3953.translation: 描绘（在图片中展示或在文章中描述某人/某物）

3954.definition: to create a threat, problem, etc. that has to be dealt with
3954.translation: 造成，引起（产生必须处理的威胁、问题等）

3955.definition: the place where somebody/something is located
3955.example: Where would be the best position for the lights?
3955.translation: 位置（某人/某物所在的地点）

3956.definition: to put somebody/something in a particular position
3956.example: position somebody/something/yourself + adv./prep., She quickly positioned herself behind the desk.
3956.translation: 安置（将某人/某物置于特定位置）

3957.example: The tests have so far yielded positive results.
3957.translation: 积极的，肯定的（好的或有用的）

3958.definition: a good or useful quality or aspect
3958.example: What are the positives and negatives of going this route?
3958.translation: 优点（好的或有用的品质或方面）

3959.example: He was charged with possessing a shotgun without a licence.

3960.definition: something that you own or have with you at a particular time
3960.example: Prisoners were allowed no personal possessions.
3960.translation: 拥有物（你在特定时间拥有或携带的东西）

3961.definition: a thing that may happen or be true; the fact that something might happen or be true, but is not certain
3961.example: Bankruptcy is a real possibility if sales don't improve.
3961.translation: 可能性（可能发生或为真的事；其发生的可能性）

3962.definition: that can be done or achieved
3962.example: possible to do something, New technology has made it possible to communicate more easily.
3962.translation: 可能的（可以被完成或实现的）

3963.definition: used to say that something might exist, happen or be true, but you are not certain
3963.example: It was possibly their worst performance ever.
3963.translation: 可能地（用于表示某事可能存在或发生，但不确定）

3964.definition: the official system used for sending and delivering letters, packages, etc.
3964.example: by post, I'll send the original to you by post.
3964.translation: 邮件，邮政（用于发送和递送信件、包裹的官方系统）

3965.definition: to send a letter, etc. to somebody by post
3965.example: post something, The cost of posting a letter has gone up again.
3965.translation: 邮寄（通过邮政系统发送信件等）

3966.definition: existing, happening or made in the period after a war, especially the Second World War
3966.translation: 战后的（存在、发生或制作于战争——尤指二战——之后的）

3967.definition: a large notice, often with a picture on it, that is put in a public place to advertise something
3967.translation: 海报（置于公共场所用于广告的大型通知，常带图画）

3968.definition: to arrange for an event, etc. to take place at a later time or date than originally planned
3968.example: postpone something, The game has already been postponed three times.
3968.translation: 推迟（安排活动等在比原计划更晚的时间进行）

3969.definition: a deep round container used for cooking things in
3969.translation: 罐，壶（用于烹饪的深圆形容器）

3970.definition: a round white vegetable with a brown or red skin that grows underground as part of a plant also called a potato
3970.example: Will you peel the potatoes for me?
3970.translation: 土豆（作为土豆植株一部分在地下生长的白色圆形蔬菜）

3971.definition: that can develop into something or be developed in the future
3971.translation: 潜在的（未来可以发展成某样事物的）

3972.definition: the possibility of something happening or being developed or used
3972.example: potential for something, the potential for change
3972.translation: 潜力，可能性（某事发生、被发展或使用的可能性）

3973.definition: used to say that something may develop into something
3973.translation: 潜在地（用于说明某事可能发展成某种情况）

3974.definition: the unit of money in the UK, worth 100 pence
3974.translation: 英镑（英国货币单位，等于100便士）

3975.definition: to make a liquid or other substance flow from a container in a continuous stream, especially by holding the container at an angle
3975.example: pour something + adv./prep., Pour the sauce over the pasta.
3975.translation: 倒，倾泻（使液体等从容器中连续流出，尤指斜持容器时）

3977.definition: a dry mass of very small fine pieces or grains
3977.translation: 粉末（由极小细粒组成的干燥物团）

3978.definition: the ability to control people or things
3978.example: power to do something, He has the power to make things very unpleasant for us.
3978.translation: 权力，电力（控制人或事的能力；动力）

3979.definition: to supply a machine or vehicle with the energy that makes it work
3979.example: be powered (by something), The aircraft is powered by a jet engine.
3979.translation: 为...提供动力（为机器或车辆提供使其工作的能源）

3980.definition: being able to control and influence people and events
3980.translation: 强有力的（能控制和影响人、事的）

3981.definition: connected with real situations rather than with ideas or theories
3981.example: to have gained practical experience of the work
3981.translation: 实际的，实用的（与现实情况而非想法或理论相关的）

3982.definition: doing an activity or training regularly so that you can improve your skill; the time you spend doing this
3982.translation: 练习，实践（定期进行的活动或培训以提高技能；其所花时间）

3983.definition: to do an activity or train regularly so that you can improve your skill
3983.example: You need to practise every day.
3983.translation: 练习（定期进行活动或培训以提高技能）

3984.definition: a person who works in a profession, especially medicine or law
3984.translation: 从业者（在专业领域工作的人，尤指医疗或法律）

3985.definition: words that show that you approve of and admire somebody/something
3985.example: The team coach singled out two players for special praise.
3985.translation: 赞扬（表达对某人/某事认可和钦佩的话语）

3986.definition: to say that you approve of and admire somebody/something
3986.example: praise somebody/something, She praised his cooking.
3986.translation: 赞扬（表示你认可并钦佩某人/某事）

3987.definition: to speak to God, especially to give thanks or ask for help
3987.translation: 祈祷（向上帝说话，尤指为了感谢或寻求帮助）

3988.definition: words that you say to God giving thanks or asking for help
3988.translation: 祈祷（向上帝表达感谢或寻求帮助的话语）

3989.definition: to give a religious talk in a public place, especially in a church during a service
3989.example: She preached to the congregation about forgiveness.
3989.translation: 传教，布道（在公共场所——尤指教堂——进行宗教演讲）

3990.definition: to happen before something or come before something/somebody in order
3990.translation: 领先，在...之前（在时间或顺序上发生在...之前）

3991.definition: an official action or decision that has happened in the past and that is seen as an example or a rule to be followed in a similar situation later
3991.example: The ruling set a precedent for future libel cases.
3991.translation: 先例（过去发生的、在未来类似情况下被视为范例或规则的官方行动）

3992.definition: rare and worth a lot of money
3992.translation: 珍贵的（稀有的且值很多钱的）

3994.example: They look precisely the same to me.

3995.definition: the quality of being exact, accurate and careful
3995.example: Her writing is imaginative but lacks precision.

3996.definition: an animal that kills and eats other animals
3996.example: Some animals have no natural predators.
3996.translation: 捕食者（杀死并食用其他动物的动物）

3997.definition: a person who did a job before somebody else
3997.example: The new president reversed many of the policies of his predecessor.
3997.translation: 前任（在某人之前担任该职位的人）

3998.definition: to say that something will happen in the future
3998.example: predict something, a reliable method of predicting earthquakes
3998.translation: 预测（说明未来将发生某事）

3999.definition: if something is predictable, you know in advance that it will happen or what it will be like
3999.translation: 可预测的（如果某事可预测，指预先知道它会发生或其样子）

4000.definition: a statement that says what you think will happen; the act of making such a statement
4000.example: The results of the experiment confirmed our predictions.
4000.translation: 预测（说明你认为会发生什么的陈述；这种行为）

4001.example: She works in a predominantly male environment.
4001.translation: 主要地（大部分地；主要地）

4002.definition: to like one thing or person better than another; to choose one thing rather than something else because you like it better
4002.example: prefer something, ‘Coffee or tea?’ ‘I'd prefer tea, thanks.’
4002.translation: 更喜欢（比起另一个更喜欢这一个；因喜欢而选择）

4003.definition: a greater interest in or desire for somebody/something than somebody/something else
4003.example: It's a matter of personal preference.
4003.translation: 偏好（对比他物更显著的兴趣或欲望）

4005.definition: having a baby or young animal developing inside her/its body
4005.translation: 怀孕的（体内有胎儿或幼崽发育的）

4006.definition: an unreasonable dislike of or preference for a person, group, custom, etc., especially when it is based on their race, religion, sex, etc.
4006.translation: 偏见（对某人、群体、习俗等不合理的反感，尤指基于种族宗教等）

4007.definition: happening before a more important action or event
4007.example: After a few preliminary remarks he announced the winners.
4007.translation: 初步的（发生在更重要行动或事件之前的）

4008.example: one of the country’s premier chefs
4008.translation: 首要的，最好的（最重要的、最著名的或最成功的）

4009.definition: a statement or an idea that forms the basis for a reasonable line of argument
4009.example: the basic premise of her argument
4009.translation: 前提（作为合理推论基础的陈述或想法）

4010.definition: an amount of money that you pay once or regularly for an insurance policy
4010.translation: 保险费（为保险单支付的一次性或定期款项）

4011.definition: the act or process of getting ready for something or making something ready
4011.translation: 准备（为某事做准备或使其准备就绪的行为）

4012.definition: to make something or somebody ready to be used or to do something
4012.example: prepare something/somebody, to prepare a report
4012.translation: 准备（使某物或某人准备好被使用或去行动）

4013.definition: ready and able to deal with something
4013.example: We'll be better prepared next time.
4013.translation: 准备好的（准备好并能够应对某事的）

4014.definition: to tell somebody to take a particular medicine or have a particular treatment; to write a prescription for a particular medicine, etc.
4014.example: prescribe something, Valium is usually prescribed to treat anxiety.
4014.translation: 开处方（告诉某人服用特定药物或接受特定治疗；开药方）

4015.definition: an official piece of paper on which a doctor writes the type of medicine you should have, and which enables you to get it from a chemist's
4015.example: prescription for something, The doctor gave me a prescription for antibiotics.
4015.translation: 处方（医生写的说明你应该服用的药物类型的官方纸片）

4016.definition: the fact of being in a particular place
4016.example: He hardly seemed to notice my presence.
4016.translation: 存在，到场（在特定地方的事实）
