4017.example: I am not satisfied with the present situation.
4017.translation: 现在的（现存的或现在发生的）

4018.definition: a thing that you give to somebody as a gift
4018.example: What can I get him for a birthday present?
4018.translation: 礼物（作为礼赠给某人的东西）

4019.definition: to show or offer something for other people to look at or consider
4019.example: present something, Are you presenting a paper at the conference?
4019.translation: 展示，呈现（展示或提供某物供他人查看或考虑）

4020.definition: a meeting at which something, especially a new product or idea, or piece of work, is shown to a group of people
4020.example: presentation on/about somebody/something, The sales manager will give a presentation on the new products.
4020.translation: 展示，陈述（向群体展示新产品、主意或作品的会议）

4021.definition: at the time you are speaking or writing; now
4021.example: The crime is presently being investigated by the police.
4021.translation: 目前（在你说话或书写的时间；现在）

4022.definition: the act of keeping something in its original state or in good condition
4022.translation: 保护，保存（保持某物处于原始状态或良好状态的行为）

4023.definition: to keep a particular quality, feature, etc.; to make sure that something is kept
4023.example: He was anxious to preserve his reputation.
4023.translation: 保护，保存（保持特定的品质、特征等；确保某物被留存）

4024.definition: to lead or be in charge of a meeting, ceremony, etc.
4024.translation: 主持（领导或负责会议、仪式等）

4025.definition: the job of being president of a country or an organization; the period of time somebody holds this job
4025.example: the current holder of the EU presidency
4025.translation: 总统职位（担任国家或组织总统的工作；其任期）

4026.definition: the leader of a republic, for example the US
4026.translation: 总统（共和国——如美国——的领导人）

4027.definition: connected with the position or activities of a president
4027.translation: 总统的（与总统职位或活动相关的）

4028.translation: 新闻界（报纸和杂志的总称）

4029.definition: to push part of a device, etc. in order to make it work
4029.example: press something, to press a button/key
4029.translation: 按，压（推动设备的一部分使其工作，如按按钮）

4030.definition: the act of trying to persuade or to force somebody to do something
4030.example: pressure for something, The pressure for change continued to mount.
4030.translation: 压力（试图劝说或强迫某人做某事的行为）

4031.definition: respected and admired as very important or of very high quality
4031.translation: 有威望的（被视为非常重要或高质量而受人尊敬钦佩的）

4032.definition: used to say that you think that something is probably true
4032.example: Presumably this is where the accident happened.
4032.translation: 大概（用于说明你认为某事很可能是真实的）

4033.definition: to suppose that something is true, although you do not have actual proof
4033.example: They are very expensive, I presume?
4033.translation: 假定（假定某事为真，尽管没有实际证据）

4034.definition: to behave in a particular way, in order to make other people believe something that is not true
4034.example: I'm tired of having to pretend all the time.
4034.translation: 假装（以特定方式表现以使他人相信非真实的事）

4035.translation: 漂亮的（吸引人但非极其美丽的）

4036.translation: 相当（在某种程度上；相当地）

4037.definition: to exist or be very common at a particular time or in a particular place
4037.example: prevail in something, We were horrified at the conditions prevailing in local prisons.
4037.translation: 流行，盛行（在特定时间或地点存在或非常普遍）

4038.definition: the fact of existing or being very common at a particular time or in a particular place
4038.example: an increase in the prevalence of smoking among young people
4038.translation: 流行，普及（在特定时间或地点存在或非常普遍的事实）

4039.definition: to stop somebody from doing something; to stop something from happening
4039.example: prevent something/somebody, The accident could have been prevented.
4039.translation: 防止（阻止某人做某事；阻止某事发生）

4040.definition: the act of stopping something bad from happening
4040.translation: 预防（阻止坏事发生的行为）

4041.definition: happening or existing before the event or object that you are talking about
4041.example: No previous experience is necessary for this job.
4041.translation: 以前的（在你谈论的事件或物体之前发生的或存在的）

4042.definition: at a time before the time that you are talking about
4042.example: The building had previously been used as a hotel.
4042.translation: 以前（在你谈论的时间点之前）

4043.definition: an animal, a bird, etc. that is hunted, killed and eaten by another
4043.example: The lion will often stalk its prey for hours.
4043.translation: 猎物（被另一动物追捕、杀死并食用的动物）

4044.definition: the amount of money that you have to pay for something
4044.translation: 价格（购买某物所需支付的金额）

4045.definition: to fix the price of something at a particular level
4045.example: be priced + adv./prep., The main courses are all reasonably priced.
4045.translation: 定价（将某物的价格固定在特定水平）

4046.definition: a feeling of being pleased or satisfied that you get when you or people who are connected with you have done something well or own something that other people admire
4046.example: The sight of her son graduating filled her with pride.
4046.translation: 自豪，骄傲（当你或相关人员表现出色时产生的心满意足感）

4047.definition: a person who is qualified to perform religious duties and ceremonies in the Roman Catholic, Anglican and Orthodox Churches
4047.translation: 牧师（在天主教、圣公会等教会有资格执行宗教仪式的人）

4048.example: a course designed primarily for specialists

4049.definition: connected with the education of children between the ages of about five and eleven
4049.translation: 小学的（与大约五至十一岁儿童的教育相关的）

4050.example: My prime concern is to protect my property.
4050.translation: 主要的，首要的（主要的；最重要的；基本的）

4051.definition: a male member of a royal family who is not king, especially the son or grandson of the king or queen
4051.translation: 王子（皇室男性成员，非国王，尤指国王/女王的子孙）

4052.definition: a female member of a royal family who is not a queen, especially the daughter or granddaughter of the king or queen
4052.translation: 公主（皇室女性成员，非女王，尤指国王/女王的子孙）

4053.example: The principal reason for this omission is lack of time.
4053.translation: 主要的（最重要的；主要的）

4054.definition: the person who is in charge of a college or (in Scotland and Canada) a university
4054.example: Peter Brown, principal of St John’s College
4054.translation: 校长（学院或大学的负责人）

4055.definition: a moral rule or a strong belief that influences your actions
4055.translation: 原则，准则（影响你行动的道德规则或坚定信念）

4056.definition: letters, words, numbers, etc. that have been printed onto paper
4056.example: The tiny print was hard to read without my glasses.
4056.translation: 印刷品（印在纸上的字母、单词、数字等）

4057.definition: to produce letters, pictures, etc. on paper using a machine that puts ink (= coloured liquid) on the surface
4057.example: print (something), I'm printing a copy of the document for you.
4057.translation: 印刷（使用机器在纸张表面着墨以产出文字、图片等）

4058.definition: a machine for printing text on paper, especially one connected to a computer
4058.translation: 打印机（打印文字到纸上的机器，尤指连接电脑的）

4059.definition: the act of producing letters, pictures, patterns, etc. on something by pressing a surface covered with ink (= coloured liquid for printing, drawing, etc.) against it
4059.translation: 印刷业（通过压印着墨表面在物体上产出文字图案的行为）

4060.definition: happening or existing before something else or before a particular time
4060.example: Although not essential, some prior knowledge of statistics is desirable.
4060.translation: 先前的（在另一事物或特定时间之前发生或存在的）

4061.definition: something that you think is more important than other things and should be dealt with first
4061.translation: 优先事项（你认为比其他更重要且应先处理的事）

4062.definition: a building where people are kept as a punishment for a crime they have committed, or while they are waiting for trial
4062.example: She went to prison for tax evasion.
4062.translation: 监狱（作为对犯罪惩罚而关押人的建筑，或供候审者居住）

4063.definition: a person who is kept in prison as a punishment, or while they are waiting for trial
4063.example: The number of prisoners serving life sentences has fallen.
4063.translation: 囚犯（被关在监狱里服刑或候审的人）

4064.definition: the state of being alone and not watched or interrupted by other people
4064.example: She was longing for some peace and privacy.
4064.translation: 隐私（独自一人且不被他人观看或打扰的状态）

4065.definition: belonging to or for the use of a particular person or group; not for public use
4065.example: The sign said, ‘Private property. Keep out.’
4065.translation: 私人的（属于或供特定人/群体使用的；非公开的）

4066.definition: the act of selling a business or an industry so that it is no longer owned by the government
4066.example: There were fears that privatization would lead to job losses.
4066.translation: 私有化（出售业务或行业使其不再由政府拥有的行为）

4067.definition: a special right or advantage that a particular person or group of people has
4067.example: Education should be a universal right and not a privilege.
4067.translation: 特权（特定个人或群体拥有的特殊权利或优势）

4068.definition: an award that is given to a person who wins a competition, race, etc. or who does very good work
4068.example: She was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize.
4068.translation: 奖品，奖项（给予比赛获胜者或表现优异者的奖励）

4069.definition: how likely something is to happen
4069.example: The probability is that prices will rise rapidly.
4069.translation: 可能性（某事发生的几率）

4070.definition: likely to happen, to exist or to be true
4070.translation: 可能的（很可能发生、存在或为真的）

4071.definition: used to say that something is likely to happen or to be true
4071.translation: 大概（用于表示某事很可能发生或属实）

4072.definition: a complete and careful investigation of something
4072.example: a police probe into the financial affairs of the company
4072.translation: 调查（对某事全面而仔细的调查）

4073.definition: to ask questions in order to find out secret or hidden information about somebody/something
4073.example: probe (into something), He didn't like the media probing into his past.
4073.translation: 探查，调查（提问以找出关于某人/某事的秘密或隐藏信息）

4074.definition: a thing that is difficult to deal with or to understand
4074.translation: 问题（难以处理或理解的事情）

4075.definition: difficult to deal with or to understand; full of problems; not certain to be successful
4075.example: The situation is more problematic than we first thought.
4075.translation: 有问题的（难以处理或理解的；充满问题的；不确定成功的）

4076.definition: a way of doing something, especially the usual or correct way
4076.translation: 程序，步骤（做某事的方式，尤指常规或正确的方式）

4077.definition: to continue doing something that has already been started; to continue being done
4077.example: We're not sure whether we still want to proceed with the sale.
4077.translation: 继续进行（继续做已经开始的事；继续被执行）

4078.definition: the process of using a court to settle an argument or to deal with a complaint
4078.translation: 诉讼，程序（使用法院解决争论或处理投诉的过程）

4079.definition: the money that you receive when you sell something or organize a performance, etc.; profits
4079.example: She sold her car and bought a piano with the proceeds.
4079.translation: 收益，收入（卖出某物或组织演出等收到的钱；利润）

4080.definition: a series of things that are done in order to achieve a particular result
4080.translation: 过程（为了实现特定结果而进行的一系列行动）

4082.definition: the treatment of raw material, food, etc. in order to change it, preserve it, etc.
4082.translation: 加工（为了改变、保存等对原材料或食品进行的处理）

4083.definition: a machine, person or company that processes things
4083.example: The company is Ireland's largest dairy processor.
4083.translation: 处理器（处理事物的机器、人或公司）

4084.definition: to publicly and officially tell people about something important
4084.example: proclaim something, The president proclaimed a state of emergency.
4084.translation: 宣布（公开且正式地告知重要事情）

4085.definition: things that have been made or grown, especially things connected with farming
4085.example: The market is full of farm produce.
4085.translation: 产品，农产品（已制造出或生长出的东西，尤指与农业相关的）

4086.definition: to make things to be sold, especially in large quantities
4086.example: Our company mainly produces goods for export.
4086.translation: 生产（制造供出售的东西，尤指大量生产）

4087.definition: a person, a company or a country that grows or makes food, goods or materials
4087.translation: 生产者（种植或制造食物、商品或材料的人、公司或国家）

4088.definition: a thing that is grown, produced or created, usually for sale
4088.translation: 产品（通常为了出售而生长、生产或创造的东西）

4089.definition: the process of growing or making food, goods or materials, especially large quantities
4089.translation: 生产（生长或制造食物、商品或材料的过程，尤指大量生产）

4090.definition: making goods or growing crops, especially in large quantities
4090.translation: 多产的（制造商品或种植作物，尤指大量地）

4091.definition: the rate at which a worker, a company or a country produces goods, and the amount produced, compared with how much time, work and money is needed to produce them
4091.translation: 生产力（劳动者或公司生产商品的速率及产量）

4092.definition: a type of job that needs special training or skill, especially one that needs a high level of education
4092.translation: 职业（需要特殊培训或技能的工作类型，尤指需要高等教育者）

4093.definition: doing something as a paid job rather than as a hobby
4093.translation: 专业的（作为带薪工作而非爱好而进行的）

4094.definition: a person who does a job that needs special training and a high level of education
4094.example: You need a professional to sort out your finances.
4094.translation: 专业人员（从事需要特殊培训和高等教育工作的人）

4095.definition: a university teacher of the highest rank
4095.translation: 教授（大学中最高级别的教师）

4096.definition: a description of somebody/something that gives useful information
4096.example: We first build up a detailed profile of our customers and their requirements.
4096.translation: 概况，简介（对某人/某物提供有用信息的描述）

4097.definition: the money that you make in business or by selling things, especially after paying the costs involved
4097.translation: 利润（在业务或销售中赚取的钱，尤指扣除成本后）

4098.definition: that makes or is likely to make money
4098.translation: 盈利的（能赚钱或很可能赚钱的）

4099.definition: very great; felt or experienced very strongly
4099.example: profound changes in the earth’s climate
4099.translation: 深刻的（极大的；感觉或体验非常强烈的）

4100.definition: a set of instructions in code that control the operations or functions of a computer
4100.example: You'll need to download and install the program on your computer.
4100.translation: 程序（控制电脑运行或功能的一套代码指令）

4101.definition: to give a computer, etc. a set of instructions to make it perform a particular task
4101.example: In this class, students will learn how to program.
4101.translation: 编程（给电脑等设定一套指令使其执行特定任务）

4102.definition: something that people watch on television or listen to on the radio
4102.translation: 节目（在电视或广播中收看收听的内容）

4103.definition: the process of writing and testing computer programs
4103.translation: 编程（编写和测试计算机程序的过程）

4104.definition: the process of improving or developing, or of getting nearer to achieving or completing something
4104.translation: 进步，进展（改进、发展或接近完成某事的过程）

4105.definition: to improve or develop over a period of time; to make progress
4105.example: The course allows students to progress at their own speed.
4105.translation: 进步，进展（在一段时间内改进或发展）

4106.definition: in favour of new ideas, modern methods and change
4106.translation: 进步的，先进的（支持新主意、现代方法和变革的）

4107.definition: to stop something from being done or used especially by law
4107.example: prohibit something, a law prohibiting the sale of alcohol
4107.translation: 禁止（停止某事的执行或使用，尤指通过法律）

4108.definition: a piece of work involving careful study of a subject over a period of time, done by school or college students
4108.translation: 项目，课题（由学生进行的涉及对某一主题仔细研究的一项工作）

4109.definition: to estimate what the size, cost or amount of something will be in the future based on what is happening now
4109.example: be projected, A growth rate of 4 per cent is projected for next year.
4109.translation: 预测，推算（基于现状估算某事未来的规模、成本或数量）

4110.definition: an estimate or a statement of what figures, amounts, or events will be in the future, or what they were in the past, based on what is happening now
4110.example: to make forward/backward projections of population figures
4110.translation: 预测，推算（基于现状对未来或过去数字、事件的估算或陈述）

4111.translation: 杰出的，显著的（重要的或众所周知的）

4112.definition: a statement that tells somebody that you will definitely do or not do something
4112.translation: 承诺，诺言（肯定会做或不做某事的陈述）

4113.definition: to tell somebody that you will definitely do or not do something, or that something will definitely happen
4113.example: ‘We haven't got time to go to the park.’ ‘But you promised!’
4113.translation: 承诺（告诉某人肯定会做或不做某事，或某事肯定会发生）

4114.definition: showing signs of being good or successful
4114.example: He was voted the most promising new actor for his part in the movie.
4114.translation: 有希望的，有前途的（显示出良好或成功迹象的）

4115.definition: to help sell a product, service, etc. or make it more popular by advertising it or offering it at a special price
4115.example: promote something, The band has gone on tour to promote their new album.
4115.translation: 促销，推演（通过广告或特价帮助销售产品或提高知名度）

4116.definition: a move to a more important job or rank in a company or an organization
4116.example: The new job is a promotion for him.
4116.translation: 晋升，升职（在公司或组织中升至更重要的职位）

4117.definition: to make somebody decide to do something; to cause something to happen
4117.example: prompt something, The discovery of the bomb prompted an increase in security.
4117.translation: 促使，引起（使某人决定做某事；导致某事发生）

4118.definition: to make the sound of a word or letter in a particular way
4118.translation: 发音（以特定方式发出单词或字母的读音）

4119.definition: very obvious, easy to notice or strongly expressed
4119.example: He walked with a pronounced limp.
4119.translation: 显著的，明显的（非常明显、易于察觉或强烈表达的）

4120.definition: information, documents, etc. that show that something is true
4120.translation: 证明，证据（显示某事属实的信息、文件等）

4121.definition: ideas or statements that may be false or present only one side of an argument that are used in order to gain support for a political leader, party, etc.
4121.translation: 宣传，政治宣传（可能虚假或片面的旨在获得政治支持的想法或陈述）

4122.definition: right, appropriate or correct; according to the rules
4122.example: We should have had a proper discussion before voting.
4122.translation: 正确的，恰当的（合适的、正确的或符合规则的）

4123.definition: in a way that is correct and/or appropriate
4123.example: How much money do we need to do the job properly?
4123.translation: 正确地，恰当地（以正确和/或恰当的方式）

4124.definition: a thing or things that are owned by somebody; a possession or possessions
4124.translation: 财产，房产（某人拥有的东西；所有物）

4125.definition: a part or share of a whole
4125.example: Water covers a large proportion of the earth's surface.
4125.translation: 比例（整体中的一部分或份额）

4126.definition: a formal suggestion or plan; the act of making a suggestion
4126.translation: 提议，建议（正式的建议或计划；提出建议的行为）

4127.definition: to suggest a plan, an idea, etc. for people to think about and decide on
4127.example: propose something, The government proposed changes to the voting system.
4127.translation: 提议，建议（提出计划、想法等供人们思考和决定）

4128.definition: an idea or a plan of action that is suggested, especially in business
4128.example: I'd like to put a business proposition to you.
4128.translation: 主张，提议（被建议的想法或行动计划，尤指在商业中）

4129.definition: to officially charge somebody with a crime in court
4129.example: The police decided not to prosecute.
4129.translation: 起诉（在法庭上正式指控某人犯罪）

4130.definition: the process of trying to prove in court that somebody is guilty of a crime (= of prosecuting them); the process of being officially charged with a crime in court
4130.example: Prosecution for a first minor offence rarely leads to imprisonment.
4130.translation: 起诉，公诉（在法庭上证明某人有罪的过程；被正式指控犯罪的过程）

4131.definition: a public official who charges somebody officially with a crime and prosecutes them in court
4131.translation: 检察官（正式指控某人犯罪并在法庭上起草公诉的公职人员）

4132.definition: the possibility that something will happen
4132.example: prospect of something, There is no immediate prospect of peace.
4132.translation: 前景，可能性（某事发生的可能性）

4133.definition: expected to do something or to become something
4133.translation: 预期的，未来的（期望去做某事或成为某样身份的）

4134.definition: the state of being successful, especially in making money
4134.example: Our future prosperity depends on economic growth.
4134.translation: 繁荣，兴旺（成功，尤指在赚钱方面）

4135.definition: to make sure that somebody/something is not harmed, injured, damaged, etc.
4135.translation: 保护（确保某人/某物不被伤害、受损等）

4136.definition: the act of protecting somebody/something; the state of being protected
4136.example: protection against something, Wear clothes that provide adequate protection against the wind and rain.
4136.translation: 保护（保护某人/某物的行为；受保护的状态）

4137.definition: providing or intended to provide protection
4137.example: Workers should wear full protective clothing.
4137.translation: 保护性的（提供或旨在提供保护的）

4138.definition: a substance, found within all living things, that forms the structure of muscles, organs, etc. There are many different proteins and they are an essential part of what humans and animals eat to help them grow and stay healthy.
4138.translation: 蛋白质（存在于所有生物中、构成肌肉器官结构、维持健康必需的物质）

4139.definition: the expression of strong dislike of or opposition to something; a statement or an action that shows this
4139.translation: 抗议（对某事强烈不满或反对的表达；展现此情绪的声明或行动）

4140.definition: to say or do something to show that you disagree with something or think it is bad, especially publicly
4140.example: There's no use protesting, I won't change my mind.
4140.translation: 抗议（通过言行展示你不同意某事或认为其不好，尤指公开地）

4141.definition: a person who makes a public protest
4141.example: Thousands of protesters marched through the city.
4141.translation: 抗议者（进行公开抗议的人）

4142.definition: a system of fixed rules and formal behaviour used at official meetings, usually between governments
4142.translation: 协议，礼仪（官方会议——通常是政府间——使用的固定规则和正式行为体系）

4143.definition: feeling pleased and satisfied about something that you own or have done, or are connected with
4143.translation: 自豪的，骄傲的（对自己拥有、完成或相关的事物感到满意和欣慰的）

4144.definition: to use facts, evidence, etc. to show that something is true
4144.example: prove something, They hope this new evidence will prove her innocence.
4144.translation: 证明（使用事实、证据等显示某事属实）

4145.definition: to give something to somebody or make it available for them to use
4145.example: provide something, Please provide the following information.
4145.translation: 提供（给予某人某物或使其可供使用）

4146.definition: one of the areas that some countries are divided into with its own local government
4146.translation: 省，省份（一些国家划分出的拥有地方政府的区域之一）

4147.definition: connected with one of the large areas that some countries are divided into, with its own local government
4147.translation: 省的，地方性的（与国家划分出的拥有地方政府的区域相关的）

4148.definition: the act of supplying somebody with something that they need or want; something that is supplied
4148.translation: 供应，规定（为某人提供其所需或所欲之物的行为；所提供之物）

4149.definition: to cause a particular reaction or have a particular effect
4149.example: The announcement provoked a storm of protest.
4149.translation: 挑衅，引起（引起特定的反应或产生特定的效果）

4150.definition: relating to psychiatry or to mental illnesses
4150.translation: 精神病学的（与精神病学或精神疾病相关的）

4151.definition: connected with a person’s mind and the way in which it works
4151.translation: 心理的（与人的思想及其运作方式相关的）

4152.definition: a scientist who studies and is trained in psychology
4152.translation: 心理学家（研究心理学并受过相关训练的科学家）

4153.definition: the scientific study of the mind and how it influences behaviour
4153.translation: 心理学（关于思维及行为影响的科学研究）

4154.definition: a building where people go to drink and meet their friends. Pubs serve alcoholic and other drinks, and often also food.
4154.example: We're all going to the pub after work.
4154.translation: 酒吧（人们聚会饮酒的建筑，通常也供应食物）

4155.definition: connected with ordinary people in society in general
4155.example: The campaign is designed to increase public awareness of the issues.
4155.translation: 公众的（与社会大众相关的）

4156.definition: ordinary people in society in general
4156.example: The palace is now open to the public.
4156.translation: 公众，民众（社会中的普通大众）

4157.definition: the act of printing a book, a magazine, etc. and making it available to the public; a book, a magazine, etc. that has been published
4157.translation: 出版，出版物（印制书籍、杂志等并供公众使用的行为；已出版的书报）

4158.definition: the attention that is given to somebody/something by newspapers, television, etc.
4158.translation: 宣传，知名度（报纸、电视等给予某人/某物的关注）

4159.definition: to produce a book, magazine, CD-ROM, etc. and sell it to the public
4159.translation: 出版，发表（制作书、报、CD等并向公众出售）

4160.definition: the profession or business of preparing and printing books, magazines, CD-ROMs, etc. and selling or making them available to the public
4160.translation: 出版业（准备并印制书报、CD等并向公众出售的职业或行业）

4161.definition: an act of trying to make something move by taking hold of it and using force to bring it towards you
4161.example: I gave the door a sharp pull and it opened.
4161.translation: 拉（通过握住并用力使其向你移动的尝试）

4162.definition: to take hold of something and use force in order to move it or try to move it towards yourself
4162.translation: 拉，拽（拿住某物并用力使其向你移动）

4163.definition: the regular beat of the heart as it sends blood around the body, that can be felt in different places, especially on the inside part of the wrist; the number of times the heart beats in a minute
4163.translation: 脉搏（心脏向全身输送血液时的规律跳动，可在手腕等处感觉到）

4164.definition: a machine that is used to force liquid, gas or air into or out of something
4164.translation: 泵，抽水机（用于将液体、气体或空气压入或压出某物的机器）

4165.definition: to make water, air, gas, etc. flow in a particular direction by using a pump or something that works like a pump
4165.example: pump something (+ adv./prep.), The engine is used for pumping water out of the mine.
4165.translation: 抽吸，泵送（使用泵使水、气等向特定方向流动）

4166.definition: a hard hit made with the fist (= closed hand)
4166.translation: 拳击（用拳头进行的有力击打）

4167.definition: to hit somebody/something hard with your fist (= closed hand)
4167.example: punch somebody/something, He was kicked and punched as he lay on the ground.
4167.translation: 用拳头击打（用拳头有力地击打某人/某物）

4168.definition: to make somebody suffer because they have broken the law or done something wrong
4168.example: punish somebody, Those responsible for this crime will be severely punished.
4168.translation: 惩罚（因某人违法或做错事而使其受苦）

4169.definition: an act or a way of punishing somebody
4169.translation: 惩罚（惩罚某人的行为或方式）

4170.definition: a type of loud and aggressive rock music popular in the late 1970s and early 1980s
4170.translation: 朋克（70年代末80年代初流行的一种吵闹且具攻击性的摇滚乐）

4171.definition: a person who is being taught, especially a child in a school
4171.translation: 学生（正在接受教育的人，尤指小学生）

4172.definition: the act or process of buying something
4172.example: to make a purchase (= buy something)
4172.translation: 购买（购买某物的行为或过程）

4173.example: purchase something, Please ensure that you purchase your ticket in advance.

4174.definition: not mixed with anything else; with nothing added
4174.translation: 纯的（不含杂质的；未添加他物的）

4175.example: I saw the letter purely by chance.

4176.definition: having the colour of blue and red mixed together
4176.translation: 紫色的（蓝红混合产生的颜色）

4177.definition: the colour of blue and red mixed together
4177.example: Her hair was dyed a bright shade of purple.
4177.translation: 紫色（蓝红混合产生的颜色）

4178.definition: the intention, aim or function of something; the thing that something is supposed to achieve
4178.example: Our campaign's main purpose is to raise money.
4178.translation: 目的（某事物的意图、目标或功能；某事物旨在实现的目标）

4179.definition: to do something or try to achieve something over a period of time
4179.translation: 追求，从事（在一段时间内做某事或尝试实现某目标）

4180.definition: the act of looking for or trying to get something
4180.example: pursuit of something, the pursuit of happiness/knowledge/profit
4180.translation: 追求（寻找或尝试获得某物的行为，如追求幸福）

4181.example: She gave him a gentle push.

4182.definition: to use your hands, arms or body in order to make somebody/something move forward or away from you; to move part of your body into a particular position
4182.example: We pushed and pushed but the piano wouldn't move.
4182.translation: 推（用手、臂或身体使某人/某物向前或远离你移动）

4183.definition: to move something into a particular place or position
4183.example: Put the cases down there, please.
4183.translation: 放，置（将某物移动到特定的地方或位置）

4184.definition: a game, etc. that you have to think about carefully in order to answer it or do it
4184.translation: 谜，难题（需要仔细思考才能回答或完成的游戏等）

4185.definition: an exam that you have passed or a course of study that you have successfully completed
4185.translation: 资格，资历（通过的考试或成功完成的学业课程）

4186.definition: having passed the exams or completed the training that are necessary in order to do a particular job; having the experience to do a particular job
4186.translation: 合格的（已通过考试或完成培训，具备从事特定工作的经验或能力）

4187.definition: to reach the standard of ability or knowledge needed to do a particular job, for example by completing a course of study or passing exams
4187.example: How long does it take to qualify?
4187.translation: 取得资格（达到从事特定工作所需的标准，如通过学业或考试）

4188.definition: the standard of something when it is compared to other things like it; how good or bad something is
4188.example: Improving the quality of care for nursing home residents is a priority.
4188.translation: 质量，标准（事物与其他同类事物比较时的标准；好坏程度）

4189.definition: an amount or a number of something
4189.example: quantity of something, a large/small quantity of something
4189.translation: 数量（某事物的数额或多少）

4190.definition: one of four equal parts of something
4190.example: quarter of something, a quarter of an hour/a century
4190.translation: 四分之一（某事物的四个相等部分之一）

4191.definition: the female ruler of an independent state that has a royal family
4191.example: She was crowned queen at the age of fifteen.
4191.translation: 女王（拥有皇室家族的独立国家的女性统治者）

4192.definition: a question, especially one asking for information or expressing a doubt about something
4192.example: Our assistants will be happy to answer your queries.
4192.translation: 疑问，查询（问题，尤指询问信息或表示怀疑的问题）

4193.definition: a long search for something, especially for some quality such as happiness
4193.example: quest for something, the quest for happiness/knowledge/truth
4193.translation: 探索，追求（对某种品质如幸福、知识的长期搜寻）

4194.definition: a sentence, phrase or word that asks for information
4194.translation: 问题（询问信息的句子、短语或词）

4195.definition: to ask somebody questions about something, especially officially
4195.example: question somebody, Police are keen to question any witnesses.
4195.translation: 提问，质询（向某人询问关于某事的问题，尤指正式地）

4196.definition: a written list of questions that are answered by a number of people so that information can be collected from the answers
4196.example: (British English), to fill in a questionnaire
4196.translation: 问卷调查（为了收集信息而由多人回答的书面问题列表）

4197.definition: a line of people, cars, etc. waiting for something or to do something
4197.example: There were long queues at polling stations.
4197.translation: 队列（等待某物或做某事的人或车排成的行）

4198.definition: to wait in a line of people, vehicles, etc. in order to do something, get something or go somewhere
4198.translation: 排队（排成一行人或车以等待做某事或去某处）

4199.definition: done with speed; taking or lasting a short time
4199.translation: 快的（以很快速度完成的；耗时短的）

4201.translation: 安静的（发出很小响声的）

4202.definition: in a way that makes very little noise
4202.translation: 安静地（以发出很小响声的方式）

4203.definition: to leave your job, school, etc.
4203.example: If I don't get more money I'll quit.
4203.translation: 辞职，退出（离开工作、学校等）

4204.translation: 相当，非常（在某种程度上）

4205.definition: a limited number or amount of people or things that is officially allowed
4205.example: to introduce a strict import quota on grain
4205.translation: 配额，限额（官方允许的受限制的人或物的数量）

4206.definition: a group of words or a short piece of writing taken from a book, play, speech, etc. and repeated because it is interesting or useful
4206.translation: 引用，引文（摘自书籍、演讲等并因有趣有用而被重复的一组词）

4207.definition: a group of words or a short piece of writing taken from a book, play, speech, etc. and repeated because it is interesting or useful
4207.example: The essay was full of quotes.
4207.translation: 引用，引文（摘自书籍、演讲等并因有趣有用而被重复的一组词）

4208.definition: to repeat the exact words that another person has said or written
4208.translation: 引用（重复他人说过或写过的确切词语）

4209.definition: a competition between people, animals, vehicles, etc. to see which one is the faster or fastest
4209.translation: 比赛（比谁更快或最快的竞争，如赛船/赛马）

4210.definition: to compete against somebody/something to see who can go faster or the fastest, do something first, etc.; to take part in a race or races
4210.example: They raced to a thrilling victory in the relay.
4210.translation: 赛跑，竞速（与他人/物比快；参加比赛）

4211.definition: happening or existing between people of different races
4211.translation: 种族的（发生在不同种族人群之间或与之相关的）

4212.example: He used to watch the racing on TV in the afternoons.

4213.definition: the unfair treatment of people who belong to a different race; violent behaviour towards them
4213.translation: 种族主义（对不同种族人群的不公平对待；暴力行为）

4214.definition: having the belief that some races of people are better than others or having general beliefs about other people based only on their race; showing this through violent or unfair treatment of people of other races
4214.translation: 种族主义的（认为某些种族优于他人的；表现出不公平对待的）

4215.definition: a person who believes that some races of people are better than others or who has general beliefs about other people based only on their race, and may show this in violent or unfair treatment of people of other races
4215.translation: 种族主义者（相信某些种族优于他人或对他人有不公平对待的人）

4216.definition: a system that uses radio waves to find the position and movement of objects, for example planes and ships, when they cannot be seen
4216.example: They located the ship by radar.
4216.translation: 雷达（使用无线电波探测肉眼看不见物体位置和移动的系统）

4217.definition: powerful and very dangerous rays that are sent out from radioactive substances
4217.example: high levels/doses of radiation that damage cells
4217.translation: 辐射（放射性物质发出的强有力且危险的射线）

4218.definition: relating to the most basic and important parts of something; complete and detailed
4218.example: the need for radical changes in education
4218.translation: 激进的，根本的（涉及事物最基本、最重要部分的；彻底详细的）

4219.definition: the activity of broadcasting programmes for people to listen to; the programmes that are broadcast
4219.example: The play was written specially for radio.
4219.translation: 无线电，收音机（播放节目供人收听的活动；所播放的节目）

4220.definition: a feeling of violent anger that is difficult to control
4220.example: His face was dark with rage.
4220.translation: 愤怒（难以控制的暴怒感）

4221.definition: a short surprise attack on an enemy by soldiers, ships or aircraft
4221.translation: 突袭（士兵、船只或飞机对敌人的突然袭击）

4222.definition: to visit a person or place without warning to look for criminals, illegal goods, drugs, etc.
4222.example: The house was raided in the early hours.
4222.translation: 突击搜查（不打招呼地访问某处以搜寻罪犯、非法财物等）

4223.definition: a wooden or metal bar placed around something as a barrier or to provide support
4223.example: She leaned on the ship's rail and gazed out to sea.
4223.translation: 扶手，栏杆（放置在物体周围作为屏障或提供支撑的木/金属条）

4224.definition: a track with rails on which trains run
4224.example: The railway is still under construction.

4225.definition: water that falls from the sky in separate drops
4225.example: There will be rain in all parts tomorrow.

4226.definition: when it rains, water falls from the sky in drops

4227.definition: to lift or move something to a higher level
4227.example: She raised the gun and fired.
4227.translation: 举起，提高（将某物提升到更高水平）

4228.definition: a large public meeting, especially one held to support a particular idea or political party
4228.translation: 集会（为了支持特定想法或政党而举行的大型公共会议）

4229.definition: to come together or bring people together in order to help or support somebody/something
4229.example: rally around/behind somebody/something, The cabinet rallied behind the Prime Minister.
4229.translation: 团结，支持（为了帮助或支持某人/某事而聚在一起）

4230.definition: done, chosen, etc. without somebody deciding in advance what is going to happen, or without any regular pattern
4230.example: the random killing of innocent people
4230.translation: 随机的（在未预先决定或无常规模式的情况下完成或选择的）

4231.definition: a variety of things of a particular type
4231.example: range of something, The hotel offers a wide range of facilities.
4231.translation: 范围（特定类型的各种各样的事物）

4232.definition: to vary between two particular amounts, sizes, etc., including others between them
4232.example: range from A to B, Accommodation ranges from tourist class to luxury hotels.
4232.translation: 在...范围内变化（在两个特定的量、尺寸等之间变化，包括中间值）

4233.definition: the position, especially a high position, that somebody has in a particular organization, society, etc.
4233.example: She was not used to mixing with people of high social rank.
4233.translation: 等级，地位（某人在组织或社会中所处的位置，尤指高位）

4234.definition: to give somebody/something a particular position on a scale according to quality, importance, success, etc.; to have a position of this kind
4234.example: rank somebody/something, In most Australian elections, electors are required to rank all candidates.
4234.translation: 分等级，排名（根据质量、重要性等在尺度上给某人/某物特定位置）

4235.definition: the position of somebody/something on a scale that shows how good or important they are in relation to other similar people or things, especially in sport
4235.example: He has improved his ranking this season from 67th to 30th.
4235.translation: 排名（某人/某物在展示其优劣或重要性尺度上的位置，尤指体育）

4236.definition: the crime of forcing somebody to have sex when they do not want it or are not able to agree to it
4236.translation: 强奸（违背他人意愿强行发生性关系的罪行）

4237.definition: to force somebody to have sex when they do not want it or are not able to agree to it
4237.translation: 强奸（违背他人意愿强行发生性关系）

4238.definition: happening quickly or in a short period of time
4238.translation: 快速的（迅速发生或在短时间内发生的）

4239.definition: very quickly; at a great rate
4239.translation: 快速地（非常迅速地；以很大的速率）

4240.definition: not done, seen, happening, etc. very often
4240.translation: 稀有的（不经常做、看到或发生的）

4241.example: She is rarely seen in public nowadays.

4242.definition: a small animal with a long tail, that looks like a large mouse, usually considered a pest (= an animal which is disliked because it destroys food or spreads disease)
4242.translation: 老鼠（带长尾巴、类似大号小鼠的动物，通常被视为害虫）

4243.definition: a measurement of the speed at which something happens
4243.example: rate (of something), Figures published today show another fall in the rate of inflation.
4243.translation: 速率，速度（某事发生速度的测量）

4244.definition: to have or think that somebody/something has a particular level of quality, value, etc.
4244.example: rate somebody/something + adv./prep., The university is highly rated for its research.
4244.translation: 评价，等级（认为某人/某物具有特定水平的质量或价值）

4245.definition: used to mean ‘fairly’ or ‘to some degree’, often when you are disappointed, surprised or expressing slight criticism
4245.translation: 相当，宁愿（意为“相当地”，常用于失望、惊讶或轻微批评时）

4246.definition: a measurement of how good, popular, important, etc. somebody/something is, especially in relation to other people or things
4246.example: The poll gave an approval rating of 39 per cent for the president.
4246.translation: 评分，评价（对某人/某物好坏、受欢迎程度的测量）

4247.definition: the relationship between two groups of people or things that is represented by two numbers showing how much larger one group is than the other
4247.example: The school has a very high teacher-student ratio.
4247.translation: 比例，比率（代表两组人或物间大小关系的两个数字）

4248.definition: based on reason rather than emotions
4248.translation: 理性的（基于理智而非情感的）

4250.definition: a narrow line of light, heat or other energy
4250.example: The last of the sun's rays shone on the grass.
4250.translation: 射线（光、热或其他能量的细线）

4251.definition: the distance over which you can stretch your arms to touch something; the distance over which a particular object can be used to touch something else
4251.example: beyond somebody's reach, The shot was well beyond the reach of the goalkeeper.
4251.translation: 触及范围（手臂伸展能触及的距离；或物体能接触他物的距离）

4252.definition: to arrive at the place that you have been travelling to
4252.example: They didn't reach the border until after dark.
4252.translation: 到达（到达你一直在旅行前往的地方）

4253.definition: to change or behave in a particular way as a result of or in response to something
4253.example: I nudged her but she didn't react.
4253.translation: 反应（作为对某事的响应而以特定方式改变或表现）

4254.definition: what you do, say or think as a result of something that has happened
4254.translation: 反应（由于发生之事你所做的行为、言语或思考）

4255.definition: to look at and understand the meaning of written or printed words or symbols
4255.translation: 读（看并理解书写或打印文字符号的含义）

4256.definition: a person who reads, especially one who reads a lot or in a particular way
4256.example: an avid reader of science fiction
4256.translation: 读者（读书的人，尤指读得多或以特定方式读的人）

4257.example: All ingredients are readily available from your local store.
4257.translation: 容易地，迅速地（快速且无困难地）

4258.definition: the activity of somebody who reads
4258.example: My hobbies include reading and painting.

4259.definition: fully prepared for what you are going to do and able to start it immediately
4259.translation: 准备好的（为要做的事充分准备好并能立即开始的）

4260.definition: actually existing or happening and not imagined or pretended
4260.translation: 真实的（实际存在或发生的，而非想象或虚构的）

4261.definition: accepting in a sensible way what it is actually possible to do or achieve in a particular situation
4261.translation: 现实的（以明智方式接受在特定情况下实际可能做到的）

4262.definition: the true situation and the problems that actually exist in life, in contrast to how you would like life to be
4262.translation: 现实（生活中的真实情况和实际存在的问题，与理想相对）

4263.definition: the process of becoming aware of something
4263.example: As realization dawned, he went pale.
4263.translation: 意识到，变现实（察觉到某事的过程）

4264.definition: to understand or become aware of a particular fact or situation
4264.example: realize (that)…, I didn’t realize (that) you were so unhappy.
4264.translation: 意识到（理解或察觉到特定的事实或情况）

4265.definition: used to emphasize an adjective or adverb
4265.translation: 真正地（用于强调形容词或副词）

4266.definition: an area of activity, interest or knowledge
4266.example: in the realm of something, in the realm of literature
4266.translation: 领域（活动、兴趣或知识的范围）

4267.definition: at or near the back of something
4267.translation: 后面的（在某物后端或靠近后端的）

4268.example: A trailer was attached to the rear of the truck.

4269.definition: a cause or an explanation for something that has happened or that somebody has done
4269.example: He said no but he didn't give a reason.
4269.translation: 原因，理由（发生之事或某人所做之事的起因或解释）

4270.example: it is reasonable to do something, It is reasonable to assume that he knew beforehand that this would happen.
4270.translation: 合理的（公正、务实且明智的）

4271.definition: to a degree that is fairly good but not very good
4271.translation: 尚可地，相当地（程度相当好但非非常好地）

4272.definition: the process of thinking about things in a logical way; opinions and ideas that are based on logical thinking
4272.example: What is the reasoning behind this decision?
4272.translation: 推理，论证（以逻辑方式思考的过程；基于逻辑思维的观点）

4273.definition: to say or do something that makes somebody less frightened or worried
4273.example: reassure somebody (about something), They tried to reassure her, but she still felt anxious.
4273.translation: 使放心（通过言行使某人减少恐惧或忧虑）

4274.definition: a person who fights against the government of their country
4274.translation: 反叛者（反对其国家政府的人）

4275.definition: an attempt by some of the people in a country to change their government, using violence
4275.example: in rebellion (against somebody/something), The north of the country rose in rebellion against the government.
4275.translation: 反叛，起义（国家部分民众利用暴力改变政府的尝试）

4276.definition: to build or put something together again
4276.example: After the earthquake, the people set about rebuilding their homes.
4276.translation: 重建（再次建造或组装某物）

4277.example: recall something, She could not recall his name.

4278.definition: a piece of paper or an electronic document that shows that goods or services have been paid for
4278.example: Can I have a receipt, please?
4278.translation: 收据，收据（显示商品或服务已付款的纸张或电子文档）

4279.definition: to get or accept something that is sent or given to you
4279.translation: 收到（得到或接受发给你的东西）

4280.definition: the part of a phone that you hold close to your mouth and ear
4280.example: to pick up/lift/put down/replace the receiver
4280.translation: 听筒（电话中靠近嘴和耳朵的部分）

4281.definition: that happened or began only a short time ago
4281.translation: 最近的（不久前发生或开始的）

4283.definition: the area inside the entrance of a hotel, an office building, etc. where guests or visitors go first when they arrive
4283.example: Please report to reception on arrival.
4283.translation: 前台，接待处（旅馆、办公楼入口内客人到达时先去的地方）

4284.definition: a difficult time for the economy of a country, when there is less trade and industrial activity than usual and more people are unemployed
4284.example: How do you assess the impact of the current recession on manufacturing?
4284.translation: 衰退，不景气（国家经济困难时期，贸易减少且失业增加）

4285.definition: a set of instructions that tells you how to cook something and the ingredients (= items of food) you need for it
4285.example: recipe for something, a recipe for chicken soup
4285.translation: 食谱（告诉如何烹饪某物及所需食材的一套指令）

4287.definition: to think something or have an opinion about something
4287.example: I reckon (that) I’m going to get that job.
4287.translation: 认为，料想（认为或持有关于某事的某种观点）

4288.definition: the act of remembering who somebody is when you see them, or of identifying what something is
4288.example: He glanced briefly towards her but there was no sign of recognition.
4288.translation: 认出，承认（看到某人时想起其是谁，或识别出某物是什么）

4289.definition: to know who somebody is or what something is when you see or hear them or it, because you have seen or heard them or it before
4289.example: recognize somebody/something, I recognized him as soon as he came in the room.
4289.translation: 认出（因以前见过或听过而知道某人/某物是谁/是什么）

4290.definition: to tell somebody that something is good or useful, or that somebody would be suitable for a particular job, etc.
4290.example: recommend somebody/something, The hotel's new restaurant comes highly recommended (= a lot of people have praised it).
4290.translation: 推荐（告诉某人某物好或有用，或某人适合某项工作）

4291.definition: an official suggestion about the best thing to do
4291.translation: 推荐（关于最好做法的正式建议）

4292.definition: the process of changing or improving the condition of something or the way it works; the process of putting something back into the state it was in before
4292.example: the reconstruction of the educational system
4292.translation: 重建（改变或改善某物状况的过程；恢复到先前状态的过程）

4293.definition: a written account of something that is kept so that it can be looked at and used in the future
4293.example: You should keep a record of your expenses.
4293.translation: 记录（为了未来查阅而保留的关于某事的书面陈述）

4294.definition: to keep a permanent account of facts or events by writing them down, filming them, storing them in a computer, etc.
4294.example: record something, Her childhood is recorded in the diaries of those years.
4294.translation: 记录（通过书写、拍摄、存储在电脑等方式保留事实或事件的永久陈述）

4295.definition: sound or pictures that have been recorded on computer files or on CD, DVD, video, etc.
4295.translation: 记录，录音（存储在电脑文件、CD、视频等中的声音或画面）

4296.definition: sound or pictures that have been recorded on computer files or on CD, DVD, video, etc.
4296.translation: 描述，叙述（详细讲述事件或经历）

4297.definition: to get well again after being ill, hurt, etc.
4297.example: recover from something, He's still recovering from his operation.
4297.translation: 康复（生病、受伤后再次好转）

4298.definition: the process of becoming well again after an illness or injury
4298.example: My father has made a full recovery from the operation.
4298.translation: 康复（生病或受伤后再次好转的过程）

4299.definition: a person who has recently joined the armed forces or the police
4299.translation: 新兵，新成员（最近加入武装部队或警察的人）

4300.definition: to find new people to join a company, an organization, the armed forces, etc.
4300.example: recruit (somebody), We are trying to recruit officers from more diverse backgrounds.
4300.translation: 招募（寻找新人加入公司、组织、军队等）

4301.definition: the act or process of finding new people to join a company, an organization, the armed forces, etc.
4301.translation: 招募（寻找新人加入公司、组织、军队等的行为或过程）

4302.definition: to treat things that have already been used so that they can be used again
4302.translation: 回收利用（对已使用的物品进行处理以便再次使用）

4303.definition: having the colour of blood or fire
4303.translation: 红色的（血液或火的颜色）

4304.definition: the colour of blood or fire

4305.definition: to make something less or smaller in size, quantity, price, etc.; to become less or smaller in size, quantity, etc.
4305.example: reduce something, Reduce speed now (= on a sign).
4305.translation: 减少（在规模、数量、价格等方面使之变小或变少）

4306.definition: an act of making something less or smaller; the state of being made less or smaller
4306.example: Some staff received wage rises, while others experienced a reduction.
4306.translation: 减少（使某物变小、变少的行为；被缩减的状态）

4307.definition: to send somebody/something to somebody/something for help, advice or a decision
4307.example: refer somebody/something to somebody/something, My doctor referred me to a specialist.
4307.translation: 转诊，查阅（为了寻求帮助、建议或决定而将某人/物转给他人/机构）

4308.definition: the official who controls the game in some sports
4308.example: He was sent off for arguing with the referee.
4308.translation: 裁判（在某些体育运动中控制比赛的官员）

4309.definition: a thing you say or write that mentions somebody/something else; the act of mentioning somebody/something
4309.example: reference to somebody/something, She made no reference to her illness but only to her future plans.
4309.translation: 提及，引用（谈论或写到他人/他物的言语；提及的行为）

4310.definition: an occasion when all the people of a country can vote on an important issue
4310.example: referendum on something, Switzerland decided to hold a referendum on joining the EU.
4310.translation: 全民公投（一国全体民众对重大问题进行投票的场合）

4311.definition: to show the image of somebody/something on the surface of something such as a mirror, water or glass
4311.example: be reflected (in something), His face was reflected in the mirror.
4311.translation: 反射，反映（在镜子、水或玻璃表面显示影像；或反映出某种情况）

4312.definition: an image in a mirror, on a shiny surface, on water, etc.
4312.example: He admired his reflection in the mirror.
4312.translation: 倒影，反射（镜子、发光表面、水中的影像）

4313.definition: change that is made to a social system, an organization, etc. in order to improve or correct it
4313.translation: 改革（为了改进或纠正而对社会制度、组织等进行的变革）

4314.definition: to improve a system, an organization, a law, etc. by making changes to it
4314.example: proposals to reform the social security system
4314.translation: 改革（通过实施变革来改进制度、组织、法律等）

4315.definition: shelter or protection from danger, trouble, etc.
4315.example: A further 300 people have taken refuge in the US embassy.
4315.translation: 避难所，庇护（免受危险、麻烦等的掩蔽或保护）

4316.definition: a person who has been forced to leave their country or home, because there is a war or for political, religious or social reasons
4316.example: There has been a steady flow of refugees from the war zone.
4316.translation: 难民（因战争、政治、宗教或社会原因被迫离开国家或家园的人）

4317.definition: an act of saying or showing that you will not do, give or accept something
4317.example: the refusal of a request/an invitation/an offer
4317.translation: 拒绝（表示或展示不愿做、给予或接受某事的行为）

4318.definition: to say or show that you will not do something that somebody has asked you to do
4318.example: Go on, ask her; she can hardly refuse.
4318.translation: 拒绝（对他人提出的要求表示不愿去做）

4319.definition: to get back something you no longer have, especially an ability or a quality
4319.example: I struggled to regain some dignity.
4319.translation: 重新获得（收回不再拥有的东西，尤指能力或品质）

4320.definition: attention to or thought and care for somebody/something
4320.example: regard for somebody/something, to have scant/little/no regard for somebody/something
4320.translation: 关注，考虑（对某人/某物的注意、思考或照顾）

4321.definition: to think about somebody/something in a particular way
4321.example: regard somebody/something + adv./prep., They regarded people outside their own town with suspicion.
4321.translation: 看待，视作（以特定方式思考某人/某物）

4322.definition: paying no attention, even if the situation is bad or there are difficulties
4322.example: The weather was terrible but we carried on regardless.
4322.translation: 不顾，不管（不给予注意，即使情况糟糕或存在困难）

4323.definition: a method or system of government, especially one that has not been elected in a fair way
4323.translation: 政权，体制（政府的管理方法或体系，尤指非公平选出的）

4324.definition: a large area of land, usually without exact limits or borders
4324.translation: 地区（大面积的土地，通常没有精确的界限或边界）

4325.definition: of or relating to a region
4325.example: services available at a local and regional level
4325.translation: 地区的（属于或关于某一地区的）

4326.definition: an official list or record of names, items, etc.; a book that contains such a list
4326.example: The bride and groom signed the register.
4326.translation: 登记簿，记录（名字、项目等的官方清单或记录；包含此类清单的簿子）

4327.definition: to record your/somebody’s/something’s name on an official list
4327.translation: 登记，注册（在官方清单上记录名字）

4328.definition: the act of making an official record of something/somebody
4328.example: the registration of letters and parcels
4328.translation: 登记，注册（对某人/某事进行官方记录的行为）

4329.definition: a sad feeling because of something that has happened or something that you have done or not done
4329.translation: 遗憾，后悔（因发生之事或已做/未做之事产生的悲伤感）

4330.definition: to feel sorry about something you have done or about something that you have not been able to do
4330.example: regret something, If you don't do it now, you'll only regret it.
4330.translation: 遗憾，后悔（对自己已做或未能做到的事感到难过）

4331.definition: following a pattern, especially with the same time or space in between each thing and the next
4331.translation: 规律的（遵循某种模式的，尤指间隔时间或空间相等的）

4332.example: We meet regularly to discuss the progress of the project.
4332.translation: 定期地（以规律的时间间隔或次数）

4333.definition: to control something by means of rules
4333.example: The department is responsible for regulating the insurance industry.
4333.translation: 调节，监管（通过规则控制某物）

4334.definition: an official rule made by a government or some other authority
4334.translation: 规定，条例（政府或其他权力机构制定的官方规则）

4335.definition: a person or an organization that officially controls an area of business or industry and makes sure that it is operating fairly
4335.translation: 监管者（官方控制某商业领域并确保公平运行的个人或组织）

4336.definition: having the power to control an area of business or industry and make sure that it is operating fairly
4336.translation: 监管的（有权控制某商业领域并确保其公平运行的）

4337.definition: the process of helping somebody to return to a normal, healthy life after they have been in prison or very ill
4337.translation: 康复，恢复（帮助某人从监狱或大病后回归正常健康生活的活动或过程）

4338.definition: the period during which a king, queen, emperor, etc. rules
4338.example: By the end of his reign, the vast empire was in decline.
4338.translation: 统治，任期（国王、女王、皇帝等统治的时期）

4339.definition: to rule as king, queen, emperor, etc.
4339.example: It was the first visit by a British reigning monarch to Russia.
4339.translation: 统治（担任国王、女王、皇帝等进行统治）

4340.definition: to make a feeling, an idea, etc. stronger
4340.example: The experience reinforced my sense of loss.
4340.translation: 加强，强化（使一种感觉、主意等变得更强烈）

4341.definition: to refuse to accept or consider something
4341.example: to reject an argument/a hypothesis/a notion/a plan
4341.translation: 拒绝（拒绝接受或考虑某事，如论点、计划等）

4342.definition: the act of refusing to accept or consider something
4342.example: Her proposal met with unanimous rejection.
4342.translation: 拒绝（拒绝接受或考虑某事的行为）

4343.definition: show or make a connection between two or more things
4343.example: relate something, I found it difficult to relate the two ideas in my mind.
4343.translation: 联系（展示或建立两个或更多事物间的联系）

4344.definition: connected with something/somebody in some way
4344.example: related to something/somebody, The amount of protein you need is directly related to your lifestyle.
4344.translation: 相关的（以某种方式与某人/某物有联系的）

4345.definition: the way in which two people, groups or countries behave towards each other or deal with each other
4345.translation: 关系（两人、群体或国家间相互对待或交往的方式）

4346.definition: the way in which two people, groups or countries behave towards each other or deal with each other
4346.translation: 关系（两人、群体或国家间相互对待或交往的方式）

4347.definition: considered and judged by being compared with something else
4347.example: You must consider the relative merits of the two plans.
4347.translation: 相对的（通过与他物比较来考虑和判断的）

4348.definition: a person who is in the same family as somebody else
4348.translation: 亲戚（与某人同属一个家庭的人）

4349.definition: to a fairly large degree, especially in comparison to something else
4349.translation: 相对地（在相当大的程度上，尤指与其他事物相比时）

4350.definition: to rest while you are doing something that you enjoy, especially after work or effort
4350.example: Just relax and enjoy the movie.
4350.translation: 放松（做喜欢的事进行休息，尤指在工作或努力后）

4351.definition: calm and not anxious or worried
4351.example: He appeared relaxed and confident before the match.
4351.translation: 放松的（冷静且不焦虑或担心的）

4352.definition: helping you to rest and become less anxious
4352.translation: 轻松的（帮助你休息并减少焦虑的）

4353.definition: the act of setting a person or an animal free; the state of being set free
4353.example: release of somebody/something, The government has been working to secure the release of the hostages.
4353.translation: 释放，解脱（释放人或动物的行为；被释放的状态）

4354.definition: to let somebody come out of a place where they have been kept or stuck and unable to leave or move
4354.example: release somebody, to release a prisoner
4354.translation: 释放（让某人从被关押或困住的地方出来）

4355.definition: a close connection with the subject you are discussing or the situation you are in
4355.example: I don't see the relevance of your question.
4355.translation: 关联性，相关性（与所谈论主题或所处情况的紧密联系）

4356.definition: closely connected with the subject you are discussing or the situation you are in
4356.translation: 相关的（与所谈论主题或所处情况紧密联系的）

4357.definition: the quality of being able to be trusted to do what somebody wants or needs
4357.example: The incident cast doubt on her motives and reliability.
4357.translation: 可靠性（能被信任去完成他人所需之事的品质）

4358.definition: that can be trusted to do something well; that you can rely on
4358.example: We are looking for someone who is reliable and hard-working.
4358.translation: 可靠的（可以被信任做好某事的；可以依靠的）

4359.definition: the feeling of happiness that you have when something unpleasant stops or does not happen
4359.example: I felt a huge sense of relief when I heard they were all OK.
4359.translation: 宽慰，缓解（不快之事停止或未发生时产生的快乐感）

4360.definition: to remove or reduce an unpleasant feeling or pain
4360.example: to relieve the symptoms of a cold
4360.translation: 缓解（消除或减轻不快的感觉或疼痛）

4361.definition: feeling happy because something unpleasant has stopped or has not happened; showing this
4361.translation: 宽慰的（因不快之事停止或未发生而感到快乐的）

4362.definition: the belief in the existence of a god or gods, and the activities that are connected with the worship of them, or in the teachings of a spiritual leader
4362.example: Is there always a conflict between science and religion?
4362.translation: 宗教（对神灵存在的信仰及相关的礼拜活动，或精神领袖的教诲）

4363.definition: connected with religion or with a particular religion
4363.translation: 宗教的（与宗教或特定宗教相关的）

4364.definition: hesitating before doing something because you do not want to do it or because you are not sure that it is the right thing to do
4364.example: He finally gave a reluctant smile.
4364.translation: 不情愿的（做某事前犹豫，因不想做或不确定其正确性）

4366.definition: to continue to be something; to be still in the same state or condition
4366.translation: 保持，仍然是（继续作为某种状态；仍处于同一状况或水平）

4367.definition: the people, things or time that remain
4367.example: I kept some of his books and gave away the remainder.
4367.translation: 剩余部分（剩余的人、物或时间）

4368.definition: the parts of something that are left after the other parts have been used, eaten, removed, etc.
4368.example: She fed the remains of her lunch to the dog.
4368.translation: 残余，残骸（其他部分被使用、食用、移除后留下的部分）

4369.definition: something that you say or write which expresses an opinion, a thought, etc. about somebody/something
4369.translation: 话语，评论（表达关于某人/某事看法、想法的言语或文字）

4370.definition: to say or write a comment about something/somebody
4370.example: Sport, George Orwell once remarked, is like war.
4370.translation: 评论，说起（对某人/某事发表言论）

4371.definition: unusual or surprising in a way that causes people to take notice
4371.translation: 非凡的，卓越的（因不寻常或令人惊讶而引起关注的）

4372.definition: in a way that is unusual or surprising and causes people to take notice
4372.example: The car is in remarkably good condition for its age.
4372.translation: 显著地，非凡地（以不寻常或令人惊讶的方式，引起关注地）

4373.definition: a way of dealing with or improving an unpleasant or difficult situation
4373.example: When the reservoir becomes blocked, the only remedy lies in cleaning the entire system.
4373.translation: 补救方法（处理或改善不快或困难情况的方法）

4374.definition: to have or keep an image in your memory of an event, a person, a place, etc. from the past
4374.example: remember somebody/something, This is Carla. Do you remember her?
4374.translation: 记得（脑中保留过去事件、人物、地方的影像）

4375.definition: to help somebody remember something, especially something important that they must do
4375.example: remind somebody/yourself, I'm sorry, I've forgotten your name. Can you remind me?
4375.translation: 提醒（帮助某人想起某事，尤指其必须完成的重要事项）

4376.definition: something that makes you think about or remember somebody/something, that you have forgotten or would like to forget
4376.example: reminder of something, The sheer size of the cathedral is a constant reminder of the power of religion.
4376.translation: 提醒物（使你想到或记起已忘记或想忘记的人/事的东西）

4377.definition: far away from places where other people live
4377.translation: 偏僻的（远离他人居住地的）

4378.definition: the act of taking somebody/something away from a particular place
4378.example: Clearance of the site required the removal of a number of trees.
4378.translation: 移除，迁移（将某人/某物从特定地方带走的行为）

4379.definition: to take somebody/something away from a place
4379.example: remove somebody/something, Illegally parked vehicles will be removed.
4379.translation: 移除（将某人/某物从某处带走）

4380.definition: to cause somebody/something to be in a particular state or condition
4380.translation: 使得（导致某人/某物处于特定的状态或状况）

4381.definition: to begin something again after it stopped or was interrupted
4381.example: The army renewed its assault on the capital.
4381.translation: 更新，恢复（在停止或中断后再次开始某事）

4382.translation: 著名的（出名且受尊敬的）

4383.definition: an amount of money that you regularly pay so that you can use a house, room, etc.
4383.example: I earn just about enough to pay the rent.
4383.translation: 租金（为了使用房子、房间等定期支付的款项）

4384.definition: to regularly pay money to somebody so that you can use something that they own, such as a house, a room, some land, etc.
4384.example: Are you looking to buy or rent?
4384.translation: 租用（定期付钱给他人以使用其拥有的房子、土地等）

4385.definition: the amount of money that you pay to use something for a particular period of time
4385.translation: 租赁的（在一定时期内支付使用某物的金额相关的）

4386.example: They agreed to pay the costs of any repairs.

4387.definition: to fix something that is broken, damaged or torn
4387.translation: 修理（修补损坏、破裂或撕裂的东西）

4388.definition: an event that is very similar to something that happened before
4388.example: repeat of something, She didn't want a repeat performance of what had happened the night before.
4388.translation: 重复（与以前发生过的事情非常相似的事件）

4389.definition: to say or write something again or more than once
4389.example: repeat something, to repeat a question/a claim/an assertion/a warning
4389.translation: 重复（再次说或写某事，或多次进行）

4390.definition: happening, said or done many times
4390.translation: 重复的（多次发生、说或做的）

4391.definition: to be used instead of somebody/something else; to do something instead of somebody/something else
4391.example: The new design will eventually replace all existing models.
4391.translation: 取代，更换（用作他人/他物的替代；做他人/他物所做的事）

4392.definition: the act of replacing one thing with another, especially something that is newer or better
4392.example: the replacement of worn car parts
4392.translation: 更换，替换（将一物换成另一物的行为，尤指换成更新更好的）

4393.definition: an act of replying to something/somebody in speech, writing or by some action
4393.example: I asked her what her name was but she made no reply.
4393.translation: 回复（通过言语、书写或行动对某人/某事做出的回应）

4394.definition: to say or write something as an answer to somebody/something
4394.example: She didn't even bother to reply.
4394.translation: 回复（说或写某事作为对某人的回答）

4395.definition: a written or spoken account of an event, especially one that is published or broadcast
4395.translation: 报告（对事件的书面或口头陈述，尤指出版或广播的）

4396.definition: to give people information about something that you have heard, seen, done, etc.
4396.example: report something, The crash happened seconds after the pilot reported engine trouble.
4396.translation: 报告（向他人提供关于所听、所见或所做之事的信息）

4397.definition: according to what some people say
4397.example: The band have reportedly decided to split up.
4397.translation: 据报道（根据一些人的说法）

4398.definition: a person who collects and reports news for newspapers, radio or television
4398.example: He leaked the story to a news reporter.
4398.translation: 记者（为报纸、电台或电视搜集并报道新闻的人）

4399.definition: the presenting of and writing about news on television and radio, and in newspapers
4399.translation: 报道（在媒体上呈现和撰写新闻的活动）

4400.definition: to be a member of a group of people and act or speak for them at an event, a meeting, etc.
4400.example: The competition attracted over 500 contestants representing eight different countries.
4400.translation: 代表（作为群体的成员在活动、会议等处为其行动或发言）

4401.definition: the act of presenting somebody/something in a particular way; something that shows or describes something
4401.example: the negative representation of single mothers in the media
4401.translation: 陈述，表现（以特定方式呈现某人/某物的行为；描述某事的东西）

4402.definition: typical of a particular group of people; that is a typical example of something
4402.example: Is a questionnaire answered by 500 people truly representative of the population as a whole?
4402.translation: 有代表性的（特定人群中典型的；事物的典型示例）

4403.definition: a person who has been chosen to speak or vote for somebody else or for a group of people, or to take the place of somebody else
4403.example: Our elected representatives in government should be doing something about this.
4403.translation: 代表（被选出为他人发言、投票或取代他人位置的人）

4404.definition: to make a copy of a picture, piece of text, etc.
4404.example: It is illegal to reproduce these worksheets without permission from the publisher.
4404.translation: 复制，繁殖（制作图片、文本等的副本）

4405.definition: the act or process of producing babies, young animals or plants
4405.translation: 生殖，繁殖（产下后代的过程）

4406.definition: a country that is governed by a president and politicians elected by the people and where there is no king or queen
4406.translation: 共和国（没有君主、由民选总统和政客治理的国家）

4407.definition: the opinion that people have about what somebody/something is like, based on what has happened in the past
4407.translation: 名声（基于过去发生之事，人们对某人/某物所持的看法）

4408.definition: the action of asking for something formally and politely; a thing that you formally ask for
4408.example: request for something, a request for information
4408.translation: 请求（正式且礼貌地要求某事；正式要求的事物）

4409.definition: to ask for something or ask somebody to do something in a polite or formal way
4409.example: request something, She requested permission to film at the White House.
4409.translation: 请求（以礼貌或正式的方式要求某事或要求某人做某事）

4410.definition: to need something; to depend on somebody/something
4410.example: require something, These pets require a lot of care and attention.
4410.translation: 需要（需要某物；依赖某人/某物）

4411.definition: something that you need or want
4411.translation: 要求（你需要或想要的东西）

4412.definition: the act of saving somebody/something from a dangerous or difficult situation; the fact of being saved
4412.example: We had given up hope of rescue.
4412.translation: 营救，救援（从危险或困难局面救出某人的行为；被救的事实）

4413.definition: to save somebody/something from a dangerous or harmful situation
4413.example: rescue somebody/something from something/somebody, The coastguard rescued six people from the sinking boat.
4413.translation: 营救（从危险或有害局面中救出某人/某物）

4414.definition: a careful study of a subject, especially in order to discover new facts or information about it
4414.translation: 研究，调查（为了发现新事实对某一主题进行的仔细研究）

4415.definition: to study something carefully and try to discover new facts about it
4415.translation: 研究（仔细研究某事以尝试发现新事实）

4416.definition: a person who studies something carefully and tries to discover new facts about it
4416.example: European researchers say olive oil could help prevent cancer.
4416.translation: 研究人员（仔细研究某事以发现新事实的人）

4417.definition: to look like or be similar to another person or thing
4417.translation: 像，类似（长得像或与另一人/物相似）

4418.definition: an arrangement for a seat on a plane or train, a room in a hotel, etc. to be kept for you
4418.example: I'll call the restaurant and make a reservation.
4418.translation: 预订（为了让你使用而保留飞机座位、旅馆房间等的安排）

4419.definition: a supply of something that is available to be used in the future or when it is needed
4419.translation: 储备，储藏（现有供未来或需要时使用的供应量）

4420.definition: to ask for a seat, table, room, etc. to be available for you or somebody else at a future time
4420.example: reserve something for somebody/something, I'd like to reserve a table for three for eight o'clock.
4420.translation: 预留，保留（要求在未来时间为你或他人保留座位、桌子、房间等）

4421.definition: to live in a particular place
4421.example: He returned to Britain in 1939, having resided abroad for many years.

4422.definition: a house, especially a large or impressive one
4422.example: a desirable family residence for sale (= for example, in an advertisement)
4422.translation: 住宅（房子，尤指大型或给人印象深刻的）

4423.example: the town’s resident population (= not tourists or visitors)
4423.translation: 居住的（居住在特定地方的）

4424.definition: a person who lives in a particular place or who has their home there
4424.example: a resident of the United States
4424.translation: 居民（居住在特定地方或在此安家的人）

4425.definition: suitable for living in; consisting of houses rather than factories or offices
4425.translation: 住宅的（适合居住的；由住房而非工厂或办公室组成的）

4426.definition: a small amount of something that remains at the end of a process
4426.example: pesticide residues in fruit and vegetables
4426.translation: 残留物（过程结束时留下的少量物质）

4427.definition: to officially tell somebody that you are leaving your job, an organization, etc.
4427.example: She was forced to resign due to ill health.
4427.translation: 辞职（正式告知他人你要离开工作、组织等）

4428.definition: the act of giving up your job or position; the occasion when you do this
4428.translation: 辞职（放弃工作或职位的行为；这种情况）

4429.definition: to refuse to accept something and try to stop it from happening
4429.example: resist something, They are determined to resist pressure to change the law.
4429.translation: 抵抗（拒绝接受某事并试图阻止其发生）

4430.definition: dislike of or opposition to a plan, an idea, etc.; the act of refusing to obey
4430.example: As with all new ideas it met with resistance.
4430.translation: 抵抗（对计划、想法等的不喜欢或反对；拒绝服从的行为）

4431.definition: a definite decision to do or not to do something
4431.example: Have you made any New Year's resolutions (= for example, to give up smoking from 1 January)?
4431.translation: 决定，决议（做或不做某事的明确决定）

4432.definition: to find an acceptable solution to a problem or difficulty
4432.example: resolve something, to resolve an issue/a dispute/a conflict/a crisis
4432.translation: 解决（为问题或困难找到可接受的方案）

4433.definition: a place where a lot of people go on holiday
4433.translation: 度假胜地（很多人去度假的地方）

4434.definition: a supply of something that a country, an organization or a person has and can use, especially to increase their wealth
4434.example: the exploitation of minerals and other natural resources
4434.translation: 资源（国家、组织或个人拥有的可供使用的供应品，尤指为了增加财富）

4435.definition: a strong feeling of approval of somebody/something because of their good qualities or achievements
4435.example: I have the utmost respect for her and her work.
4435.translation: 尊重（因他人的优秀品质或成就而产生的强烈认可感）

4436.definition: to have a very good opinion of somebody/something; to admire somebody/something
4436.example: I respect Jack's opinion on most subjects.
4436.translation: 尊重（对某人/某物有非常好的看法；钦佩）

4437.definition: belonging or relating separately to each of the people or things already mentioned
4437.example: They are each recognized specialists in their respective fields.
4437.translation: 各自的（分别属于或关于已提到的每个人或物的）

4438.definition: in the same order as the people or things already mentioned
4438.example: Julie and Mark, aged 17 and 19 respectively
4438.translation: 分别地（按已提到的人或物的顺序分别地）

4439.definition: to give a spoken or written answer to somebody/something
4439.example: I asked him his name, but he didn't respond.
4439.translation: 回答，做出反应（给出言语或书面的回答；做出反应）

4440.translation: 回答，响应（言语或书面的回答）

4441.definition: a duty to deal with or take care of somebody/something, so that you may be blamed if something goes wrong
4441.example: to be in a position of responsibility
4441.translation: 责任（处理或照顾某人/某物的职责，出错时可能被归咎）

4442.definition: having the job or duty of doing something or taking care of somebody/something, so that you may be blamed if something goes wrong
4442.example: responsible for doing something, Mike is responsible for designing the entire project.
4442.translation: 负责的（承担做某事或照顾某人职责的，出错时可能被归咎）

4443.definition: the part of something that remains
4443.example: Take what you want and throw the rest away.
4443.translation: 其余，剩余部分（事物留下的部分）

4444.definition: to relax, sleep or do nothing after a period of activity or illness; to not use a part of your body for some time
4444.example: The doctor told me to rest.
4444.translation: 休息（在活动或患病后放松、睡觉或什么都不做）

4445.definition: a place where you can buy and eat a meal
4445.example: We're going to try this Italian restaurant that just opened.
4445.translation: 餐厅（可以购买并进餐的场所）

4446.definition: the work of repairing and cleaning an old building, a painting, etc. so that its condition is as good as it originally was
4446.translation: 修复（修理和清理旧建筑、绘画等使其恢复原状的工作）

4447.definition: to bring back a situation or feeling that existed before
4447.example: restore something, The measures are intended to restore public confidence in the economy.
4447.translation: 恢复（带回以前存在的情况或感觉）

4448.definition: a rule, a fact, an idea, etc. that limits or controls what people can do
4448.example: The government has imposed export restraints on some products.
4448.translation: 限制，克制（限制或控制人们行为的规则、事实、想法等）

4449.definition: to limit the size, amount or range of something
4449.example: restrict something to something, Speed is restricted to 30 mph in towns.
4449.translation: 限制（限制某事的大小、数量或范围）

4450.definition: a rule or law that limits what you can do or what can happen
4450.translation: 限制，规定（限制你能做什么或能发生什么的规则或法律）

4451.definition: a thing that is caused or produced because of something else
4451.example: And did your intervention produce the desired result?
4451.translation: 结果（由另一件事引起或产生的事物）

4452.example: A heavy frost could result in loss of the crop.

4453.definition: if you resume an activity, or if it resumes, it begins again or continues after being interrupted
4453.translation: 重新开始，恢复（停止或中断后再次开始或继续活动）

4454.definition: the selling of goods to the public, usually through shops
4454.translation: 零售（通常通过商店向公众销售商品）

4455.definition: to keep something; to continue to have something
4455.translation: 保留，保持（保留某物；继续拥有某物）

4456.definition: to leave your job and stop working, especially because you have reached a particular age or because you are ill; to tell somebody they must stop doing their job
4456.example: He is retiring next year after 30 years with the company.
4456.translation: 退休（离开工作岗位停止工作，尤指达到特定年龄或因病）

4457.translation: 退休的（已从工作岗位退休的）

4458.definition: the fact of leaving your job and stopping work, usually because you have reached a particular age; the time when you do this
4458.example: At 60, he was now approaching retirement.
4458.translation: 退休（离开工作岗位停止工作的事实，尤指由于年龄）

4459.definition: a movement away from a place or an enemy because of danger or defeat
4459.translation: 撤退（因危险或战败而离开某地或避开敌人的行动）

4460.definition: to move away from a place or an enemy because you are in danger or because you have been defeated
4460.example: The army was forced to retreat after suffering heavy losses.
4460.translation: 撤退（因危险或战败而离开某地或避开敌人）

4461.definition: to bring or get something back, especially from a place where it should not be
4461.example: retrieve something from somebody/something, She bent to retrieve her comb from the floor.
4461.translation: 取回，恢复（带回或找回某物，尤指从不该在的地方）

4462.definition: the action of arriving in or coming back to a place that you were in before
4462.example: return of somebody to…, A week had passed since their return to Geneva.
4462.translation: 归来，返回（到达或回到以前所在地方的行动）

4463.definition: to come or go back from one place to another
4463.example: I waited a long time for him to return.
4463.translation: 归来，返回（从一处回到另一处）

4464.definition: to make something known to somebody
4464.example: reveal something, to reveal a secret
4464.translation: 揭露，展示（使某事为人所知）

4465.definition: a fact that people are made aware of, especially one that has been secret and is surprising
4465.example: revelation about/concerning something, startling/sensational revelations about her private life
4465.translation: 揭露，启示（让人察觉到的事实，尤指先前保密且令人惊讶的）

4466.definition: something that you do in order to make somebody suffer because they have made you suffer
4466.example: revenge for something, She is seeking revenge for the murder of her husband.
4466.translation: 报复（为了让曾使你受苦的人受苦而做的事）

4467.definition: the money that a government receives from taxes or that an organization, etc. receives from its business
4467.example: The government is currently facing a shortfall in tax revenue.
4467.translation: 收入，税收（政府从税收中获得的钱，或组织从业务中获得的钱）

4468.definition: opposite to what has been mentioned
4468.example: to travel in the reverse direction
4468.translation: 相反的（与所提到的相反的）

4469.definition: the opposite of what has just been mentioned
4469.example: This problem is the reverse of the previous one.
4469.translation: 相反的事物（与刚才提到的相反的事物）

4470.definition: to change something completely so that it is the opposite of what it was before
4470.example: Falling birth rates may reverse the trend towards early retirement.
4470.translation: 反转，彻底改变（完全改变某事使其与以前相反）

4471.definition: a report in a newspaper or magazine, or on the internet, television or radio, in which somebody gives their opinion of a book, play, film, product, etc.; the act of writing this kind of report
4471.translation: 评论，回顾（媒体上某人对书、戏、产品等的看法的报道；撰写此报道的行为）

4472.definition: to write a report of a book, play, film, product, etc. in which you give your opinion of it
4472.example: Please rate and review your purchase on our website.
4472.translation: 评论，回顾（撰写对书、戏、产品等的看法报道）

4473.definition: to change your opinions or plans, for example because of something you have learned
4473.example: I can see I will have to revise my opinions of his abilities now.
4473.translation: 修改，修订（由于学到了新东西而改变观点或计划）

4474.definition: a change or set of changes to something
4474.example: He made some minor revisions to the report before printing it out.
4474.translation: 修订，校订（对某事物做出的一个或一组改动）

4475.definition: an improvement in the condition or strength of something
4475.translation: 复兴，复苏（某物状况或强度的改善）

4476.definition: to become, or to make somebody/something become, conscious or healthy and strong again
4476.example: The flowers soon revived in water.
4476.translation: 使苏醒，复兴（变得或使某人/某物重新恢复意识或健康强壮）

4477.definition: an attempt, by a large number of people, to change the government of a country, especially by violent action
4477.translation: 革命（大量人群试图改变国家政府的尝试，尤指通过暴力）

4478.translation: 革命的（与政治革命相关的）

4479.definition: a thing that you are given because you have done something good, worked hard, etc.
4479.translation: 奖赏，报酬（因做了好事、努力工作等而得到的报酬）

4480.definition: to give something to somebody because they have done something good, worked hard, etc.
4480.example: reward somebody for something, She was rewarded for her efforts with a cash bonus.
4480.translation: 奖赏，给以报酬（因他人做了好事、努力工作等而给予报酬）

4481.definition: speech or writing that is intended to influence people, but that is not completely honest or sincere
