4481.translation: 修辞（旨在影响他人的言论或写作，但往往非完全诚实）

4482.definition: a strong regular repeated pattern of sounds or movements
4482.example: to dance to the rhythm of the music
4482.translation: 节奏（声音或动作的强有力的规律重复模式）

4483.definition: short, narrow white or brown grain grown on wet land in hot countries as food; the plant that produces this grain
4483.translation: 大米，米饭（在热带湿地生长的短窄谷物；这种作物）

4484.definition: having a lot of money or property
4484.example: She's one of the richest women in the world.
4484.translation: 富有的（有很多钱或财产的）

4485.definition: to be free of somebody/something that has been annoying you or that you do not want
4485.example: She wanted to be rid of her parents and their authority.
4485.translation: 摆脱（脱离令你恼火或不想要的人/物）

4486.definition: a short journey in a vehicle, on a bicycle, etc.
4486.example: a train ride through beautiful countryside
4486.translation: 骑行，旅程（乘车、骑车的短途旅行）

4487.definition: to sit on an animal, especially a horse, and control it as it moves
4487.example: I learnt to ride as a child.
4487.translation: 骑（坐在动物——尤指马——身上并控制其移动）

4488.example: I look ridiculous in this hat.
4488.translation: 荒谬的（非常铺蠢或不合理的）

4489.definition: a gun with a long barrel which you hold to your shoulder to fire
4489.translation: 步枪（持于肩部发射的长管枪）

4490.definition: true or correct as a fact
4490.example: Did you get the answer right?
4490.translation: 正确的（作为事实是真实的或正确的）

4491.definition: on or to the right side
4491.example: Turn right at the end of the street.

4492.example: on the right, Take the first street on the right.
4492.translation: 右侧（右侧的位置或方向）

4493.definition: a piece of jewellery that you wear on your finger, consisting of a round band of gold, silver, etc., sometimes decorated with precious stones
4493.translation: 戒指（戴在手指上的由金、银等制成的圆环形珠宝）

4494.example: Thousands of demonstrators ringed the building.

4495.definition: a situation in which a group of people behave in a violent way in a public place, often as a protest
4495.example: One prison guard was killed when a riot broke out in the jail.
4495.translation: 暴乱（一群人在公共场所进行的暴力行为，常作为抗议）

4496.definition: to tear something or to become torn, often suddenly or violently
4496.example: rip (something), I ripped my jeans on the fence.
4496.translation: 撕裂（撕开某物，常为突然或猛烈地）

4497.definition: an increase in an amount, a number or a level
4497.example: The industry is feeling the effects of recent price rises.
4497.translation: 上升，上涨（数量、数字或水平的增加）

4498.definition: to come or go upwards; to reach a higher level or position
4498.example: The curtain rose to reveal an empty stage.
4498.translation: 上升，升高（向上移动；达到更高水平或位置）

4499.definition: the possibility of something bad happening at some time in the future; a situation that could be dangerous or have a bad result
4499.example: The health risks are very low.
4499.translation: 风险（未来某时可能发生坏事的可能性；危险的情况）

4500.definition: to put something valuable or important in a dangerous situation, in which it could be lost or damaged
4500.example: He risked his life to save her.
4500.translation: 冒风险（将重要或有价值的事物置于可能损失或损坏的危险境地）

4501.definition: involving the possibility of something bad happening
4501.example: Life as an aid worker can be a risky business (= dangerous).
4501.translation: 冒险的，有风险的（涉及可能发生坏事的情况）

4502.definition: a series of actions that are always performed in the same way, especially as part of a religious ceremony
4502.translation: 仪式，典礼（总以相同方式执行的一系列行动，尤指宗教仪式）

4503.definition: competing with another person, company, thing, etc.
4503.translation: 竞争的，对手的（与另一人、公司或事物竞争的）

4504.definition: a person, company or thing that competes with another in sport, business, etc.
4504.example: The two teams have always been rivals.
4504.translation: 对手，竞争者（在体育、商业等领域与他人竞争的人或公司）

4505.definition: a natural flow of water that continues in a long line across land to the sea
4505.example: Eventually we came to the mouth of the River Thames.
4505.translation: 河流（横跨陆地流向海洋的自然长条水流）

4506.definition: a hard surface built for vehicles to travel on
4506.translation: 道路，马路（为车辆行驶建造的坚硬表面）

4507.definition: to steal money or property from a person or place
4507.translation: 抢劫，掠夺（从人或地方盗取金钱或财产）

4508.definition: the crime of stealing money or goods from a bank, shop, person, etc., especially using violence or threats
4508.example: armed robbery (= using a gun, knife, etc.)
4508.translation: 抢劫罪（从银行、商店或人处盗取钱财的罪行，尤指涉及暴力或威胁）

4509.definition: a machine that can perform a complicated series of tasks by itself
4509.example: These cars are built by robots.
4509.translation: 机器人（能独立执行复杂系列任务的机器）

4510.example: She was almost 90, but still very robust.
4510.translation: 强健的，稳固的（强壮且健康的；或系统稳固的）

4511.definition: the hard solid material that forms part of the surface of the earth and some other planets
4511.example: They drilled through several layers of rock to reach the oil.
4511.translation: 岩石（构成地球及其他行星表面的坚硬固体物质）

4512.definition: to move gently backwards and forwards or from side to side; to make somebody/something move in this way
4512.example: (+ adv./prep.), The boat rocked from side to side in the waves.
4512.translation: 摇晃（使某人/某物前后或左右轻轻移动；或以此方式移动）

4513.definition: a spacecraft in the shape of a tube that is driven by a stream of gases let out behind it when fuel is burned inside
4513.translation: 火箭（管状航天器，通过内部燃料燃烧向后喷射气流驱动）

4514.definition: a long straight piece of wood, metal or glass
4514.example: The concrete is reinforced with steel rods.
4514.translation: 杆，棒（木制、金属或玻璃制的长直条）

4515.definition: an actor’s part in a play, film, etc.
4515.example: She has landed the lead role (= the most important one) in a new play.
4515.translation: 角色（演艺人员在戏或电影中扮演的部分，或某人的社会职责）

4516.definition: a small loaf of bread for one person
4516.translation: 小圆面包（供一人食用的小型面包）

4517.definition: to turn over and over and move in a particular direction; to make a round object do this
4517.example: + adv./prep., The ball rolled down the hill.
4517.translation: 滚动，翻滚（翻转着向特定方向移动；或使圆状物这样做）

4518.definition: an exciting, usually short, relationship between two people who are in love with each other
4518.translation: 浪漫史（两人间令人兴奋的、通常短暂的恋爱关系）

4519.definition: connected with or about love or a sexual relationship
4519.translation: 浪漫的（与爱情或性关系相关的）

4520.definition: the structure that covers or forms the top of a building or vehicle
4520.translation: 屋顶，车顶（覆盖或构成建筑或车辆顶部的结构）

4521.definition: a part of a building that has its own walls, floor and ceiling and is usually used for a particular purpose
4521.example: I heard him enter the room.
4521.translation: 房间（建筑中拥有墙壁、地板和天花板的独立空间，常有特定用途）

4522.definition: the part of a plant that grows under the ground and takes in water and minerals that it sends to the rest of the plant
4522.translation: 根，根源（植物生长在地下、吸收水分和养分的部分）

4523.definition: very strong thick string made by twisting thinner strings, wires, etc. together
4523.example: The rope broke and she fell 50 metres onto the rocks.
4523.translation: 绳索（由多股细线、金属丝等拧成的强韧粗绳）

4524.definition: a flower with a sweet smell that grows on a bush with thorns (= sharp points) on its stems
4524.translation: 玫瑰（一种带香味的花，长在带刺的灌木上）

4525.definition: to move or turn around a central fixed point; to make something do this
4525.example: Stay well away from the helicopter when its blades start to rotate.
4525.translation: 旋转（围绕中心固定点移动或转动；使之旋转）

4526.definition: the action of an object moving in a circle around a central fixed point
4526.example: the daily rotation of the earth on its axis
4526.translation: 旋转（物体围绕中心固定点圆周运动的行为）

4527.definition: having a surface that is not even or regular
4527.translation: 粗糙的，不平整的（表面不平整或不规则的）

4528.example: Sales are up by roughly 10 per cent.
4528.translation: 大约，粗略地（大约，但不精确）

4529.definition: having a shape like a circle or a ball
4529.translation: 圆的（形状像圆圈或球的）

4530.example: Everybody joins hands and dances round.
4530.translation: 旋转地（以圆周运动移动地）

4531.definition: a stage in a competition or sports event
4531.example: the qualifying rounds of the National Championships
4531.translation: 一轮，一局（竞赛或体育赛事中的一个阶段）

4532.example: the first woman to sail round the world
4532.translation: 环绕（绕圈子，如绕世界航行）

4533.definition: a way that you follow to get from one place to another
4533.example: Which is the best route to take?
4533.translation: 路线，路径（从一处到另一处所遵循的道路）

4534.definition: done or happening as a normal part of a particular job, situation or process
4534.translation: 常规的，例行的（作为工作或过程正常部分而进行的）

4535.definition: the normal order and way in which you regularly do things
4535.translation: 常规，惯例（定期做事的正常顺序和方式）

4536.translation: 行，排（排成一行的若干人或物）

4537.definition: connected with or belonging to the king or queen of a country
4537.translation: 皇室的（与国家的国王或女王相关或属于他们的）

4538.definition: to move your hand, a cloth, etc., backwards and forwards over a surface while pressing it
4538.example: rub something, He sat up on the hard bunk and rubbed his eyes.
4538.translation: 擦，揉（在表面上来回移动手、布等并施加压力）

4539.translation: 橡胶制的（由橡胶制成的）

4540.definition: a strong substance that can be stretched and does not allow liquids to pass through it, used for making tyres, boots, etc. It is made from the liquid (= sap) inside a tropical plant or is produced using chemicals.
4540.translation: 橡胶（一种可拉伸、不透水的强韧物质，用于制造轮胎等）

4541.definition: things that you throw away because you no longer want or need them
4541.translation: 垃圾（因不想要或不需要而扔掉的东西）

4542.definition: having or showing a lack of respect for other people and their feelings
4542.translation: 粗鲁的（表现出对他人的不尊重或不顾及他人感受的）

4543.definition: a game played by two teams of 13 or 15 players, using an oval ball which may be kicked or carried. Teams try to put the ball over the other team’s line.
4543.example: to play a game of rugby
4543.translation: 橄榄球（由两队13或15人进行的、使用椭圆形球的比赛）

4544.definition: the state or process of being destroyed or severely damaged
4544.example: A large number of churches fell into ruin after the revolution.
4544.translation: 废墟，毁坏（被毁坏或严重受损的状态或过程）

4545.definition: to damage something so badly that it loses all its value, pleasure, etc.
4545.example: The bad weather ruined our trip.
4545.translation: 毁掉，破坏（严重损坏某物使其失去价值或乐趣）

4546.definition: a statement of what may, must or must not be done in a particular situation or when playing a game
4546.example: She laid down strict rules for her tenants, including prompt payment of rent.
4546.translation: 规则（在特定情况下或游戏中规定该做什么、不该做什么的陈述）

4547.definition: to control and have authority over a country, a group of people, etc.
4547.example: rule (something), At that time, King John ruled England.
4547.translation: 统治，治理（控制并对国家、群体等拥有权威）

4548.definition: an official decision made by somebody in a position of authority, especially a judge
4548.example: The court will make its ruling on the case next week.
4548.translation: 裁定，判决（权力部门——尤指法官——做出的官方决定）

4549.definition: a piece of information, or a story, that people talk about, but that may not be true
4549.translation: 传闻，谣言（人们谈论的、可能非真实的信息或故事）

4550.definition: an act of running; a period of time spent running or the distance that somebody runs
4550.example: I go for a run every morning.
4550.translation: 跑步，路程（跑步的行为；或跑步的一段时间、距离）

4551.definition: to move using your legs, going faster than when you walk
4551.example: Can you run as fast as Mike?
4551.translation: 跑（用腿移动，速度快于走）

4552.definition: a person or an animal that runs, especially one taking part in a race
4552.translation: 跑步者（跑步的人或动物，尤指参加比赛者）

4553.definition: the action or sport of running
4553.translation: 跑步（跑步的动作或这项运动）

4554.definition: connected with or like the countryside
4554.translation: 农村的，乡下的（与乡村相关的或像乡村的）

4555.definition: a sudden strong movement or action
4555.example: rush for something, Shoppers made a rush for the exits.
4555.translation: 冲，猛冲（突然强烈的移动或行动）

4556.definition: to move or to do something with great speed, often too fast
4556.example: We've got plenty of time; there's no need to rush.
4556.translation: 冲，急促（以很快的速度移动或做事，常过快）

4557.definition: to dismiss somebody from a job
4557.example: She was sacked for refusing to work on Sundays.
4557.translation: 解雇（将某人从工作中辞退）

4558.definition: connected with God or a god; considered to be holy
4558.translation: 神圣的（与神相关的；被认为是神圣的）

4559.definition: the fact of giving up something important or valuable to you in order to get or do something that seems more important; something that you give up in this way
4559.example: The makers of the product assured us that there had been no sacrifice of quality.
4559.translation: 牺牲（为了更重要的事而放弃重要或有价值之物的事实；所放弃之物）

4560.definition: to give up something that is important or valuable to you in order to get or do something that seems more important for yourself or for another person
4560.example: sacrifice something for somebody/something, She sacrificed everything for her children.
4560.translation: 牺牲（为了自己或他人放弃重要或有价值之物）

4561.example: sad to do something, We are very sad to hear that you are leaving.
4561.translation: 悲伤的（不快乐的或表现出不快乐的）

4562.translation: 悲哀地，遗憾地（以悲伤的方式）

4563.definition: protected from any danger, harm or loss
4563.example: The children are quite safe here.
4563.translation: 安全的（受保护免受危险、伤害或损失的）

4564.definition: the state of being safe and protected from danger or harm
4564.example: in safety, a place where children can play in safety
4564.translation: 安全（处于安全、受保护免受危险的状态）

4565.definition: a sheet of strong cloth which the wind blows against to make a boat or ship travel through the water
4565.example: As the boat moved down the river the wind began to fill the sails.
4565.translation: 帆（风吹在其上使船航行的强韧布片）

4566.definition: to travel on water using sails or an engine
4566.translation: 航行（利用帆或引擎在水上旅行）

4567.definition: the sport or activity of travelling in a boat with sails
4567.translation: 航行，帆船运动（在带帆船只中旅行的运动或活动）

4568.definition: a person who works on a ship as a member of the crew
4568.example: a crew of two officers and 13 sailors
4568.translation: 水手（在船上工作的船员）

4569.definition: a person that the Christian Church recognizes as being very holy, because of the way they have lived or died
4569.translation: 圣人（教会因其生前或死后的神圣事迹而认可的人）

4570.translation: 缘故，利益（为了某人的利益或某事的原因）

4571.definition: a mixture of raw vegetables such as lettuce, tomato and cucumber, usually served with other food as part of a meal
4571.example: All main courses come with salad or vegetables.
4571.translation: 沙拉（通常随餐食用的生蔬菜混合物，如生菜、西红柿等）

4572.definition: money that employees receive for doing their job, especially professional employees or people working in an office, usually paid every month
4572.translation: 薪水（雇员——尤指办公室职员——因工作收到的钱，通常按月支付）

4573.definition: an act or the process of selling something
4573.example: regulations governing the sale of alcoholic beverages
4573.translation: 出售，销售（卖出某物的行为或过程）

4574.definition: a white substance that is added to food to make it taste better or to preserve it. Salt is obtained from mines and is also found in seawater. It is sometimes called common salt to show that it is different from other chemical salts. Its chemical name is sodium chloride.
4574.translation: 盐（添加到食物中以调味或防腐的白色物质，主要成分是氯化钠）

4575.definition: exactly the one or ones referred to or mentioned; not different
4575.example: We have lived in the same house for twenty years.
4575.translation: 相同的（指代已提到的那一个或那些，没有任何不同的）

4576.example: We treat boys exactly the same as girls.

4577.example: I would do the same again.
4577.translation: 同样的事物（同样的东西或事情）

4578.definition: a number of people or things taken from a larger group and used in tests to provide information about the group
4578.example: The interviews were given to a random sample of students.
4578.translation: 样本，样品（从大群体中提取用于测试以提供信息的少量人或物）

4579.definition: to try a small amount of a particular food to see what it is like; to experience something for a short time to see what it is like
4579.example: I sampled the delights of Greek cooking for the first time.
4579.translation: 品尝，体验（尝试少量的食物；或短时间体验某事以了解其样子）

4580.definition: an official order that limits trade, contact, etc. with a particular country, in order to make it do something, such as obeying international law
4580.example: Trade sanctions were imposed against any country that refused to sign the agreement.
4580.translation: 制裁（为了促使某国遵守国际法而对其贸易、接触等进行的官方限制）

4581.definition: a substance that consists of very small fine grains of rock. Sand is found on beaches, in deserts, etc.
4581.translation: 沙，沙子（由极细小的岩石颗粒组成的物质，见于海滩、沙漠等）

4582.definition: two slices of bread, often spread with butter, with a layer of meat, cheese, etc. between them
4582.translation: 三明治（两片面包，中间夹有肉、奶酪等，常抹有黄油）

4583.definition: an electronic device that is sent into space and moves around the earth or another planet. It is used for communicating by radio, television, etc. and for gathering information.
4583.translation: 卫星（被送入太空绕行星运动的电子设备，用于通信或搜集信息）

4584.definition: the good feeling that you have when you have achieved something or when something that you wanted to happen does happen; something that gives you this feeling
4584.translation: 满意（实现目标或想要的事发生后的良好感觉；给人此感觉的事物）

4585.definition: pleased because you have achieved something or because something that you wanted to happen has happened
4585.translation: 满意的（因实现目标或想要的事发生而感到高兴的）

4586.definition: to make somebody pleased by doing or giving them what they want
4586.translation: 使满意（通过做或给某人想要的东西使其高兴）

4587.definition: the day of the week after Friday and before Sunday
4587.translation: 星期六（周五之后、周日之前的一天）

4588.definition: a thick liquid that is eaten with food to add taste to it
4588.translation: 酱汁，调味汁（配餐食用以增加风味的浓稠液体）

4589.definition: to keep somebody/something safe from death, harm, loss, etc.
4589.example: save somebody/something, to save somebody’s life
4589.translation: 拯救，节省（使某人/某物免于死亡、伤害、损失；或节省金钱、时间）

4590.definition: an amount of something such as time or money that you do not need to use or spend
4590.example: saving of something, Buy three and make a saving of 55p.
4590.translation: 节省（不需要使用或花费的量，如时间或金钱）

4591.definition: the right to influence something by giving your opinion before a decision is made
4591.example: say (in something), We had no say in the decision to sell the company.
4591.translation: 发言权（在决策前通过给出意见来产生影响的权利）

4592.definition: to speak or tell somebody something, using words

4593.definition: the size or extent of something, especially when compared with something else
4593.example: on a … scale, They entertain on a large scale (= they hold expensive parties with a lot of guests).
4593.translation: 规模（某事的大小或程度，尤指与他物相比时）

4594.definition: to look quickly but not very carefully at a document, etc.
4594.example: scan something for something, I scanned the list quickly for my name.
4594.translation: 扫描，浏览（快速但非非常仔细地查看文档等）

4595.definition: behaviour or an event that people think is morally or legally wrong and causes public feelings of shock or anger
4595.translation: 丑闻（人们认为在道德或法律上错误并引起公愤的行为或事件）

4596.definition: a situation in which a lot of people are anxious or frightened about something
4596.translation: 惊恐（许多人对某事感到焦虑或恐惧的情况）

4598.definition: frightened of something or afraid that something bad might happen
4598.example: The thieves got scared and ran away.
4598.translation: 受惊的（害怕某事或担心坏事可能发生）

4599.example: It was a really scary moment.

4600.definition: spread far apart over a wide area or over a long period of time
4600.translation: 分散的（在大面积区域或长时期内散布得很开的）

4601.definition: a description of how things might happen in the future
4601.example: Let me suggest a possible scenario.
4601.translation: 方案，设想（对未来可能发生情况的描述）

4602.definition: the place where something happens, especially something unpleasant
4602.translation: 现场（事情发生的地方，尤指不快之事发生地）

4603.definition: having doubts that a claim or statement is true or that something will happen
4603.translation: 怀疑的（对主张或陈述的真实性或某事是否发生持有怀疑的）

4604.definition: a plan that lists all the work that you have to do and when you must do each thing
4604.example: I have a hectic schedule for the next few days.
4604.translation: 时间表，进度表（列出所有要做的工作及其时间的计划）

4605.definition: to arrange for something to happen at a particular time
4605.example: schedule something for something, The meeting is scheduled for Friday afternoon.
4605.translation: 安排（安排某事在特定时间发生）

4606.definition: a plan or system for doing or organizing something
4606.translation: 计划，方案（做某事或组织某事的计划或系统）

4607.definition: a person who knows a lot about a particular subject because they have studied it in detail
4607.translation: 学者（因详细研究而对特定学科了解很多的人）

4608.definition: an amount of money given to somebody by an organization to help pay for their education
4608.example: She won a scholarship to study at Stanford.
4608.translation: 奖学金（组织给予某人以资助其教育的款项）

4609.definition: a place where children go to be educated
4609.example: My brother and I went to the same school.
4609.translation: 学校（儿童接受教育的地方）

4610.definition: knowledge about the structure and behaviour of the natural and physical world, based on facts that you can prove, for example by experiments
4610.example: new developments in science and technology
4610.translation: 科学（基于可证明事实——如通过实验——对自然和物理世界的结构和行为的认识）

4611.translation: 科学的（涉及科学的；与科学相关的）

4612.definition: a person who studies one or more of the natural sciences (= for example, physics, chemistry or biology)
4612.translation: 科学家（研究一门或多门自然科学——如物理、化学、生物——的人）

4613.definition: the opportunity or ability to do or achieve something
4613.example: scope for something, There's still plenty of scope for improvement.
4613.translation: 范围，余地（做或实现某事的机会或能力）

4614.definition: the number of points, goals, etc. scored by each player or team in a game or competition
4614.translation: 分数，得分（比赛中选手或团队得到的分数、进球数等）

4615.definition: to win points, goals, etc. in a game or competition
4615.example: Fraser scored again in the second half.
4615.translation: 得分（在比赛或竞赛中赢得点数、进球等）

4616.definition: a mark, a cut or an injury made by scratching somebody’s skin or the surface of something
4616.example: Her hands were covered in scratches from the brambles.
4616.translation: 划痕，抓痕（抓挠皮肤或物体表面留下的痕迹、切口或伤口）

4617.definition: to rub your skin with your nails, usually because it is itching
4617.example: scratch something, John yawned and scratched his chin.
4617.translation: 抓挠（用指甲揉搓皮肤，通常是因为发痒）

4618.definition: a loud high shout made by somebody who is hurt, frightened, excited, etc.; a loud high noise
4618.example: scream of something, She let out a scream of pain.
4618.translation: 尖叫（因受伤、惊吓、兴奋等发出的响亮高音叫喊）

4619.definition: to give a loud, high shout, because you are hurt, frightened, excited, etc.
4619.example: There was a bang and I heard someone scream.
4619.translation: 尖叫（发出响亮的高音叫喊，因为受伤、害怕等）

4620.definition: the flat surface at the front of a television, computer, or other electronic device, on which you see pictures or information
4620.translation: 屏幕（电视、电脑等电子设备前部显示图像或信息的平整表面）

4621.definition: to show a film, etc. in a cinema or on television
4621.example: a list of films to be screened as part of the festival
4621.translation: 放映（在影院或电视上播放电影等）

4622.definition: the act of showing a film or television programme
4622.example: This will be the movie's first screening in this country.
4622.translation: 放映，筛查（放映电影或电视节目的行为）

4623.definition: a thin pointed piece of metal like a nail with a raised spiral line (called a thread) along it and a line or cross cut into its head. Screws are turned and pressed into wood, metal, etc. with a screwdriver in order to fasten two things together.
4623.example: One of the screws is loose.
4623.translation: 螺钉（带螺旋纹的钉状金属片，通过旋转旋入物体以起到固定作用）

4624.definition: to fasten one thing to another or make something tight with a screw or screws
4624.example: The bookcase is screwed to the wall.
4624.translation: 拧紧（用螺钉将一物固定到另一物上或使之变紧）

4625.definition: a written text of a play, film, broadcast, talk, etc.
4625.example: That line isn't in the original script.
4625.translation: 剧本，脚本（戏剧、电影、广播等的书面文本）

4626.example: Her argument doesn't really stand up to scrutiny.
4626.translation: 审查，细看（仔细且全面的检查）

4627.definition: a work of art that is a solid figure or object made by carving or shaping wood, stone, clay, metal, etc.
4627.translation: 雕塑（通过雕刻或塑造木、石、粘土等制成的立体艺术品）

4628.definition: the salt water that covers most of the earth’s surface and surrounds its continents and islands
4628.example: The waste was dumped in the sea.
4628.translation: 海，海洋（覆盖地球大部分表面并包围大陆岛屿的咸水）

4629.definition: an official design or mark, stamped on a document to show that it is real and carries the authority of a particular person or organization
4629.example: The letter bore the president's seal.
4629.translation: 印章，封条（盖在文件上以证明其真实性并带有特定机构权威的标志）

4630.definition: to close an envelope, etc. by sticking the edges of the opening together
4630.example: Make sure you've signed the cheque before sealing the envelope.
4630.translation: 密封（通过粘住开口边缘来关闭信封等）

4631.definition: an attempt to find somebody/something, especially by looking carefully for them/it
4631.example: search for somebody/something, a long search for the murder weapon
4631.translation: 搜索，搜寻（尝试寻找某人/某物，尤指通过仔细寻找）

4632.definition: to look carefully for something/somebody; to examine a particular place when looking for something/somebody
4632.example: search for something/somebody, She searched in vain for her passport.
4632.translation: 搜寻（仔细寻找某物/某人；或检查特定地点以寻找）

4633.definition: any of the four main periods of the year: spring, summer, autumn and winter
4633.translation: 季节（一年的四个主要时段之一：春夏秋冬）

4634.definition: a place where you can sit, for example a chair
4634.example: She sat back in her seat.
4634.translation: 座位（可以坐的地方，如椅子）

4635.definition: to give somebody a place to sit; to sit down in a place
4635.example: Please wait to be seated (= in a restaurant, etc.).
4635.translation: 就座（给某人安排座位；在某处坐下）

4636.definition: after one other person or thing in order or importance
4636.example: She came second in the marathon.
4636.translation: 第二地（在顺序或重要性上排在另一人/物之后）

4637.definition: happening or coming next after the first in a series of similar things or people; 2nd
4637.example: This is the second time it's happened.
4637.translation: 第二个（在类似事物或人的系列中紧随第一个之后的；2nd）

4638.definition: a unit for measuring time. There are 60 seconds in one minute.
4638.example: in… seconds, She can run 100 metres in just over 11 seconds.
4638.translation: 秒（时间测量单位，一分钟等于60秒）

4639.definition: happening or coming next after the first in a series of similar things or people; 2nd
4639.example: This is the second time it's happened.
4639.translation: 第二个（在类似事物或人的系列中紧随第一个之后的；2nd）

4640.definition: connected with teaching children of 11–18 years
4640.translation: 中学的（与11-18岁儿童教学相关的）

4641.definition: used to introduce the second of a list of points you want to make in a speech or piece of writing
4641.example: Firstly, it's expensive, and secondly, it's too slow.
4641.translation: 其次（用于引入演说或文章要点列表中的第二项）

4642.definition: known about by only a few people; kept hidden from others
4642.translation: 秘密的（仅被少数人知晓的；对他人隐藏的）

4643.definition: something that is known about by only a few people and not told to others
4643.translation: 秘密（仅被少数人知晓且不告知他人的事情）

4644.definition: a person who works in an office, working for another person, dealing with mail and phone calls, keeping records, arranging meetings with people, etc.
4644.translation: 秘书（在办公室为他人工作、处理邮件电话、记录和安排会议等的人）

4645.definition: any of the parts into which something is divided
4645.example: section of something, That section of the road is still closed.
4645.translation: 部分（事物划分出的任何一个部分）

4646.definition: a part of an area of activity, especially of a country’s economy
4646.translation: 部门（活动领域的一部分，尤指国家经济的部门）

4647.definition: not connected with spiritual or religious matters
4647.translation: 世俗的（与精神或宗教事务无关的）

4648.definition: likely to continue or be successful for a long time
4648.translation: 安全的，稳固的（很可能长期持续或成功的）

4649.definition: to obtain or achieve something, especially when this means using a lot of effort
4649.example: secure something, to secure a contract/deal/funding
4649.translation: 获得（获得或实现某事，尤指通过大量努力）

4650.definition: the activities involved in protecting a country, building or person against attack, danger, etc.
4650.example: national/homeland security (= the defence of a country)
4650.translation: 安全（保护国家、建筑或人免受攻击、危险等的活动）

4651.definition: to become aware of somebody/something by using your eyes
4651.example: see somebody/something, She looked for him but couldn't see him in the crowd.
4651.translation: 看见（利用眼睛察觉到某人/某物）

4652.definition: the small hard part produced by a plant, from which a new plant can grow
4652.example: a packet of wild flower seeds
4652.translation: 种子（由植物产出的能长成新植株的微小硬块）

4653.example: seek something/somebody, Drivers are advised to seek alternative routes.
4653.translation: 寻找，寻求（寻找某物/某人）

4654.definition: a person who is trying to find or get the thing mentioned
4654.translation: 寻找者（尝试寻找或获得所提到的事物的人）

4655.definition: to give the impression of being or doing something
4655.translation: 似乎（给出作为或正在做某事的印象）

4656.definition: in a way that appears to be true but may in fact not be
4656.translation: 表面上（以看似真实但实际可能并非如此的方式）

4657.definition: a part of something that is separate from the other parts or can be considered separately
4657.example: She cleaned a small segment of the painting.
4657.translation: 部分，段（事物中与其他部分分开或可被单独考虑的一部分）

4658.definition: to take somebody/something in your hand suddenly and using force
4658.example: seize something from somebody, She tried to seize the gun from him.
4658.translation: 夺取（突然用力将某人/某物抓在手中）

4659.example: He had seldom seen a child with so much talent.

4660.definition: to choose somebody/something from a group of people or things, usually according to a system
4660.example: select somebody/something for something, He hasn't been selected for the team.
4660.translation: 选择（通常根据某种体系从一群人或物中挑选）

4661.definition: the process of choosing somebody/something from a group of people or things, usually according to a system
4661.example: She took a long time to make her selection.
4661.translation: 选择（通常根据某种体系从一群人或物中挑选的过程）

4662.definition: affecting or involving only a small number of people or things from a larger group
4662.translation: 选择性的（仅影响或涉及大群体中少数人或物的）

4663.definition: the type of person you are, especially the way you normally behave, look or feel
4663.example: You'll soon be feeling your old self again (= feeling well or happy again).
4663.translation: 自我（你作为人的类型，尤指你通常的表现、外貌或感觉）

4664.definition: to give something to somebody in exchange for money
4664.example: sell (something), I recently sold my bike.
4664.translation: 卖（给某人某物以换取金钱）

4665.definition: a class at a university or college when a small group of students and a teacher discuss or study a particular topic
4665.example: Teaching is by lectures and seminars.
4665.translation: 研讨会（大学中师生就特定主题进行讨论或研究的课程）

4667.definition: to make something go or be taken to a place, especially by post, email, radio, etc.
4667.example: send something, She sent a letter of support.
4667.translation: 发送（使某物移动或被带到某处，尤指通过邮政、电邮等）

4668.definition: high in rank or status; higher in rank or status than others
4668.translation: 高级的，资深的（职级或地位高的；比他人职级更高的）

4669.definition: a feeling that you get when something affects your body
4669.translation: 感觉（当某物影响身体时产生的感觉）

4670.definition: an understanding about something; an ability to judge something
4670.example: One of the most important things in a partner is a sense of humour (= the ability to find things funny or make people laugh).
4670.translation: 感觉，感官（对某事的理解；判断某事的能力）

4671.definition: to become aware of something even though you cannot see it, hear it, etc.
4671.example: sense something, Sensing danger, they started to run.
4671.translation: 感觉到（察觉到某事，尽管无法直接看见或听到）

4672.definition: able to make good judgements based on reason and experience rather than emotion; practical
4672.example: She's a sensible sort of person.
4672.translation: 明智的（能基于理智而非情感做出良好判断的；务实的）

4673.definition: aware of and able to understand other people and their feelings
4673.translation: 敏感的（察觉到并能理解他人及其感受的）

4674.definition: the ability to understand other people’s feelings
4674.example: sensitivity to the needs of children
4674.translation: 敏感性（理解他人感受的能力）

4675.definition: a set of words expressing a statement, a question or an order, usually containing a subject and a verb. In written English sentences begin with a capital letter and end with a full stop/period (.), a question mark (?) or an exclamation mark (!).
4675.example: Does the sentence contain an adverb?
4675.translation: 句子（表达陈述、疑问或命令的一组词，通常含主谓语）

4676.definition: to say officially in court that somebody is to receive a particular punishment
4676.example: sentence somebody to something, He sentenced the defendant to life in prison.
4676.translation: 判决（在法庭上正式宣布某人应受的特定惩罚）

4677.definition: a feeling or an opinion, especially one based on emotions
4677.translation: 情感，情绪（感觉或观点，尤指基于情感的）

4678.definition: forming a unit by itself; not joined to something else
4678.example: They have begun to sleep in separate rooms.
4678.translation: 分开的（单独成一个单元的；未连接的）

4679.definition: to divide into different parts or groups; to divide things into different parts or groups
4679.example: Stir the sauce constantly so that it does not separate.
4679.translation: 分开（划分为不同的部分或群体）

4680.definition: the act of separating people or things; the state of being separate
4680.example: separation from somebody/something, the state’s eventual separation from the federation
4680.translation: 分开，分离（将人或物分开的行为；分开的状态）

4681.definition: the 9th month of the year, between August and October
4681.translation: 九月（一年中的第九个月）

4682.definition: a set of events, actions, numbers, etc. which have a particular order and which lead to a particular result
4682.example: He described the sequence of events leading up to the robbery.
4682.translation: 顺序，序列（具有特定顺序并导致特定结果的一组事件、数字等）

4683.definition: doing the same thing in the same way several times; done in the same way several times
4683.translation: 连环的（多次以相同方式做相同事情的）

4684.definition: a set of television or radio programmes or podcasts that deal with the same subject or that have the same characters
4684.example: The first episode of the new series is on Saturday.
4684.translation: 系列，丛书（涉及相同主题或具有相同人物的一套节目或出版物）

4687.definition: a person who works in another person’s house, and cooks, cleans, etc. for them
4687.translation: 仆人（在他人雇主家中为其做饭、打扫等工作的人）

4688.definition: to give somebody food or drink, for example at a restaurant or during a meal
4688.example: serve (something), Breakfast is served between 7 and 10 a.m.
4688.translation: 供应，端上（给某人食物或饮料，例如在餐厅或用餐时）

4689.definition: a system that provides something that the public needs, organized by the government or a private company
4689.translation: 服务，公共事业（由政府或私企组织的满足公众需求的系统）

4690.definition: a period of time that is spent doing a particular activity
4690.translation: 会议，时间段（花费在进行特定活动上的一段时间）

4691.definition: a group of similar things that belong together in some way
4691.translation: 一套，一组（以某种方式属于一类的类似事物的组合）

4692.definition: to prepare or arrange something so that it is ready for use or in position
4692.example: set something, Have you set the alarm clock?
4692.translation: 放置，安排（准备或安排某物使其就绪或到位）

4693.definition: a way of organizing something; a system
4693.example: I've only been here a couple of weeks and I don't really know the set-up.
4693.translation: 组织结构，体制（组织某事的方式；一个系统）

4694.definition: an environment where something is located; the place at which something happens
4694.example: a rural/an ideal/a beautiful/an idyllic setting
4694.translation: 背景，环境（某物所在的环境；某事发生的地点）

4695.definition: to put an end to an argument or a disagreement
4695.example: settle something, to settle a dispute/a matter/an issue

4696.definition: an official agreement that ends an argument between two people or groups
4696.translation: 解决，协议（结束人或群体间争论的正式协议）

4697.definition: a person who goes to live in a new country or region
4697.example: Most of the settlers came from England.
4697.translation: 移居者（前往新国家或地区定居的人）

4701.definition: more than two but not very many
4701.translation: 几个，若干（多于两个但不是很多）

4702.definition: more than two but not very many
4702.translation: 几个，若干（多于两个但不是很多）

4703.translation: 严重的，严厉的（极其糟糕或严重的）

4704.translation: 严重地，严厉地（非常糟糕或严重地）

4705.definition: the state of being male or female
4705.example: How can you tell what sex a fish is?
4705.translation: 性别（男性或女性的状态）

4706.definition: connected with the physical activity of sex

4707.definition: the feelings and activities connected with a person’s sexual desires
4707.example: He was confused about his sexuality.
4707.translation: 性取向，性征（与人的性欲相关的感觉和活动）

4708.translation: 性感的（具有性吸引力的）

4709.definition: an area that is dark and cool under or behind something, for example a tree or building, because the sun’s light does not get to it
4709.example: shade of something, The shade of the pine tree provided some protection from the sun.
4709.translation: 阴凉处（因阳光照不到而在物体下方或后面形成的阴暗凉爽区域）

4710.definition: the dark shape that somebody/something’s form makes on a surface, for example on the ground, when they are between the light and the surface
4710.example: The children were having fun, chasing each other's shadows.
4710.translation: 影子（光线被物体遮挡而在表面形成的暗影）

4711.example: She gave him a shake to wake him.
4711.translation: 摇动（摇晃某人/某物的动作）

4712.definition: to move or make somebody/something move with short quick movements from side to side or up and down
4712.example: The whole house shakes when a train goes past.
4712.translation: 摇晃（以短促快速的动作左右或上下移动某人/某物）

4713.definition: used with I and we for talking about or predicting the future
4713.example: This time next week I shall be in Scotland.
4713.translation: （助动词）将要（与I和we连用，用于谈论或预测未来）

4714.definition: not having much distance between the top or surface and the bottom
4714.translation: 浅的（顶部或表面到底部距离不大的）

4715.definition: used to say that something is a cause for feeling sad or disappointed
4715.example: She's retiring because of ill health, which is a great shame.
4715.translation: 遗憾（用于表示某事令人难过或失望）

4716.definition: the form of the outer edges or surfaces of something; an example of something that has a particular form
4716.translation: 形状（物体的外缘或表面的形式；特定形式的示例）

4717.definition: to make something into a particular shape
4717.example: shape A into B, Shape the dough into a ball.
4717.translation: 使成形（将某物做成特定的形状）

4718.definition: having the type of shape mentioned
4718.example: a huge balloon shaped like a giant cow
4718.translation: ...形状的（具有所提到的形状类型的）

4719.definition: one part of something that is divided between two or more people
4719.example: share of something, Next year we hope to have a greater share of the market.
4719.translation: 份额（两人或多人间分配的事物的一份）

4720.definition: to have, use or experience something at the same time as somebody else
4720.example: There isn't an empty table. Would you mind sharing?
4720.translation: 分享，共有（与他人同时拥有、使用或体验某事）

4721.definition: an owner of shares in a company or business
4721.example: the major shareholders in the company
4721.translation: 股东（公司或企业的股份拥有者）

4722.definition: having a fine edge or point, especially of something that can cut or make a hole in something
4722.translation: 锋利的（有细薄边缘或尖端的，尤指能切割或刺穿的）

4723.definition: to suddenly break into small pieces; to make something suddenly break into small pieces
4723.example: shatter (into something), He dropped the vase and it shattered into pieces on the floor.
4723.translation: 破碎，震碎（突然破碎成小片；使之破碎）

4724.definition: a female person or animal that has already been mentioned or is easily identified
4724.example: ‘What does your sister do?’ ‘She's a dentist.’
4724.translation: 她（代指已提到或易识别的女性或雌性动物）

4725.definition: to get rid of something that is no longer wanted
4725.example: The factory is shedding a large number of jobs.
4725.translation: 摆脱，裁减（去掉不再想要的东西，如裁减职位）

4726.definition: an animal with a thick coat, kept on farms for its meat (called mutton or lamb) or its wool
4726.translation: 羊（农场饲养的产肉或产毛的长毛动物）

4727.definition: used to emphasize the size, degree or amount of something
4727.example: The area is under threat from the sheer number of tourists using it.
4727.translation: 十足的，纯粹的（用于强调某事物的规模、程度或数量）

4728.definition: a large piece of thin cloth used on a bed to lie on or lie under
4728.example: Have you changed the sheets (= put clean sheets on the bed)?
4728.translation: 床单，薄片（床上的大薄布片；或纸张等薄片）

4729.definition: a flat board, made of wood, metal, glass, etc., fixed to the wall or forming part of a cupboard, bookcase, etc., for things to be placed on
4729.example: I helped him put up some shelves in his bedroom.
4729.translation: 搁板（固定在墙上或橱柜中用于放置物品的扁平木/金属/玻璃板）

4730.definition: the hard outer part of eggs, nuts, some seeds, and some animals
4730.example: We collected shells on the beach.
4730.translation: 壳，外壳（蛋、坚果、种子或某些动物的坚硬外部）

4731.definition: the fact of having a place to live or stay, considered as a basic human need
4731.example: Human beings need food, clothing and shelter.
4731.translation: 避难所，住所（基本的居住地；遮风避雨处）

4732.definition: to give somebody/something a place where they are protected from the weather or from danger; to protect somebody/something
4732.example: shelter somebody/something from somebody/something, Trees shelter the house from the wind.
4732.translation: 庇护，遮蔽（给予某人/某物免受天气或危险影响的场所；保护）

4733.definition: a period of time worked by a group of workers who start work as another group finishes
4733.translation: 轮班（一组工人在另一组下班后开始工作的时间段）

4734.definition: to move, or move something, from one position or place to another
4734.example: Lydia shifted uncomfortably in her chair.
4734.translation: 转移，移动（从一个位置或地方移动到另一个）

4735.definition: to produce or reflect light; to be bright
4735.example: The sun shone brightly in a cloudless sky.
4735.translation: 发光，闪耀（产生或反射光线；明亮）

4736.definition: smooth and bright; reflecting the light
4736.translation: 发光的，闪亮的（光滑明亮的；反射光线的）

4737.definition: a large boat that carries people or goods by sea
4737.example: The yard builds ships for the Navy.
4737.translation: 船（通过海洋运送人或货物的大型船只）

4738.definition: to send or transport somebody/something by ship or by another means of transport
4738.example: The company ships its goods all over the world.
4738.translation: 运输，运送（通过船或其他交通工具发送或运输人/物）

4739.definition: ships in general or considered as a group
4739.example: The canal is open to shipping.
4739.translation: 运输，航运（所有的船只；或通过船只进行的运输业务）

4740.definition: a piece of clothing worn on the upper part of the body, made of light cloth, with sleeves and usually with a collar and buttons down the front
4740.translation: 衬衫（穿在身体上半部的由轻薄布料制成的带袖上衣，通常带领和扣）

4741.definition: a strong feeling of surprise as a result of something happening, especially something unpleasant; the event that causes this feeling
4741.example: I got a terrible shock the other day.
4741.translation: 震惊（由于发生不快之事而产生的强烈惊讶感；引起此感的事）

4742.example: shock somebody, President Kennedy's assassination in Dallas on November 22, 1963, shocked the world.
4742.translation: 使震惊（使某人感到惊讶且沮丧）

4743.definition: surprised and upset; showing that somebody feels surprised and upset
4743.example: I was quite shocked when I found out what he'd done.
4743.translation: 震惊的（感到惊讶且沮丧的；表现出此情绪的）

4744.definition: that offends or upsets people; that is morally wrong
4744.translation: 令人震惊的（冒犯或令他人沮丧的；在道德上错误的）

4745.definition: one of a pair of objects usually made of leather or plastic that you wear on your feet
4745.translation: 鞋（穿在脚上的皮革或塑料制品的一只）

4746.definition: the part that grows up from the ground when a plant starts to grow; a new part that grows on plants or trees
4746.translation: 嫩芽，幼苗（植物开始生长时从地里长出的部分；植物的新芽）

4747.definition: to fire a gun or other weapon; to fire something from a weapon
4747.translation: 射击（发射枪支或其他武器；从武器中射出某物）

4748.definition: a situation in which a person is shot with a gun
4748.example: Terrorist groups claimed responsibility for the shootings and bomb attacks.
4748.translation: 射击，枪击（人被枪击中的情况）

4749.definition: a building or part of a building where you can buy goods or services
4749.translation: 商店（可以购买商品或服务的建筑或其中一部分）

4750.example: I shop there from time to time.

4751.definition: the activity of going to shops and buying things or ordering them online
4751.translation: 购物（去商店买东西或在线订购的活动）

4752.definition: the land along the edge of the sea, the ocean or a lake
4752.translation: 岸（沿着海、洋或湖边的一块土地）

4753.definition: measuring or covering a small length or distance, or a smaller length or distance than usual
4753.translation: 短的，矮的（测量或覆盖的长度或距离短的；比通常短的）

4754.definition: lasting a short time; designed only for a short period of time in the future
4754.translation: 短期的（持续时间短的；仅为未来短期设计的）

4755.definition: a situation when there is not enough of the people or things that are needed
4755.translation: 短缺（所需人或物不足的情况）

4756.translation: 不久，很快（短时间内；不长久）

4757.definition: the act of firing a gun; the sound this makes
4757.example: We heard some shots in the distance.
4757.translation: 射击，开枪（发射枪支的行为；发出的响声）

4758.definition: used to show what is right, appropriate, etc., especially when criticizing somebody’s actions
4758.translation: 应该（用于表示什么是正确的、恰当的，尤用于批评他人）

4759.definition: either of the two parts of the body between the top of each arm and the neck
4759.translation: 肩膀（手臂顶端与脖子之间的身体部位）

4760.definition: a loud cry of anger, fear, excitement, etc.
4760.translation: 大叫（因愤怒、恐惧、兴奋等发出的响亮叫喊）

4761.definition: to say something in a loud voice; to speak loudly/angrily to somebody
4761.translation: 叫喊（以响亮的嗓门说话；愤怒地对某人说话）

4762.definition: a programme on television or the radio
4762.example: Millions of people watch the show.
4762.translation: 节目，演出（电视或广播节目）

4763.definition: to make something clear; to prove something
4763.example: show (that)…, The figures clearly show that her claims are false.
4763.translation: 显示，展示（使某事清晰；证明某事）

4764.definition: a piece of equipment producing a flow of water that you stand under to wash yourself; the small room or part of a room that contains a shower
4764.example: in the shower, He's in the shower.
4764.translation: 阵雨，淋浴（人站立其下洗澡的流水设备；淋浴间）

4765.definition: to become smaller, especially when washed in water that is too hot; to make clothes, cloth, etc. smaller in this way
4765.example: My sweater shrank in the wash.
4765.translation: 缩水，缩小（变得更小，尤指由于热水洗涤；使衣物等变小）

4766.definition: to raise your shoulders and then drop them to show that you do not know or care about something
4766.translation: 耸肩（抬起并放下肩膀以示不知道或不在乎）

4768.definition: to close something; to become closed

4769.definition: nervous or embarrassed about meeting and speaking to other people
4769.example: He is not exactly the shy and retiring type.
4769.translation: 害羞的（在见人或说话时感到紧张或尴尬的）

4771.translation: 生病的（身体或精神生病的）

4772.definition: either of the two halves of a surface, an object or an area that is divided by an imaginary central line
4772.example: the right side of the brain
4772.translation: 侧面（由假想中心线分成的平面、物体或区域的一半）

4773.definition: an act or the sound of sighing
4773.translation: 叹息（叹气的行为或声音）

4774.definition: to take and then let out a long deep breath that can be heard, to show that you are disappointed, sad, tired, etc.
4774.example: He sighed deeply at the thought.
4774.translation: 叹气（深吸一口气并出声呼出，以示失望、悲伤或疲倦）

4775.example: to lose your sight (= to become blind)

4776.definition: an event, an action, a fact, etc. that shows that something exists, is happening or may happen in the future
4776.example: Looking back, I should have seen the signs.
4776.translation: 迹象，标志（显示某事存在、正在发生或未来可能发生的事件、事实）

4777.definition: to write your name on a document, letter, etc. to show that you have written it, that you agree with what it says, or that it is real
4777.translation: 签名，签署（在文件上写下名字以表示它是你写的或你同意其内容）

4778.definition: a movement or sound that you make to give somebody information, instructions, a warning, etc.
4778.translation: 信号（向他人提供信息、指令、警告等的动作或声音）

4779.definition: to make a movement or sound to give somebody a message, an order, etc.
4779.translation: 发信号（发出动作或声音以给他人消息或命令）

4780.definition: your name as you usually write it, for example at the end of a letter
4780.example: Someone had forged her signature on the cheque.
4780.translation: 签名（你通常写名字的方式，如在支票末尾）

4781.definition: the importance of something, especially when this has an effect on what happens in the future
4781.example: a decision of major political significance
4781.translation: 意义，重要性（某事的重要性，尤指其对未来的影响）

4782.definition: large or important enough to have an effect or to be noticed
4782.example: There are no significant differences between the two groups of students.
4782.translation: 显著的，重要的（大到或重要到足以产生影响或被注意到的）

4783.definition: in a way that is large or important enough to have an effect on something or to be noticed
4783.translation: 显著地（以足够大或重要到产生影响或被注意到的方式）

4784.definition: a complete lack of noise or sound
4784.example: Their footsteps echoed in the silence.
4784.translation: 沉默（完全没有响声或声音）

4785.definition: where there is little or no sound; making little or no sound
4785.example: At last the traffic fell silent.
4785.translation: 沉默的（几乎没有或完全没有声音的；不发声的）

4786.definition: fine soft thread produced by silkworms
4786.example: The caterpillar spins the silk around its entire body.
4786.translation: 丝，丝绸（蚕产出的精细柔软纤维）

4787.definition: showing a lack of thought, understanding, or judgement
4787.translation: 愚蠢的（表现出缺乏思考、理解或判断的）

4788.translation: 银色的（发亮的灰白色的）

4789.definition: a chemical element. Silver is a shiny, grey-white precious metal used for making coins, jewellery, beautiful objects, etc.
4789.translation: 银（一种发亮的灰白色贵金属化学元素，用于制造钱币、珠宝等）

4790.definition: like somebody/something but not exactly the same
4790.translation: 相似的（像某人/某物但不完全一样的）

4791.definition: the state of being similar to somebody/something but not exactly the same
4791.example: similarity between A and B, The report highlights the similarity between the two groups.
4791.translation: 相似性（与某人/某物相似但不完全一样的状态）

4792.example: It is a little cheaper than other similarly sized cars.
4792.translation: 相似地（以几乎相同的方式）

4793.definition: not complicated; easy to understand or do
4793.translation: 简单的（不复杂的；易于理解或执行的）

4794.definition: used to emphasize how easy or basic something is
4794.translation: 简单地（用于强调某事是多么容易或基础）

4795.definition: to create particular conditions that exist in real life using computers, models, etc., usually for study or training purposes
4795.example: Computer software can be used to simulate conditions on the seabed.
4795.translation: 模拟（使用电脑、模型等创造现实生活中的特定条件，用于研究培训）

4796.definition: a situation in which a particular set of conditions is created artificially in order to study or experience something that could exist in reality
4796.example: a computer simulation of how the planet functions
4796.translation: 模拟（人工创造一套特定条件以研究或体验现实中可能存在的情况）

4797.definition: at the same time as something else
4797.example: The game will be broadcast simultaneously on TV and radio.
4797.translation: 同时地（与另一件事在同一时间）

4798.definition: an offence against God or against a religious or moral law
4798.translation: 罪，罪孽（对上帝或宗教/道德法律的触犯）

4799.definition: from a time in the past until a later past time, or until now
4799.example: She went for a run on Monday and has not been seen since.
4799.translation: 自...以来（从过去的某个时间直到后来或现在）

4800.definition: from an event in the past until a later past event, or until now
4800.example: Cath hasn't phoned since she went to Berlin.
4800.translation: 自从（从过去的某个事件直到后来或现在）

4801.definition: from a time in the past until a later past time, or until now
4801.example: She's been off work since Tuesday.
4801.translation: 自...以来（从过去的某个时间直到后来或现在）

4802.definition: showing what you really think or feel
4802.translation: 诚挚的（表现出真实想法或感受的）

4803.definition: to make musical sounds with your voice in the form of a song or tune
4803.example: I just can't sing in tune!
4803.translation: 唱（用嗓音发出歌曲或旋律的音乐声）

4804.definition: a person who sings, or whose job is singing, especially in public
4804.translation: 歌手（唱歌的人，尤指以此为业者）

4805.definition: the activity of making musical sounds with your voice
4805.translation: 歌唱（发出歌曲旋律的嗓音活动）

4806.example: He sent her a single red rose.
4806.translation: 单一的，唯一的（仅有的一个）

4807.definition: a ticket that allows you to travel to a place but not back again
4807.example: How much is a single to York?
4807.translation: 单程票（允许去某地但不返回的票）

4808.definition: to go down below the surface or towards the bottom of a liquid or soft substance
4808.example: The ship sank to the bottom of the sea.
4808.translation: 沉没（在液体或软物质中降至表面以下或底部）

4809.definition: used as a polite way of addressing a man whose name you do not know, for example in a shop or restaurant
4809.example: Good morning, sir. Can I help you?
4809.translation: 先生（在商店或餐厅礼貌称呼不知名的男性）

4810.definition: a girl or woman who has the same mother and father as another person
4810.translation: 姐妹（具有相同父母的女孩或女性）

4811.definition: to rest your weight on your bottom with your back straight, for example on/in a chair
4811.example: She sat and stared at the letter in front of her.
4811.translation: 坐（背挺直地将重心压在臀部休息，如在椅子上）

4812.definition: a place where a building, town, etc. was, is or will be located
4812.example: the site of a sixteenth-century abbey
4812.translation: 地点，遗址（建筑或城镇过去、现在或未来所在的地点）

4813.definition: in a particular place or position
4813.example: My bedroom was situated on the top floor of the house.
4813.translation: 位于（处于特定位置或地点的）

4814.definition: all the circumstances and things that are happening at a particular time and in a particular place
4814.translation: 情况，处境（特定时间和地点的所有环境和发生的事情）

4818.definition: how large or small a person or thing is
4818.translation: 尺寸，大小（人或物多大多小的度量）

4819.definition: a simple picture that is drawn quickly and does not have many details
4819.example: The artist is making sketches for his next painting.
4819.translation: 素描（快速画出的、不含细节的简单图画）

4820.definition: connected with the sport of skiing
4820.translation: 滑雪的（与滑雪运动相关的）

4821.definition: one of a pair of long narrow pieces of wood, metal or plastic that you attach to boots so that you can move smoothly over snow
4821.translation: 滑雪板（系在靴子上以便在雪上平稳滑行的一对长窄木/金属/塑料板之一）

4822.definition: to move over snow on skis, especially as a sport
4822.example: Our children want to learn to ski.
4822.translation: 滑雪（在雪上滑行，尤指作为运动）

4823.definition: the sport or activity of moving over snow on skis
4823.example: He also enjoys skiing and mountain biking.
4823.translation: 滑雪（在雪上滑行的运动或活动）

4824.definition: the ability to do something well
4824.example: The job requires skill and an eye for detail.

4825.definition: having enough ability, experience and knowledge to be able to do something well
4825.translation: 熟练的（具备足够的完成某事所需的能力、经验和知识的）

4826.definition: the layer of tissue that covers the body
4826.translation: 皮肤（覆盖身体的组织层）

4827.definition: to move forwards lightly and quickly making a little jump with each step
4827.example: She skipped happily along beside me.
4827.translation: 跳过，蹦跳（轻快地向前移动，每步带有一个小跳跃）

4828.definition: a piece of clothing that hangs from the middle part of the body
4828.translation: 裙子（从身体中部垂下的服装）

4829.definition: the bone structure that forms the head and surrounds and protects the brain
4829.translation: 头骨（构成头部、包围并保护大脑的骨骼结构）

4830.definition: the space above the earth that you can see when you look up, where clouds and the sun, moon and stars appear
4830.example: The sky suddenly went dark and it started to rain.
4830.translation: 天空（地球上方的、能看见云及日月星辰的空间）

4831.definition: to shut, or to make something shut, with a lot of force, making a loud noise
4831.example: I heard the door slam behind him.
4831.translation: 砰地关上（用力且发出巨大响声地关闭某物）

4832.definition: to hit somebody/something with the flat part of your hand
4832.translation: 拍，扇（用手掌击打某人/某物）

4833.definition: to make a long cut with a sharp object, especially in a violent way
4833.example: slash something, Someone had slashed the tyres on my car.
4833.translation: 割，划（用锋利物品切出长口子，尤指猛烈地）

4834.definition: a person who is owned by another person and is forced to work for and obey them
4834.example: A former slave, he graduated from Clafflin University in South Carolina.
4834.translation: 奴隶（被他人拥有并被迫为其工作、服从的人）

4835.definition: the state of being forced to work as a slave
4835.translation: 奴隶制度（被迫作为奴隶工作的状态）

4836.definition: the natural state of rest in which your eyes are closed, your body is not active, and your mind is not conscious
4836.example: I need to get some sleep.
4836.translation: 睡眠（眼睛闭合、身体静止、意识清醒的自然休息状态）

4837.definition: to rest with your eyes closed and your mind and body not active
4837.example: Let her sleep—it'll do her good.
4837.translation: 睡觉（闭眼休息，身体和精神不活跃）

4838.definition: a thin flat piece of bread, meat, cheese, etc. that has been cut off a larger piece; a piece of cake that has been cut from a larger cake
4838.example: Cut the meat into thin slices.
4838.translation: 薄片，切片（从较大部分切下的薄平片，如面包、肉、蛋糕片）

4840.definition: one page of an electronic presentation, that may contain text and images, that is usually viewed on a computer screen or projected onto a larger screen
4840.example: Here's a slide showing target markets.
4840.translation: 幻灯片（电子演示文稿的一页，通常在屏幕上观看或投影）

4841.definition: to move easily over a smooth or wet surface; to make something move in this way
4841.example: As I turned left on a bend, my car started to slide.
4841.translation: 滑动（在光滑或湿润表面上轻松移动；使之滑动）

4844.definition: to slide a short distance by accident so that you fall or nearly fall
4844.example: She slipped and landed flat on her back.
4844.translation: 滑倒（因意外在短距离内滑动导致摔倒或几乎摔倒）

4845.definition: a word or phrase that is easy to remember, used for example by a political party or in advertising to attract people’s attention or to suggest an idea quickly
4845.translation: 口号（易记的词或短语，如政党或广告中使用以吸引注意）

4846.definition: a surface or piece of land that slopes (= is higher at one end than the other)
4846.example: on a slope, The town is built on a slope.
4846.translation: 斜坡，坡度（倾斜的表面或土地）

4847.definition: to be at an angle so that it is higher at one end than the other
4847.translation: 倾斜（处于一个角度，使一端高于另一端）

4848.definition: a long, narrow opening, into which you put or fit something
4848.example: to put some coins in the slot
4848.translation: 槽，狭缝（放入或嵌入某物的狭长开口）

4849.definition: not moving, acting or done quickly; taking a long time; not fast
4849.translation: 慢的（移动、行动不快的；耗时长的）

4850.definition: to go or to make something/somebody go at a slower speed or be less active
4850.example: Economic growth has slowed a little.
4850.translation: 变慢（以更慢的速度行进或使之变慢）

4851.definition: at a slow speed; not quickly

4852.definition: not large in size, number, degree, amount, etc.
4852.translation: 小的（在尺寸、数量、程度等方面不大的）

4853.definition: looking clean and neat; well dressed in fashionable and/or formal clothes
4853.example: I have to be smart for work.
4853.translation: 时髦的，整洁的（看起来干净整洁的；穿着入时的）

4854.definition: a mobile phone that also has some of the functions of a computer, for example the facility to use apps and the internet
4854.example: You can use your smartphone to access the internet.
4854.translation: 智能手机（也具备电脑功能——如应用和网络——的手机）

4855.definition: to break something, or to be broken, violently and noisily into many pieces
4855.translation: 撞碎，粉碎（猛烈且响亮地破碎成许多碎片；使之粉碎）

4856.definition: the quality of something that people and animals sense through their noses
4856.translation: 气味（人或动物通过鼻子感知的特质）

4857.translation: 闻起来（具有某种特定的气味）

4858.definition: the expression that you have on your face when you are happy or you think something is funny, in which the corners of your mouth turn upwards
4858.translation: 微笑（高兴或觉得滑稽时嘴角上扬的面部表情）

4859.definition: to make a smile appear on your face

4860.definition: the grey, white or black gas that is produced by something burning
4860.translation: 烟（物体燃烧产生的灰、白或黑色的气体）

4861.definition: to take smoke from a cigarette, pipe, etc. into your mouth and let it out again
4861.example: Do you mind if I smoke?
4861.translation: 吸烟（吸入香烟等的烟雾并吐出）

4862.definition: the activity or habit of smoking cigarettes, etc.
4862.example: No Smoking (= for example, on a notice)
4862.translation: 吸烟（吸烟的活动或习惯）

4863.definition: completely flat and even, without any rough areas or holes
4863.example: the smooth surface of the metal
4863.translation: 光滑的（完全平整的，没有粗糙区域或孔洞）

4864.definition: a reptile with a very long thin body and no legs. There are many types of snake, some of which are poisonous.
4864.example: a snake coiled up in the grass
4864.translation: 蛇（长而细、无足的爬行动物，有些有毒）

4865.definition: to break something suddenly with a sharp noise; to be broken in this way
4865.example: snap something, The wind had snapped the tree in two.
4865.translation: 啪地折断（发出尖锐响声并突然断开；以此方式变断）

4866.definition: small soft white pieces (called flakes) of frozen water that fall from the sky in cold weather; this substance when it is lying on the ground
4866.translation: 雪（寒冷天气从天空落下的白色冻水薄片）

4867.definition: when it snows, snow falls from the sky
4867.example: It's been snowing heavily all day.

4869.definition: used to show the reason for something
4869.example: It was still painful, so I went to see a doctor.
4869.translation: 所以（用于说明某事的原因）

4870.definition: used to show that you do not think that the word or phrase that is being used to describe somebody/something is appropriate
4870.translation: 所谓的（用于表示你认为用于描述某人/某物的词语不恰当）

4871.definition: to put something in liquid for a time so that it becomes completely wet; to become completely wet in this way
4871.example: soak something (in something), I usually soak the beans overnight.
4871.translation: 浸泡（将某物放入液体一段时间使其湿透；变湿透）

4872.definition: a substance that you use with water for washing your body
4872.example: Wash the affected area with soap and water.
4872.translation: 肥皂（洗涤身体时随水使用的物质）

4873.definition: if the value, amount or level of something soars, it rises very quickly
4873.translation: 猛增，翱翔（某物的价值、数量或水平极快地上升）

4874.definition: a game played by two teams of 11 players, using a round ball which players kick up and down the playing field. Teams try to kick the ball into the other team’s goal.
4874.example: I played soccer when I was younger.
4874.translation: 足球（两队各11名球员、将圆球踢入对方球门的比赛）

4875.definition: connected with activities in which people meet each other for pleasure
4875.example: She has a busy social life.
4875.translation: 社交的（与人际交往活动相关的）

4876.translation: 社会主义的（与社会主义相关的）

4877.definition: people in general, living together in communities
4877.example: She believes that the arts benefit society as a whole.
4877.translation: 社会（居住在社区中的广大民众）

4878.definition: a piece of clothing that is worn over the foot, ankle and lower part of the leg, especially inside a shoe
4878.translation: 袜子（穿在脚和脚踝上的衣物，通常在鞋内穿）

4879.definition: changing shape easily when pressed; not stiff or hard
4879.translation: 柔软的（被按压时易改变形状的；不僵硬的）

4880.definition: the programs used by a computer for doing particular jobs
4880.translation: 软件（电脑用于执行特定任务的程序）

4881.definition: the top layer of the earth in which plants, trees, etc. grow
4881.translation: 土壤（植物、树木生长的地球表层）

4882.definition: of or connected with the sun
4882.translation: 太阳的（属于或与太阳相关的）

4883.definition: a member of an army, especially one who is not an officer
4883.example: They visited the graves of US soldiers killed in the First World War.
4883.translation: 士兵（军队成员，尤指非军官成员）

4884.example: the sole surviving member of the family

4885.example: She was motivated solely by self-interest.
4885.translation: 唯一地（仅仅；不涉及他人/他物地）

4886.definition: a lawyer who prepares legal documents, for example for the sale of land or buildings, advises people on legal matters, and can speak for them in some courts of law
4886.example: Her first step was to contact a solicitor for advice.
4886.translation: 初级律师（准备法律文件、提供法律建议并在某些法庭发言的律师）

4887.definition: hard; not in the form of a liquid or gas
4887.example: The planet Jupiter may have no solid surface at all.
4887.translation: 固体的（硬的；非液体或气体的）

4888.definition: a substance or an object that is solid, not a liquid or a gas
4888.translation: 固体（固体物质或物体，非液体或气体）

4889.definition: support by one person or group of people for another because they share feelings, opinions, aims, etc.
4889.translation: 团结（因情感、观点、目标一致而对他人的支持）

4890.definition: done by one person alone, without anyone helping them
4890.translation: 单独的（由一人独自完成且无他人帮助的）

4891.definition: a piece of music, dance or entertainment performed by only one person
4891.example: The song features an extended guitar solo.
4891.translation: 独奏，独舞（仅由一人表演的音乐、舞蹈或娱乐节目）

4892.definition: a way of solving a problem or dealing with a difficult situation
4892.example: Attempts to find a solution have failed.
4892.translation: 解决方案（解决问题或处理困难局面的方式）

4893.definition: to find a way of dealing with a problem or difficult situation
4893.example: Attempts are being made to solve the problem of waste disposal.
4893.translation: 解决（找出处理问题或困难局面的方式）

4894.definition: used with uncountable nouns or plural countable nouns to mean ‘an amount of’ or ‘a number of’, when the amount or number is not given
4894.example: There's some milk in the fridge.
4894.translation: 一些（用于不可数或复数名词，表示未给具体数额的“一些”）

4895.definition: used to refer to an amount of something or a number of people or things when the amount or number is not given
4895.translation: 一些（指代未给具体数额的一些人或物）

4896.definition: a person who is not known or mentioned by name

4897.definition: in a way that is not known or certain
4897.example: We must stop him from seeing her somehow.
4897.translation: 以某种方式（以一种不为人知或不确定的方式）

4898.definition: a person who is not known or mentioned by name

4899.definition: a thing that is not known or mentioned by name
4899.example: We stopped for something to eat.
4899.translation: 某事（未指名道姓的事物）

4900.definition: at a time that you do not know exactly or has not yet been decided
4900.example: I saw him sometime last summer.
4900.translation: 在某时（在将来或过去某个不确定的时间）

4901.definition: occasionally rather than all of the time

4902.translation: 稍微，有点（在某种程度上）

4903.definition: in, at or to a place that you do not know or do not mention by name
4903.example: I read somewhere that she refuses to do interviews.
4903.translation: 在某处（在一个不确定或未指名的地方）

4904.definition: a place that you do not know or do not mention by name
4904.example: We need to find somewhere to live.
4904.translation: 某个地方（一个不确定或未指名的地方）

4906.definition: a short piece of music with words that you sing
4906.translation: 歌曲（带有歌词的简短乐曲）

4907.definition: in a short time from now; a short time after something else has happened
4907.example: She sold the house soon after her husband died.
4907.translation: 很快（从现在起很短时间内；某事发生后不久）

4908.definition: clever and complicated in the way that it works or is presented
4908.translation: 复杂的，高级的（在运作或呈现方式上精巧复杂的）

4909.definition: feeling sad and ashamed about something that has been done
4909.example: sorry about something, We're very sorry about the damage to your car.
4909.translation: 难过的，遗憾的（对已做之事感到悲伤或羞愧）

4910.definition: used when you are apologizing for something

4911.definition: a group or type of people or things that are similar in a particular way
4911.example: sort of somebody/something, ‘What sort of music do you like?’ ‘Oh, all sorts.’
4911.translation: 种类，类别（在某方面相似的一组人或物）

4912.definition: to arrange things in groups or in a particular order according to their type, etc.; to separate things of one type from others
4912.example: sort something, I started at the bottom, answering phones and sorting the mail.
4912.translation: 分类，整理（根据类型等将事物分组或按序排列；将一类与他类分开）

4913.definition: the spiritual part of a person, believed to exist after death
4913.example: He believed his immortal soul was in peril.
4913.translation: 灵魂（人的精神部分，被认为死后依然存在）

4914.definition: sensible; that you can rely on and that will probably give good results
4914.example: He's a person of very sound judgement.
4914.translation: 明智的，可靠的（理智的；可信赖且可能产生好结果的）

4916.definition: to give a particular impression when heard or read about
4916.translation: 听起来（听起来或读起来给出某种印象）

4917.definition: a liquid food made by boiling meat, vegetables, etc. in water, often eaten as the first course of a meal
4917.translation: 汤（通过加水煮肉、菜等制成的液体食物）

4918.definition: a place, person or thing that you get something from
4918.translation: 来源，源头（获得某物的地点、人或事物）

4919.translation: 南方的（在南方或向南的）

4921.definition: the direction that is on your right when you watch the sun rise; one of the four main points of the compass
4921.translation: 南方（看日出时在你右侧的方向；罗盘四个主要点之一）

4922.definition: located in the south or facing south; connected with or typical of the south part of the world or a region
4922.example: the southern slopes of the mountains
4922.translation: 南方的（位于南方或面向南方的；与南方地区相关的）

4923.definition: complete power to govern a country
4923.example: The country claimed sovereignty over the island.
4923.translation: 主权（统治国家的完全权力）

4924.definition: the area outside the earth’s atmosphere where all the other planets and stars are
4924.example: in space, Valentina Tereshkova was the first woman in space.
4924.translation: 太空（地球大气层以外的、有星辰存在的区域）

4925.definition: advertising material sent by email to people who have not asked for it; advertising material on the internet that is not wanted
4925.translation: 垃圾邮件（未经请求通过电邮发送的广告材料）

4926.definition: the length of time that something lasts or is able to continue
4926.example: I worked with him over a span of six years.
4926.translation: 跨度，时段（某事持续的时间长度）

4927.definition: to last all through a period of time or to cover the whole of it
4927.translation: 跨越，持续（持续贯穿一段时间或覆盖其全部）

4928.definition: available to do what you want with rather than work
4928.example: He's studying music in his spare time.
4928.translation: 空闲的（可供支配而非工作的，如空闲时间）

4929.definition: to make something such as time or money available to somebody or for something, especially when it requires an effort for you to do this
4929.example: spare something/somebody, I'd love to have a break, but I can't spare the time just now.
4929.translation: 腾出，抽出（拨出时间或金钱给他人或某事，尤指费力做到）

4930.definition: to cause something to start or develop, especially suddenly
4930.example: spark something, The proposal would spark a storm of protest around the country.
4930.translation: 引发，触发（导致某事开始或发展，尤指突然引发）

4931.definition: to talk to somebody about something; to have a conversation with somebody
4931.example: speak to somebody, The President refused to speak to reporters.
4931.translation: 说话，谈话（就某事与某人交谈）

4932.definition: a person who gives a talk or makes a speech
4932.example: He was a guest speaker at the conference.
4932.translation: 发言者，演说者（进行演说或讲座的人）

4933.definition: not ordinary or usual; different from what is normal
4933.example: The school will only allow this in special circumstances.
4933.translation: 特别的（非普通的；与平常不同的）

4934.definition: having or involving expert knowledge of a particular area of work, study or medicine
4934.translation: 专家的，专门的（在特定领域具有或涉及专门知识技能的）

4935.definition: a person who is an expert in a particular area of work or study
4935.example: specialist in something, a specialist in Japanese history

4936.definition: to become an expert in a particular area of work, study or business; to spend more time on one area of work, etc. than on others
4936.example: Many students prefer not to specialize too soon.
4936.translation: 专门研究，专攻（成为特定领域的专家；在某方面投入更多时间）

4937.definition: designed or developed for a particular purpose or area of knowledge
4937.translation: 专门的，专业的（为特定目的或领域设计开发的）

4938.definition: a group into which animals, plants, etc. that are able to have sex with each other and produce healthy young are divided, smaller than a genus and identified by a Latin name
4938.example: a conservation area for endangered species
4938.translation: 物种（能相互交配并产生健康后代的一群生物）

4939.definition: connected with one particular thing only
4939.translation: 具体的，特定的（仅与一特定事物相关的）

4940.definition: connected with or intended for one particular thing only
4940.example: liquid vitamins specifically designed for children
4940.translation: 具体地，专门地（仅与一特定事物相关或为此设计的）

4941.definition: a detailed description of how something is, or should be, designed or made
4941.example: the technical specifications of the new model (= of car)
4941.translation: 规格，说明书（关于某物如何设计或制造的详细描述）

4942.definition: to state something, especially by giving an exact measurement, time, exact instructions, etc.
4942.example: specify something, Remember to specify your size when ordering clothes.
4942.translation: 指定，具体说明（通过给出精确度量、时间、指令等说明某事）

4943.definition: a small amount of something that shows what the rest of it is like
4943.example: Astronauts have brought back specimens of rock from the moon.
4943.translation: 标本，样本（能显示同类事物全貌的少量物质）

4944.definition: two lenses in a frame that rests on the nose and ears. People wear spectacles in order to be able to see better or to protect their eyes from bright light.
4944.translation: 眼镜（戴在鼻梁和耳朵上的矫正视力或保护眼睛的镜片）

4945.example: The coastal road has spectacular scenery.
4945.translation: 壮观的（给人留下深刻印象的）

4946.definition: a person who is watching an event, especially a sports event
4946.example: The new football stadium will hold 75 000 spectators.
4946.translation: 观众（观看活动——尤指体育赛事——的人）

4947.definition: a band of coloured lights in order of their wavelengths, as seen in a rainbow and into which light may be separated
4947.example: A spectrum is formed by a ray of light passing through a prism.
4947.translation: 光谱，光谱（按波长排列的彩色光带，如彩虹）

4948.definition: to form an opinion about something without knowing all the details or facts
4948.example: speculate (about/on/as to something), We all speculated about the reasons for her resignation.
4948.translation: 推测，猜测（在不了解所有细节的情况下形成观点）

4949.definition: the act of forming opinions about what has happened or what might happen without knowing all the facts
4949.example: His private life is the subject of much speculation.
4949.translation: 推测，投机（在不了解所有事实的情况下对已发生或可能发生之事的观点形成）

4950.definition: a formal talk that a person gives to an audience
4950.example: Several people made speeches at the wedding.
4950.translation: 演说，说话能力（向听众做的正式讲话；或说话的能力）

4951.definition: the rate at which somebody/something moves or travels
4951.translation: 速度（人或物移动或旅行的速率）

4952.example: They sped off to get help.

4953.definition: a short period of time during which something lasts
4953.example: We had a spell of warm weather in April.
4953.translation: 一段时期（某事持续的短时间）

4954.definition: to say or write the letters of a word in the correct order
4954.example: How do you spell your surname?
4954.translation: 拼写（按正确顺序说出或写出单词的字母）

4955.definition: the act of forming words correctly from individual letters; the ability to do this
4955.example: the differences between British and American spelling
4955.translation: 拼写（正确组合字母构成单词的行为；这种能力）

4956.definition: to give money to pay for goods, services, etc.
4956.example: spend something, I've spent all my money already.
4956.translation: 花费，度过（花钱购买商品服务；或度过时间）

4957.definition: the amount of money that is spent by a government, an organization or a person
4957.translation: 开支，支出（政府、组织或个人花费的金额）

4958.definition: a solid figure that is completely round, with every point on its surface at an equal distance from the centre
4958.example: The Earth is not a perfect sphere.
4958.translation: 球体，范围（表面各点离中心距离相等的立体图形；或活动范围）

4959.definition: one of the various types of powder or seed that come from plants and are used in cooking. Spices have a strong taste and smell.
4959.example: common spices such as ginger and cinnamon
4959.translation: 香料，辛香料（来自植物的、用于烹饪的带强味粉末或种子）

4960.definition: having a strong taste because spices have been added to it
4960.translation: 辛辣的（因加入香料而具有强烈味道的）

4961.definition: a small creature with eight thin legs. Many spiders spin webs to catch insects for food.
4961.translation: 蜘蛛（有八条细腿的小生物，常结网捕食）

4962.definition: to flow over the edge of a container by accident; to make liquid do this
4962.example: Water had spilled out of the bucket onto the floor.
4962.translation: 溢出，洒出（因意外从容器边缘流出；使之流出）

4963.example: Only in the last 50 years have we had clocks accurate enough to measure changes in the earth's spin.
4963.translation: 旋转，旋转（极快的转动动作）

4964.definition: to turn round and round quickly; to make something do this
4964.example: (+ adv./prep.), The plane was spinning out of control.
4964.translation: 旋转（快速地转圈；使之转动）

4965.definition: the row of small bones that are connected together down the middle of the back
4965.example: A shiver went down my spine.
4965.translation: 脊柱（背部中间连接在一起的一行小骨头）

4966.definition: the part of a person that includes their mind, feelings and character rather than their body
4966.example: You are underestimating the power of the human spirit to overcome difficulties.
4966.translation: 精神，灵魂（人的思想、情感和性格而非身体的部分）

4967.definition: connected with the human spirit, rather than the body or physical things
4967.translation: 精神的，心灵的（与人类精神而非身体或物质相关的）

4968.definition: a feeling of wanting to hurt or upset somebody
4968.example: out of spite, I'm sure he only said it out of spite.
4968.translation: 恶意，怨恨（想伤害或使人不快的感觉）

4969.definition: an argument or disagreement that divides a group of people or makes somebody separate from somebody else
4969.example: Ten years after their acrimonious split, the band has reformed.
4969.translation: 分裂，分歧（导致群体分开或个人脱离的分歧）

4970.definition: to divide, or to make something divide, into two or more parts
4970.example: split something, He was a member of the team that split the atom in 1932.
4970.translation: 分裂，分开（分成两个或多个部分；使之分开）

4971.definition: to change something good into something bad, unpleasant, etc.
4971.example: Our camping trip was spoilt by bad weather.
4971.translation: 破坏，宠坏（使好事变坏、变不快等；或溺爱孩子）

4972.definition: involving speaking rather than writing; expressed in speech rather than in writing
4972.translation: 口语的（涉及说话而非书写的；口头表达的）

4973.definition: a person who speaks for a group or an organization
4973.translation: 发言人（代表群体或组织讲话的人）

4974.definition: a person who speaks for a group or an organization
4974.translation: 发言人（代表群体或组织讲话的人）

4975.definition: a woman who speaks for a group or an organization
4975.translation: 女发言人（代表群体或组织讲话的女性）

4976.definition: a person or company that pays for a radio or television programme, or for a concert or sporting event, usually in return for advertising
4976.example: The programme is funded by a number of corporate sponsors.
4976.translation: 赞助者（为节目、活动等付费以换取广告权利的个人或公司）

4977.definition: to pay the costs of a particular event, programme, etc. as a way of advertising
4977.example: Sports events are no longer sponsored by the tobacco industry.
4977.translation: 赞助（作为广告方式为特定活动等付费）

4978.translation: 赞助，资助（来自赞助者的财务支持）

4979.definition: a tool that has a handle with a shallow bowl at the end, used for mixing, serving and eating food
4979.translation: 勺子（带柄且末端有浅碗状部的搅拌、进食工具）

4980.definition: activity that you do for pleasure and that needs physical effort or skill, usually done in a special area and according to fixed rules
4980.example: There are excellent facilities for sport and recreation.
4980.translation: 体育（为了快乐进行的、需要体力或技能的、有规则的活动）

4981.translation: 体育的（与体育运动相关的）

4982.definition: a small round area that has a different colour or feels different from the surface it is on
4982.example: Which has spots, the leopard or the tiger?
4982.translation: 斑点（颜色或感觉与周围表面不同的小圆区域）

4983.definition: to see or notice a person or thing, especially suddenly or when it is not easy to do so
4983.example: spot somebody/something, Can you spot the difference between these two pictures?
4983.translation: 发现，看出（看见或注意到某人/某事，尤指突然或在不易发现时）

4984.definition: a light with a single, very bright beam that can be directed at a particular place or person, especially a performer on the stage
4984.example: The room was lit by spotlights.
4984.translation: 聚光灯（能指向特定位置或人的单束极强光线）

4985.example: Fill in your spouse’s name here.

4986.definition: an increase in the amount or number of something that there is, or in the area that is affected by something
4986.example: measures to halt the spread of the disease
4986.translation: 传播，扩展（事物数量、范围的增加或影响区域的扩大）

4987.definition: to affect or make something affect, be known by, or be used by more and more people
