4987.example: The news had spread and was causing great excitement.
4987.translation: 传播，散布（影响越来越多的人，或被越来越多的人知晓）

4988.definition: the season between winter and summer when plants begin to grow
4988.example: The following spring, the three artists travelled to California.
4988.translation: 春天（冬夏之间植物开始生长的季节）

4989.definition: to move suddenly and with one quick movement in a particular direction
4989.example: The cat crouched ready to spring.
4989.translation: 跳跃，弹起（向特定方向突然且快速地移动）

4990.definition: a person who tries to get secret information about another country, organization or person, especially somebody who is employed by a government or the police
4990.example: He was denounced as a foreign spy.
4990.translation: 间谍（试图获取他国或组织秘密信息的人，尤指受雇于政府警察者）

4991.definition: to collect secret information about another country, organization or person
4991.example: He spied for his government for more than ten years.
4991.translation: 从事间谍活动（收集关于他国、组织或个人的秘密信息）

4992.definition: a section of a police force that deals with a particular type of crime
4992.translation: 小组，小队（警察部队中处理特定类型犯罪的部门）

4993.definition: having four straight equal sides and four angles of 90°
4993.translation: 正方形的，平方的（有四条相等直边且角为90度的）

4994.definition: a shape with four straight sides of equal length and four angles of 90°; a piece of something that has this shape
4994.example: First break the chocolate into squares.
4994.translation: 正方形，广场（有四条相等直边且角为90度的形状；广场）

4995.definition: to press something, especially with your fingers
4995.example: to squeeze a tube of toothpaste
4995.translation: 挤，捏（用力按压，尤指用手指）

4996.definition: to push a sharp, pointed object, especially a knife, into somebody, killing or injuring them
4996.example: He was stabbed to death in a racist attack.
4996.translation: 刺，戳（将锋利尖锐物——如刀——刺入人体导致伤亡）

4997.definition: the quality or state of being steady and not changing or being upset in any way (= the quality of being stable)
4997.translation: 稳定性（稳固、不改变或不被打乱的品质或状态）

4998.definition: to become or to make something become steady and unlikely to change; to make something stable
4998.translation: 稳定（变得或使之变得稳固且不易改变）

4999.definition: fixed or steady; not likely to move, change or fail
4999.example: The patient's condition is stable (= it is not getting worse).
4999.translation: 稳定的（固定的或稳固的；不易移动、改变或失败的）

5000.definition: a large sports ground surrounded by rows of seats and usually other buildings
5000.translation: 体育场（由看台环绕的大型运动场）

5001.definition: all the workers employed in an organization considered as a group
5001.translation: 全体员工（组织中雇佣的所有工作人员的总称）

5002.definition: a period or state that something/somebody passes through while developing or making progress
5002.example: at… stage, I can't make a decision at this stage.
5002.translation: 阶段（发展或进步过程中的一段时间或状态）

5003.definition: to organize and present a play or an event for people to see
5003.example: to stage a play/an event/an exhibition
5003.translation: 上演，举行（组织并呈现戏剧、活动或展览供人观看）

5004.definition: a set of steps built between two floors inside a building
5004.example: We had to carry the piano up three flights of stairs.
5004.translation: 楼梯（建筑内两层楼之间的台阶）

5005.definition: money that somebody invests in a company
5005.example: a 20 per cent stake in the business
5005.translation: 股份，赌注（在公司中投入的资金；或赌注）

5006.definition: a table or small shop with an open front that people sell things from, especially at a market
5006.example: He works on a market stall in the Square.
5006.translation: 摊位（市场上卖东西的桌子或前部开敞的小铺子）

5007.definition: a small piece of paper with a design on it that you buy and stick on an envelope or a package before you post it
5007.translation: 邮票（贴在信封或包裹上表示已付邮费的小纸片）

5008.definition: the opinions that somebody has about something and expresses publicly
5008.example: What is the newspaper's stance on the war?
5008.translation: 立场（某人对某事所持并公开表达的观点）

5009.definition: an attitude towards something or an opinion that you make clear to people
5009.example: He has avoided taking a firm stand.
5009.translation: 立场，态度（向他人明确表达的对某事的态度或观点）

5010.definition: to be on your feet; to be in a vertical position
5010.example: She was too weak to stand.
5010.translation: 站立（双脚着地，身体处于垂直位置）

5011.definition: average or normal rather than having special or unusual features
5011.example: the standard rate of tax (= paid by everyone)
5011.translation: 标准的（普通的或正常的，而非特殊的）

5012.definition: a level of quality, especially one that people think is acceptable
5012.example: There has been a fall in living standards.
5012.translation: 标准，水平（人们认为可接受的质量水平）

5013.definition: done from a position in which you are standing rather than sitting or running
5013.translation: 站立的（从站立姿势而非坐姿或跑姿进行的）

5014.definition: a large ball of burning gas in space that we see as a point of light in the sky at night
5014.example: There was a big moon and hundreds of stars were shining overhead.
5014.translation: 星星（天空中发光的恒星）

5015.definition: to have one of the main parts in a film, play, etc.
5015.example: star in something, He starred in that movie about the crazy professor.
5015.translation: 主演（在电影、戏剧中担任主角）

5016.definition: to look at somebody/something for a long time
5016.translation: 凝视（长时间盯着某人/某物看）

5017.definition: unpleasant; real, and impossible to avoid
5017.example: The author paints a stark picture of life in a prison camp.
5017.translation: 严酷的，赤裸裸的（令人不快的；真实的且无法回避的）

5018.definition: the point at which something begins
5018.example: If we don't hurry, we'll miss the start.
5018.translation: 开始，开端（某事开始的点）

5019.definition: to begin doing or using something
5019.example: start (something), I start work at nine.
5019.translation: 开始（开始做或使用某事）

5020.definition: to suffer or die because you do not have enough food to eat; to make somebody suffer or die in this way
5020.example: The animals were left to starve to death.
5020.translation: 挨饿（因食物不足而受苦或死亡；使之挨饿）

5021.definition: provided or controlled by the government of a country
5021.translation: 国家的，州的（由政府提供或控制的）

5022.definition: a country considered as an organized political community controlled by one government
5022.translation: 国家，州（作为一个有组织的政治共同体的国家或地区）

5023.definition: to formally write or say something, especially in a careful and clear way
5023.example: state something, He has already stated his intention to run for election.
5023.translation: 陈述，声明（正式地书写或说出某事，尤指仔细且清晰地）

5024.definition: something that you say or write that gives information or an opinion
5024.example: Are the following statements true or false?
5024.translation: 陈述，声明（给出信息或观点的言语或文字）

5025.definition: a place where trains stop so that passengers can get on and off; the buildings connected with this
5025.translation: 车站，站（火车停靠供乘客上下车的地方；相关建筑）

5026.definition: a collection of information shown in numbers
5026.example: Analysis of crime statistics showed high levels of violent crime within the area.
5026.translation: 统计数据（以数字显示的收集到的信息）

5027.definition: connected with or based on statistics
5027.translation: 统计的（与统计学相关的或基于统计学的）

5028.definition: a figure of a person or an animal in stone, metal, etc., usually the same size as in real life or larger
5028.translation: 雕像（由石头、金属等制成的通常与真人同大或更大的形象）

5029.definition: the legal position of a person, group or country
5029.translation: 身份，地位（个人、群体或国家在法律上的位置）

5030.definition: a period of staying; a visit
5030.example: I enjoyed my stay in Prague.
5030.translation: 停留，访问（停留的一段时间；访问）

5031.definition: to continue to be in a particular place for a period of time without moving away
5031.example: + adv./prep., Stay there and don't move!
5031.translation: 停留（继续在某处而不离开）

5032.definition: gradually and in an even and regular way
5032.example: The company's exports have been increasing steadily.
5032.translation: 稳定地（逐渐且均匀规律地）

5033.definition: developing, growing, etc. gradually and in an even and regular way
5033.example: We've had five years of steady economic growth.
5033.translation: 稳定的（逐渐且均匀规律地发展、增长的）

5034.definition: to take something from a person, shop, etc. without permission and without intending to return it or pay for it
5034.example: I'll report you to the police if I catch you stealing again.
5034.translation: 偷窃（未经许可且不打算归还或付钱地拿走他人财物）

5035.definition: the hot gas that water changes into when it boils
5035.example: Steam rose from the boiling kettle.
5035.translation: 蒸汽（水沸腾时变成的热气）

5036.definition: a strong, hard metal that is made of a mixture of iron and carbon
5036.translation: 钢，钢铁（铁和碳混合制成的坚硬强韧金属）

5037.definition: rising or falling quickly, not gradually
5037.translation: 陡峭的（上升或下降极快而非逐渐的）

5038.definition: to control the direction in which a boat, car, etc. moves
5038.example: He steered the boat into the harbour.
5038.translation: 驾驶，掌舵（控制船、车等移动的方向）

5039.definition: the main long, thin part of a plant above the ground from which the leaves or flowers grow; a smaller part that grows from this and supports flowers or leaves
5039.translation: 茎，干（植物在地上的长窄部分，叶花由此长出）

5040.definition: to stop something that is flowing from spreading or increasing
5040.example: The cut was bandaged to stem the bleeding.
5040.translation: 阻止，遏制（停止流动事物的蔓延或增加）

5041.definition: one of a series of things that you do in order to achieve something
5041.example: We are taking steps to prevent pollution.
5041.translation: 步骤，台阶（为了实现目标而采取的一系列行动之一；或台阶）

5042.definition: to lift your foot and move it in a particular direction or put it on or in something; to move a short distance
5042.translation: 迈步，跨步（举起脚向特定方向移动；或移动一短段距离）

5043.definition: a fixed idea or image that many people have of a particular type of person or thing, but which is often not true in reality and may cause hurt and offence
5043.translation: 刻板印象（许多人对某类人或物的固定看法，往往非事实且具伤害性）

5044.definition: a thin piece of wood that has fallen or been broken from a tree
5044.example: We collected dry sticks to start a fire.
5044.translation: 木棍，枝条（从树上落下或折断的细木块）

5045.definition: to fix something to something else, usually with a sticky substance; to become fixed to something in this way
5045.example: stick something + adv./prep., He stuck a stamp on the envelope.
5045.translation: 粘贴，粘住（通常用粘性物质将一物固定在另一物上；粘住）

5046.definition: made of or covered in a substance that sticks to things that touch it
5046.translation: 黏的（由粘性物质制成或覆盖其上的）

5047.example: a sheet of stiff black cardboard
5047.translation: 僵硬的（难以弯曲或移动的）

5048.example: A fallen tree floated in the still water.
5048.translation: 静止的（不移动的；平静且安静的）

5049.definition: continuing until a particular point in time and not finishing
5049.example: I am very happy that you all are still alive and well.
5049.translation: 仍然（持续到特定时间点且未结束）

5050.definition: to make something develop or become more active; to encourage something
5050.example: The exhibition has stimulated interest in her work.
5050.translation: 刺激，激励（使某事发展或变得更活跃；鼓励）

5051.definition: something that helps somebody/something to develop better or more quickly
5051.example: stimulus for something, Books provide children with ideas and a stimulus for play.
5051.translation: 刺激物（帮助某人/某事更好或更快发展的事物）

5052.definition: to move a liquid or substance around, using a spoon or something similar, in order to mix it completely
5052.example: stir something, She stirred her tea.
5052.translation: 搅拌（使用勺子等搅动液体使之完全混合）

5053.definition: a supply of goods that is available for sale in a shop
5053.example: We have a fast turnover of stock.
5053.translation: 库存（商店中可供出售的商品供应）

5054.definition: the organ inside the body where food goes when you eat it
5054.translation: 胃（进食后食物进入的体内器官）

5055.definition: a hard solid mineral substance that is found in the ground, often used for building
5055.example: Most of the houses are built of stone.
5055.translation: 石头（在地下发现的坚硬固体矿物质，常用于建筑）

5056.definition: a place where a bus or train stops regularly for passengers to get on or off
5056.example: I get off at the next stop.
5056.translation: 站，车站（公交、火车定期停靠供乘客上下车的地方）

5057.definition: to no longer move; to make somebody/something no longer move
5057.example: The car stopped at the traffic lights.
5057.translation: 停止，停止（不再移动；使人/物不再移动）

5058.definition: the process of keeping something in a particular place until it is needed; the space where things can be kept
5058.example: tables that fold flat for storage
5058.translation: 储存（将某物存放在特定地方直至需要的行为；储存空间）

5059.definition: a large shop that sells many different types of goods
5059.example: It's available at London's three biggest stores.
5059.translation: 商店（出售多种不同商品的大型商店）

5060.definition: to put something somewhere and keep it there to use later
5060.example: store something, We do not have adequate space to store these documents.
5060.translation: 储存（将某物放在某处保留以备后用）

5061.definition: very bad weather with strong winds and rain, and often thunder and lightning
5061.translation: 暴风雨（伴有强风和雨、常有雷电的恶劣天气）

5062.definition: a description of events and people that the writer or speaker has invented in order to entertain people
5062.translation: 故事（为了娱乐而虚构的事件和人物描述）

5063.definition: without a bend or curve; going in one direction only
5063.translation: 直的（无弯曲的；仅朝一个方向的）

5064.definition: not in a curve or at an angle; in a straight line
5064.example: Keep straight on for two miles.
5064.translation: 直地（不弯曲地；成直线地）

5065.definition: easy to do or to understand; not complicated
5065.translation: 简单的，直接的（易于执行或理解的；不复杂的）

5066.definition: pressure on a system or relationship because great demands are being placed on it
5066.example: The transport service cannot cope with the strain of so many additional passengers.
5066.translation: 压力，负担（由于巨大需求对系统或关系产生的压力）

5067.definition: a single thin piece of thread, wire, hair, etc.
5067.example: He pulled at a loose strand of wool in his sweater.
5067.translation: 股，缕（单根细长的线、丝、头发等）

5068.definition: unusual or surprising, especially in a way that is difficult to understand
5068.example: A strange thing happened this morning.
5068.translation: 奇怪的（不寻常或令人惊讶的，尤指难以理解的）

5069.definition: a person that you do not know
5069.example: There was a complete stranger sitting at my desk.

5070.definition: done as part of a plan that is meant to achieve a particular purpose or to gain an advantage
5070.translation: 战略性的（作为旨在实现特定目的或获取优势的计划一部分而进行的）

5071.definition: a plan that is intended to achieve a particular purpose
5071.translation: 战略，策略（旨在实现特定目的的计划）

5073.definition: a public road in a city or town that has houses and buildings on one side or both sides
5073.example: along/down/up the street, I was just walking along the street when it happened.
5073.translation: 街道（城市或城镇中一侧或两侧有建筑的公共道路）

5074.definition: the quality of being physically strong
5074.example: He pushed against the rock with all his strength.
5074.translation: 力量，强度（身体强健的品质）

5075.definition: to become more powerful or effective; to make somebody/something more powerful or effective
5075.example: Her position in the party has strengthened in recent weeks.
5075.translation: 加强，增强（变得或使某人/某事更有力或更有效）

5076.definition: pressure or worry caused by problems in somebody’s life or by having too much to do
5076.translation: 压力，紧张（因生活问题或事务过多导致的压力或忧虑）

5077.definition: to give extra force to a word or syllable when saying it
5077.example: You stress the first syllable in ‘happiness’.
5077.translation: 重读，强调（说话时对单词或音节加重语气）

5078.definition: an area of land or water, especially a long one
5078.example: a particularly dangerous stretch of road
5078.translation: 一段，一段距离（长条状的陆地或水域，尤指长的一段）

5079.definition: to make something longer, wider or looser, for example by pulling it; to become longer, etc. in this way
5079.example: Is there any way of stretching shoes?
5079.translation: 拉伸，延伸（通过拉动使之变长、变宽或变松；以此方式变长）

5080.translation: 严格的（必须被精确遵守的）

5081.definition: with a lot of control and rules that must be obeyed
5081.example: She was brought up very strictly.
5081.translation: 严格地（带着大量的控制和必须遵守的规则）

5082.definition: a period of time when an organized group of employees of a company stops working because of an argument over pay or conditions
5082.translation: 罢工（因薪酬等争议而组织的集体停止工作的行为）

5083.definition: to hit somebody/something hard or with force
5083.example: strike somebody/something, The ship struck a rock.
5083.translation: 打击，撞击（有力地击打某人/某物）

5084.definition: interesting and unusual enough to attract attention
5084.translation: 显著的，引人注目的（足够有趣或不寻常以吸引注意力的）

5085.definition: long, thin material used for tying things together, made of several threads that have been twisted together; a piece of string used to fasten or pull something or keep something in place
5085.translation: 线，绳（用于捆绑的细长材料，由多股纤维拧成）

5086.definition: a long narrow piece of paper, metal, cloth, etc.
5086.translation: 条，带（纸、金属、布等制成的长窄片）

5087.definition: to take off all or most of your clothes or another person’s clothes
5087.example: I stripped and washed myself all over.
5087.translation: 脱掉（脱掉自己或他人的全部或大部分衣服）

5088.definition: to try very hard to achieve something
5088.example: strive for something, We encourage all members to strive for the highest standards.
5088.translation: 努力，奋斗（非常努力地去实现某事）

5089.definition: an act of hitting a ball, for example with a bat or racket
5089.translation: 击球（用球棒或球拍击球的动作）

5090.definition: having a lot of physical power so that you can lift heavy weights, do hard physical work, etc.
5090.example: He's strong enough to lift a car!
5090.translation: 强壮的（具有很强体力，能举重物或干重活的）

5091.definition: in a way that shows definite and serious opinions or beliefs
5091.translation: 强烈地（以展示明确且严肃观点或信念的方式）

5092.definition: connected with the way in which something is built or organized
5092.example: Storms have caused structural damage to hundreds of homes.
5092.translation: 结构上的（与建筑或组织的构建方式相关的）

5093.definition: the way in which the parts of something are connected together, arranged or organized; a particular arrangement of parts
5093.translation: 结构（事物各部分连接、排列或组织的方式；特定的排列）

5094.definition: to arrange or organize something into a system or pattern
5094.example: structure something, How well does the teacher structure the lessons?
5094.translation: 组织，构建（将某事按体系或模式排列组织）

5095.definition: a hard fight in which people try to obtain or achieve something, especially something that somebody else does not want them to have
5095.example: Marx wrote about the class struggle.
5095.translation: 斗争（为了获得某物而进行的艰苦战斗，尤指他人阻挠时）

5096.definition: to try very hard to do something when it is difficult or when there are a lot of problems
5096.example: life as a struggling artist (= one who is very poor)
5096.translation: 奋斗（在困难或问题重重时非常努力地去做某事）

5097.definition: a person who is studying at a university or college
5097.translation: 学生（在大学或学院学习的人）

5098.definition: a room where radio or television programmes are recorded and broadcast from, or where music is recorded
5098.translation: 工作室，演播室（录制播放节目或录制音乐的房间）

5099.definition: the activity of learning or gaining knowledge, either from books or by examining things in the world
5099.example: a room set aside for private study
5099.translation: 研究，学习（通过读书或观察世界来学习或获取知识的活动）

5100.definition: to spend time learning about a subject by reading, going to college, etc.
5100.example: He sat up very late that night, studying.
5100.translation: 学习，研究（花时间通过读书、上大学等了解某一学科）

5101.definition: used to refer to a substance, material, group of objects, etc. when you do not know the name, when the name is not important or when it is obvious what you are talking about
5101.example: What's all that sticky stuff on the carpet?
5101.translation: 东西，物品（用于指代不具名或名字不重要的物质、材料或物体）

5102.definition: to fill a space or container tightly with something
5102.example: stuff A with B, She had 500 envelopes to stuff with leaflets.
5102.translation: 填充，塞进（将某物紧紧填满空间或容器）

5103.definition: to hit your foot against something while you are walking or running and almost fall
5103.translation: 绊，踉跄（在走或跑时脚碰到某物几乎摔倒）

5104.definition: to make a person or an animal unconscious for a short time, especially by hitting them on the head
5104.example: The fall stunned me for a moment.
5104.translation: 使昏迷，打晕（使人或动物短时间失去知觉，尤指击打头部）

5105.translation: 极漂亮的，极好的（极具吸引力或令人印象深刻的）

5106.definition: showing a lack of thought or good judgement
5106.translation: 愚蠢的（表现出缺乏思考或良好判断的）

5107.definition: the particular way in which something is done
5107.example: a wide range of musical styles
5107.translation: 风格，方式（做某事的特定方式）

5108.definition: likely to be affected by something, especially something bad
5108.example: At this stage these are proposals and are still subject to change.
5108.translation: 受制于，易受影响的（很可能受某事影响的，尤指坏事）

5109.definition: a thing or person that is being discussed, described or dealt with
5109.example: subject of something, Walker's work has been the subject of much debate.
5109.translation: 主题，题目（正在讨论、描述或处理的事物或人）

5110.definition: the act of accepting that somebody has defeated you and that you must obey them
5110.translation: 屈服，投降（接受某人已击败你且必须服从其的行为）

5111.definition: to give a document, proposal, etc. to somebody in authority so that they can study or consider it
5111.example: submit something, to submit an application/a claim/a proposal
5111.translation: 提交，递交（将文件、建议等交给权力机构以便其研究或考虑）

5112.definition: a person who pays money, usually once a year, to receive regular copies of a magazine or newspaper or have access to it online
5112.translation: 订阅者，用户（定期付钱以接收杂志、报纸或使用在线服务的人）

5113.definition: an amount of money that you pay regularly to receive a service, be a member of a club, support a charity or receive regular copies of a newspaper or magazine; the act of paying this money
5113.translation: 订阅，会员费（为了获取服务、成为会员或接收报刊定期支付的款项）

5114.definition: happening or coming after something else
5114.translation: 随后的，后来的（发生在某事之后或随之而来的）

5115.definition: afterwards; later; after something else has happened
5115.example: The original interview notes were subsequently lost.
5115.translation: 随后，后来（在某事发生之后）

5116.definition: money that is paid by a government or an organization to reduce the costs of services or of producing goods so that their prices can be kept low
5116.translation: 补贴，补助金（政府或组织为降低服务或商品生产成本而支付的钱）

5117.definition: a type of solid, liquid or gas that has particular qualities
5117.translation: 物质（具有特定性质的固体、液体或气体）

5118.definition: large in amount, value or importance
5118.translation: 大量的，实质性的（在数量、价值或重要性上很大的）

5119.translation: 显著地，基本上（非常多地；很大程度上）

5120.definition: a person or thing that you use or have instead of the one you normally use or have
5120.translation: 替代品，代用品（用于替代通常使用的人或物的人或物）

5121.definition: to take the place of somebody/something else; to use somebody/something instead of somebody/something else
5121.example: substitute for somebody/something, Nothing can substitute for the advice your doctor is able to give you.
5121.translation: 替代（取代他人/他物的位置；使用他人/他物作为替代）

5122.definition: an act of using one person or thing in the place of another
5122.example: Two substitutions were made during the game.
5122.translation: 替换，换人（用一人或一物代替另一人的行为；或换下场）

5123.definition: not very obvious or easy to notice
5123.translation: 微妙的，精细的（不明显的或不易察觉的）

5124.definition: an area where people live that is outside the centre of a city
5124.translation: 郊区（城市中心以外的居住区域）

5125.definition: in or connected with a suburb
5125.translation: 郊区的（在郊区的或与郊区相关的）

5126.definition: to achieve something that you have been trying to do or get; to have the result or effect that was intended
5126.translation: 成功（实现一直在尝试做或获得的事；产生预期的结果）

5127.definition: the fact that you have achieved something that you want and have been trying to do or get
5127.example: The company has achieved considerable success in this market.
5127.translation: 成功（实现想要或一直在尝试的事实）

5128.definition: achieving your aims or what was intended
5128.translation: 成功的（实现目标的或达到预期效果的）

5129.definition: in a way that achieves your aims or what was intended
5129.example: She had already successfully completed these courses.
5129.translation: 成功地（以实现目标或达到预期效果的方式）

5130.definition: a number of people or things that follow each other in time or order
5130.translation: 接替，连续（在时间或顺序上相互接续的一系列人或物）

5131.definition: following immediately one after the other
5131.example: This was their fourth successive win.
5131.translation: 连续的（一个接一个紧接着发生的）

5132.definition: a person or thing that comes after somebody/something else and takes their/its place
5132.example: Who's the likely successor to him as party leader?
5132.translation: 继承者，接替者（在他人之后接替其位置或职位的人或物）

5133.definition: used to emphasize the great degree of something
5133.example: This issue was of such importance that we could not afford to ignore it.
5133.translation: 如此的，那样的（用于强调某事物的程度极大）

5134.definition: used to emphasize the great degree of something
5134.example: This issue was of such importance that we could not afford to ignore it.
5134.translation: 如此的，那样的（用于强调某事物的程度极大）

5135.definition: to take liquid, air, etc. into your mouth by using the muscles of your lips
5135.example: to suck the juice from an orange
5135.translation: 吸，吮（利用唇部肌肉将液体、空气等吸入口中）

5136.definition: happening or done quickly and unexpectedly
5136.example: News of his sudden and unexpected death came as a great shock.
5136.translation: 突然的（快速且出乎意料发生的）

5137.example: I suddenly realized what I had to do.
5137.translation: 突然地（快速且出乎意料地）

5138.definition: to make a claim against a person or an organization in court about something that they have said or done to harm you
5138.example: They threatened to sue if the work was not completed.
5138.translation: 起诉，控告（在法庭上对个人或组织提出索赔，因其言行造成伤害）

5139.definition: to be badly affected by a disease, pain, sad feelings, a lack of something, etc.
5139.example: I hate to see animals suffering.
5139.translation: 受苦，遭受（受疾病、疼痛、悲伤或匮乏的严重影响）

5140.example: Death finally brought an end to her suffering.
5140.translation: 痛苦，苦难（身体或精神上的疼痛）

5141.definition: enough for a particular purpose; as much as you need
5141.example: Allow sufficient time to get there.
5141.translation: 足够的，充足的（对特定目的而言够用的；达到你所需的）

5142.definition: enough for a particular purpose; as much as you need
5142.example: The following day she felt sufficiently well to go to work.
5142.translation: 足够地，充分地（对特定目的而言够用地）

5143.definition: a sweet substance, often in the form of white or brown crystals, made from the juices of various plants, used in cooking or to make tea, coffee, etc. sweeter
5143.example: Do you take sugar (= have it in your tea, coffee, etc.)?
5143.translation: 糖（从植物汁液中提取的甜味物质，常为白色或棕色结晶，用于调味）

5144.definition: to put forward an idea or a plan for other people to think about
5144.example: suggest something, I'd like to suggest a different explanation for the company's decline.
5144.translation: 建议，提议（提出想法或计划供他人考虑）

5145.definition: an idea or a plan that you mention for somebody else to think about
5145.translation: 建议，提议（提及供他人考虑的想法或计划）

5146.definition: the act of killing yourself deliberately
5146.translation: 自杀（故意杀死自己的行为）

5147.definition: a set of clothes made of the same cloth, including a jacket and trousers or a skirt
5147.example: She was wearing a grey business suit.
5147.translation: 套装，西装（由相同布料制成的一套衣服，包括上衣和长裤/裙子）

5148.definition: to be convenient or useful for somebody
5148.example: suit somebody/something, If we met at two, would that suit you?
5148.translation: 适合，相配（对某人方便或有用）

5149.definition: right or appropriate for a particular purpose or occasion
5149.translation: 合适的（对特定目的或场合而言正确或恰当的）

5150.definition: a set of rooms, especially in a hotel
5150.translation: 套房，套间（一组房间，尤指旅馆中的）

5151.example: You will be fined the sum of £200.
5151.translation: 金额，总数（一笔钱的数额）

5153.definition: to give a summary of something
5153.example: This essay briefly summarizes some of our approaches.
5153.translation: 总结，概括（给出某事的简短摘要）

5154.definition: a short statement that gives only the main points of something, not the details
5154.translation: 总结，摘要（给出某事要点而非细节的简短陈述）

5155.definition: the warmest season of the year, coming between spring and autumn
5155.example: in the summer, We're going away in the summer.
5155.translation: 夏天，夏季（一年中最暖的季节，在春秋之间）

5156.definition: the highest point of something, especially the top of a mountain
5156.example: We reached the summit at noon.
5156.translation: 顶点，巅峰（某事物的最高点，尤指山顶）

5157.definition: the star that shines in the sky during the day and gives the earth heat and light
5157.example: The sun was shining and birds were singing.
5157.translation: 太阳（白天在天空中发光、为地球提供热和光的恒星）

5158.definition: the day of the week after Saturday and before Monday, thought of as either the first or the last day of the week
5158.translation: 星期日（周六之后、周一之前的一天，被视为一周的第一天或最后一天）

5160.translation: 精湛的，极好的（优秀的；质量非常好的）

5161.definition: better in quality than somebody/something else; greater than somebody/something else
5161.translation: 优越的，较好的（在质量上比他人/他物更好；更伟大的）

5162.definition: a large shop that sells food, drinks and goods used in the home. People choose what they want from the shelves and pay for it as they leave.
5162.example: I only shop at this supermarket.
5162.translation: 超市（出售食品、饮料和家居用品的大型商店，顾客自选后结账）

5163.definition: to be in charge of somebody/something and make sure that everything is done correctly, safely, etc.
5163.translation: 监督，指导（负责某人/某事并确保工作正确、安全地进行）

5164.definition: the work or activity involved in being in charge of somebody/something and making sure that everything is done correctly, safely, etc.
5164.example: Very young children should not be left to play without supervision.
5164.translation: 监督，管理（负责某人/某事并确保工作正确、安全进行的活动）

5165.example: I have a meeting with my supervisor about my research topic.
5165.translation: 监督者，主管（监督某人/某事的人）

5166.definition: a thing that is added to something else to improve or complete it
5166.example: vitamin/dietary supplements (= vitamins and other foods eaten in addition to what you usually eat)
5166.translation: 补充，补充物（为了改进或完成某事而添加的东西，如维生素补充剂）

5167.definition: to add something to something in order to improve it or make it more complete
5167.example: supplement something with something, a diet supplemented with vitamin pills
5167.translation: 补充，增补（向某物添加东西使其更完善或更完整）

5168.definition: an amount of something that is provided or available to be used
5168.example: Advances in agriculture increased the food supply.
5168.translation: 供应，供应量（提供或可供使用的某物的数量）

5169.definition: to provide somebody/something with something that they need or want, especially in large quantities
5169.example: supply something to somebody/something, The company supplied sports equipment to schools.
5169.translation: 供应，提供（向某人提供其所需或所欲之物，尤指大量提供）

5170.definition: approval that you give to somebody/something because you want them to be successful
5170.example: support for something, There is strong public support for the policy.
5170.translation: 支持，拥护（因希望某人成功而给予的认可或帮助）

5171.definition: to help or encourage somebody/something by saying or showing that you agree with them/it
5171.example: support somebody/something, to support an idea/a view
5171.translation: 支持，拥护（通过言行展示你同意某人/某事，从而给予帮助或鼓励）

5172.definition: a person who supports a political party, an idea, etc.
5172.translation: 支持者，拥护者（支持政党、想法等的人）

5173.definition: encouraging somebody or giving them help or sympathy
5173.translation: 给予支持的（给予他人鼓励、帮助或同情的）

5174.definition: to think or believe that something is true or possible (based on the knowledge that you have)
5174.example: Getting a visa isn't as simple as you might suppose.
5174.translation: 假设，猜想（基于已知知识认为某事属实或可能）

5175.definition: according to what is generally thought or believed but not known for certain
5175.example: The novel is supposedly based on a true story.
5175.translation: 据推测（根据普遍认为但非确知的事实）

5176.definition: to put an end, often by force, to a group or an activity that is believed to threaten authority
5176.translation: 镇压，压制（通过武力结束被认为威胁权威的群体或活动）

5177.example: the Supreme Commander of the armed forces
5177.translation: 至高无上的（职级或地位最高的）

5178.definition: confident that you know something or that you are right
5178.example: ‘Is that John over there?’ ‘I'm not sure’.
5178.translation: 确定的（确信自己知道某事或自己是正确的）

5179.example: ‘Will you get me my coat?’ ‘Sure, where is it?’

5180.definition: used to show that you are almost certain of what you are saying and want other people to agree with you
5180.example: Surely we should do something about it?
5180.translation: 想必，确定（用于表示你几乎确信所言并希望他人同意）

5181.definition: the outside or top layer of something
5181.example: We need a flat, smooth surface to play the game on.
5181.translation: 表面（事物的外部或顶层）

5182.definition: a sudden increase of a strong feeling
5182.example: She felt a sudden surge of anger.
5182.translation: 激增，涌动（强烈情感的突然增加）

5183.definition: to move quickly and with force in a particular direction
5183.example: The gates opened and the crowd surged forward.
5183.translation: 激增，冲（向特定方向快速且有力地移动）

5184.definition: a doctor who is trained to perform surgery (= medical operations that involve cutting open a person’s body)
5184.translation: 外科医生（受过执行手术培训的医生）

5185.definition: medical treatment of injuries or diseases that involves cutting open a person’s body and often removing or replacing some parts; the branch of medicine connected with this treatment
5185.translation: 外科手术（通过切开人体来移除或修复部位的医疗手段；外科学）

5186.definition: used in or connected with surgery
5186.translation: 外科的（用于手术或与手术相关的）

5187.definition: an amount that is extra or more than you need
5187.translation: 剩余，盈余（多于所需的数额）

5188.definition: an event, a piece of news, etc. that is unexpected or that happens suddenly
5188.translation: 惊喜，惊讶（出乎意料或突然发生的事件、消息等）

5189.example: surprise somebody, It wouldn't surprise me if they got married soon.
5189.translation: 使惊讶（使某人感到惊讶）

5190.translation: 惊讶的（感到或表现出惊讶的）

5191.translation: 令人惊讶的（引起惊讶的）

5192.definition: to admit that you have been defeated and want to stop fighting; to allow yourself to be caught, taken prisoner, etc.
5192.example: The rebel soldiers were forced to surrender.
5192.translation: 投降（承认被击败并停止战斗；让自己被抓获）

5193.example: surround something/somebody, Tall trees surround the lake.
5193.translation: 包围，环绕（在某人/某物周围）

5194.definition: that is near or around something
5194.translation: 周围的（在某物附近或周围的）

5195.definition: the act of carefully watching a person suspected of a crime or a place where a crime may be committed
5195.example: The police are keeping the suspects under constant surveillance.
5195.translation: 监视，监控（对疑似罪犯或犯罪地点进行的仔细观察）

5196.definition: an investigation of the opinions, behaviour, etc. of a particular group of people, which is usually done by asking them questions
5196.example: A recent survey showed 75 per cent of those questioned were in favour of the plan.
5196.translation: 调查，民意调查（对特定人群意见、行为等的调查，通常通过提问进行）

5197.definition: to look carefully at the whole of something, especially in order to get a general impression of it
5197.example: The next morning we surveyed the damage caused by the fire.
5197.translation: 调查，勘测（仔细查看某物的整体，尤指为了获得总体印象）

5198.definition: the state of continuing to live or exist, often despite difficulty or danger
5198.translation: 生存，幸存（继续活着或存在状态，尤指在困难危险中）

5199.definition: to continue to live or exist
5199.example: She was the last surviving member of the family.
5199.translation: 生存，幸存（继续活着或存在）

5200.definition: a person who continues to live, especially despite being nearly killed or experiencing great danger or difficulty
5200.example: the sole/only survivor of the massacre
5200.translation: 幸存者（在经历危险或几乎丧命后继续活着的人）

5201.definition: a person who is suspected of a crime or of having done something wrong
5201.translation: 嫌疑人（被怀疑犯罪或做错事的人）

5202.definition: to have an idea that something is probably true or likely to happen, especially something bad, but without having definite proof
5202.example: As I had suspected all along, he was not a real policeman.
5202.translation: 怀疑（认为某事可能是真实的，尤指坏事，但无确凿证据）

5203.definition: to hang something from something else
5203.example: be suspended from something, A lamp was suspended from the ceiling.
5203.translation: 悬挂（将一物吊在另一物上）

5204.definition: the act of officially removing somebody from their job, school, team, etc. for a period of time, usually as a punishment
5204.translation: 停职，停学（正式暂时剥夺某人的工作、学业或参赛资格，通常作为惩罚）

5205.definition: a feeling that somebody has done something wrong, illegal or dishonest, even though you have no proof
5205.example: They drove away slowly to avoid arousing suspicion.
5205.translation: 怀疑（认为某人做了错事、违法或不诚实的感觉，即使无证据）

5206.definition: feeling that somebody has done something wrong, illegal or dishonest, without having any proof
5206.example: They became suspicious of his behaviour and contacted the police.
5206.translation: 怀疑的，可疑的（认为某人做了错事、违法或不诚实的，即使无证据）

5207.definition: to provide enough of what somebody/something needs in order to live or exist
5207.translation: 维持，支撑（提供足够的生存或存在所需之物）

5208.definition: involving the use of natural products and energy in a way that does not harm the environment
5208.translation: 可持续的（以不损害环境的方式使用自然产品和能源的）

5209.definition: to make food, drink, etc. go down your throat into your stomach
5209.example: swallow (something), Always chew food well before swallowing it.
5209.translation: 吞咽（使食物、饮料等从喉咙进入胃部）

5210.definition: to use rude or offensive language, usually because you are angry
5210.example: She fell over and swore loudly.
5210.translation: 咒骂，发誓（使用粗鲁冒犯的语言，通常因愤怒）

5211.definition: a piece of clothing for the upper part of the body, made of wool or cotton, with long sleeves
5211.example: She wore jeans and a sweater.
5211.translation: 毛衣（羊毛或棉制的长袖上衣）

5212.definition: to clean a room, surface, etc. using a broom (= a type of brush on a long handle)
5212.translation: 扫，清扫（使用扫帚清洁房间、表面等）

5213.definition: containing, or tasting as if it contains, a lot of sugar
5213.example: a cup of hot sweet tea
5213.translation: 甜的（含有大量糖分或尝起来有甜味的）

5214.definition: a small piece of sweet food, usually made with sugar and/or chocolate and eaten between meals
5214.translation: 糖果（糖或巧克力制成的小块甜食，常在两餐间吃）

5215.definition: a period of time during which you swim

5216.definition: to move through water by moving your arms and legs, without touching the bottom
5216.translation: 游泳（在水中移动手臂和腿部行进，不接触底部）

5217.definition: the sport or activity of swimming
5217.example: Swimming is a good form of exercise.

5218.example: He took a wild swing at the ball.
5218.translation: 秋千，摆动（摆动的动作或节奏）

5219.definition: to move backwards or forwards or from side to side while hanging from a fixed point; to make something do this
5219.example: His arms swung as he walked.
5219.translation: 摆动，摇摆（悬挂在固定点前后或左右移动；使之摆动）

5220.definition: a small device that you press or move up and down in order to turn a light or piece of electrical equipment on and off
5220.translation: 开关（控制电灯或设备通断的小装置）

5221.definition: to change or make something change from one thing to another
5221.example: switch (over) to something, We're in the process of switching over to a new system of invoicing.
5221.translation: 切换，转换（从一物改变或使之改变为另一物）

5222.definition: a weapon with a long metal blade (= sharp cutting part) and a handle
5222.example: to draw/sheathe a sword (= to take it out of/put it into its cover)
5222.translation: 剑（带长金属刃和柄的武器）

5223.definition: a person, an object, an event, etc. that represents a more general quality or situation
5223.example: The vase is decorated with religious symbols.
5223.translation: 象征，符号（代表更广泛特质或情况的人、物或事件）

5224.definition: containing symbols, or being used as a symbol
5224.example: He shook his fist in a symbolic gesture of defiance.
5224.translation: 象征性的（包含象征的或作为象征使用的）

5225.definition: kind to somebody who is hurt or sad; showing that you understand and care about their problems
5225.translation: 同情的，体谅的（对受难者友好的；表现出理解其问题的）

5226.definition: the feeling of being sorry for somebody; showing that you understand and care about somebody’s problems
5226.example: sympathy for somebody, to express/feel sympathy for somebody
5226.translation: 同情（对他人的不幸感到难过；理解并关心他人的问题）

5227.definition: a change in your body or mind that shows that you are not healthy
5227.example: Symptoms include a headache and sore throat.
5227.translation: 症状（表明身体或精神不健康的改变）

5228.definition: a set of physical conditions that show you have a particular disease or medical problem
5228.translation: 综合征，综合症（表明患有特定疾病的一组身体状况）

5229.definition: the act of combining separate ideas, beliefs, styles, etc.; a mixture or combination of ideas, beliefs, styles, etc.
5229.example: synthesis of A with B, the synthesis of art with everyday life
5229.translation: 综合，合成（将不同的主意、信念、风格等结合的行为；其结合体）

5230.definition: an organized set of ideas or theories or a particular way of doing something
5230.example: reform of the country's education system
5230.translation: 系统，体制（一套有组织的思想理论或特定的做事方式）

5231.definition: done according to a system or plan, in a complete, efficient or determined way
5231.example: a systematic approach to solving the problem
5231.translation: 系统化的，有计划的（按照系统或计划以彻底高效的方式进行的）

5232.definition: an informal shirt, usually with short sleeves (= arms) no collar or buttons, or just a few buttons at the top
5232.example: He was wearing a faded pair of blue jeans and an old T-shirt.
5232.translation: T恤（非正式的短袖上衣，通常无领无扣）

5233.definition: a piece of furniture that consists of a flat top supported by legs
5233.example: at a/the table, We sat at a round table in the corner.
5233.translation: 桌子（由支脚支撑的平整台面的家具）

5234.definition: a small computer that is easy to carry, with a large touch screen and usually without a physical keyboard
5234.example: The company has launched its latest 10-inch tablet.
5234.translation: 平板电脑（带大触摸屏、通常无物理键盘的易携带小型电脑）

5235.definition: an act of trying to take the ball from an opponent in football (soccer), hockey, etc.; an act of knocking somebody to the ground, for example in rugby or American football
5235.example: He was booked for a late tackle on Torres.
5235.translation: 抢断，铲球（在足球等运动中尝试抢球；或在橄榄球中将人撞倒）

5236.definition: to make a determined effort to deal with a difficult problem or situation
5236.example: The government is determined to tackle inflation.
5236.translation: 处理，解决（下定决心处理困难问题或局面）

5237.definition: the particular method you use to achieve something
5237.example: They tried all kinds of tactics to get us to go.
5237.translation: 策略，战术（为实现目标而采取的特定方法）

5238.definition: connected with the particular method you use to achieve something
5238.translation: 战术的（与实现目标所采取的特定方法相关的）

5239.definition: a small piece of paper, cloth, plastic, etc. attached to something to identify it or give information about it
5239.example: He put name tags on all his shirts.
5239.translation: 标签（贴在物体上用于识别或提供信息的小纸、布或塑料片）

5240.definition: to fasten a tag onto something/somebody
5240.example: Each animal was tagged with a number for identification.
5240.translation: 给...贴标签（将标签固定在某物/某人上）

5241.definition: the part that sticks out at the back of the body of a bird, an animal or a fish, which the animal can move from side to side or up and down
5241.example: The dog ran up, wagging its tail.
5241.translation: 尾巴（动物、鸟或鱼身体后部伸出的部分，可移动）

5242.definition: to carry or move something from one place to another
5242.example: take something, Remember to take your coat when you leave.
5242.translation: 拿，带（将某物从一处携带或移动到另一处）

5243.definition: a story created using the imagination, especially one that is full of action and adventure
5243.translation: 故事，传说（虚构的、常充满动作和冒险的故事）

5244.definition: a natural ability to do something well
5244.example: The festival showcases the talent of young musicians.
5244.translation: 天赋，才能（做好某事的自然能力）

5245.definition: having a natural ability to do something well
5245.translation: 有天赋的（具备做好某事的自然能力的）

5246.definition: a speech or lecture on a particular subject
5246.example: I went to several interesting talks at the conference.
5246.translation: 谈话，讲座（就特定主题进行的演说或讲课）

5247.definition: to say things; to speak in order to give information or to express feelings, ideas, etc.
5247.translation: 说话，交谈（为了给出信息或表达情感、主意而说话）

5248.definition: having a greater than average height
5248.translation: 高的（高度超过平均水平的）

5249.definition: a large container for holding liquid or gas
5249.translation: 罐，箱（盛放液体或气体的大型容器，如油箱、水箱）

5250.definition: a device for controlling the flow of water from a pipe into a bath or sink
5250.translation: 水龙头（控制管道中流向浴缸或水槽的水流的装置）

5251.definition: to hit somebody/something quickly and lightly
5251.example: tap (away) (at something), Someone tapped at the door.
5251.translation: 敲，拍（快速轻微地击打某人/某物）

5252.definition: a long, narrow piece of material with a sticky substance on one side that is used for sticking things together
5252.translation: 胶带（一侧带粘性物质、用于粘贴物品的长条材料）

5253.definition: a result that you try to achieve

5254.definition: to aim an attack or a criticism at somebody/something
5254.example: target somebody/something, He accused the group of deliberately targeting civilians.
5254.translation: 瞄准，针对（将攻击或批评针对某人/某物）

5255.definition: a piece of work that somebody has to do, especially a hard or unpleasant one
5255.translation: 任务（某人必须完成的工作，尤指艰巨或不快的）

5256.definition: the particular quality that different foods and drinks have that allows you to recognize them when you put them in your mouth
5256.translation: 味道（食物和饮料进入口中时让你辨别它们的特质）

5257.translation: 尝起来（具有某种特定的味道）

5258.definition: money that you have to pay to the government so that it can pay for public services. People pay tax according to their income and businesses pay tax according to their profits. Tax is also often paid on goods and services.
5258.translation: 税，税收（付给政府以支持公共服务的钱，根据收入、利润或商品支付）

5259.definition: to put a tax on somebody/something; to make somebody pay tax
5259.example: tax somebody/something, His declared aim was to tax the rich.
5259.translation: 向...征税（对某人/某物征税；使之交税）

5260.definition: a car with a driver that you pay to take you somewhere. Taxis usually have meters that show how much money you have to pay.
5260.example: We took a taxi to the airport.
5260.translation: 出租车（你付钱让司机送你去某处的汽车，通常带计价器）

5261.definition: a person who pays tax to the government, especially on the money that they earn
5261.example: Hundreds of thousands of pounds of taxpayers' money (= money paid in taxes) have been spent on the project.
5261.translation: 纳税人（向政府交税的人，尤指根据收入交税者）

5262.definition: the dried leaves (called tea leaves) of the tea bush
5262.translation: 茶，茶叶（茶树干燥后的叶子）

5263.definition: to give lessons to students in a school, college, university, etc.; to help somebody learn something by giving information about it
5263.example: She teaches at our local school.
5263.translation: 教，教学（在学校、大学等给学生讲课；或通过提供信息帮助他人学习）

5264.definition: a person whose job is teaching, especially in a school
5264.translation: 教师（以教学为职业的人，尤指在学校中）

5265.example: She wants to go into teaching (= make it a career).

5266.definition: a group of people who play a particular game or sport against another group of people
5266.translation: 团队，队（在游戏或运动中与另一组对抗的一群人）

5267.definition: a hole that has been made in something by tearing
5267.example: This sheet has a tear in it.
5267.translation: 裂缝，撕痕（因撕扯而在某物上形成的孔洞）

5268.definition: to damage something by pulling it apart or into pieces or by cutting it on something sharp; to become damaged in this way
5268.example: tear something + adv./prep., I tore my jeans on the fence.
5268.translation: 撕，撕碎（通过用力拉扯或被尖锐物划破使某物受损）

5269.definition: connected with the practical use of machines, methods, etc. in science and industry
5269.example: We offer free technical support for those buying our software.
5269.translation: 技术的，技术上的（与科学和工业中机器、方法的实际使用相关的）

5270.definition: a particular way of doing something, especially one in which you have to learn special skills
5270.translation: 技术，技能（做某事的特定方式，尤指需学习专门技能者）

5271.translation: 科技的（与科学技术相关的）

5272.definition: scientific knowledge used in practical ways in industry, for example in designing new machines
5272.translation: 科技，技术（在工业中实际使用的科学知识，如设计新机器）

5273.definition: between 13 and 19 years old; connected with people of this age
5273.translation: 青少年的（13至19岁之间的；与此年龄段人群相关的）

5274.definition: a person who is between 13 and 19 years old

5275.definition: the years of a person’s life when they are between 13 and 19 years old
5275.example: in your teens, She began writing poetry in her teens.
5275.translation: 青少年时期（一个人13至19岁之间的那段岁月）

5276.definition: a system for talking to somebody else over long distances, using wires or radio; a machine used for this
5276.example: The telephone rang and Pat answered it.
5276.translation: 电话（利用线路或无线电进行远距离交谈的系统；这种机器）

5277.definition: to speak to somebody by phone
5277.example: Please write or telephone for details.
5277.translation: 打电话（通过电话与某人交谈）

5278.definition: a piece of electrical equipment with a screen on which you can watch programmes with moving pictures and sounds
5278.translation: 电视机（带有屏幕、可观看带音画节目的电子设备）

5279.definition: to give information to somebody by speaking or writing
5279.example: tell something to somebody, He told the news to everybody he saw.
5279.translation: 告诉（通过说话或书写向某人提供信息）

5280.definition: the measurement in degrees of how hot or cold a thing or place is
5280.translation: 温度（以度数衡量的物体或地方的热冷程度）

5281.definition: a building used for religious worship, especially in religions other than Christianity
5281.example: the Temple of Diana at Ephesus
5281.translation: 寺庙，寺院（用于宗教礼拜的建筑，尤指非基督教的）

5282.definition: in a way that lasts or is intended to last or be used only for a short time; in a way that is not permanent
5282.example: We regret this service is temporarily unavailable.
5282.translation: 暂时地（以持续短时间或非永久的方式）

5283.definition: lasting or intended to last or be used only for a short time; not permanent
5283.translation: 暂时的（仅持续或预定使用短时间的；非永久的）

5284.definition: to attract somebody or make somebody want to do or have something, even if they know it is wrong
5284.example: tempt somebody, I was tempted by the dessert menu.
5284.translation: 引诱，诱惑（吸引某人做某事，即使其知道这是错的）

5285.example: There are only ten of these rare animals left.

5286.definition: a person who pays rent for the use of a room, building, land, etc. to the person who owns it
5286.example: They had evicted their tenants for non-payment of rent.
5286.translation: 租户，房客（向房东付房租以使用房间、建筑或土地的人）

5287.definition: to be likely to do something or to happen in a particular way because this is what often or usually happens
5287.example: Women tend to live longer than men.
5287.translation: 往往，倾向于（很可能以特定方式做事或发生，因其经常如此）

5288.definition: if somebody/something has a particular tendency, they are likely to behave or act in a particular way
5288.translation: 倾向，习性（某人/某物很可能以特定方式表现的特质）

5289.translation: 温柔的（和蔼、温和且充满爱的）

5290.definition: a game in which two or four players use rackets to hit a ball backwards and forwards across a net on a specially marked court
5290.translation: 网球（两或四人在专用球场上用球拍隔网击球的比赛）

5291.definition: a situation in which people do not trust each other, or feel unfriendly towards each other, and that may cause them to attack each other
5291.example: There is mounting tension along the border.
5291.translation: 紧张，张力（人们互不信任、不友好且可能导致攻击的局面）

5292.definition: a shelter made of a large sheet of canvas, nylon, etc. that is supported by poles and ropes fixed to the ground, and is used especially for camping
5292.example: to put up/take down a tent
5292.translation: 帐篷（由帆布、尼龙制成、用杆和绳支撑在地面上的野营住所）

5293.definition: the period of time when somebody holds an important job, especially a political one; the act of holding an important job
5293.translation: 任期，任职（担任重要职位——尤指政治职位——的时期；担任的行为）

5294.definition: a word or phrase used as the name of something, especially one connected with a particular type of language
5294.translation: 术语，词语（作为某物名称的词或短语，尤指与特定语言相关的）

5295.definition: to use a particular name or word to describe somebody/something
5295.example: term somebody/something + adj., At his age, he can hardly be termed young.
5295.translation: 称为，称作（使用特定的名称或词语描述某人/某物）

5296.definition: that cannot be cured and will lead to death, often slowly
5296.translation: 晚期的（无法治愈并将导致死亡的，通常指疾病）

5297.definition: a building or set of buildings at an airport where passengers arrive and leave
5297.example: A second terminal was opened last year.
5297.translation: 航站楼，航站（机场供旅客到达和离开的建筑群）

5298.definition: to end; to make something end
5298.example: Your contract of employment terminates in December.
5298.translation: 终止，结束（结束；使某事结束）

5299.definition: the conditions that people offer, demand or accept when they make an agreement, an arrangement or a contract
5299.translation: 条款，条件（协议、安排或合同中人们提供、要求或接受的条件）

5300.definition: used to refer to an area of land when you are mentioning its natural features, for example, if it is rough, flat, etc.
5300.translation: 地形，地势（提到土地自然特征时的区域，如崎岖、平坦等）

5301.definition: very unpleasant; making you feel very unhappy, upset or frightened
5301.translation: 可怕的，糟糕的（非常令人不快、忧虑或惊吓的）

5302.example: I'm terribly sorry—did I hurt you?
5302.translation: 非常，极度（用于道歉或强调，意为“非常”）

5303.translation: 极好的，了不起的（优秀的；美妙的）

5304.definition: to make somebody feel extremely frightened
5304.translation: 使恐怖，惊吓（使某人感到极度恐惧）

5305.definition: land that is under the control of a particular country or political leader
5305.translation: 领土，领土（处于特定国家或政治领袖控制下的土地）

5306.translation: 恐惧，恐怖（极度恐惧的感觉）

5307.definition: the use of violent action in order to achieve political aims or to force a government to act
5307.translation: 恐怖主义（为了达到政治目的而使用的暴力行为）

5308.definition: a person who takes part in terrorism
5308.example: The terrorists are threatening to blow up the plane.
5308.translation: 恐怖分子（参加恐怖活动的人）

5309.definition: an examination of somebody’s knowledge or ability, consisting of questions for them to answer or activities for them to perform
5309.translation: 测试，考试（对某人知识或能力的检查，含问题或活动）

5310.definition: to find out how much somebody knows, or what they can do by asking them questions or giving them activities to perform
5310.example: test somebody, Students will be tested at the end of each module.
5310.translation: 测试（通过提问或活动找出某人知道多少或能做什么）

5311.definition: to make a statement that something happened or that something is true, especially as a witness in court
5311.example: testify against somebody/something, She refused to testify against her husband.
5311.translation: 作证（正式陈述某事已发生或属实，尤指作为法庭证人）

5312.definition: a thing that shows that something else exists or is true
5312.example: This increase in exports bears testimony to the successes of industry.
5312.translation: 证明，证据（显示他物存在或属实的事物）

5313.definition: the activity of testing somebody/something in order to find something out, see if it works, etc.
5313.translation: 测试，试验（为了发现某事、核实其是否有效而进行的活动）

5314.example: a computer that can process text
5314.translation: 文本，正文（任何形式的书面材料）

5316.definition: a book that teaches a particular subject and that is used especially in schools and colleges
5316.translation: 教科书（教授特定学科的书，尤用于学校和学院）

5317.definition: the way a surface, substance or piece of cloth feels when you touch it, for example how rough, smooth, hard or soft it is
5317.translation: 质感，纹理（表面、物质或布料摸起来的感觉，如粗糙、光滑等）

5318.definition: used to introduce the second part of a comparison
5318.translation: 比（用于引入比较的第二部分）

5319.definition: used to introduce the second part of a comparison
5319.translation: 比（用于引入比较的第二部分）

5320.definition: to tell somebody that you are grateful for something
5320.example: thank somebody for something, I must write and thank Mary for the present.
5320.translation: 感谢（告诉某人你对其所做之事表示感激）

5321.definition: used to show that you are pleased that something good has happened or that something bad has been avoided
5321.example: There was a fire in the building, but thankfully no one was hurt.
5321.translation: 谢天谢地（用于表示对好事发生或坏事避免感到高兴）

5322.definition: used to show that you are grateful to somebody for something they have done
5322.example: ‘How are you?’ ‘Fine, thanks (= thanks for asking).’

5323.definition: words or actions that show that you are grateful to somebody for something
5323.example: thanks to somebody for something, How can I ever express my thanks to you for all you've done?
5323.translation: 感谢（表示感激的言语或行动）

5324.example: I can't walk that far (= as far as that).

5325.definition: used after some verbs, adjectives and nouns to introduce a new part of the sentence
5325.example: She said (that) the story was true.
5325.translation: （连词）那（用于动词、形容词或名词后引导句子的新部分）

5326.definition: used for referring to a person or thing that is not near the speaker or as near to the speaker as another
5326.example: Look at that man over there.
5326.translation: 那个（指代离说话者较远的人或物）

5327.definition: used for referring to a person or thing that is not near the speaker, or not as near to the speaker as another
5327.translation: 那个（指代离说话者较远的人或物）

5328.definition: used to refer to somebody/something that has already been mentioned or is easily understood
5328.example: There were three questions. The first two were relatively easy but the third one was hard.
5328.translation: 这个/那个（定冠词，指代已提到或易理解的人/物）

5329.definition: a building or an outdoor area where plays and similar types of entertainment are performed
5329.translation: 剧院（表演戏剧或类似娱乐形式的建筑或户外区域）

5330.translation: 戏剧的（与剧院或戏剧相关的）

5331.definition: the crime of stealing something from a person or place
5331.translation: 偷窃，盗窃罪（从人或地方窃取某物的犯罪）

5332.definition: of or belonging to people, animals or things that have already been mentioned or are easily identified
5332.translation: 他们的（属于已提到或易识别的人、动物或事物的）

5333.example: Theirs are the children with very fair hair.
5333.translation: 他们的东西（属于他们的东西）

5334.definition: used when referring to people, animals or things as the object of a verb or preposition, or after the verb be
5334.translation: 他们（用作动词或介词的宾语，指代已提到的人或物）

5335.definition: the subject or main idea in a talk, piece of writing or work of art
5335.translation: 主题（谈话、文章或艺术作品的主题或核心思想）

5336.definition: used when people or animals performing an action are also affected by it
5336.example: They seemed to be enjoying themselves.

5337.definition: used to refer to a particular time in the past or future
5337.example: Life was harder then because neither of us had a job.
5337.translation: 那时，然后（指代过去或未来的特定时间）

5338.definition: the study of religion and beliefs
5338.translation: 神学（宗教和信仰的研究）

5339.definition: connected with the ideas and principles on which a particular subject is based, rather than with practice and experiment
5339.translation: 理论上的（与学科的基本想法和原则相关的，而非实践）

5340.definition: a formal set of ideas that is intended to explain why something happens or exists
5340.example: theory of something, the theory of evolution/relativity
5340.translation: 理论（旨在解释某事发生原因或存在的一套正式想法）

5341.definition: a specialist who treats a particular type of illness or problem, or who uses a particular type of treatment
5341.translation: 治疗师（治疗特定类型疾病或问题的专家）

5342.definition: the treatment of a physical problem or an illness
5342.example: He is receiving therapy for cancer.
5342.translation: 治疗，疗法（对身体问题或疾病的治疗）

5343.definition: used to show that something exists or happens
5343.example: There's a restaurant around the corner.
5343.translation: 那里（用于显示某物存在或发生）

5344.definition: after the time or event mentioned
5344.example: She married at 17 and gave birth to her first child shortly thereafter.
5344.translation: 此后（在提到的时间或事件之后）

5345.definition: used to introduce the result of the action or situation mentioned
5345.example: Regular exercise strengthens the heart, thereby reducing the risk of heart attack.
5345.translation: 从而，因此（用于引入提到行动或情况的结果）

5346.definition: used to introduce the logical result of something that has just been mentioned
5346.example: He's only 17 and therefore not eligible to vote.
5346.translation: 因此，所以（用于引入刚提到之事的逻辑结果）

5347.definition: a long piece of writing completed by a student as part of a university degree, based on their own research
5347.example: Students must submit a thesis on an agreed subject within four years.
5347.translation: 论文（学生作为大学学位一部分完成的长篇书面研究作品）

5348.definition: people, animals or things that have already been mentioned or are easily identified
5348.example: ‘Where are John and Liz?’ ‘They went for a walk.’
5348.translation: 他们（指代已提到或易识别的人、动物或事物）

5349.definition: having a larger distance between opposite sides or surfaces than other similar objects or than normal
5349.translation: 厚的（两面间距离大的；比平常厚的）

5350.definition: a person who steals something from another person or place
5350.translation: 小偷（从他人或他处窃取财物的人）

5351.definition: having a smaller distance between opposite sides or surfaces than other similar objects or than normal
5351.example: Cut the vegetables into thin strips.
5351.translation: 薄的，细的（两面间距离小的；比平常薄的）

5352.definition: an object whose name you do not use because you do not need to or want to, or because you do not know it
5352.example: Can you pass me that thing over there?
5352.translation: 东西（不知道名字或不想使用名字的物体）

5353.definition: to have a particular idea or opinion about something/somebody; to believe something
5353.example: think (that)…, Do you really think (that) he'll win?
5353.translation: 想，认为（对某人/某事有特定的看法；相信某事）

5354.definition: the process of thinking about something
5354.example: I had to do some quick thinking.
5354.translation: 思考，想法（思考某事的过程）

5355.definition: each of three equal parts of something
5355.example: He divided the money into thirds.
5355.translation: 三分之一（某物三个相等部分中的一个）

5357.translation: 渴的（需要或想要喝水的）

5360.example: It's about this high (= as high as I am showing you with my hands).

5361.definition: used to refer to a particular person, thing or event that is close to you, especially compared with another
5361.example: How long have you been living in this country?
5361.translation: 这，这个（指代离说话者较近的人、物或事件）

5362.translation: 这，这个（指代离说话者较近的人、物或事件）

5363.definition: done completely; with great attention to detail
5363.example: a thorough knowledge of the subject
5363.translation: 彻底的，详尽的（完全做好的；非常注重细节的）

5364.translation: 彻底地（非常多地；完全地）

5365.definition: used especially at the end of a sentence or clause to add a fact or an opinion that makes the previous statement less strong or less important
5365.example: Our team lost. It was a good game though.
5365.translation: 不过（尤其用于句末，使前述陈述语气减弱或不那么重要）

5366.example: Anne was fond of Tim, though he often annoyed her.

5367.definition: something that you think of or remember
5367.example: thought of doing something, I couldn't bear the thought of waiting any longer.
5367.translation: 想法，念头（你想到或记起的事情）

5368.definition: making people think seriously about a particular subject or issue
5368.translation: 发人深省的（使人严肃思考特定主题或问题的）

5369.translation: 沉思的（因在思考而安静的）

5370.example: There were thousands of people there.

5371.definition: a thin string of cotton, wool, silk, etc. used for sewing or making cloth
5371.translation: 线（缝纫或织布用的棉、毛、丝细线）

5372.definition: a statement in which you tell somebody that you will punish or harm them, especially if they do not do what you want
5372.example: threat against somebody/something, to make threats against somebody
5372.translation: 威胁（告知某人若不按要求做将受惩罚或伤害的陈述）

5373.definition: to say that you will cause trouble, hurt somebody, etc. if you do not get what you want
5373.example: threaten somebody/something, They broke my windows and threatened me.
5373.translation: 威胁（表示如果不得到想要的东西将制造麻烦或伤害他人）

5374.example: There are only three cookies left.

5375.definition: the floor or ground at the bottom of a doorway, considered as the entrance to a building or room
5375.translation: 门槛（门口底部的地面或地板，被视为进入建筑的入口）

5376.translation: 激动，欣喜若狂（非常兴奋和高兴的）

5377.definition: to become, and continue to be, successful, strong, healthy, etc.
5377.example: New businesses thrive in this area.
5377.translation: 繁荣，茁壮成长（变得且持续成功、强壮、健康等）

5378.definition: a passage in the neck through which food and air pass on their way into the body; the front part of the neck
5378.translation: 喉咙（颈部内食物和空气经过的通道；颈部前部）

5379.definition: from one end or side of something to the other
5379.example: Put the coffee in the filter and let the water run through.
5379.translation: 穿过（从一端或一侧到另一端）

5380.definition: from one end or side of something/somebody to the other
5380.example: The burglar got in through the window.
5380.translation: 穿过（从一端或一侧到另一端）

5381.definition: in or into every part of something
5381.example: They export their products to markets throughout the world.
5381.translation: 贯穿（在某物的每一个部分）

5382.definition: in or into every part of something
5382.example: They export their products to markets throughout the world.
5382.translation: 贯穿（在某物的每一个部分）

5383.definition: to send something from your hand through the air by moving your hand or arm quickly
5383.translation: 扔，投（通过快速移动手或臂将某物从手中掷向空中）

5384.definition: the short, thick finger at the side of the hand, slightly apart from the other four
5384.example: She still sucks her thumb when she's worried.
5384.translation: 拇指（手侧面短而粗的手指，与其他四个分开）

5385.definition: the day of the week after Wednesday and before Friday
5385.translation: 星期四（周三之后、周五之前的一天）

5386.translation: 如此，因此（以这种方式；像这样）

5387.definition: a printed piece of paper, or a message or image received on your phone or computer, that gives you the right to travel on a particular bus, train, etc. or to go into a theatre, etc.
5387.translation: 票（证明你有权乘坐车、进入剧院等的打印纸片或电子信息）

5388.definition: a regular rise and fall in the level of the sea, caused by the pull of the moon and sun; the flow of water that happens as the sea rises and falls
5388.example: the ebb and flow of the tide
5388.translation: 潮汐（月球和太阳引力引起的海平面定期涨落；及其水流）

5389.definition: arranged neatly and with everything in order
5389.translation: 整洁的（排列整齐、井井有条的）

5390.definition: to make something look neat by putting things in the place where they belong
5390.example: I spent all morning cleaning and tidying.
5390.translation: 整理（把东西放在应有的位置使之看起来整洁）

5391.definition: a long, narrow piece of cloth worn around the neck, especially by men, with a knot in front
5391.example: He was dressed impeccably in a suit and tie.
5391.translation: 领带（系在脖子上的、前面带结的长条布，尤指男子穿戴）

5392.definition: to attach or hold two or more things together using string, rope, etc.; to fasten somebody/something with string, rope, etc.
5392.example: tie something + adv./prep., She tied the newspapers in a bundle.
5392.translation: 系，捆（使用绳、索等将两物连接或固定在一起）

5393.definition: held or fixed in position securely; difficult to move, open or separate
5393.example: He kept a tight grip on her arm.
5393.translation: 紧的，牢固的（牢牢固定在位置上的；难以移动、打开或分开的）

5394.definition: to hold or fix something more securely in position; to make something or become more difficult to move, open or separate
5394.example: tighten something, to tighten a lid/screw/rope/knot
5394.translation: 变紧，拉紧（将某物更牢固地固定；使之更难移动或打开）

5397.definition: trees that are grown to be used in building or for making things
5397.translation: 木材（种来用于建筑或制作物品的树木）

5398.definition: what is measured in minutes, hours, days, etc.
5398.example: The world exists in time and space.
5398.translation: 时间（以分、时、天等衡量的事物）

5399.definition: to measure how long it takes for something to happen or for somebody to do something
5399.example: time something, ‘How long does it take to get to Leeds from here?’ ‘I don’t know, I’ve never timed it.’
5399.translation: 计时（测量某事发生或某人做某事所花的时间）

5400.definition: happening at exactly the right time
5400.example: A nasty incident was prevented by the timely arrival of the police.
5400.translation: 及时的（在恰当的时间发生的）

5401.definition: the act of choosing when something happens; a particular point or period of time when something happens or is planned
5401.example: The timing of the decision was a complete surprise.
5401.translation: 时机（选择某事发生时间的行为；某事发生的时间点）

5402.definition: a metal container in which food is sold; the contents of one of these containers
5402.example: Open the tin and drain the tuna.
5402.translation: 锡罐，罐头（出售食品用的金属容器；及其内含物）

5403.definition: very small in size or amount
5403.translation: 极小的（尺寸或数量上非常小的）

5404.definition: a small piece of advice about something practical
5404.example: tip on/for doing something, handy tips for buying a computer
5404.translation: 小建议，贴士（关于实用事项的一小条建议）

5405.definition: to give somebody an extra amount of money to thank them for something they have done for you as part of their job
5405.example: Americans were always welcome because they tended to tip heavily.
5405.translation: 给小费（给从事服务工作的人额外的一笔钱以示感谢）

5406.definition: feeling that you would like to sleep or rest; needing rest
5406.translation: 疲倦的（想要睡觉或休息的；需要休息的）

5407.definition: a piece of soft paper, used especially as a handkerchief
5407.translation: 纸巾（柔软的纸片，尤用作手帕）

5408.definition: the name of a book, poem, painting, piece of music, etc.
5408.example: What's title of her new book?
5408.translation: 标题，题目（书、诗、画、乐曲的名字）

5409.definition: to give a book, piece of music, etc. a particular name
5409.example: be titled…, Their first album was titled ‘Made in Valmez’.
5409.translation: 给...定名（给书、乐曲等起特定的名字）

5410.definition: used to show purpose or intention
5410.example: I set out to buy food.
5410.translation: （不定式标志）（用于表示目的或意图）

5411.definition: in the direction of something; towards something
5411.translation: 到，向（朝向某物或某方向）

5412.definition: the dried leaves of the tobacco plant that are used for making cigarettes, smoking in a pipe, etc.
5412.translation: 烟草（用于制作香烟、烟斗等的烟草植物干燥叶子）

5413.example: I've got a piano lesson later today.

5415.definition: one of the five small parts that stick out from the foot; any similar part on the foot of an animal or bird
5415.example: the big/little toe (= the largest/smallest toe)
5415.translation: 脚趾（脚上的五个小突出部之一）

5416.definition: with or near to somebody/something else; with each other
5416.translation: 一起（与他人在一起；相互之间）

5417.definition: a large bowl attached to a pipe that you sit on or stand over when you get rid of waste matter from your body
5417.translation: 厕所，马桶（冲洗身体排泄物的大碗状容器及管道）

5418.definition: the quality of being willing to accept or tolerate somebody/something, especially opinions or behaviour that you may not agree with, or people who are not like you
5418.example: She had no tolerance for jokes of any kind.
5418.translation: 宽容，容忍（乐于接受不同意见、行为或不同人群的品质）

5419.definition: to allow somebody to do something that you do not agree with or like
5419.example: tolerate something, Their relationship was tolerated but not encouraged.
5419.translation: 容忍，忍受（允许他人做你不同意或不喜欢的事）

5420.definition: money that you pay to use a particular road or bridge
5420.translation: 通行费（使用特定道路或桥梁支付的钱）

5421.definition: a soft fruit with a lot of juice and shiny red skin that is eaten as a vegetable either raw or cooked
5421.example: a bacon, lettuce, and tomato sandwich
5421.translation: 西红柿（带很多汁液、红色发亮表皮的软质水果，常作蔬菜食用）

5422.definition: on or during the day after today
5422.example: I'm off now. See you tomorrow.

5423.example: Today is Tuesday, so tomorrow is Wednesday.

5424.definition: a unit for measuring weight, in the UK 2 240 pounds (long ton) and in the US 2 000 pounds (short ton)
5424.example: (informal), What have you got in this bag? It weighs a ton (= is very heavy).
5424.translation: 吨（重量单位；英制2240磅，美制2000磅）

5425.definition: the quality of somebody’s voice, especially expressing a particular emotion
5425.translation: 语气，音调（某人嗓音的特质，尤指表达某种情感）

5426.definition: the soft part in the mouth that moves around, used for tasting, swallowing, speaking, etc.
5426.example: He clicked his tongue to attract their attention.
5426.translation: 舌头（口中移动的柔软部分，用于味觉、吞咽、说话等）

5427.definition: on or during the evening or night of today
5427.example: Will you have dinner with me tonight?

5428.definition: the evening or night of today

5429.definition: a unit for measuring weight, equal to 1 000 kilograms
5429.example: a record grain harvest of 236m tonnes

5430.definition: used before adjectives and adverbs to say that something is more than is good, necessary, possible, etc.
5430.example: He's far too young to go on his own.
5430.translation: 太（用于形容词、副词前，表示程度超过了所需或可能的）

5431.definition: an instrument such as a hammer, screwdriver, saw, etc. that you hold in your hand and use for making things, repairing things, etc.
5431.translation: 工具（手持的用于制造或修理物品的器具，如锤子、锯子）

5432.definition: any of the hard white structures in the mouth used for biting food
5432.example: I've just had a tooth out at the dentist's.
5432.translation: 牙齿（口中用于咬碎食物的白色坚硬结构之一）

5433.example: He lives on the top floor.
5433.translation: 顶部的（处于最高位置的）

5434.definition: the highest part or point of something
5434.example: at the top of something, She was standing at the top of the stairs.
5434.translation: 顶部（某物的最高部分或点）

5435.definition: to be higher than a particular amount
5435.example: Worldwide sales look set to top $1 billion.
5435.translation: 超过，胜过（高于特定的数额）

5436.definition: a subject that you talk, write or learn about
5436.example: The main topic of conversation was Tom's new girlfriend.
5436.translation: 话题，主题（谈论、书写或学习的主题）

5437.definition: the act of causing somebody severe pain in order to punish them or make them say or do something
5437.example: Many of the refugees have suffered torture.
5437.translation: 折磨，酷刑（为了惩罚或逼供而使人遭受剧烈疼痛的行为）

5438.definition: to hurt somebody physically or mentally in order to punish them or make them tell you something
5438.example: torture somebody, Many of the rebels were captured and tortured by secret police.
5438.translation: 折磨，拷打（为了惩罚或逼供而在肉体或精神上伤害他人）

5439.definition: to throw something lightly or carelessly
5439.example: toss something + adv./prep., I tossed the book aside and got up.
5439.translation: 扔，投（轻微或不经意地抛掷某物）

5440.definition: being the amount or number after everyone or everything is counted or added together
5440.translation: 总的，全部的（所有人或物计入后的总数或数量）

5441.definition: the amount you get when you add several numbers or amounts together; the final number of people or things when they have all been counted
5441.example: a total of something, You got 47 points on the written examination and 18 on the oral, making a total of 65.
5441.translation: 总计，合计（多个数字相加后的总额；计算后的总人数）

5442.translation: 总计达（达到特定的总数）

5443.example: They come from totally different cultures.

5444.definition: the sense that enables you to be aware of things and what they are like when you put your hands and fingers on them
5444.translation: 触觉，触摸（通过手和手指感知物体及其特质的感官）

5445.definition: to put your hand or another part of your body onto somebody/something
5445.translation: 触摸（将手或身体其他部位碰到他人/他物）

5446.definition: having or causing problems or difficulties
5446.translation: 艰苦的，棘手的（产生或引起问题和困难的）

5447.definition: a journey made for pleasure during which several different towns, countries, etc. are visited
5447.translation: 旅行，游览（为了娱乐而访问多个不同城镇或国家的旅程）

5448.definition: to travel around a place, for example on holiday, or to perform, to advertise something, etc.
5448.example: tour something, He toured America with his one-man show.
5448.translation: 游览，巡演（在某处到处旅行，如度假、表演或宣传）

5449.definition: the business activity connected with providing accommodation, services and entertainment for people who are visiting a place for pleasure
5449.example: The area is heavily dependent on tourism.
5449.translation: 旅游业（为度假游客提供住宿、服务和娱乐的商业活动）

5450.definition: a person who is travelling or visiting a place for pleasure
5450.translation: 游客（为了娱乐而旅行或访问某地的人）

5451.definition: a sports competition involving a number of teams or players who take part in different games and must leave the competition if they lose. The competition continues until there is only the winner left.
5451.translation: 锦标赛，联赛（涉及多个团队或选手参与、输者出局的体育竞赛）

5452.example: They were heading towards the German border.
5452.translation: 朝向，向着（朝着某人/某物的方向）

5453.definition: a piece of cloth or paper used for drying things, especially your body
5453.example: Help yourself to a clean towel.
5453.translation: 毛巾（用于擦干身体等的布片或纸片）

5454.definition: a tall narrow building or part of a building, especially of a church or castle
5454.translation: 塔，塔楼（高而窄的建筑或建筑的一部分，如教堂或城堡塔）

5455.definition: a place with many houses, shops, etc. where people live and work. It is larger than a village but smaller than a city.
5455.example: The nearest town is ten miles away.
5455.translation: 城镇，市镇（有许多住房商店、供人工作生活的居住区，大于村小于城）

5456.translation: 有毒的（含有毒素的；有毒的）

5457.definition: made as a copy of a particular thing and used for playing with
5457.translation: 玩具的（作为某物副本供玩耍的）

5458.definition: an object for children to play with
5458.translation: 玩具（供儿童玩耍的物品）

5459.definition: a mark, an object or a sign that shows that somebody/something existed or was present
5459.example: It's exciting to discover traces of earlier civilizations.
5459.translation: 痕迹，踪迹（显示某人/某物曾存在或到场的迹象、物体或痕迹）

5460.definition: to find or discover somebody/something by looking carefully for them/it
5460.example: We finally traced him to an address in Chicago.
5460.translation: 追踪，找到（通过仔细寻找发现或找到某人/某物）

5461.definition: rails (= metal bars) that a train moves along
5461.translation: 轨道，铁轨（火车行驶其上的金属条）

5462.definition: to find somebody/something by following the marks, signs, information, etc., that they have left behind them
5462.example: track somebody/something, hunters tracking and shooting bears
5462.translation: 追踪，跟踪（通过跟随他人留下的痕迹、信息等找到他们）

5463.definition: the activity of buying and selling or of exchanging goods or services between people or countries
5463.translation: 贸易（人或国家间买卖、交换商品或服务的活动）

5464.example: trade in something, The firm openly traded in arms.

5465.definition: a name, symbol or design that a company uses for its products and that cannot be used by anyone else
5465.translation: 商标（公司用于其产品且他人不得使用的名称、符号或设计）

5466.definition: the activity of buying and selling things
5466.example: new laws on Sunday trading (= shops being open on Sundays)
5466.translation: 交易，营业（买卖物品的活动，如周日营业）

5467.definition: a belief, custom or way of doing something that has existed for a long time among a particular group of people; a set of these beliefs or customs
5467.translation: 传统（长期存在于特定人群中的信仰、习俗或做事方式）

5468.definition: being part of the beliefs, customs or way of life of a particular group of people, that have not changed for a long time
5468.translation: 传统的（属于特定人群长期未变的信仰、习俗或生活方式一部分的）

5469.definition: the vehicles that are on a road at a particular time
5469.example: There's always a lot of traffic at this time of day.
5469.translation: 交通（特定时间道路上的车辆）

5470.definition: a very sad event or situation, especially one that involves death
5470.example: It's a tragedy that she died so young.
5470.translation: 悲剧（非常悲惨的事件或情况，尤指涉及死亡）

5471.definition: making you feel very sad, usually because somebody has died or suffered a lot
5471.example: He was killed in a tragic accident at the age of 24.
5471.translation: 悲剧性的（令人非常悲伤的，通常因为涉及伤亡）

5472.definition: a long line or series of marks that is left by somebody/something
5472.translation: 踪迹，痕迹（某人/某物留下的一行长长的标记或痕迹）

5473.definition: to pull something behind somebody/something, usually along the ground; to be pulled along in this way
5473.example: trail something, A jeep trailing a cloud of dust was speeding in my direction.
5473.translation: 拖，拉（在身后拉某物，通常沿地面；或被拖着走）

5474.definition: a truck, or a container with wheels, that is pulled by another vehicle
5474.example: a car towing a trailer with a boat on it
5474.translation: 拖车，挂车（由另一辆车牵引的卡车或带轮容器）

5475.definition: a number of connected coaches or trucks, pulled by an engine or powered by a motor in each one, taking people and goods from one place to another
5475.translation: 火车（由车头牵引的、连接在一起运送人或货物的车厢）

5476.definition: to teach a person or an animal the skills for a particular job or activity; to be taught in this way
5476.translation: 训练，培训（教导人或动物特定工作的技能；或接受教导）

5477.definition: a shoe that you wear for sports or as informal clothing
5477.translation: 运动鞋（用于运动或作为非正式服装穿的鞋）

5478.definition: the process of learning the skills that you need to do a job
5478.translation: 培训（学习工作所需技能的过程）

5479.definition: a particular quality in your personality
5479.translation: 特质，性格（性格中的特定品质）

5480.definition: a piece of business that is done between people, especially an act of buying or selling
5480.translation: 交易（人与人之间进行的业务，尤指买卖行为）

5481.definition: a written or printed copy of words that have been spoken
5481.translation: 誊本，录音文本（所言内容的文字或打印副本）

5482.definition: the act of moving somebody/something from one place, group or job to another; an occasion when this happens
